gurmukhi: ਹਵਾੲਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ ਦਰ ਵਜੂਦ ਮਰਾ
transliteration: havaae bandhagee aavuradh dhar vajoodh maraa
translation: The attraction of meditation and religious devotion brought me into this world,

gurmukhi: ਵਗਰਨਾ ਜ਼ੋਕਿ ਚੁਨੀਂ ਨ ਬੂਦ ਮਰਾ ||੧||੧||
transliteration: vagaranaa zok chunee n boodh maraa | 1 | 1 |
translation: Otherwise, I had no urge to come. (1) (1)

gurmukhi: ਖੁਸ਼ ਅਸਤ ੳੁਮਰ ਕਿਹ ਦਰ ਯਾਦ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰਦ ਵਰਨਾ
transliteration: khush asath oumar kih dhar yaadh biguzaradh varanaa
translation: Only that part of my life is useful and happy that is spent in remembering the Akaalpurakh

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਹਾਸਲ ਅਸਤ ਅਜ਼ੀਣ ਗੁੰਬਦਿ ਕਬੂਦ ਮਰਾ ||੧||੨||
transliteration: ch haasal asath azeen gunbadh kaboodh maraa | 1 | 2 |
translation: Otherwise what is the benefit to me from this blue sky or the world. (1) (2)

gurmukhi: ਦਰਾਂ ਜ਼ਮਾਂ ਕਿ ਨਿਅਾੲੀ ਬ-ਯਾਦ ਮੀ-ਮਰਮ
transliteration: dharaa zamaa k niaaee ba-yaadh mee-marama
translation: For any moment that you are out of my remembrance, I feel that I am dying,

gurmukhi: ਬਗ਼ੈਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਤੂ ਜ਼ੀਂ ਜ਼ੀਸਤਨ ਚਿਹ ਸੂਦ ਮਰਾ ||੧||੩||
transliteration: baghair yaadh thoo zee zeesathan chih soodh maraa | 1 | 3 |
translation: What is the purpose of my life (it became worthless) without your reminiscence.(1) (3)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਿਦਾਸਤ ਜਾਨੋ ਦਿਲਿ ਮਨ ਬ-ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਮਰਦਮਿ ਪਾਕ
transliteration: fidhaasath jaano dhil man ba-khaak maradham paaka
translation: I can sacrifice my heart and soul uninhibitedly for (the dust of the feet of) this holy person

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਅਾਂ ਕਸੇ ਕਿਹ ਬੂ-ਸੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਰਹਿ ਨਮੂਦ ਮਰਾ ||੧||੪||
transliteration: har aa kasae kih boo-sooe thoo rehi namoodh maraa | 1 | 4 |
translation: Who has shown me the way to You, the Akaalpurakh. (1) (4)

gurmukhi: ਨਬੂਦ ਹੀਚ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨ ਹਾ ਜ਼ਿ-ਅਾਸਮਾਨੋ ਜ਼ਮੀਂ
transliteration: naboodh heech nishaan haa zi-aasamaano zamee
translation: There was no sign-posts on the Pilgrim's way through earth or sky at that time,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ ਦਰ ਸਜੂਦ ਮਰਾ ||੧||੫||
transliteration: k shaauak rooe thoo aavuradh dhar sajoodh maraa | 1 | 5 |
translation: When my longing for Your glimpse made me prostrate in Your honor. (1) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਗ਼ੈਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਤੂ ਗੋਯਾ ਨਮੀ ਤਵਾਨਮ ਜ਼ੀਸਤ
transliteration: baghair yaadh thoo goyaa namee thavaanam zeesatha
translation: O Goya! I cannot live without Your remembrance, If pining for you ceases, then an end to life is the only thing coveted;

gurmukhi: ਬਸੂੲਿ ਦੋਸਤ ਰਹਾੲੀ ਦਿਹੰਦ ਜ਼ੂਦ ਮਰਾ ||੧||੬||
transliteration: basooe dhosath rehaaee dhihandh zoodh maraa | 1 | 6 |
translation: I will be free then to move in the direction of my Beloved. (1) (6)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਨੋ ਦੁਨੀਅਾ ਦਰ ਕਮੰਦਿ ਅਾਂ ਪਰੀ ਰੁਖ਼ਸਾਰਿ ਮਾ
transliteration: dheeno dhuneeaa dhar kamandh aa paree rukhasaar maa
translation: Both the religion and the actions of the world are in the grip of my beloved, handsome and fairy-faced friend.

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਯ?ਕ ਤਾਰਿ ਮੂੲਿ ਯਾਰਿ ਮਾ ||੨||੧||
transliteration: har dho aalam keemath yak thaar mooe yaar maa | 2 | 1 |
translation: Both the worlds, this and the next, are (not) equal to or match the price (weight) of just one hair of my friend-mentor, Guru Gobind Singh Ji. (2) (1)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਨਮੀ ਅਾਰੇਮ ਤਾਬਿ ਗ਼ਮਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਮਿਜ਼ਗਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: maa namee aaraem thaab ghamazaae mizagaan oo
translation: I don't have the strength to bear the intensity of even one of his skewed looks,

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਨਿਗਾਹਿ ਜਾਂ-ਫਿਜ਼ਾੲਿਸ਼ ਬਸ ਬਵਦ ਦਰਕਾਰਿ ਮਾ ||੨||੨||
transliteration: yak nigaahi jaa-fizaaeish bas bavadh dharakaar maa | 2 | 2 |
translation: Just one of his (blessed) looks, that prolongs life instantly, is enough for me. (2) (2)

gurmukhi: ਗਾਹੇ ਸੂਫੀ ਗਾਹੇ ਜ਼ਾਹਿਦ ਗਹਿ ਕਲੰਦਰ ਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: gaahae soofee gaahae zaahidh gehi kalandhar mee shavadha
translation: Sometimes, he acts like a mystic, sometimes like a meditator, and other times like a carefree recluse;

gurmukhi: ਰੰਗਹਾੲਿ ਮੁਖ਼ਤਲਿਫ ਦਾਰਦ ਬੁਤਿ ਅਯਾਰ ਮਾ ||੨||੩||
transliteration: rangehaae mukhathalif dhaaradh buth ayaar maa | 2 | 3 |
translation: He is our pilot steering our way; he operates in numerous different postures. (2) (3)

gurmukhi: ਕਦਰਿ ਲਾਅਲਿ ੳੂ ਬਜੁਜ਼ ਅਾਸ਼ਿਕ ਨਾਂ ਦਾਨਦ ਹੀਚ ਕਸ
transliteration: kadhar laaal oo bajuz aashik naa dhaanadh heech kasa
translation: Who other than his true devotee-lover can evaluate his pearl-like lips?

gurmukhi: ਕੀਮਤਿ ਯਾਕੂਤ ਦਾਨਦ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਗੌਹਰ ਬਾਰਿ ਮਾ ||੨||੪||
transliteration: keemath yaakooth dhaanadh chasham gaauehar baar maa | 2 | 4 |
translation: The value of this gem is only appreciated by a diamond-rearing-vision. (2) (4)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਨਫਸ ਗੋਯਾ ਬ-ਯਾਦ ਨਰਗਸਿ ਮਖ਼ਮੂਰਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: har nafas goyaa ba-yaadh naragas makhamoor oo
translation: During every moment of Goyaa's life, my alert heart and soul are relishing

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਾਹਾੲਿ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਮੀ-ਨੋਸ਼ਦ ਦਿਲਿ ਹੁਸ਼ਿਅਾਰਿ ਮਾ ||੨||੫||
transliteration: baadhaahaae shaauak mee-noshadh dhil hushiaar maa | 2 | 5 |
translation: the memory of intoxication of his Narcissus-like-imbued eyes. (2) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਦਿਹ ਸਾਕੀ ਮਰਾ ਯ?ਕ ਜਾਮ ਜ਼ਾਂ ਰੰਗੀਨੀੲਿ ਦਿਲਹਾ
transliteration: badhih saakee maraa yak jaam zaa rangeeneee dhilehaa
translation: O bartender! Kindly spare a heart-warming-shot out of your enjoyable intoxication for me also,

gurmukhi: ਬਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਪਾਕ-ਬੀਣ ਅਾਸਾਣ ਕੁਨਮ ੲੀ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਿਲ ਹਾ ||੩||੧||
transliteration: bachasham paaka-been aasaan kunam ee jumalaa mushakil haa | 3 | 1 |
translation: so that with my eyes of recognizing the God-sent prophet, I can solve all my riddles. (3) (1)

gurmukhi: ਮਰਾ ਦਰ ਮੰਜ਼ਿਲ ਜਾਨਾਂ ਹਮਾ ਅੈਸ਼ੋ ਹਮਾ ਸ਼ਾਦੀ
transliteration: maraa dhar manzil jaanaa hamaa aisho hamaa shaadhee
translation: When moving towards the destination, my Beloved, I am ever in blissful elation.

gurmukhi: ਜਰਸ ਬੇਹੂਦਾ ਮੀ-ਨਾਲਦ ਕੁਜਾ ਬੰਦੇਮ ਮਹਿਮਲ ਹਾ ||੩||੨||
transliteration: jaras baehoodhaa mee-naaladh kujaa bandhaem mehimal haa | 3 | 2 |
translation: The bell in the neck of a female camel is peeling for nothing. It cannot stop me from proceeding to my goal. (3) (2)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਜ਼ਿਰ ਬਵਦ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਬੀਂ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਪਾਕਿਸ਼ ਰਾ
transliteration: khudhaa haazir bavadh dhaaeim babee dheedhaar paakish raa
translation: The Akaalpurakh is Omnipresent. Our strive to seek his glimpses should be spontaneous

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਗਿਰਦਾਬੇ ਦਰੂ ਹਾੲਿਲ ਨਾ ਦਰਿਅਾਓ ਨਾ ਸਾਹਿਲ ਹਾ ||੩||੩||
transliteration: naa giradhaabae dharoo haaeil naa dhariaaou naa saahil haa | 3 | 3 |
translation: Without any obstacle of the whirlpool, the torrent or the bank of the river. (3) (3)

gurmukhi: ਚਿਰਾ ਬੇਹੂਦਾ ਮੀਗਰਦੀ ਬ-ਸਹਿਰਾ ਓ ਬ-ਦਸਤ ਅੈ ਦਿਲ
transliteration: chiraa baehoodhaa meegaradhee ba-sehiraa ou ba-dhasath ai dhila
translation: Why are we wandering (aimlessly) in jungles and wildernesses,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਅਾਂ ਸੁਲਤਾਨਿ ਖੂਬਾਂ ਕਰਦਾ ਅੰਦਰ ਦੀਦਾ ਮੰਜ਼ਿਲ ਹਾ ||੩||੪||
transliteration: choon aa sulathaan khoobaa karadhaa andhar dheedhaa manzil haa | 3 | 4 |
translation: When He, The Master of Beauty, has made his abode in our own eyes? (3) (4)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਜਾਤਿ-ਪਾਕਿਸ਼ ਨੀਸਤ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਜਾ ਕਿ ਮੀ-ਬੀਨਮ
transliteration: choon ghair az jaathi-paakish neesath dhar har jaa k mee-beenama
translation: When I look around without the Akaalpurakh, I see only a big void;

gurmukhi: ਬਗੋ ਗੋਯਾ ਕੁਜਾ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਾਰਮ ੲੀਂ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਓ ਅੈਹਲਿ ਹਾ ||੩||੫||
transliteration: bago goyaa kujaa biguzaaram ee dhuniaa ou aihal haa | 3 | 5 |
translation: Then Goyaa, you tell me, with whom can I entrust this world and my family and household affairs? (3) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਿਅਾ ਅੈ ਸਾਕੀੲੇ ਰੰਗੀਨ ਜ਼ਿ ਮੈ ਪੁਰ ਕੁਨ ਅ?ਯਾਗ਼ ੲੀਂਜਾ
transliteration: biaa ai saakeeeae rangeen z mai pur kun ayaagh eejaa
translation: O bartender! Please fill up my glass with a colored alcohol, cup of love,

gurmukhi: ਨਸ਼ਾੲਿ ਲਾਅਲ ਮੈ-ਗੂਨਤ ਜ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਦ ਸੁਰਾਗ ੲੀਣਜਾ ||੪||੧||
transliteration: nashaae laaal mai-goonath z hak bakhashadh suraag eenajaa | 4 | 1 |
translation: Because ruby-colored alcohol will give me clues towards my Master. (4) (1)

gurmukhi: ਅਨਲ-ਹ?ਕ ਅਜ਼ ਲਬਿ ਮਨਸੂਰ ਗਰ ਚੂੰ ਸ਼ੀਸ਼ਾ ਕੁਲਕੁਲ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: anala-hak az lab manasoor gar choon sheeshaa kulakul karadha
translation: If the long-necked decanter, like the word, 'Analhaqq', coming out of Mansoor's lips, were to create the ripple sound,

gurmukhi: ਕਿਹ ਅਾਰਦ ਤਾਬਿ ੲੀਂ ਸਹਬਾ ਕੁਜਾ ਜਾਮਿ ਦਿਮਾਗ ੲੀਂਜਾ ||੪||੨||
transliteration: kih aaradh thaab ee sehabaa kujaa jaam dhimaag eejaa | 4 | 2 |
translation: Then, who will endure the strength of such a wee-hour alcohol? And where would there be a brain-cup (to receive such a powerful drink)? (4) (2)

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਣ ਤਾਰੀਕ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਜਾਨਾਣ ਬਰ ਅਫ਼ਰੂਜ਼ ੲੀਣ ਕ?ਦਿ ਰਾਅਨਾ
transliteration: jehaan thaareek shudh jaanaan bar afarooz een kadh raaanaa
translation: There is darkness in the world. O beloved! Enhance your beauty by increased burnishing, and your moon-face be a candle to the way-farer.

gurmukhi: ਨੁਮਾ ਰੁਖ਼ਸਾਰਾੲਿ ਤਾਬਾਣ ਕਿ ਮੀ-ਬਾੲਿਦ ਚਰਾਗ਼ ੲੀਣ ਜਾ ||੪||੩||
transliteration: numaa rukhasaaraae thaabaan k mee-baaeidh charaagh een jaa | 4 | 3 |
translation: And make your face conspicuously identifiable, because there is a need of a light (lamp) in this world. (4) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬ?ੲੀਣ ਯ?ਕ-ਦਮ ਕਿ ਯਾਦ ਅਾੲਿਦ ਤਵਾਂ ੳੁਮਰੇ ਬਸਰ ਬੁਰਦਨ
transliteration: baeen yaka-dham k yaadh aaeidh thavaa oumarae basar buradhana
translation: The whole life becomes worth living if we can grab a moment (ecstacy) in our Master's remembrance,

gurmukhi: ਅਗਰ ਯਕਦਮ ਕਸੇ ਬਾੲਿਦ ਬਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਫ਼ਰਾਗ ੲੀਂਜਾ ||੪||੪||
transliteration: agar yakadham kasae baaeidh bashaauak hak faraag eejaa | 4 | 4 |
translation: Provided, one happens to have such a trice of eagerness, keenness and zest for Akaalpurakh's love. (4) (4)

gurmukhi: ਦੋ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਨ ਕਿ ਦਰਯਾੲਿ ਅਜ਼ੀਮੁ?ਸ਼ਾਣ ਬਵਦ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: dho chasham man k dharayaae azeemushaan bavadh goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, Both of my eyes are like a long and large stream,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਹਰ ਅਸ਼ਕਮ ਬਵਦ ਸ਼ਾਦਾਬੀੲਿ ਸਦ ਬਾਗ਼ ਬਾਗ਼ ੲੀਣਜਾ ||੪||੫||
transliteration: z har ashakam bavadh shaadhaabeee sadh baagh baagh eenajaa | 4 | 5 |
translation: And every tear coming out of them can bring greenery to hundreds of smiling gardens (because of my faith). (4) (5)

gurmukhi: ਰਹਿ-ਰਸਾਨਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਮਦ ਅਦਬ
transliteration: rehi-rasaan raahi hak aamadh adhaba
translation: It is essential for the travellers on the path towards the Creator to have His remembrance in their hearts,

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਬਦਿਲ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਵ ਹਮ ਬਲਬ ||੫||੧||
transliteration: ham badhil yaadh khudhaa v ham balab | 5 | 1 |
translation: And additionally, should have meditation of His Naam on their lips. (5) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕੁਜਾ ਦੀਦੇਮ ਅਨਵਾਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: har kujaa dheedhaem anavaar khudhaa
translation: At every place, I observe the radiance and manifestation of the Providence

gurmukhi: ਬਸਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਬਜ਼ੁਰਗਾਣ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਜਜ਼ਬ ||੫||੨||
transliteration: basak az suhabath bazuragaan shudh jazab | 5 | 2 |
translation: When I get absorbed in the company of noble souls (which confers on me the blessing of realization). (5) (2)

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ-ਮਾ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਜਮਾਲਸ਼ ਵਾ ਨਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: chashami-maa ghair az jamaalash vaa naa shudha
translation: Our (inside) eyes cannot be really opened without Akaalpurakh's elegance,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਣ ਕਿ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਖ਼ਲਕ ਰਾ ਦੀਦੇਮ ਰ?ਬ ||੫||੩||
transliteration: zaan k jumalaa khalak raa dheedhaem rab | 5 | 3 |
translation: Because we perceive His presence in the entire humanity. (5) (3)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਕਦਮਸ਼ ਰੌਸ਼ਨੀੲਿ ਜਿਲ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: khaak kadhamash raauashaneee jil kunadha
translation: The dust of their feet (humility) can enlighten our hearts, provided,

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਰ ਤੁਰਾਬਾ ਸਾਲਿਕਾਂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਨਸਬ ||੫||੪||
transliteration: ghar thuraabaa saalikaa baashadh nasab | 5 | 4 |
translation: we can establish a sound relationship with those noble souls who are treading this path (of deep devotion for the Master). (5) (4)

gurmukhi: ਕੀਸਤ ਗੋਯਾ ਕੁ ਮਰਾਦਿ ਦਿਲ ਨ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: keesath goyaa k maraadh dhil n yaafatha
translation: Bhai Sahib (Goyaa) is posing the question: Who is that person

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਬਾ ਨਫਸਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਕਰਦਾ ਜਜ਼ਬ ||੫||੫||
transliteration: har kasae baa nafas khudh karadhaa jazab | 5 | 5 |
translation: whose inner desires have not been fulfilled after he can get over his ego? (5) (5)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲ ਅਗ਼ਰ ਦਾਨਾ ਬਵਦ ਅੰਦਰ ਕਿਨਾਰਸ਼ ਯਾਰ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: dhil aghar dhaanaa bavadh andhar kinaarash yaar hasatha
translation: If our mind and heart were intelligent, then the Beloved is in their embrace, and,

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮ ਗਰ ਬੀਨਾ ਬਵਦ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਦੀਦਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੬||੧||
transliteration: chasham gar beenaa bavadh dhar har tharaf dheedhaar hasath | 6 | 1 |
translation: if our eyes were able to appreciate all that they see, then, they will see glimpses and glimpses (of the Beloved) all over. (6) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਤਰਫ ਦੀਦਾਰ ਅ?ਮਾ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ ਬੀਨਾ ਕੁਜਾ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: har tharaf dheedhaar amaa dheedhaae beenaa kujaa hasatha
translation: There are glimpses and glimpses (of the Beloved) all over, but where is the eye to appreciate them?

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਤਰਫ ਤੂਰ ਅਸਤ ਹਰ ਸੂ ਸ਼ੋਅਲਾੲੇ ਅਨਵਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੬||੨||
transliteration: har tharaf thoor asath har soo shoalaaeae anavaar hasath | 6 | 2 |
translation: There is the Mount Sinai all over, and there are leaping flames of His glow and refulgence. (6) (2)

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਅਗਰ ਦਾਰੀ ਬਿਰੌ ਸਰ ਰਾ ਬਿਨਿਹ ਬਰ ਪਾੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: sar agar dhaaree biraau sar raa binih bar paae oo
translation: If you have a head on your body, you should go to Him and place it on His lotus feet;

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣ ਅਗਰ ਦਾਰੀ ਨਿਸਾਰਿਸ਼ ਕੁਨ ਅਗਰ ਦਰਕਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੬||੩||
transliteration: jaan agar dhaaree nisaarish kun agar dharakaar hasath | 6 | 3 |
translation: And, if you have life in you which you value very much, then sacrifice it for Him. (6) (3)

gurmukhi: ਦਸਤ ਅਗਰ ਦਾਰੀ ਬਿਰੌ ਦਾਮਾਨਿ ਜਾਨਾਣ ਰਾ ਬਗੀਰ
transliteration: dhasath agar dhaaree biraau dhaamaan jaanaan raa bageera
translation: If you have a hand, then grab and hold tight the corner of His robe.

gurmukhi: ਸੂੲੇ ੳੂੋ ਮੀ ਰੌ ਅਗਰ ਪਾ ਰਾ ਸਰਿ ਰਫਤਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੬||੪||
transliteration: sooeae ooo mee raau agar paa raa sar rafathaar hasath | 6 | 4 |
translation: If your feet are anxious (or have the strength) to walk, then start walking fast towards Him. (6) (4)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੋਸ਼ ਅਗਰ ਸ਼ੁਨਵਾ ਬਵਦ ਜਜ਼ ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਕੇ ਬਿਸ਼ਨਵਦ
transliteration: ghosh agar shunavaa bavadh jaz naam hak kae bishanavadha
translation: If we have ears that have perfect hearing then they should not hear anything other than the Naam of Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: ਵਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਣ ਗੋਯਾ ਬਵਦ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਸਖ਼ੁਨ ਅਸਰਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੬||੫||
transliteration: var zubaan goyaa bavadh dhar har sakhun asaraar hasath | 6 | 5 |
translation: If our tongue has the power to speak, then it should utter mystic expressions. (6) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਅਦਬ ਪਾ ਰਾ ਮਨਿਹ ਮਨਸੂਰ ਵਸ਼ ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ
transliteration: bae-adhab paa raa manih manasoor vash dhar raahi eishaka
translation: A Brahmin is a devotee of his idol and a Muslim of his shrine;

gurmukhi: ਰਾਹ ਰਵਿ ੲੀਣ ਰਾਹ ਰਾ ਅਵ?ਲ ਕਦਮ ਬਰ ਦਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੬||੬||
transliteration: raah rav een raah raa aval kadham bar dhaar hasath | 6 | 6 |
translation: I am enamored wherever I find an adorer-connoisseur of 'devotion'. (6) (6)

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਰਹਮਨ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਾਕਿ ਬੁ?ਤ ਜ਼ਾਹਿਦ ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਕਾਹ
transliteration: brehaman mushathaak buth zaahidh fidhaae khaanakaaha
translation: Like Mansorr, do not step on the path of devotion with arrogance,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕੁਜਾ ਜਾਮਿ ਮੁਹ?ਬਤ ਦੀਦਾਅਮ ਸਰਸ਼ਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੬||੭||
transliteration: har kujaa jaam muhabath dheedhaaam sarashaar hasath | 6 | 7 |
translation: Otherwise, it is a path where there is a crucifix at the very first step.(6) (7)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿ ਦਾਰੀ ਦਰ ਬਜਾਤਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਨਿਸਾਰਿ ਯਾਰ ਕੁਨ
transliteration: har ch dhaaree dhar bajaath khudh nisaar yaar kuna
translation: Goya says, If your disposition is similar to mine of getting mollified by diamonds,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੁਰਾ ਮਾਨਿੰਦਿ ਗੋਯਾ, ਤਬਾਅਾੲਿ ਗੋਹਰ ਬਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੬||੮||
transliteration: gar thuraa maanindh goyaa, thabaaaae gohar baar hasath | 6 | 8 |
translation: Even then, you should willingly sacrifice all your assets for your Beloved. (6) (8)

gurmukhi: ਗਦਾੲਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਤੁਰਾ ਮੈਲਿ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: gadhaae kooe thuraa mail baadhashaahee neesatha
translation: Goyaa, the beggar and mendicant in your street, has absolutely no desire for an imperial kingdom,

gurmukhi: ਹਵਾੲਿ ਸਲਤਨਤੋ ਜ਼ੋਕਿ ਕਜਕੁਲਾਹੀ ਨੀਸਤ ||੭||੧||
transliteration: havaae salathanatho zok kajakulaahee neesath | 7 | 1 |
translation: He does have a desire for a realm but not only for the sake of a royal tilted cap of power (which brings in ego). (7) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਮਮਲਕਤਿ ਦਿਲ ਗਿ੍ਰਫਤ ਸੁਲਤਾਣ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: har aan k mamalakath dhil grifath sulathaan shudha
translation: Whosoever has won over the realm of 'mind', he is considered as the all-powerful monarch,

gurmukhi: ਕਸੇ ਕਿ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ਤੁਰਾ ਹਮਚੂ ਓ ਸਿਪਾਹੀ ਨੀਸਤ ||੭||੨||
transliteration: kasae k yaafath thuraa hamachoo ou sipaahee neesath | 7 | 2 |
translation: And, whosoever has discovered You does not have a rival as a soldier. (7) (2)

gurmukhi: ਗਦਾੲਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਤੁਰਾ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹਿ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਸਰਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: gadhaae kooe thuraa baadhashaahi har dho saraa-satha
translation: (Addressing Dasam Guru) An established beggar in your street is the emperor of both the worlds,

gurmukhi: ਅਸੀਰਿ ਖ਼ਤਿ ਤੁਰਾ ਹਾਜਤਿ ਗਵਾਹੀ ਨੀਸਤ ||੭||੩||
transliteration: aseer khath thuraa haajath gavaahee neesath | 7 | 3 |
translation: The captive of the ecstasy of the love of your burgeoning hair is not just looking for resurrection. (7) (3)

gurmukhi: ਕੁਦਾਮ ਦੀਦਾ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਵੈ ਸਵਾਦਿ ਨੂਰਿ ਤੂ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: kudhaam dheedhaa k dhar vai savaadh noor thoo neesatha
translation: Which is that eye that does not have the glow of Your glory?

gurmukhi: ਕੁਦਾਮ ਸੀਨਾ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਮਖ਼ਜ਼ਨਿ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ਨੀਸਤ ||੭||੪||
transliteration: kudhaam seenaa k oo makhazan eilaahee neesath | 7 | 4 |
translation: Which is that body (chest) that doesn't have godly treasures in it? (7) (4)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਸ਼ੌ ਵ ੳੁਜਰੇ ਮਖਾਹ ਅੈ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: fidhaae oo shaau v oujarae makhaah ai goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, Do not hesitate or make excuses but sacrifice yourself for Him,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਦਰ ਤਰੀਕਤਿ-ਮਾਜਾੲਿ ੳੁਜ਼ਰ ਖ਼ਾਹੀ ਨੀਸਤ ||੭||੫||
transliteration: k dhar thareekathi-maajaae ouzar khaahee neesath | 7 | 5 |
translation: Because in the vocabulary of lovers (of true devotees), there is no word like 'excuse'. (7) (5)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਅਾਂ ਬੁਤਿ ਨਾਂ-ਮਿਹਰਬਾਂ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ
transliteration: az paesh chasham aa buth naa-miharabaa guzashatha
translation: A non-compassionate cruel beloved passed through before my eyes;

gurmukhi: ਜਾਨਾਂ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ਤਾ ਚਿ ਰਹੇ ਦੀਦਾ ਜਾਂ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੮||੧||
transliteration: jaanaa guzashath thaa ch rehae dheedhaa jaa guzashath | 8 | 1 |
translation: As the beloved went through, it was as if my life (heart and soul) passed away through my eyes. (8) (1)

gurmukhi: ਰੋਗਸ਼ ਕਬੂਦ ਵ ਦਿਲਸ਼ ਪੁਰ ਸ਼ਰਾਰਾ ਸਾਖ਼ਤ
transliteration: rogash kaboodh v dhilash pur sharaaraa saakhatha
translation: The smoke from my continued sighs rose high and deep through the sky,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬਸਕਿ ਦੂਦਿ ਅਾਹਿ ਮਨ ਅਜ਼ ਅਾਸਮਾਂ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੮||੨||
transliteration: az basak dhoodh aahi man az aasamaa guzashath | 8 | 2 |
translation: That they changed its very complexion into teal-blue color and charred its heart. (8) (2)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਰਾ ਬ-ਯ?ਕ ੲਿਸ਼ਾਰਾੲਿ ਅਬਰੂ ਸ਼ਹੀਦ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: maa raa ba-yak eishaaraae abaroo sheheedh karadha
translation: With one pointer with his eyebrows, he simply (metaphorically) murdered (martyred) us,

gurmukhi: ਅਕਨੂੰ ੲਿਲਾਜ ਨੀਸਤ ਕਿ ਤੀਰ ਅਜ਼ ਕਮਾਂ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੮||੩||
transliteration: akanoon eilaaj neesath k theer az kamaa guzashath | 8 | 3 |
translation: But there is no treatment now when the arrow has been shot from the bow. (8) (3)

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਦਮ ਬ-ਖੋਸ਼ ਰਾਹ ਨਾ ਬੁਰਦਮ ਕਿ ਕੀਸਤਮ
transliteration: yak dham ba-khosh raah naa buradham k keesathama
translation: Goyaa says, I cannot attain nor understand my reality as to who I am,

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਵਾੲਿ ਨਕਦ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀਅਮ ਰਾੲਿਗਾਣ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੮||੪||
transliteration: ai vaae nakadh zindhageeam raaeigaan guzashath | 8 | 4 |
translation: Alas ! I have simply wasted all my life's assets.? (8) (4)

gurmukhi: ਹਰਗਿਜ਼ ਬ-ਸੈਰਿ ਰੌਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਰਿਜ਼ਵਾਣ ਨਮੀ ਰਵਦ
transliteration: haragiz ba-sair raauazaae rizavaan namee ravadha
translation: Goyaa says, If someone ever happens to pass through the street of the Beloved,

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਕਸੇ ਕਿ ਜਾਨਿਬ ਕੁੲਿ ਬੁਤਾਣ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੮||੫||
transliteration: goyaa kasae k jaanib kue buthaan guzashath | 8 | 5 |
translation: He would then never go for a stroll (which will be beneath the above pleasure) even in the heavenly garden.? (8) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਦਰ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: badhar paesh rooe thoo sharamindhaa asatha
translation: The moon is abashed when compared to your (beautiful) face,

gurmukhi: ਬਲਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਿ ਜਹਾਣ ਹਮ ਬੰਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੯||੧||
transliteration: balak khurasheedh jehaan ham bandhaa asath | 9 | 1 |
translation: In fact, even the world's sun is also mortified before your radiance, O Guru! its glow and light is subservient to yours. (9) (1)

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਾ ਹਰਗਿਜ਼ ਬਗੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਨਾ ਦੀਦ
transliteration: chasham maa haragiz bagair az hak naa dheedha
translation: Goyaa: My eyes have never recognized anyone other than the Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ਾ ਚਸ਼ਮੇ ਕਿ ਬੀਨਿੰਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੯||੨||
transliteration: ai khushaa chashamae k beenindhaa asath | 9 | 2 |
translation: Blessed are the eyes which can possibly see the Almighty.? (9) (2)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਨਮੀ ਲਾਫ਼ੇਮ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ੁਹਦੋ ਰਿਅਾ
transliteration: maa namee laafaem az zuhadho riaa
translation: I do not brag about my meditation or sanctimony,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਗੁਨਾਹ ਗ਼ਾਰੇਮ ਹ?ਕ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੯||੩||
transliteration: gar gunaah ghaaraem hak bakhashindhaa asath | 9 | 3 |
translation: But if I am ever guilty of this sin, the Waaheguru is all-Forgiving.? (9) (3)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਗਰੇ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਕੁਜਾ ਅਾਰੇਮ ਮਾ
transliteration: dheegarae raa az kujaa aaraem maa
translation: Where can we find another one,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੋਰ ਦਰ ਅਾਲਮ ਯਕੇ ਅਫ਼ਗੰਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੯||੪||
transliteration: shor dhar aalam yakae afagandhaa asath | 9 | 4 |
translation: When there is so much of noise and ado about the Only One. (9) (4)

gurmukhi: ਹਰਫਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਨਿਅਾੲਿਦ ਹੀਚਗਾਹ
transliteration: haraf ghair az hak niaaeidh heechagaaha
translation: No word, other than the Naam of the Waaheguru ever comes to the lips of Goyaa,

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਲਬਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੯||੫||
transliteration: bar lab goyaa k hak bakhashindhaa asath | 9 | 5 |
translation: because of His divine attribute being All-forgiving. (9) (5)

gurmukhi: ਦਰਮਿਅਾਨਿ ਬਜ਼ਮਿ ਮਾ ਜੁਜ਼ ਕਿ?ਸਾੲਿ ਜਾਨਾਨਾ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: dharamiaan bazam maa juz ksiaae jaanaanaa neesatha
translation: In (the chamber of my heart) our gathering, no sermon or discourse other than that about Akaalpurakh is delivered,

gurmukhi: ਬੇ ਹਜਾਬ ਅਾ ਅੰਦਰੀਣ ਮਜਲਿਸ ਕਿ ਕਸ ਬੇਗਾਨਾ ਨੀਸਤ ||੧੦||੧||
transliteration: bae hajaab aa andhareen majalis k kas baegaanaa neesath | 10 | 1 |
translation: Come in and join this congregation. There is no stranger here (in the secrecy of this rendezous). (10) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰ ਅਜ਼ ਬੇਗਾਨਗੀਹਾ ਓ ਬਖ਼ੁਦ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ ਸੌ
transliteration: biguzar az baegaanageehaa ou bakhudh aashanaa saaua
translation: Without worrying about others' personalities, try to understand your own;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਬਾ ਖੁਦ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਬੇਗਾਨਾ ਨੀਸਤ ||੧੦||੨||
transliteration: har k baa khudh aashanaa shudh az khudhaa baegaanaa neesath | 10 | 2 |
translation: Anyone who has understood his own self is no longer stranger to the Akaalpurakh. (10) (2)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਹਰ ਕਿ ਰਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਹਮਾਣ ਸਾਹਿਬ-ਦਿਲ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa har k raa baashadh hamaan saahiba-dhil asatha
translation: Anyone who has a longing to meet the Creator is the master of his own self.

gurmukhi: ਕਾਰਿ ਹਰ ਦਾਨਾ ਨਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ, ਕਾਰਿ ਹਰ ਦੀਵਾਨਾ ਨੀਸਤ ||੧੦||੩||
transliteration: kaar har dhaanaa naa baashadha, kaar har dheevaanaa neesath | 10 | 3 |
translation: This kind of determination does not belong to any intelligent person nor to any maniac. (10) (3)

gurmukhi: ਨਾਸਹਾ ਤਾ ਚੰਦ ਗੋੲੀ ਕਿ?ਸਾਹਾੲਿ ਵਾਅਜ਼ੋ ਪੰਦ
transliteration: naasehaa thaa chandh goee ksiaahaae vaaazo pandha
translation: O sermonizer! How long shall you continue to deliver your sermons?

gurmukhi: ਬਜ਼ਮਿ ਮਸਤਾਨ ਅਸਤ ਜਾੲਿ, ਕਿ?ਸਾ ਓ ਅਫ਼ਸਾਨਾ ਨੀਸਤ ||੧੦||੪||
transliteration: bazam masathaan asath jaaei, ksiaa ou afasaanaa neesath | 10 | 4 |
translation: This is a group of inebriated drunks (of Waaheguru's Naam): It is not a place for telling stories and tales. (10) (4)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਮਤਾੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬ-ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਸਾਹਿਬਾਨਿ-ਦਿਲ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: een mathaae hak ba-paesh saahibaani-dhil bavadha
translation: This divine treasure is only with the men of heart, the masters of their minds,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਬ-ਸਹਿਰਾ ਮੀਰਵੀ ਦਰ ਗੋਸ਼ਾੲਿ ਵੀਰਾਨਾ ਨੀਸਤ ||੧੦||੫||
transliteration: choon ba-sehiraa meeravee dhar goshaae veeraanaa neesath | 10 | 5 |
translation: Why are you wandering in the wilderness? He does not abide in the nooks and corners of the desolate and ruined places. (10) (5)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਮਤਾੲਿ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਅਾਸ਼ਕਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਖ਼ਾਹ
transliteration: ee mathaae shaauak raa az aashakaan hak bakhaaha
translation: Ask the true devotees of Waaheguru about the treasures of fondness for Him;

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਜ਼ਾਨਸ਼ ਬ-ਜੁਜ਼ ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਜਾਨਾ ਨੀਸਤ ||੧੦||੬||
transliteration: jaan k dhar zaanash ba-juz nakash rukh jaanaa neesath | 10 | 6 |
translation: Because, there is nothing else but their concentration on His facial features all their lives. (10) (6)

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦ ਮੀ-ਗੋੲੀ ਤੂ ਅੈ ਗੋਯਾ ਖ਼ਮੁਸ਼ ਸ਼ੋ ਜ਼ੀਣ ਸਖ਼ੁਨ
transliteration: chandh mee-goee thoo ai goyaa khamush sho zeen sakhuna
translation: O Goyaa! How long are you going to indulge in such discussions; it is time for you to shut up;

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਮੁਨਹਸਿਰ ਬਰ ਕਾਅਬਾ ਓ ਬੁਤਖ਼ਾਨਾ ਨੀਸਤ ||੧੦||੭||
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa munehasir bar kaaabaa ou buthakhaanaa neesath | 10 | 7 |
translation: A keenness of the desire for Waaheguru is not confined either in Kaaba or a temple. (10) (7)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲ ਅਗਰ ਦਰ ਹਲਕਾੲਿ, ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਦੋ ਤਾ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ,
transliteration: dhil agar dhar halakaaei, zulaf dho thaa khaahadh guzashatha,a
translation: If my heart can survive (the yearning) passing through tresses of his double curled hair,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਤਨ ਵਜ਼ ਚੀਨੋ, ਮਾਚੀਨੋ ਖ਼ਤਾ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੧੧||੧||
transliteration: az khuthan vaz cheeno, maacheeno khathaa khaahadh guzashath | 11 | 1 |
translation: Then I will understand that it can go through sensitive countries like China without any trouble. (11) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਬਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ, ਯ?ਕ ਨਿਗਾਹਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: baadhashaahee bar dho aalama, yak nigaahi rooe thoo
translation: Just one glimpse of your face is equivalent to the kingdom of both the worlds,

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲਿਅਾੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫਿ ਤੂ, ਅਜ਼ ਬਾਲਿ ਹੁਮਾ ਖਾਹਦ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੧੧||੨||
transliteration: saaeiaae zulaf thoo, az baal humaa khaahadh guzashath | 11 | 2 |
translation: The shadow of your lock of hair has gone past the shadow of the wings of Phoenix, the mystical bird (which is supposed to bring good luck). (11) (2)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਬਸਾਤਿ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ, ਦਰਯਾਬ ਕੀਣ ਬਾਦਿ ਸਬਾ,
transliteration: een basaath oumar raa, dharayaab keen baadh sabaa,a
translation: Make efforts to understand and realize the expansive territory of life,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਕੁਜਾ ਅਾਮਦ ਨਭਦਾਨਮ, ਅਜ਼ ਕੁਜਾ ਖ਼ਹਿਦ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੧੧||੩||
transliteration: az kujaa aamadh nabhadhaanama, az kujaa khehidh guzashath | 11 | 3 |
translation: Because I have no idea of the direction of the morning (youths) breeze from where it came or where it was headed to. (11) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹੀੲਿ ਜਹਾਣ ਜੁਜ਼ ਸ਼ੋਰੋ ਗ਼ੋਗ਼ਾ ਬੇਸ਼ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: baadhashaaheee jehaan juz shoro ghoghaa baesh neesatha
translation: In the eyes of that ascetic who has absolutely no personal axe to grind,

gurmukhi: ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਦਰਵੇਸ਼ੇ ਕਿ ੳੂ, ਅਜ਼ ਮੁਦਅਾ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੧੧||੪||
transliteration: paesh dharavaeshae k oo, az mudhaaa khaahadh guzashath | 11 | 4 |
translation: The kingdom of this world is nothing else but a confusing noise. (11) (4)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤਨ ਹਾ ਚਿਹ ਮੀ ਪੁਰਸੀ ਦਰੀਣ ਦੈਰਿ ਖ਼ਰਾਬ
transliteration: az guzashathan haa chih mee purasee dhareen dhair kharaaba
translation: What kind of questions you want to ask to go through this desolate country (the world),

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਗੁਜ਼ਜ਼ ਤੋ ਹਮ ਗਦਾ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੧੧||੫||
transliteration: baadhashaah khaahadh guzaz tho ham gadhaa khaahadh guzashath | 11 | 5 |
translation: The kings have gone through it and so have the ascetics as well. (11) (5)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਿਅਰਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ-ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ ਅਸਤ ਚੂੰ ਅਾਬਿ-ਹਯਾਤ
transliteration: shiar goyaa zindhagee-bakhash asath choon aabi-hayaatha
translation: The couplets of Goyaa are capable to grant life like the divine nectar,

gurmukhi: ਬਲਕਿ ਦਰ ਪਾਕੀਜ਼ਗੀ ਜ਼ਿ ਅਾਬਿ ਬਕਾ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੧੧||੬||
transliteration: balak dhar paakeezagee z aab bakaa khaahadh guzashath | 11 | 6 |
translation: In fact, they are more effective in chastity than even the elixir of eternal life. (11) (6)

gurmukhi: ੲਿਮ ਸ਼ਬ ਬ-ਤਮਾਸ਼ਾੲਿ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਯਾਰ ਤਵਾਣ ਰਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: eim shab ba-thamaashaae rukh yaar thavaan rafatha
translation: Tonight, Goyaa, the connoisseur of love, can go for a glimpse of beloved,

gurmukhi: ਸੂੲਿ ਬੁਤਿ ਅਾਸ਼ਕ-ਕੁਸ਼ ਅ?ਯਾਰ ਤਵਾਣ ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੨||੧||
transliteration: sooe buth aashaka-kush ayaar thavaan rafath | 12 | 1 |
translation: He can go to the annihilating murderer of the lovers. (metaphorically) (12) (1)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਕੂਚਾੲਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ਅਰ ਚਿ ਮੁਹਾਲ ਅਸਤ ਰਸੀਦਨ
transliteration: dhar koochaae eishak ar ch muhaal asath raseedhana
translation: Even though it is difficult to reach the passage of love and devotion,

gurmukhi: ਮਨਸੂਰ ਸਿਫ਼ਤ ਬਾ-ਕਦਿਮ ਦਾਰ ਤਵਾਣ ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੨||੨||
transliteration: manasoor sifath baa-kadhim dhaar thavaan rafath | 12 | 2 |
translation: It is still possible if one is prepared to put his foot on the crucifix like Mansoor. (12) (2)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਦਿਲ ਬਸੂੲਿ ਮਦਰਿਸਾ ਗਰ ਮੈਲ ਨ ਦਾਰੀ
transliteration: ai dhil basooe madharisaa gar mail n dhaaree
translation: O mind! If you do not have the motive to go the educational school or you are scared of the teacher,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰੇ ਬ-ਸੂੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਮਾਰ ਤਵਾਣ ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੨||੩||
transliteration: baarae ba-sooe khaanaae khumaar thavaan rafath | 12 | 3 |
translation: You may not, but, at least, you should be able to go towards the bar. (12) (3)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਖ਼ਾਤਿ੍ਰਮ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ਤੂ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਰਸ਼ਕਿ ਗੁਲਿਸਤਾਣ
transliteration: choon khaathrim az eishak thoo shudh rashak gulisathaana
translation: When my heart, due to my deep affection for You, has become envy of the blossomed garden,

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਹੁਦਾ ਚਿਰਾ ਜਾਨਬਿ ਗੁਲਜ਼ਾਰ ਤਵਾਣ ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੨||੪||
transliteration: bae-hudhaa chiraa jaanab gulazaar thavaan rafath | 12 | 4 |
translation: Then, how can it ever even think of going to the flower beds. (12) (4)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਦਿਲ ਚੂ ਸ਼ੁਦੀ ਵਾਕਿਫ਼ਿ ਅਸਰਾਰਿ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ
transliteration: ai dhil choo shudhee vaakif asaraar eilaahee
translation: O my mind! When you become familiar with the mysteries of the Lord,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਸੀਨਾ-ਅ?ਮ ਅੈ ਮਖਜ਼ਨਿ ਅਸਰਾਰ ਤਵਾਣ ਰਫਤ ||੧੨||੫||
transliteration: dhar seenaa-am ai makhazan asaraar thavaan rafath | 12 | 5 |
translation: Then, only You, the repository of mysteries, can get into my body. (12) (5)

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਰੌਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਰਿਜ਼ਵਾਨਸਤ ਚੂ ਦਰ ਖਾਨਾ ਸ਼ਿਗੁਫ਼ਤਾ
transliteration: sadh raauazaae rizavaanasath choo dhar khaanaa shigufathaa
translation: When hundreds of gardens are blossoming inside the house, the body,

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਬ-ਚਿਹ ਸੂੲਿ ਦਰੋ ਦੀਵਾਰ ਤਵਾਣ ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੨||੬||
transliteration: goyaa ba-chih sooe dharo dheevaar thavaan rafath | 12 | 6 |
translation: Goyaa says, then how can anyone go to any other structures? (12) (6)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦੀ ਅਾਖਿਰ ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਰਹਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: dheedhee aakhir thaalib maaualaa rehi maaualaa grifatha
translation: Bhai Sahib telling the worldly people, You have eventually seen that the seekers of Akaalpurakh adopted the only path to attain Him,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਲਿ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਗਿਰਾਮੀ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ੀਣ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੩||੧||
transliteration: haasal oumar giraamee raa azeen dhuniaa grifath | 13 | 1 |
translation: Then, you have reaped full benefits from this precious life. (13) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹੀਚ ਕਸ ਬੀਤੂੰ ਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ, ਅਜ਼ ਸਵਾਦਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਤੂ,
transliteration: heech kas beethoon n baashadha, az savaadh zulaf thoo,a
translation: No individual is outside the circumference of your ravishing locks of hair,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਦਿਲਿ ਦੀਵਾਨਾ-ਅਮ, ਅਾਖਿਰ ਹਮੀ ਸੌਦਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੩||੨||
transliteration: een dhil dheevaanaa-ama, aakhir hamee saauadhaa grifath | 13 | 2 |
translation: And, my enchanted mind is also twirled into the same mania. (13) (2)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਅਾਣ ਸਰਵਿ ਰਵਾਣ ਹਰਗਿਜ਼ ਨਿਅਾੲਿਦ ਦਰ ਨਜ਼ਰ
transliteration: ghair aan sarav ravaan haragiz niaaeidh dhar nazara
translation: Since the time his beautiful tall and hefty torso has penetrated into my eyes,

gurmukhi: ਤਾਣ ਕ?ਦਿ ਰਾਅਨਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਦਰ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ-ਮਾ ਜਾ-ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੩||੩||
transliteration: thaan kadh raaanaae oo dhar dheedhaaei-maa jaa-grifath | 13 | 3 |
translation: I have not been able to recognize any one else except his living-cypress-like graceful personality. (13) (3)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਨਿਦਾੲੇ ਨਾਕਾੲਿ ਲੈਲਾ ਦਿਲ ਸ਼ੋਰੀਦਾ ਅਾਮ
transliteration: az nidhaaeae naakaae lailaa dhil shoreedhaa aam
translation: Just hearing the ringing of the bell hung in the neck of Laila's camel, my heart went crazy (because it was the sign of Laila's arrival),

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਮਜਨੂੰ ਮਸਤ ਗਸ਼ਤੋ ਰਹਿ ਸੂੲਿ ਸਹਰਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੩||੪||
transliteration: hamachoo majanoon masath gashatho rehi sooe seharaa grifath | 13 | 4 |
translation: And, like Majnoo, it became ecstatic and ran towards the wilderness of the jungle. (13) (4)

gurmukhi: ਖੁਸ਼ ਨਮੀ ਅਾੲਿਦ ਮਰਾ, ਗਾਹੇ ਬਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ,
transliteration: khush namee aaeidh maraa, gaahae baghair az yaadh haka,a
translation: Ever since, his love-story has abided in my heart,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਹਦੀਸਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ੳੂ, ਅੰਦਰ ਦਿਲਮ ਮਾਵਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੩||੫||
transliteration: thaa hadhees eishak oo, andhar dhilam maavaa grifath | 13 | 5 |
translation: I have no taste for anything other than his true remembrance in every fiber of my body. (13) (5)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਿਅਾੲਿ ਯ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ, ਬਹਿਰਿ ਨਿਸਾਰਿ ਖਿਦਮਤਤ,
transliteration: thaa biaae yak nafasa, behir nisaar khidhamathatha,a
translation: My diamond-showering eyes are preserving lustrous gems similar to the delicate poppy flowers,

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਗੌਹਰ-ਬਾਰਿ ਮਾ, ਖੁਸ਼ ਲੂਲੂੲੇ ਲਾਲਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੩||੬||
transliteration: chasham gaauehara-baar maa, khush loolooeae laalaa grifath | 13 | 6 |
translation: So that during your momentary visit, I could waive them over your precious head in sacrifice. (13) (6)

gurmukhi: ਮੀ ਬਰ-ਅਾੲਿਦ ਜਾਨਿ ਮਨ, ੲਿਮਰੂਜ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਰਾਹਿ ਦੋ ਚਸ਼ਮ,
transliteration: mee bara-aaeidh jaan mana, eimarooz az raahi dho chashama,a
translation: Today, my life is ending through both of my eyes,

gurmukhi: ਨੌਬਤਿ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ੳੂ, ਤਾ ਵਾਅਦਾਦਿ ਫ਼ਰਦਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੩||੭||
transliteration: naauabath dheedhaar oo, thaa vaaadhaadh faradhaa grifath | 13 | 7 |
translation: However, the chance of only one glimpse of him has been deferred to the doomsday.? (13) (7)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਹਮਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਨਿਅਾੲਿਦ, ਬਰ ਜ਼ਬਾਨਮ ਹੀਚ ਗਾਹ,
transliteration: ghair hamadh hak niaaeidha, bar zabaanam heech gaaha,a
translation: Nothing else but the praises of the Lord come up on my lips,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਲਿ ੲੀਣ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ, ਅਾਖ਼ਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੧੩||੮||
transliteration: haasal een oumar raa, aakhar dhil goyaa grifath | 13 | 8 |
translation: Ultimately, Goyaa's heart has reaped full benefits of this life. (13) (8)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਮਨ ਦਰ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕਿ ਯਾਰ ਬਿਸੋਖ਼ਤ
transliteration: dhil man dhar firaak yaar bisokhatha
translation: My heart is charred because of my separation from my beloved,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਬਹਿਰਿਅਾਣ ਨਿਗਾਰ ਬਿਸੋਖ਼ਤ ||੧੪||੧||
transliteration: jaan man behiriaan nigaar bisokhath | 14 | 1 |
translation: And my life and spirit are ablaze and reduced to ashes (in memory of) for my handsome master. (14) (1)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਚੁਨਾਣ ਸੋਖ਼ਤਮ ਅਜ਼ਾਣ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼
transliteration: aan chunaan sokhatham azaan aathisha
translation: I was burnt in that fire so much,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਬਿਸ਼ੁਨੀਦ ਚੂੰ ਚਨਾਰ ਬਸੋਖ਼ਤ ||੧੪||੨||
transliteration: har k bishuneedh choon chanaar basokhath | 14 | 2 |
translation: That anyone who heard about this got burnt too like a pine tree. (14) (2)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਨ ਤਿਨਹਾ ਬਿਸੋਖ਼ਤਮ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ
transliteration: man n thinehaa bisokhatham az eishaka
translation: I am not the only one who was putrefied in the fire of love,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਜ਼ੀਣ ਸ਼ਰਾਰ ਬਿਸੋਖ਼ਤ ||੧੪||੩||
transliteration: hamaa aalam azeen sharaar bisokhath | 14 | 3 |
translation: Rather, the entire world was burnt down with this spark. (14) (3)

gurmukhi: ਸੋਖਤਮ ਦਰ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕਿ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ਿ ਯਾਰ
transliteration: sokhatham dhar firaak aathish yaara
translation: To get burnt in the 'flames of separation' of one's beloved,

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਚੁਨੰੀਣ ਕੀਮੀਅਾ ਬਕਾਰ ਬਿਸੋਖ਼ਤ ||੧੪||੪||
transliteration: ham chunaneen keemeeaa bakaar bisokhath | 14 | 4 |
translation: Is like alchemy, substance that turns any metal into gold, getting minced (burnt) in fire into ashes. (14) (4)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਫਰੀਣ ਬਾਦ ਬਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: aafareen baadh bar dhil goyaa
translation: Blessed is the heart of Goyaa

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਬ-ੳੁਮੀਦ ਰੂੲਿ ਯਾਰ ਬਿਸੋਖ਼ਤ ||੧੪||੫||
transliteration: k ba-oumeedh rooe yaar bisokhath | 14 | 5 |
translation: That it got reduced to ashes only in the expectation of a glimpse of the face of his beloved. (14) (5)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਦੇ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਸਤੋ ਸ਼ੈਦਾ ਅਲਗ਼ਿਅਾਸ
transliteration: az dhae chasham masatho shaidhaa alaghiaasa
translation: Would some one please shield me from (the glare) of his imbued ravishing eyes,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਲਬੋ ਦਹਨਿ ਸ਼ਕਰਖਾ ਅਲ-ਗ਼ਿਅਾਸ ||੧੫||੧||
transliteration: az labo dhehan shakarakhaa ala-ghiaas | 15 | 1 |
translation: And, protect me from his sugar cubes-chewing mouth and lips. (15) (1)

gurmukhi: ਵਾੲੇ ਬਰ ਨਫ਼ਸੇ ਕਿ ਬੇਹੂਦਾ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ
transliteration: vaaeae bar nafasae k baehoodhaa guzashatha
translation: I regret that moment that passed purposelessly,

gurmukhi: ਅਲਗ਼ਿਅਾਸ ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ਫਲਤਿ ਮਾ ਅਲਗ਼ਿਅਾਸ ||੧੫||੨||
transliteration: alaghiaas az ghafalath maa alaghiaas | 15 | 2 |
translation: I also regret my carelessness, and my negligence to let the opportunity to slip by. (15) (2)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਨਿਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਕੁਫ਼ਰੋ ਦੀਣ ਦਿਲ ਬਰਹਮ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: az nizaae kufaro dheen dhil bareham asatha
translation: My heart and soul are frustrated and grieved at the spat on account of blasphemy and religion

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਦਰਿ ਦਰਗਾਹਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਅਲਗ਼ਿਅਾਸ ||੧੫||੩||
transliteration: bar dhar dharagaahi maaualaa alaghiaas | 15 | 3 |
translation: I would look for anyone who would save me at the door of the abode of Akaalpurakh.(Would someone save me when I have brought a plea at the door of the Creator.)' (15) (3)

gurmukhi: ਲੂਲੀਅਾਨਿ ਸ਼ੋਖਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਦਰ ਰਬੂਦ
transliteration: looleeaan shokh aalam dhar raboodha
translation: Playful, sportive and arrogant so called lovers have looted and conned the world.

gurmukhi: ਮੀ ਕੁਨਮ ਅਜ਼ ਦਸਤਿ ਅਾਣਹਾ ਅਲਗ਼ਿਅਾਸ ||੧੫||੪||
transliteration: mee kunam az dhasath aanehaa alaghiaas | 15 | 4 |
translation: I am crying for mercy that I, too, have been exploited by them and are begging so that someone would please save me. (15) (4)

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਜ਼ਿ ਦਸਤਿ ਖ਼ੰਜਰਿ ਮਿਜ਼ਗ਼ਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: k z dhasath khanjar mizaghaan oo
translation: How can Goyaa keep quiet from the dagger-like eyelids of the Master Guru;

gurmukhi: ਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ਖ਼ਾਮੋਸ਼ ਗੋਯਾ ਅਲਗ਼ਿਅਾਸ ||੧੫||੫||
transliteration: mee shavadh khaamosh goyaa alaghiaas | 15 | 5 |
translation: I am still yelling for help. Someone would kindly save me. (15) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮਸਤ ਰਾ ਬਾ-ਜਾਮਿ ਰੰਗੀਣ ੲਿਹਤਿਅਾਜ
transliteration: masath raa baa-jaam rangeen eihathiaaja
translation: Just as a drunk is only looking for and is concerned with a wine glass with ruby-colored drink (wine or alcohol),

gurmukhi: ਤਿਸ਼ਨਾ ਰਾ ਬ-ਅਾਬਿ ਸੀਰੀਣ ੲਿਹਤਿਅਾਜ ||੧੬||੧||
transliteration: thishanaa raa ba-aab seereen eihathiaaj | 16 | 1 |
translation: Similarly, a thirsty person needs a glass of cold sweet water to quench his thirst, a glass of wine is not relevant. (16) (1)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ-ਹ?ਕ ਬਸ ਅਨਵਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: suhabath maradhaani-hak bas anavar asatha
translation: The company of the devotees of Akaalpurakh is saturated with radiance;

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬਾਣ ਰਾ ਹਸਤ ਚਦੀਣ ੲਿਹਤਿਅਾਜ ||੧੬||੨||
transliteration: thaalibaan raa hasath chadheen eihathiaaj | 16 | 2 |
translation: This is all the association that the seekers of Waaheguru really need. (16) (2)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਤਬ?ਸੁਮ ਕਰਦਾੲੀ ਗੁਲਸ਼ਨ ਜਹਾਂ
transliteration: az thabasum karadhaaee gulashan jehaa
translation: One can make this world a beautiful garden with one's smile,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਦੀਦਸ਼ ਕੈ ਬ-ਗੁਲਚੀਂ ੲਿਹਤਿਅਾਜ ||੧੬||੩||
transliteration: har k dheedhash kai ba-gulachee eihathiaaj | 16 | 3 |
translation: Why would one need a gardener, after he had a glimpse of heavenly Him?(16) (3)

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਨਿਗਾਹਿ ਲੁਤਫ਼ਿ ਤੂ ਦਿਲ ਮੀ-ਬੁਰਦ
transliteration: yak nigaahi luthaf thoo dhil mee-buradha
translation: One of your loving and affectionate glances is enough to take away my breath,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜ਼ ਮੀ-ਦਾਰਮ ਅਜ਼ਾਣ ੲੀਣ ੲਿਹਤਿਅਾਜ ||੧੬||੪||
transliteration: baaz mee-dhaaram azaan een eihathiaaj | 16 | 4 |
translation: But, still, I plead before Him for mercy and this is what I need the most. (16) (4)

gurmukhi: ਨੀਸਤ ਗੋਯਾ ਗ਼ਰਿ ਤੂ ਦਰ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਣ
transliteration: neesath goyaa ghar thoo dhar dho jehaana
translation: Goyaa is addressing the Guru: I have no one else but you in both the worlds.

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਤੂ ਦਾਰਮ ਅਜ਼ ਦਿਲੋ ਦੀਣ ੲਿਹਤਿਅਾਜ ||੧੬||੫||
transliteration: baa thoo dhaaram az dhilo dheen eihathiaaj | 16 | 5 |
translation: In fact, I need my heart and soul (faith) (want to live) only for you.(16) (5)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਅੰਬਰੀਨਿ ਤੂ ਗੋਯਾ ਨਕਾਬਿ ਸੁਬਹਾ
transliteration: ai zulaf anbareen thoo goyaa nakaab subehaa
translation: Your firmament like lock of hair is just like a camouflage for the morning,

gurmukhi: ਪਿਨਹਾਣ ਚੂ ਜ਼ੇਰ ਅਬਰਿ ਸਿਅਾਹ ਅਾਫਤਾਬਿ ਸੁਬਹਾ ||੧੭||੧||
transliteration: pinehaan choo zaer abar siaah aafathaab subehaa | 17 | 1 |
translation: Like a morning sun having been eclipsed under the black clouds. (17) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬੀਰੂੰ ਬਰ-ਅਾਮਦ ਅਾਣ ਮਹਿ ਮਨ ਚੂੰ ਜ਼ ਖ਼ਾਬਿ ਸੁਬਹਾ
transliteration: beeroon bara-aamadh aan mehi man choon z khaab subehaa
translation: When my moon, while waking up from his day-sleep, came out,

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਤਾਅਨਾ ਮੀ-ਜ਼ਨਦ ਬ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਅਾਫਤਾਬਿ ਸੁਬਹਾ ||੧੭||੨||
transliteration: sadh thaaanaa mee-zanadh b rukh aafathaab subehaa | 17 | 2 |
translation: It was as if he was imprecating the posture of the morning sun. (17) (2)

gurmukhi: ਬਾ-ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਖ਼ਾਬਨਾਕ ਚੂੰ ਬੀਰੂੰ ਬਰ ਅਾਮਦੀ
transliteration: baa-chasham khaabanaak choon beeroon bar aamadhee
translation: When you, the Guru, emerged with your sleepy eyes from your Bed of love,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਾ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਅਜ਼ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਤੂ ਅਾਫਤਾਬਿ ਸੁਬਹਾ ||੧੭||੩||
transliteration: sharamindhaa gashath az rukh thoo aafathaab subehaa | 17 | 3 |
translation: The morning sun was chagrined and abashed to compare itself with the radiance of your face. (17) (3)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਮਕਦਮਿ ਸ਼ਰੀਫ਼ ਜਹਾਣ ਰਾ ਦਿਹਦ ਫ਼ਰੋਗ਼
transliteration: az makadham shareef jehaan raa dhihadh farogha
translation: When the slumbering morning sun takes off his veil from its face,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਬਰ-ਕਸ਼ਦ ਨਕਾਬ ਜ਼ਿ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਅਾਫ਼ਤਾਬਿ ਸੁਬਹਾ ||੧੭||੪||
transliteration: choon bara-kashadh nakaab z rukh aafathaab subehaa | 17 | 4 |
translation: With its fortunate arrival, it brings (day)light to the whole world. (17) (4)

gurmukhi: ਬੇਦਾਰੀ ਅਸਤ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀੲਿ ਸਾਹਿਬਾਨ ਸ਼ੌਕ
transliteration: baedhaaree asath zindhageee saahibaan shaauaka
translation: The whole life of worldly people is an unending night-long vigil and is an ever lasting amnesia,

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਹਰਾਮ ਕਰਦਮ ਅਜ਼ ਅਾੲਿੰਦਾ ਖ਼ਾਬਿ ਸੁਬਹਾ ||੧੭||੫||
transliteration: goyaa haraam karadham az aaeindhaa khaab subehaa | 17 | 5 |
translation: Goyaa says, However, for me, sleeping during the wee hours of the morning will be forbidden, sinful and morally wrong from now on. (17) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮੀ-ਬੁਰਦ ਦੀਨੋ ਦਿਲਮ ੲੀਣ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਸ਼ੋਖ਼
transliteration: mee-buradh dheeno dhilam een chasham shokha
translation: This playful eye attracts and takes away my breath, heart and faith,

gurmukhi: ਮੀ-ਕਸ਼ਦ ਅਜ਼ ਚਾਹਿ ਗ਼ਮ ੲੀਣ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਸ਼ੋਖ਼ ||੧੮||੧||
transliteration: mee-kashadh az chaahi gham een chasham shokh | 18 | 1 |
translation: And it is the same lively eye that brings me out of my worries and sorrowful times. (18) (1)

gurmukhi: ਕਾਕਲਿ ੳੁ ਫ਼ਿਤਨਾ ਜ਼ਨਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: kaakal o fithanaa zan aalam asatha
translation: One of his locks of hair can create a calamity and disaster in the world,

gurmukhi: ਰੌਣਕ ਅਫ਼ਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਜਹਾਣ ੲੀਣ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਸ਼ੋਖ ||੧੮||੨||
transliteration: raauanak afazaae jehaan een chasham shokh | 18 | 2 |
translation: And just one of his eyes can bless the whole world with prosperity. (18) (2)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਪਾੲਿ ਦੋਸਤੀੲੇ ਦਿਲ ਬੁਵਦ
transliteration: khaak paae dhosatheeeae dhil buvadha
translation: Goyaa is praying, Wish my heart becomes the dust of the feet of my beloved (Guru) - humility,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਦੀੲੇ ਰਾਹਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ੲੀਣ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਸ਼ੋਖ਼ ||੧੮||੩||
transliteration: haadheeeae raahi khudhaa een chasham shokh | 18 | 3 |
translation: And my sportive eye steers my way towards the Akaalpurakh. (18) (3)

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਕੁਨਦ ੳੂ ਸੂੲਿ ਗੁਲਿ ਨਰਗਸ ਨਿਗਾਹ
transliteration: kai kunadh oo sooe gul naragas nigaaha
translation: Anyone who has tasted the savor of that mirthful eye (of the Guru),

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਦੀਦਾ ਲ?ਜ਼ਤਿ ਅਾਣ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਸ਼ੋਖ਼ ||੧੮||੪||
transliteration: har k dheedhaa lazath aan chasham shokh | 18 | 4 |
translation: Will never care to look at the Narcissus flower again. (18) (4)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਰਾ ਗੋਯਾ ਗ਼ੁਬਾਰਿ ਦਿਲ ਨਿਸ਼ਸਤ
transliteration: har k raa goyaa ghubaar dhil nishasatha
translation: Goyaa says, Anyone who has had a glimpse of that sprightly eye (of the Guru) even once,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਦੀਦਾ ਯਕ ਨਿਗਾਹ ਅਾਣ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਸ਼ੋਖ ||੧੮||੫||
transliteration: aan k dheedhaa yak nigaah aan chasham shokh | 18 | 5 |
translation: would have all his suspicions and illusions completely dispelled.? (18) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਹੋਸ਼ ਬਾਸ਼ ਕਿ ਹੰਗਾਮਿ ਨੌਬਹਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ
transliteration: behosh baash k hangaam naauabehaar aamadha
translation: Come back to your senses and rejoice! It is the time for the onset of the new spring season,

gurmukhi: ਬਹਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ ਵਾ ਯਾਰ ਵਾ ਕਰਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ ||੧੯||੧||
transliteration: behaar aamadh vaa yaar vaa karaar aamadh | 19 | 1 |
translation: The spring is here, my beloved, the Guru, has arrived, and now my heart is serene and at peace.? (19) (1)

gurmukhi: ਦਰੂਨਿ ਮਰਦੁਮਿ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਜ਼ਿ ਬਸ ਕਿ ਜਲਵਾ ਗਰਸਤ
transliteration: dharoon maradhum chasham z bas k jalavaa garasatha
translation: My (Guru's) splendor and refulgence have penetrated so much in the pupil of my eye,

gurmukhi: ਬਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਕਿ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਕਰਦ ਰੂੲਿ ਯਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ ||੧੯||੨||
transliteration: behar tharaf k nazar karadh rooe yaar aamadh | 19 | 2 |
translation: That wherever and in whichever direction, it may look, it sees only the loving face of my beloved, the Guru. (19) (2)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਕਿ ਰਵਦ ਦੀਦਾ ਮੀਰਵਮ ਚਿ ਕੁਨਮ
transliteration: ba-har tharaf k ravadh dheedhaa meeravam ch kunama
translation: I am the slave of my eyes; I turn in the direction in which my eyes direct me and are gazing. What can I do?

gurmukhi: ਦਰੀਣ ਮੁਕ?ਦਮਾ ਮਾ ਰਾ ਚਿਹ ਅਖ਼ਤਿਅਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ ||੧੯||੩||
transliteration: dhareen mukadhamaa maa raa chih akhathiaar aamadh | 19 | 3 |
translation: In fact, what control do we have in this path of love? (19) (3)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਬਰ ਦਿਹੰਦ ਬ-ਯਾਰਾਨਿ ਮੁਦ?ੲੀ ਕਿ ੲਿਮਸ਼ਬ
transliteration: khabar dhihandh ba-yaaraan mudhaee k eimashaba
translation: Some claimant friends got the news from some one that Manssor,

gurmukhi: ਅਨਲਹ?ਕ ਜ਼ਦਾ ਮਨਸੂਰ ਸੂੲਿ ਦਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ ||੧੯||੪||
transliteration: analehak zadhaa manasoor sooe dhaar aamadh | 19 | 4 |
translation: yelling that he was the Lord, was seen proceeding towards the scaffold tonight. (19) (4)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਬਰ ਦਿਹੇਦ ਬ-ਗੁਲਹਾ ਕਿ ਬਿਸ਼ਗੁਫ਼ੰਦ ਹਮਾ
transliteration: khabar dhihaedh ba-gulehaa k bishagufandh hamaa
translation: Inform all the flowers to begin blossoming, because

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ੀਣ ਨਵੇਦ ਕਿ ਜ਼ਾਣ ਬੁਲਬੁਲ ਹਜ਼ਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ ||੧੯||੫||
transliteration: azeen navaedh k zaan bulabul hazaar aamadh | 19 | 5 |
translation: This good news came from the thousand singing nightingales. (19) (5)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਬਾਣ ਬ-ਮਾਣਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਗ਼ੈਰਤ ਜੁਦਾ ਵ ਮਨ ਹੈਰਾਣ
transliteration: zabaan ba-maanadh z ghairath judhaa v man hairaana
translation: Goyaa says, The tongue has become dumb out of shame and the heart is distraught on its own instance;

gurmukhi: ਹਦੀਸ ਸ਼ੋਕਿ ਤੋ ਅਜ਼ ਬਸ ਕਿ ਬੇ-ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ ||੧੯||੬||
transliteration: hadhees shok tho az bas k bae-shumaar aamadh | 19 | 6 |
translation: Who can complete the story of my unlimited fondness for You, the Guru? (19) (6)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਿਅਾਲਿ ਹਲਕਾੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਤੂ ਮੀ-ਕੁਨਦ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: khiaal halakaae zulaf thoo mee-kunadh goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, I keep entangling myself on the curls of the lock of your hair, O Guru!

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ੀਣ ਸਬ?ਬ ਕਿ ਦਿਲ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਬੇ-ਕਰਾਰ ਅਾਮਦ ||੧੯||੭||
transliteration: azeen sabab k dhil az shaauak bae-karaar aamadh | 19 | 7 |
translation: Because, my mind that keeps yearning with intense desire to see you is able to attain peace and stability.? (19) (7)

gurmukhi: ਤਬੀਬ ਅਾਸ਼ਿਕਿ ਬੇਦਰਦ ਰਾ ਦਵਾ ਚਿ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: thabeeb aashik baedharadh raa dhavaa ch kunadha
translation: What can a doctor prescribe as a medication for a patient suffering from a keen love?

gurmukhi: ਤੁਰਾ ਕਿ ਪਾੲੇ ਬਵਦ ਲੰਗ ਰਹਿਨੁਮਾ ਚਿ ਕੁਨਦ ||੨੦||੧||
transliteration: thuraa k paaeae bavadh lang rehinumaa ch kunadh | 20 | 1 |
translation: How can a pilot, the Guru, help to show the right path when we, ourselves have a crippled condition with lame legs? (20) (1)

gurmukhi: ਜਮਾਲਿ ੳੂ ਹਮਾ ਜਾ ਬੇ-ਹਿਸਾਬ ਜਲਵਾਗਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: jamaal oo hamaa jaa bae-hisaab jalavaagar asatha
translation: All his (Guru's) glow and grace are visible without a camouflage,

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਦਰ ਹਿਜਾਬਿ ਖ਼ੁਦੀ ਯਾਰ ਮਹਿ ਲਕਾ ਕਿ ਕੁਨਦ ||੨੦||੨||
transliteration: thoo dhar hijaab khudhee yaar mehi lakaa k kunadh | 20 | 2 |
translation: When we are under the garb of ego, what can even a moon-like serene face do for us? (20) (2)

gurmukhi: ਤੁਰਾ ਕਿ ਨੀਸਤ ਬਯ?ਕ ਗੂਨਾ ਖ਼ਾਤਿਰਿ ਮਜਮੂਅ
transliteration: thuraa k neesath bayak goonaa khaathir majamooa
translation: One who does not have any momentary direction or stability in his mind,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਕਾਮਿ ਅਮਨੋ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਗੋਸ਼ਾ ਯਾਰ ਸਰਾ ਚਿ ਕੁਨਦ ||੨੦||੩||
transliteration: mukaam amano khush goshaa yaar saraa ch kunadh | 20 | 3 |
translation: What can a placid spot or a quiet nook of a mansion do for him? (20) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਬਦਰਕਾੲਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ਕੋ ਰਸੀ ਬ-ਮੰਜ਼ਲਿ ਯਾਰ
transliteration: baghair badharakaae eishak ko rasee ba-manzal yaara
translation: How can you reach the court of the Beloved without a preceptor of love?

gurmukhi: ਬਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਜਜ਼ਬਾੲਿ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਤੂ ਰਹਿਨੁਮਾ ਚਿ ਕੁਨਦ ||੨੦||੪||
transliteration: baghair jazabaae shaauak thoo rehinumaa ch kunadh | 20 | 4 |
translation: What can a guide do to help if you lack the desire and the emotion?? (20) (4)

gurmukhi: ਚੂ ਸੁਰਮਾੲਿ ਦੀਦਾ ਕੁਨੀ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਅੈ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: choo suramaae dheedhaa kunee khaak murashadh ai goyaa
translation: O Goyaa ! As long as you are able to use the sacred dust of the feet of the Guru as a collyrium for your eyes,

gurmukhi: ਜਮਾਲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਨਿਗਰੀ ਬਾ ਤੂ ਤੂਤੀਅਾ ਚਿ ਕੁਨਦ ||੨੦||੫||
transliteration: jamaal hak nigaree baa thoo thootheeaa ch kunadh | 20 | 5 |
translation: You would be able to see the grace and refulgence of the Creator. What other use is the collyrium for you? (20) (5)

gurmukhi: ਸਬਾਅ ਚੂੰ ਹਲਕਾ ਹਾੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਸ਼ਾਨਾ ਮੀ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ
transliteration: sabaaa choon halakaa haae zulaf oo raa shaanaa mee saazadha
translation: When the easterly breeze combs through the curls of his tresses,

gurmukhi: ਅਜਿਬ ਜ਼ੰਜੀਰ ਅਜ਼ ਬਹਰਿ ਦਿਲਿ ਦੀਵਾਨਾ ਮੀ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ ||੨੧||੧||
transliteration: ajib zanjeer az behar dhil dheevaanaa mee saazadh | 21 | 1 |
translation: It is as if it is making a strange chain link for my insane mind. (21) (1)

gurmukhi: ਨ ਦਾਨਿਸਤੇਮ ਅਜ਼ ਰੂਜ਼ਿ ਅਜ਼ਲ ੲੀਣ ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ਅਾਦਮ ਰਾ
transliteration: n dhaanisathaem az rooz azal een nakash aadham raa
translation: We have not understood the significance of the human body since the dawn of creation, beginning of the time,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਨ?ਕਾਬ ਅਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲੇ ਮਾਣਦਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਖ਼ਾਨਾ ਮੀ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ ||੨੧||੨||
transliteration: k nakaab az baraaeae maanadhan khudh khaanaa mee saazadh | 21 | 2 |
translation: That, the Lord created this body for His own abode. (21) (2)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਅਾਸ਼ਕ ਬ-ਅੰਦਕ ਫ਼ੁਰਸਤਿ ਮਾਸ਼ੂਕ ਮੀ ਗਰਦਦ
transliteration: dhil aashak ba-andhak furasath maashook mee garadhadha
translation: The heart of a lover becomes that of the beloved's in a short time;

gurmukhi: ਸਰਾ ਪਾ ਜਾਣ ਸ਼ਵਦ ਹਰ ਕਸ ਕਿ ਬਾ ਜਾਨਾਨਹ ਮੀ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ ||੨੧||੩||
transliteration: saraa paa jaan shavadh har kas k baa jaanaaneh mee saazadh | 21 | 3 |
translation: Anyone who is on good terms with the beloved becomes the heart and soul from feet to the head (all over his body). (21) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਰਾੲੇ ਗੁਰਦਾੲਿ ਨਾਣ ਗਿਰਦਿ ਹਰ ਦੁਨੀ ਚਿ ਮੀ ਗਰਦੀ
transliteration: baraaeae guradhaae  naan giradh har dhunee ch mee garadhee
translation: Why are you running after (every) mean person for a morsel of bread?

gurmukhi: ਤਮਅਾ ਦੀਦੀ ਕਿ ਅਾਦਮ ਰਾ ਅਸੀਰ ਦਾਨਾ ਮੀ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ ||੨੧||੪||
transliteration: thamaaa dheedhee k aadham raa aseer dhaanaa mee saazadh | 21 | 4 |
translation: You know well that the greed for just one grain makes one a prisoner. (21) (4)

gurmukhi: ਮਗੋ ਅਜ਼ ਹਾਲਿ ਲੈਲਾ ਰਾ ਦਿਲਿ ਸ਼ੋਰੀਦਾੲਿ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: mago az haal lailaa raa dhil shoreedhaae goyaa
translation: O Goyaa! Do not narrate the circumstances of Lailaa to any deranged mind,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਸ਼ਰਾਹ ਕਿ?ਸਾੲਿ ਮਜਨੂੰ ਮਰਾ ਦੀਵਾਨਾ ਮੀ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ ||੨੧||੫||
transliteration: k sharaah ksiaae majanoon maraa dheevaanaa mee saazadh | 21 | 5 |
translation: Because, I become insane just after listening to the tale of Majnoo. It is just apt for an insane (for Guru's love) like me. (21) (5)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਯਦਾ ਹਜ਼ਾਰ ਸਿਜਦਾ ਬ-ਸੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: hayadhaa hazaar sijadhaa ba-sooe thoo meekunandha
translation: Addressing the Guru: People prostrate eighteen thousand times with their faces towards You

gurmukhi: ਹਰਦਮ ਤਵਾਫ਼ਿ ਕਾਅਬਾ ਕੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੨||੧||
transliteration: haradham thavaaf kaaabaa kooe thoo meekunandh | 22 | 1 |
translation: And they circumambulate all the times the street of Your Kaabaa, the sacred place. (22) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਜਾ ਕਿ ਬਿਨਿਗਰੇਦ ਜਮਾਲਿ ਤੂ ਬਿਨਿਗਰੇਦ
transliteration: har jaa k binigaraedh jamaal thoo binigaraedha
translation: Wherever they see, they see your (the Guru's) elegance and radiance,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬ ਦਿਲਾਣ ਨਜ਼ਾਰਾੲਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੨||੨||
transliteration: saahib dhilaan nazaaraae rooe thoo meekunandh | 22 | 2 |
translation: O Knower of the innermost feelings of their hearts! They see a glimpse of your face. (22) (2)

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣ ਰਾ ਨਿਸਾਰਿ ਕਾਮਤਿ ਰਾਅਨਾਤ ਕਰਦਾ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: jaan raa nisaar kaamath raaanaath karadhaa andha
translation: They, the people, have sacrificed their lives for your handsome personality and grand stature,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲ-ਹਾੲਿ ਮੁਰਦਾ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੨||੩||
transliteration: dhila-haae muradhaa zindhaa z rooe thoo meekunandh | 22 | 3 |
translation: And, with your redolence, they can revive the courage in (morally and physically) dead minds. (22) (3)

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲੀਨਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ-ਨੁਮਾ ਹਸਤ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: aaeenaae khudhaaei-numaa hasath rooe thoo
translation: O Guru! Your face is the mirror through which they can get Lord's glimpse,

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਜ਼ਿ-ਅਾੲੀਨਾੲਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੨||੪||
transliteration: dheedhaar hak zi-aaeenaae rooe thoo meekunandh | 22 | 4 |
translation: And, they do get His glimpse through the mirror of your face. Even the Garden of heaven is envious of this. (22) (4)

gurmukhi: ਤੀਰਾ ਦਿਲਾਣ ਕਿ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਨਦਾਰੰਦ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: theeraa dhilaan k chasham nadhaarandh muthalik andha
translation: The corrupt-minded-peolple who do not have the proper vision,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦ ਰਾ ਮੁਕਾਬਲਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੨||੫||
transliteration: khurasheedh raa mukaabal rooe thoo meekunandh | 22 | 5 |
translation: take the liberty of putting the sun in front of your elegant face. (22) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮਸਤਾਨਿ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਗ਼ੁਲਗ਼ਲਾ ਦਾਰੰਦ ਦਰ ਜਹਾਣ
transliteration: masathaan shaauak ghulaghalaa dhaarandh dhar jehaana
translation: In their exuberance for their love for your affection, they sacrifice thousands of the worlds.

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਜਾਣ ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲਿ ਯ?ਕ ਸਰ ਮੋੲੀ ਤੂ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੨||੬||
transliteration: sadh jaan fidhaae yak sar moee thoo meekunandh | 22 | 6 |
translation: In fact, they sacrifice hundreds of lives just for one lock of your hair. (22) (6)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਪਰਦਾੲਿ ਜਮਾਲਿ ਤੂ ਰੋਸ਼ਨ ਸ਼ਵਦ ਜਹਾਣ
transliteration: dhar paradhaae jamaal thoo roshan shavadh jehaana
translation: When people talk of the notoriety and fame of your face,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਕਿ ਜ਼ਿਕਰ ਜ਼ਰਦੀ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੨||੭||
transliteration: dhar har tharaf k zikar zaradhee rooe thoo mee kunandh | 22 | 7 |
translation: Then, in the garb of your refulgence, the whole world gets illuminated and fragrance floats around. (22) (7)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਗਾਨਿ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਤੂ ਗੋਯਾ ਸਿਫ਼ਤ ਮਦਾਮ
transliteration: aashufathagaan shaauak thoo goyaa sifath madhaama
translation: Like Goyaa, those with wounds of your love and captivated by your devotion,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਵਾਜ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼-ਕਲਾਮ ਜ਼ਿ ਬੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੨||੮||
transliteration: aavaaz khusha-kalaam z booe thoo meekunandh | 22 | 8 |
translation: Always tune up their voices into melodies with your fragrance. (22) (8)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਗਰਦਸ਼ਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਤੂ ਕਿ ਅ?ਯਾਮ ਨ ਦਾਰਦ
transliteration: ai garadhash  chasham  thoo k ayaam n dhaaradha
translation: O Guru, my good friend! Radiance of your eyes cannot be matched by the light of the day.

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਿ ਫ਼ਲਕ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਰੁਖ਼ਤ ਨਾਮ ਨਦਾਰਦ ||੨੩||੧||
transliteration: khurasheedh  falak paesh rukhath naam nadhaaradh | 23 | 1 |
translation: Even the sun in the sky is no match to the refulgence of your face. (23) (1)

gurmukhi: ਸ?ਯਾਦ ਕਜ਼ਾ ਅਜ਼ ਪੲੇ ਦਿਲ ਬੁਰਦਨਿ ਅਾਸ਼ਿਕ
transliteration: sayaadh kazaa az peae dhil buradhan aashika
translation: To capture the heart of the beloved hunter of the death,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਚਲਕਾੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਤੂ ਦਿਗਰ ਦਾਮ ਨਦਾਰਦ ||੨੩||੨||
transliteration: choon chalakaae zulaf thoo dhigar dhaam nadhaaradh | 23 | 2 |
translation: There is no better snare like the noose of your ravishing lock of hair. (23) (2)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਗਿਰਾਣ ਮਾਯਾੲਿ ਗ਼ਨੀਮਤ ਸ਼ੁਮਰ ਅਾਖ਼ਿਰ
transliteration: een oumar giraan maayaae ghaneemath shumar aakhira
translation: This priceless life that we have been bestowed with should be considered as blessed,

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਸੁਬਹ ਨ ਦੀਦੇਮ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਸ਼ਾਮ ਨ-ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੩||੩||
transliteration: maa subeh n dheedhaem k oo shaam na-dhaaradh | 23 | 3 |
translation: Because, we have not yet seen a morning (youth) that did not have an evening (old age). (23) (3)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਚੰਦ ਦਿਲਾਸਾ ਕੁਨਮ ੲੀਣ ਖ਼ਾਤਿਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਰਾ
transliteration: thaa chandh dhilaasaa kunam een khaathir khudh raa
translation: O Guru, heart of hearts! How long can I keep consoling my mind?

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਦੀਦਨਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਦਿਲ ਅਾਰਾਮ ਨ ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੩||੪||
transliteration: bae-dheedhan rooe thoo dhil aaraam n dhaaradh | 23 | 4 |
translation: The fact is that I do not get any succor or comfort without getting a glimpse of your handsome face. (23) (4)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਗੋਹਰ ਬਾਰ ਕਿ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: een chasham gohar baar k dhariaa shudhaa goyaa
translation: The gem-showering eye, O Goyaa, has become deep as an ocean,

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਰੂੲਿ ਦਿਲਾਰਮ ਤੂ ਅਾਰਾਮ ਨ-ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੩||੫||
transliteration: bae-rooe dhilaaram thoo aaraam na-dhaaradh | 23 | 5 |
translation: The mind is not consoled without your comforting glimpse. (23) (5)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਲਾਲਿ ਜਾਣ ਫ਼ਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਤੂ ਗੋਯਾ ਨਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: thaa laal jaan fazaae thoo goyaa namee shavadha
translation: O Guru! Until your life-extending red lips do not utter some expression,

gurmukhi: ਦਰਮਾਨਿ ਦਰਦਿ ਮਾਸਤ ਕਿ ਪੈਦਾ ਨਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੪||੧||
transliteration: dharamaan dharadh maasath k paidhaa namee shavadh | 24 | 1 |
translation: The cure for our pains and agonies cannot be produced. (24) (1)

gurmukhi: ਲਬਿ ਤਿਸ਼ਨਾ ਰਾ ਬਾ-ਅਾਬਿ ਲਬਤ ਹਸਤ ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂ
transliteration: lab thishanaa raa baa-aab labath hasath aarazoo
translation: My thirsty lips are yearning for the elixir coming out of your lips,

gurmukhi: ਤਸਕੀਨਿ ਮਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਖ਼ਿਜ਼ਰੋ ਮਸੀਹਾ ਨਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੪||੨||
transliteration: thasakeen maa z khizaro maseehaa namee shavadh | 24 | 2 |
translation: I cannot be satisfied either by eternity-bestowing Khizar or dead-reviving  Maseehaa. (24) (2)

gurmukhi: ਦਾਰੇਮ ਦਰਦਿ ਦਿਲ ਕਿ ਮਰ ੳੂ ਰਾ ੲਿਲਾਜ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: dhaaraem dharadh dhil k mar oo raa eilaaj neesatha
translation: I am stricken with such a heart ailment that doesn't have any cure.

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਜਾਣ ਨਮੀ ਦਿਹੇਮ ਮਦਾਵਾ ਨਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੪||੩||
transliteration: thaa jaan namee dhihaem madhaavaa namee shavadh | 24 | 3 |
translation: I will be not be cured and be comfortable until I surrender my life. (24) (3)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਫ਼ਤਮ ਕਿ ਜਾਣ-ਦਿਹੇਮ ੲਿਵਜ਼ਿ ਯ?ਕ ਨਿਗਾਹਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: gufatham k jaana-dhihaem eivaz yak nigaahi thoo
translation: I said, I can give my life for just a single glimpse of yours.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਫ਼ਤਾ ਮਿਅਾਨਿ ਮਾ ਓ ਤੂ ਸੌਦਾ ਨਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੪||੪||
transliteration: gufathaa miaan maa ou thoo saauadhaa namee shavadh | 24 | 4 |
translation: He responded, We cannot have a deal between us on these terms. (24) (4)

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰ ਹਵਾੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਗਿਰਾਹਗੀਰ ਮਹਿਵਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: andhar havaae zulaf giraahageer mehivashaana
translation: My mind is twisted under the yearning for the locks of hair of the moon-like beautiful and serene personality,

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਵੀ-ਰਵਮ ਗਿਰਹ ਜ਼ਿ ਦਿਲਮ ਵਾ ਨਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੪||੫||
transliteration: man vee-ravam gireh z dhilam vaa namee shavadh | 24 | 5 |
translation: I realize this. However, no one except you, the Guru, can unravel these knots. (24) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ਮੁਰਾਦ ਕੁਜਾ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ ਸ਼ਵੇਮ
transliteration: baa haasil muraadh kujaa aashanaa shavaema
translation: Until our eyes become an ocean (full of tears) in your remembrance,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਾ ਬ-ਯਾਦਿ ਤੂ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਨਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੪||੬||
transliteration: thaa chasham maa ba-yaadh thoo dhariaa namee shavadh | 24 | 6 |
translation: We cannot be aware of the intended sense of much smaller limits of even a river-bank. (24) (6)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਦਰ ੲਿੰਤਜ਼ਾਰਿ ਤੂ ਚਸ਼ਮਮ ਸਫ਼ੇਦ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: goyaa dhar einthazaar thoo chashamam safaedh shudha
translation: Goyaa says, My eyes have become pale and blind waiting for your arrival,in expectation of seeing you,

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਚੂੰ ਕੁਨਮ ਕਿ ਬੇ ਤੂ ਦਿਲਾਸਾ ਨਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੪||੭||
transliteration: man choon kunam k bae thoo dhilaasaa namee shavadh | 24 | 7 |
translation: What can I do? No one else can give me any solace and console me. (24) (7)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਮਾਹਿ ਦੋ ਹਫ਼ਤਾ ਰੂ ਨਮਾੲੀ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: choon maahi dho hafathaa roo namaaee ch shavadha
translation: What would happen if you would show your full-moon-like gracious face?

gurmukhi: ੲਿਮਸ਼ਬ ਮਹਿ ਮਨ ਅਗਰ ਬਿਅਾੲੀ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੫||੧||
transliteration: eimashab mehi man agar biaaee ch shavadh | 25 | 1 |
translation: O my beloved! There would be just no cause of any damage if you would kindly show your face tonight. (25) (1)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਜੁਮਲਾੲਿ ਜਹਾਣ ਅਾਸੀਰਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਤ ਗਸ਼ਤਾ
transliteration: een jumalaae jehaan aaseer zulafath gashathaa
translation: The whole world is enchanted and captivated with just one lock of your hair.

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਲਹਿਜ਼ਾ ਅਗਰ ਗਿਰਹਾ ਕੁਸ਼ਾੲੀ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੫||੨||
transliteration: yak lehizaa agar girehaa kushaaee ch shavadh | 25 | 2 |
translation: What would you lose and what would be the harm if you would open this mystery (knot) just for one moment? (25) (2)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਲਮ ਹਮਾ ਗਸ਼ਤਾ ਅਸਤ ਬੇ ਤੂ ਤਾਰੀਕ
transliteration: aalam hamaa gashathaa asath bae thoo thaareeka
translation: The entire world fell into darkness without you,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦ ਸਿਫ਼ਤ ਅਗਰ ਬਰ ਅਾੲੀ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੫||੩||
transliteration: khurasheedh sifath agar bar aaee ch shavadh | 25 | 3 |
translation: What would you lose if you were to come out like the sun? (25) (3)

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਲਹਿਜ਼ਾ ਬਿਅਾ ਵਾ ਦਰ ਦੋ ਚਸ਼ਮਮ ਬਿ-ਨਸ਼ੀ
transliteration: yak lehizaa biaa vaa dhar dho chashamam bi-nashee
translation: Goyaa says: Kindly come even for a moment and make my eyes your abode.

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦੀਦਾ ਨਿਸ਼ਸਤਾ ਦਿਲਰੁਬਾੲੇ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੫||੪||
transliteration: dhar dheedhaa nishasathaa dhilarubaaeae ch shavadh | 25 | 4 |
translation: O you, the enticer of my heart! What would be the harm if you were to abide in my eyes just for a short time? (25) (4)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਿੰਦੂੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਲਤ ਕਿ ਬਰ-ਰੂਅਤ ਸ਼ੈਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: een hindhooe khaalath k bara-rooath shaidhaa asatha
translation: What would be the harm if you could sell your black moled-torso to me,

gurmukhi: ਬਿ-ਫ਼ਰੋਸ਼ੀ ਅਗਰ ਬ ਨਕਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲੀ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੫||੫||
transliteration: bi-faroshee agar b nakadh khudhaaee ch shavadh | 25 | 5 |
translation: who is crazy for your divine face in exchange for the whole world? (25) (5)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦੀਦਾ ਤੂੲੀ ਵ ਮਨ ਬਹਰਿ ਕੂ ਜੋਯਾ
transliteration: dhar dheedhaa thooee v man behar koo joyaa
translation: You are the light of my eyes and  are abiding in them. Then whom am I looking for?

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਪਰਦਾੲਿ ਗ਼ੈਬ ਰੂ-ਨਮਾੲੀ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੫||੬||
transliteration: az paradhaae ghaib roo-namaaee ch shavadh | 25 | 6 |
translation: What would be the harm if you could emerge out of the invisible veil and show me your beautiful face? (25) (6)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾਸਤ ਬਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਸੁਰਾਗ਼ਤ ਜੋਯਾ
transliteration: goyaasath behar tharaf suraaghath joyaa
translation: Goyaa says, I am lost on your trail and am trying to look for you (the Guru) in every nook and corner,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਗੁਮ-ਸ਼ੁਦਾਰਾ ਰਹਿਨਮਾੲੀ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੫||੭||
transliteration: gar guma-shudhaaraa rehinamaaee ch shavadh | 25 | 7 |
translation: What would you lose if you were to direct this strayed and lost person towards the right path. (25) (7)

gurmukhi: ਕਦਮ ਅਾਣ ਬਿਹ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਰਾਹਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਪੈਮੂਦਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: kadham aan bih k oo raahi khudhaa paimoodhaa mee baashadh
translation: A footstep taken towards the path of Truth is a worthwhile one,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਬਾਨੇ ਬਿਹ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਅਾਸੂਦਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੨੬||੧||
transliteration: zabaanae bih k dhar zikar khudhaa aasoodhaa mee baashadh | 26 | 1 |
translation: And the tongue that invokes and savors the meditation of His Naam is blessed. (26) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬਹਰ ਸੂੲਿ ਕਿ ਮੀ-ਬੀਨਮ ਬ ਚਸ਼ਮਮ ਮਾਸਵਾ ਨਾੲਿਦ
transliteration: behar sooe k mee-beenam b chashamam maasavaa naaeidha
translation: Whenever and wherever I look, nothing penetrates into my eyes,

gurmukhi: ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਨਕਬਿ ੳੂ ਦਰ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ ਮਾ ਬੂਦਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੨੬||੨||
transliteration: hamaeshaa nakab oo dhar dheedhaae maa boodhaa mee baashadh | 26 | 2 |
translation: In fact, it is His features and impressions which pervade and are imprinted into my eyes all the times. (26) (2)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਮਰਾ ਮਾਅਲੂਮ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਾਖ਼ਿਰ
transliteration: z faiz murashadh kaamil maraa maaaloom shudh aakhira
translation: It is the blessing of a complete and true Guru that made me aware (of this reality),

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਮੁਰਦਮਿ ਦੁਨੀਅਾ ਗ਼ਮ-ਅਾਲੂਦਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੨੬||੩||
transliteration: k dhaaeim muradham dhuneeaa ghama-aaloodhaa mee baashadh | 26 | 3 |
translation: That the worldly people are inseparable from sorrows and worries. (26) (3)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਹੇ ਸਾਹਿਬਦਿਲਿ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਜ਼ਮੀਰਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ
transliteration: zehae saahibadhil raauashan zameer aarif kaamila
translation: How fortunate is the person with a radiant heart and soul that is thoroughly and fully enlightened,

gurmukhi: ਕਿਹ ਬਰ ਦਰਗਾਹਿ ਹ?ਕ ਪੇਸ਼ਾਨੀੲਿ ੳੂ ਸੂਦਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੨੬||੪||
transliteration: kih bar dharagaahi hak paeshaaneee oo soodhaa mee baashadh | 26 | 4 |
translation: And whose forehead constantly bows in the court of Waaheguru. (26) (4)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਕੁਰਬਾਨੀ ਸਰਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਬਿਗ਼ਰਦ ਵ ਦਮ ਮਜ਼ਨ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: ba-kurabaanee sar kooe bigharadh v dham mazan goyaa
translation: O Goyaa! Keep circling around his territory expecting to offer a sacrifice without bragging about it,

gurmukhi: ੲਿਸ਼ਾਰਤਹਾੲਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ੳੂ ਮਰਾ ਫ਼ਰਮੂਦਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੨੬||੫||
transliteration: eishaarathehaae chasham oo maraa faramoodhaa mee baashadh | 26 | 5 |
translation: I am just waiting for a simple signal and pointer of his eyes. (26) (5)

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰ ਤਖ਼ਤਿ ਮੁਰ?ਸਾ ਫ਼ਤਾਦਾ ਦਰ ਰਹਿ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: hazaar thakhath murasaa fathaadhaa dhar rehi andha
translation: There are thousands of studded peacock thrones littered in your way,

gurmukhi: ਕਲੰਦਰਾਨਿ ਤੂ ਤਾਜੋ ਨਗੀਂ ਨਮੀ ਖ਼ਾਹੰਦ ||੨੭||੧||
transliteration: kalandharaan thoo thaajo nagee namee khaahandh | 27 | 1 |
translation: But your devout followers stupefied by your grace have absolutely no desire for any crowns or gems. (27) (1)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਨਾਹ ਪਜ਼ੀਰ ਬਵਦ ਹਰ ਚਿ ਹਸਤ ਦਰ ਅਾਲਮ
transliteration: fanaah pazeer bavadh har ch hasath dhar aalama
translation: Everything in this world is destructible and ceases to exist (ultimately),

gurmukhi: ਨਹਿ ਅਾਸ਼ਕਾਣ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ਅਸਰਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ਅਾਗਾਹ ਅੰਦ ||੨੭||੨||
transliteration: nehi aashakaan k az asaraar eishak aagaah andh | 27 | 2 |
translation: But the lovers never get destroyed because they know the secrets of love. (27) (2)

gurmukhi: ਤਮਾਮ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਤਵਾਣ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਪੈੲਿ ਨ?ਜ਼ਰਾੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: thamaam chasham thavaan  shudh paie nazaraae oo
translation: All eyes were anxiously intent for a glimpse of the Guru,

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰ ਸੀਨਾ ਬਿ ਸੌਦਾੲਿ ਹਿਜਰ ਮੀਕਾਹੰਦ ||੨੭||੩||
transliteration: hazaar seenaa b saauadhaae hijar meekaahandh | 27 | 3 |
translation: And thousands of minds are getting submerged (like in quick sand) in their anxiety of separation (from the Guru). (27) (3)

gurmukhi: ਤਮਾਮ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਦੁਨੀਅਾ ਬ-ਯ?ਕ ਨਿਗਾਹ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ੰਦ
transliteration: thamaam dhaaualath dhuneeaa ba-yak nigaah bakhashandha
translation: Believe me! That even his mendicant is the emperor of emperors,

gurmukhi: ਯਕੀਣ ਬਿਦਾਣ ਕਿ ਗਦਾਯਾਨਿ ੳੂ ਸ਼ਹਿਨਸ਼ਾਹ ਅੰਦ ||੨੭||੪||
transliteration: yakeen bidhaan k gadhaayaan oo shehinashaah andh | 27 | 4 |
translation: Because, he could endow the wealth of the world to anyone with just one of  his glances. (27) (4)

gurmukhi: ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਤਲਬ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: hamaeshaa suhabath maradhaan hak thalab goyaa
translation: O Goyaa! Always look for the company of the devotees of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਤਾਲਬਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਵਾਸਲਾਨਿ ਅ?ਲਾਹ ਅੰਦ ||੨੭||੫||
transliteration: k thaalabaan khudhaa vaasalaan alaah andh | 27 | 5 |
translation: Because His seekers are always connected with Him. (27) (5)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਦਸਤਿ ਮਨ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਪੈੲਿ ਕਾਰ ਮੀਰਵਦ
transliteration: gar dhasath man hamaeshaa paie kaar meeravadha
translation: Although my hands and feet are occupied in my mundane activities,

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਚੂੰ ਕੁਨਮ ਕਿ ਦਿਲ ਬਸੂੲਿ ਯਾਰ ਮੀ ਰਵਦ ||੨੮||੧||
transliteration: man choon kunam k dhil basooe yaar mee ravadh | 28 | 1 |
translation: But what can I do, (because I am helpless) my mind is constantly thinking of my Beloved. (28) (1)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਵਾਜ਼ਿ ਲਨਤਰਾਨੀ ਹਰ ਦਮ ਬੋਗ਼ਸ਼ਿ ਦਿਲ
transliteration: aavaaz lanatharaanee har dham boghash dhila
translation: Although the voice of 'One cannot see' keeps echoing in our ears all the times,

gurmukhi: ਮੂਸਾ ਮਗ਼ਰ ਬਦੀਦਨਿ ਦੀਦਾਰ ਮੀ-ਰਵਦ ||੨੮||੨||
transliteration: moosaa maghar badheedhan dheedhaar mee-ravadh | 28 | 2 |
translation: But still Moses kept on going to get a glimpse of the Lord. (28) (2)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਦੀਦਾ ਨੀਸਤ ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਅਸ਼ਕ ਮੀ-ਚਕਦ
transliteration: een dheedhaa neesath aan k azo ashak mee-chakadha
translation: This is not the eye that will let out any tears,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਮਿ ਮੁਹ?ਬਤ ਅਸਤ ਕਿ ਸਰਸ਼ਾਰ ਮੀ-ਰਵਦ ||੨੮||੩||
transliteration: jaam muhabath asath k sarashaar mee-ravadh | 28 | 3 |
translation: In fact, the cup of love and devotion is always full to the brim. (28) (3)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਦਾਰ ਵਾ ਦਿਲ ਜ਼ਿ ਬਸਕਿ ਯਕੇ ਅੰਦ ਦਰ ਵਜੂਦ
transliteration: dhiladhaar vaa dhil z basak yakae andh dhar vajoodha
translation: The heart and the beloved are so much intertwined with each other,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣ ਦਿਲ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਜਾਨਬਿ ਦਿਲਦਾਰ ਮੀ-ਰਵਦ ||੨੮||੪||
transliteration: jaan dhil hamaeshaa jaanab dhiladhaar mee-ravadh | 28 | 4 |
translation: That this is the reason that it always keeps running towards (seeking) the latter. (28) (4)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਕੌਨ ਗਰਦਨਿ ੳੂ ਸਰ-ਬੁਲੰਦ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: dhar har dho kaauan garadhan oo sara-bulandh shudha
translation: Any one who rushes towards the crucifix like Mansoor

gurmukhi: ਮਨਸੂਰ ਵਾਰ ਹਰ ਕਿ ਸੂੲਿ ਦਾਰ ਮੀ-ਰਵਦ ||੨੮||੫||
transliteration: manasoor vaar har k sooe dhaar mee-ravadh | 28 | 5 |
translation: Will have his neck and head high with pride in both the worlds. (29) (5)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਯਾਦਿ ਦੂਸਤ ਹਕੀਕੀ ਹ?ਯਾਤ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: goyaa z yaadh dhoosath hakeekee hayaath yaafatha
translation: Goyaa says, I have found the real life in the remembrance of my beloved,

gurmukhi: ਦੀਗ਼ਰ ਚਿਰਾ ਬਕੂਚਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਮਾਰ ਮੀ-ਰਵਦ ||੨੮||੬||
transliteration: dheeghar chiraa bakoochaae khumaar mee-ravadh | 28 | 6 |
translation: Why should I now have any reason to visit the tavern or the pub? (29) (6)

gurmukhi: ਕੀਸਤ ੲਿਮਰੂਜ਼ ਕਿ ਸੌਦਾੲਿ ਨਿਗਾਰੇ ਦਾਰਦ
transliteration: keesath eimarooz k saauadhaae nigaarae dhaaradha
translation: Is there someone today who is madly in love for a glimpse of his beloved?

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹੇਸਤ ਦਰੀਣ ਦਹਿਰ ਕਿ ਯਾਰੇ ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੯||੧||
transliteration: baadhashaahaesath dhareen dhehir k yaarae dhaaradh | 29 | 1 |
translation: Anyone who has a true friend (beloved) in this world is a king. (29) (1)

gurmukhi: ਦਾਨਮ ਅੈ ਸ਼ੋਖ਼ ਕਿ ਖ਼ੂਨਿ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਣ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਰੇਖ਼ਤ
transliteration: dhaanam ai shokh k khoon dho jehaan khaahadh raekhatha
translation: O lively lover ! I know that you will be involved in making the two worlds bleed,

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਸਤ ਤੂ ੲਿਮਰੂਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਮਾਰੇ ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੯||੨||
transliteration: chasham masath thoo eimarooz khumaarae dhaaradh | 29 | 2 |
translation: Because your intoxicated and charming eye is full of alcoholic drink today (metaphorically). (29) (2)

gurmukhi: ਦਾਮਨਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਰਾ ਖ਼ੂਨਿ ਜਿਗਰ ਰੰਗੀਣ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: dhaaman chasham maraa khoon jigar rangeen karadha
translation: The blood from my heart has reddened my eyelids (like a wounded lover),

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਦੀਵਾਨਾੲਿ ਮਾ ਤੁਰਫ਼ਾ ਬਹਾਰੇ ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੯||੩||
transliteration: dhil dheevaanaae maa thurafaa behaarae dhaaradh | 29 | 3 |
translation: Showing that a strange spring has sprung up in my mad heart due to intense love. (29) (3)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਯਾੲਿ ਤੂਬਾ ਓ ਫ਼ਿਰਦੌਸ ਨਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਹਰਗਿਜ਼
transliteration: saayaae thoobaa ou firadhaauas nakhaahadh haragiza
translation: Any one, like Manssor, who has achieved even a shadow of the scaffold or crucifix,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਮਨਸੂਰ ਸਿਫ਼ਤ ਸਾਯਾੲਿ ਦਾਰੇ ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੯||੪||
transliteration: har k manasoor sifath saayaae dhaarae dhaaradh | 29 | 4 |
translation: Would never have any desire either for the heavens or for the shade of the heavenly tree. (29) (4)

gurmukhi: ਰੂੲਿ ਗੁਲਗੂਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਅੈ ਸ਼ਮਾਅ ਬਰ ਅਫ਼ਰੂਜ਼ ਦਮੇ
transliteration: rooe gulagoon khudh ai shamaaa bar afarooz dhamae
translation: O flame of the lamp! Keep your rose-like red-flowered face lit for a little while,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਪਰਵਾਨਾ ਓ ਬੁਲਬੁਲ ਬ-ਤੂ ਕਾਰੇ ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੯||੫||
transliteration: dhil paravaanaa ou bulabul ba-thoo kaarae dhaaradh | 29 | 5 |
translation: Because the moth and the nightingale have some business with you. (29) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਦੀਵਾਨਾ ਅਗਰ ਸਿਲਸਲਾ-ਹਾ ਮੀਸਾਜ਼ੰਦਿ
transliteration: ba-har dheevaanaa agar silasalaa-haa meesaazandhi
translation: Goyaa says, Although chains are made to strangle every madly-in-love person,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਬ ਖ਼ਮਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ ਕਰਾਰੇ ਦਾਰਦ ||੨੯||੬||
transliteration: dhil goyaa b kham zulaf karaarae dhaaradh | 29 | 6 |
translation: Yet my heart is being choked in the noose of (Guru's) lock of hair. (29) (6)

gurmukhi: ਕਸੇ ਬਹਾਲਿ ਗ਼ਰੀਬਾਨਿ ਬੇ-ਨਵਾ ਨ-ਰਸਦ
transliteration: kasae behaal ghareebaan bae-navaa na-rasadha
translation: No one listens nor cares for the plight of the poor travelers.

gurmukhi: ਰਸੀਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਜਾੲਿ ਕਿ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾ ਨ ਰਸਦ ||੩੦||੧||
transliteration: raseedhaaeim bajaae k baadhashaa n rasadh | 30 | 1 |
translation: However, I have attained a stage where even the kings failed to reach.? (30) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰ ਖ਼ੁਲਦਿ ਬਰੀਣ ਰਾ ਬ-ਨੀਮ ਜੌ ਨ-ਖ਼ਰੰਦ
transliteration: hazaar khuladh bareen raa ba-neem jaau na-kharandha
translation: (The true devotees) will not purchase even thousands of lofty heavens for just a grain or two of barley,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ਾਣ ਕਿ ਹੀਚ ਬਦਾਣ ਕੂੲਿ ਦਿਲਰੁਬਾ ਨ ਰਸਦ ||੩੦||੨||
transliteration: azaan k heech badhaan kooe dhilarubaa n rasadh | 30 | 2 |
translation: Because none of these heavens are capable to lead me to the abode of my Beloved. (30) (2)

gurmukhi: ਤਬੀਬਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ਚੁਨੀਣ ਗੁਫ਼ਤਾ ਅਸਤ ਮੀ-ਗੋਯੰਦ
transliteration: thabeeb eishak chuneen gufathaa asath mee-goyandha
translation: It is said, according to the doctor of love, that no one, except the Waaheguru, knows the pain and suffering of separation.

gurmukhi: ਬਹਾਲਿ ਦਰਦਿ ਗ਼ਰੀਬਾਣ ਬਜੁਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਨ ਰਸਦ ||੩੦||੩||
transliteration: behaal dharadh ghareebaan bajuz khudhaa n rasadh | 30 | 3 |
translation: No one listens to the sad stories of the destitute (has a cure to their pains and sorrows). (30) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਰਾੲਿ ਰੌਸ਼ਨੀੲਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਦਿਲ ਅਗਰ ਖ਼ਾਹੀ
transliteration: baraae raauashaneee chasham dhil agar khaahee
translation: If you want to see the light for your eyes of your heart, then understand,

gurmukhi: ਬਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਦਰਗਾਹਿ ੳੂ ਹੀਚ ਤੁਤੀਅਾ ਨ ਰਸਦ ||੩੦||੪||
transliteration: bakhaak dharagaahi oo heech thutheeaa n rasadh | 30 | 4 |
translation: That no better collyrium than the dust of the foyer of the Beloved. (30) (4)

gurmukhi: ਬਯਾਦਿ ਦੂਸਤ ਤਵਾਣ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ ਬਸਰ ਬੁਰਦਨ
transliteration: bayaadh dhoosath thavaan oumar raa basar buradhana
translation: A person should spend his whole life in the memory of his Beloved,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਦਰ ਬਰਾਬਰਿ-ਅਾਣ ਹੀਚ ਕੀਮੀਅਾ ਨ ਰਸਦ ||੩੦||੫||
transliteration: k dhar baraabari-aan heech keemeeaa n rasadh | 30 | 5 |
translation: Because, there is no other medicine compared to this treatment. (30) (5)

gurmukhi: ਤਮਾਮ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਗੀਤੀ ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਦਰਸ਼
transliteration: thamaam dhaaualath geethee fidhaae khaak dharasha
translation: I wish I could sacrifice the entire wealth of this world and my life itself for Him,

gurmukhi: ਕਿਹ ਤਾ ਫ਼ਿਦਾ-ਸ਼ ਨ ਗਰਦਦ ਕਸੇ ਬਜਾ ਨ ਰਸਦ ||੩੦||੬||
transliteration: kih thaa fidhaa-sh n garadhadh kasae bajaa n rasadh | 30 | 6 |
translation: (He is such an Entity) that unless I do so and surrener completely, I cannot reach Him, the destination. (30) (6)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਦਰਸ਼ ਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ਅਜ਼ਾਣ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: fidhaae khaak dharash mee shavadh azaan goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, I am willing to sacrifice myself for the dust of His threshhold,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਹਰਕਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਨ ਗਰਦਦ ਬ ਮੁਦਅਾ ਨ ਰਸਦ ||੩੦||੭||
transliteration: k harak khaak n garadhadh b mudhaaa n rasadh | 30 | 7 |
translation: Because, unless I do so, I can never attain my goal. It is impossible to reach Him without complete humility. (30) (7)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਦਰਗਹਿ ੳੂ ਕੀਮੀਅਾ ਗਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: mushath khaak dharagehi oo keemeeaa gar mee kunadha
translation: Although a handful of dust of Akaalpurakh's abode can make a healing drug,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਗ਼ਦਾ ਰਾ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹਿ ਹਫ਼ਤ-ਕਿਸ਼ਵਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੧||੧||
transliteration: har ghadhaa raa baadhashaahi hafatha-kishavar mee kunadh | 31 | 1 |
translation: It can also elevate every mendicant to be the king of seven countries. (31) (1)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਦਰਗਾਹਿ ਤੂ ਸਦ ਤਾਜ ਅਸਤ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਫ਼ਰਕਿ ਮਨ
transliteration: khaak dharagaahi thoo sadh thaaj asath behir farak mana
translation: The dust of Your court shines the forehead like hundereds of crown jewels,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸੀਅਮ ਗਰ ਦਿਲ ਹਵਾੲੇ ਤਾਜੋ ਅਫ਼ਸਰ ਮੂ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੧||੨||
transliteration: aaseeam gar dhil havaaeae thaajo afasar moo kunadh | 31 | 2 |
translation: It would be a great sin if my mind still desires to have pearls and thrones. (31) (2)

gurmukhi: ਕੀਮੀਅਾਗਰ ਗਰ ਜ਼ਿ ਮਿਸ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ ਤੀਲਾੲਿ ਦੂਰ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: keemeeaagar gar z mis saazadh theelaae dhoor neesatha
translation: If a chemist can convert copper into gold, then it is not impossible for

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਹ?ਕ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਰਾ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਿ ਅਨਵਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੧||੩||
transliteration: thaalib hak khaak raa khurasheedh anavar mee kunadh | 31 | 3 |
translation: The heavenly pond to convert one grain of its soil into a radiant sun. (31) (3)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਅਾਰਫ਼ ਮੁਯ?ਸਰ ਗਰ ਸ਼ਵਦ ੲੀਂ ਅਜਬ ਦਾਂਅ
transliteration: suhabath aaraf muyasar gar shavadh ee ajab dhaaa
translation: If you can meet the Providence, consider it as a miracle;

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਤਨਤ ਰਾ ਤਾਲਬਿ ਹ?ਕ, ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਅਕਬਰ ਮੇ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੧||੪||
transliteration: ee thanath raa thaalab haka, shaauak akabar mae kunadh | 31 | 4 |
translation: In fact, search for Him is the highst prize for his seekers. (31) (4)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਿਅਰਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਕੂ ਬਿਸ਼ਨਵਦ ਅਜ਼ ਜਾਨੋ ਦਿਲ
transliteration: shiar goyaa har kasae koo bishanavadh az jaano dhila
translation: Anyone who listens to the poetry of Goyaa with his heart and soul,

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਦਿਲਸ਼ ਪਰਵਾੲੇ ਲਾਅਲਿ ਦੁਕਾਨਿ ਗੌਹਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੧||੫||
transliteration: kai dhilash paravaaeae laaal dhukaan gaauehar mee kunadh | 31 | 5 |
translation: He will not then care for the gems and pearls in a jewelers shop. (31) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮਿਸਲਿ ਦਹਾਨਿ ਤੰਗਿ ਤੂ ਤੰਗ ਸ਼ਕਰ ਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: misal dhehaan thang thoo thang shakar n baashadh
translation: A sugar bubble is no match to the beauty and touch of your closed lips,

gurmukhi: ੲੀ ਮਿਸਲ ਰਾ ਕਿ ਗੁਫ਼ਤਮ ਜ਼ੀਣ ਖ਼ੂਬਤਰ ਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੩੨||੧||
transliteration: ee misal raa k gufatham zeen khoobathar n baashadh | 32 | 1 |
translation: This is not a clich?. It is the truth unsurpassed. This is the best example that I can present here. (32) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਹਿਜਰ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ ਸ਼ੌ ਗਰ ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਵਸਾਲੀ
transliteration: baa hijar aashanaa shaau gar thaalib vasaalee
translation: If You are yearning for a meeting with Him, then get used to 'separation',

gurmukhi: ਰਹ ਕੈ ਬਰੀ ਬਮੰਜ਼ਲ ਤਾ ਰਾਹਬਰ ਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੩੨||੨||
transliteration: reh kai baree bamanzal thaa raahabar n baashadh | 32 | 2 |
translation: Separation is the only guide. If there is no one to steer your way, how can you ever reach your destination? (32) (2)

gurmukhi: ਦਾਮਾਨਿ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਮਗੁਜ਼ਾਰ ਅਜ਼ ਦਸਤ ਹਮਚੂ ਮਿਜ਼ਗਾਣ
transliteration: dhaamaan chasham maguzaar az dhasath hamachoo mizagaana
translation: Do not let go the hem of the (hands of) eyelids just as the eyelids are holding on to the eyes until,
