gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਜੇਬਿ ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂਹਾ ਪੁਰ ਅਜ਼ ਗੁਹਰ ਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੩੨||੩||
transliteration: thaa jaeb aarazoohaa pur az guhar n baashadh | 32 | 3 |
translation: Your pocket of wishes is not filled with diamonds and pearls. (32) (3)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਾਖ਼ਿ ੳੁਮੀਦਿ ਅਾਸ਼ਕਿ ਹਰਗਿਜ਼ ਸਮਰ ਨਹਿ ਗੀਰਦ
transliteration: shaakh oumeedh aashak haragiz samar nehi geeradha
translation: The branch (of the tree) of hope of a lover never blossoms unless

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਅਸ਼ਕਿ ਅਾਬਿ ਮਿਜ਼ਗਾਣ ਤਾਣ ਸਬਜ਼-ਤਰ ਨਹਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੩੨||੪||
transliteration: az ashak aab mizagaan thaan sabaza-thar nehi baashadh | 32 | 4 |
translation: It receives irrigation from the drops of water (tears) of the eyelids. (32) (4)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਬੁਅਲਫ਼ਜ਼ੂਲ ਗੋਯਾ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ੳੂ ਮ?ਜ਼ਨ ਦਮ
transliteration: ai bualafazool goyaa az eishak oo mazan dhama
translation: O you dunce Goyaa! Why are you engaging in useless talk? Do not brag about your love for him, the Guru,

gurmukhi: ਕੋ ਪਾ ਨਹਦ ਦਰੀਣ ਰਹਿ ਅਾਣ ਰਾ ਸਰ ਨਹਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੩੨||੫||
transliteration: ko paa nehadh dhareen rehi aan raa sar nehi baashadh | 32 | 5 |
translation: Because, only those who have already had their heads severed from their bodies are entitled to tread this path. (32) (5)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਲਿ ਹੋਲੀ ਬਬਾਗ਼ਿ ਦਹਿਰ ਬੂ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: gul holee babaagh dhehir boo karadha
translation: The aroma of spring flowers of Holi festival makes the whole garden, the world, full of special fragrance.

gurmukhi: ਲਬਿ ਚੂੰ ਗੁੰਚਾ ਰਾ ਫ਼ਰਖੰਦਾ ਖ਼ੂ ਕਰਦ ||੩੩||੧||
transliteration: lab choon gunchaa raa farakhandhaa khoo karadh | 33 | 1 |
translation: And gave the blossoming bud-like lips a pleasant disposition. (33) (1)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਲਾਬੋ ਅੰਬਰੋ ਮਸ਼ਕੋ ਅਬੇਰੀ
transliteration: gulaabo anbaro mashako abaeree
translation: The Akaalpurakh spread the roses, the sky, the fragrance of musk and

gurmukhi: ਚੂ ਬਾਰਾਨਿ ਬਾਰਿਸ਼ਿ ਅਜ਼ ਸੂ ਬਸੂ ਕਰਦ ||੩੩||੨||
transliteration: choo baaraan baarish az soo basoo karadh | 33 | 2 |
translation: sandalwood all over like the raindrops. (33) (2)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਹੇ ਪਿਚਕਾਰੀੲੇ ਪੁਰ ਜ਼ਾਅਫ਼ਰਾਨੀ
transliteration: zehae pichakaareeeae pur zaaafaraanee
translation: How beautiful and effective is a saffron filled squirt pump?

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਹਰ ਬੇਰੰਗ ਰਾ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ਰੰਗੋ ਬੂ ਕਰਦ ||੩੩||੩||
transliteration: k har baerang raa khusharango boo karadh | 33 | 3 |
translation: That it converts even the discolored and the ugly into colorful and aromatic. (33) (3)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਲਾਲਿ ਅਫ਼ਸ਼ਾਨੀੲਿ ਦਸਤਿ ਮੁਬਾਰਿਕ
transliteration: gulaal afashaaneee dhasath mubaarika
translation: With the throwing of powdered red color by his holy hands on me

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਮੀਨੋ ਅਾਸਮਾਂ ਰਾ ਸੁਰਖ਼ੁਰੂ ਕਰਦ ||੩੩||੪||
transliteration: zameeno aasamaa(n) raa surakhuroo karadh | 33 | 4 |
translation: It made both the earth and the heaven all crimsen colored for me. (33 ) (4)

gurmukhi: ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਰੰਗੀਣ ਅਜ਼ ਤੁਫ਼ੈਲਸ਼
transliteration: dho aalam gashath rangeen az thufailash
translation: With His grace, both the worlds began to bathe in colorful dispositions,

gurmukhi: ਚੂ ਸ਼ਾਹਮ ਜਾਮਾ ਰੰਗੀਨ ਦਰ ਗੁਲੂ ਕਰਦ ||੩੩||੫||
transliteration: choo shaaham jaamaa rangeen dhar guloo karadh | 33 | 5 |
translation: When he put shiny clothes suitable for only rich people on my neck. (33) (5)

gurmukhi: ਕਸੇ ਕੂ ਦੀਦ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਮੁਕ?ਦਸ
transliteration: kasae koo dheedh dheedhaar mukadhasa
translation: Anyone who was fortunate to get a sacred glimpse of Him, the Guru,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਾਦਿ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਨਿਕੋ ਦਰਦ ||੩੩||੬||
transliteration: muraadh oumar raa haasil niko dharadh | 33 | 6 |
translation: Take it that he, surely, was able to fulfill his lifelong desire. (33) (6)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਵਦ ਕੁਰਬਾਨ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਸੰਗਤ
transliteration: shavadh kurabaan khaak raahi sangatha
translation: Goyaa says, If I could sacrifice myself for the dust of the path traversed by noble souls,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਹਮੀਣ ਰਾ ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂ ਕਰਦ ||੩੩||੭||
transliteration: dhil goyaa hameen raa aarazoo karadh | 33 | 7 |
translation: This is all that I have wished and persevered all my life. My life's ambition would be fulfilled. (33) (7)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਵਸਫ਼ਸ਼ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਣ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼
transliteration: zikar vasafash bar zubaan baashadh lazeeza
translation: A musical description of the Master's great qualities and kudos is very savory to the tongue of a human being,

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਿ ੳੂ ਅੰਦਰ ਦਹਾਣ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੪||੧||
transliteration: naam oo andhar dhehaan baashadh lazeez | 34 | 1 |
translation: How palatable is it when His Naam is recited through the mouth of a human being? (34) (1)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਸੇਬਿ ਜ਼ਿ ਨਖ਼ਦਾਨੇ ਸ਼ੁਮਾ
transliteration: ai zehae saeb z nakhadhaanae shumaa
translation: Wonderful! How beautiful is the dimple in your chin that is red and white like an apple?

gurmukhi: ਮੇਵਾ ਚੂੰ ਦਰ ਬੋਸਤਾਣ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੪||੨||
transliteration: maevaa choon dhar bosathaan baashadh lazeez | 34 | 2 |
translation: Where can one find such a sweet and tasty fruit in the garden? (34) (2)

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਾ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਜ਼ਿ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਸ਼ੁਮਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: chasham maa raauashan z dheedhaar shumaa asatha
translation: My eyes have light only because they can see your glimpse,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣ ਨਿਸਾਰਿਸ਼ ਬਸਕਿ ਅਾਣ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੪||੩||
transliteration: jaan nisaarish basak aan baashadh lazeez | 34 | 3 |
translation: In your glimpse, there is enormous comfort; that is why I am willing to sacrifice myself for it. (34) (3)

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਬਲੇ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਤੂ ਦਿਲਿ ਰਾ ਬੁਰਦ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: sunbalae zulaf thoo dhil raa buradh asatha
translation: The scented locks of your hair have captivated my mind and soul,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਲਬਿ ਲਾਅਲਿ ਤੂ ਜਾਣ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੪||੪||
transliteration: aan lab laaal thoo jaan baashadh lazeez | 34 | 4 |
translation: And it is hanging near your ruby red lips. It is so sensuous and relishable. (34) (4)

gurmukhi: ਲ?ਜ਼ਤਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਨਹਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਬਿਹ ਅਜ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: lazath goyaa nehi baashadh bih azaana
translation: O Goyaa! There is no other larger pleasure or sweeter,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਸ਼ਿਅਰੇ ਤੂ ਬ-ਹਿੰਦੁਸਤਾਣ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੪||੫||
transliteration: hamachoo shiarae thoo ba-hindhusathaan lazeez | 34 | 5 |
translation: What the people of India derive singing your poetry. (34) (5)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਣ ਰਾ ਸੂੲਿ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼
transliteration: aarifaan raa sooe oo baashadh lazeeza
translation: For the spiritually enlightened persons, only His posture is joyful,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸ਼ਿਕਾਣ ਰਾ ਕੂੲੇ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੫||੧||
transliteration: aashikaan raa kooeae oo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 1 |
translation: And for the lovers, the streets of their beloved are the way to happiness. (35) (1)

gurmukhi: ਕਾਕਲਿ ੳੂ ਦਿਲ ਫ਼ਰੇਬਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: kaakal oo dhil faraeb aalam asatha
translation: His (guru's) locks of hair have captivated the hearts of the entire world;

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬਾਣ ਰਾ ਮੂੲੇ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੫||੨||
transliteration: thaalibaan raa mooeae oo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 2 |
translation: In fact, his devotees are enamored with each and every hair on his head. (36) (2)

gurmukhi: ਰੌਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਬਾਗ਼ਿ ੲਿਰਮ ਕੁਰਬਾਣ ਕੁਨਮ
transliteration: raauazaae baagh eiram kurabaan kunama
translation: I love his (Guru's) street so much that

gurmukhi: ਬਸਕਿ ਮਾ ਰਾ ਕੂੲਿ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੫||੩||
transliteration: basak maa raa kooe oo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 3 |
translation: I will swap it anytime and sacrifice even the garden of heaven for it. (35) (3)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਮੀ ਗਰਦਮ ਜ਼ਿ ਬੂੲਿ ਮਕਦਮਸ਼
transliteration: zindhaa mee garadham z booe makadhamasha
translation: I get completely revived with the aroma of his holy feet, blessed arrival,

gurmukhi: ਬਸਕਿ ਮਾ ਰਾ ਬੂੲਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੫||੪||
transliteration: basak maa raa booe baashadh lazeez | 35 | 4 |
translation: That is why I relish that fragrance so much. (35) (4)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼
transliteration: zikar yaadh hak k oo baashadh lazeeza
translation: How tasteful and savoray is even the talk of the thought and remembrance of Akaalpurakh?

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਹਮਾ ਮੇਵਾ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੫||੫||
transliteration: az hamaa maevaa k oo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 5 |
translation: This happens to be by far the sweetest of all fruits (35) (5)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਬ-ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ੀ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਅਾਲਮ ਮੇ ਸ਼ਵੀ
transliteration: aaba-bakhashee jumalaa aalam mae shavee
translation: If you aspire the pursuit for this kind of ambition,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੁਰਾ ੲੀਣ ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੫||੬||
transliteration: gar thuraa een aarazoo baashadh lazeez | 35 | 6 |
translation: Then, you would be the one who would bestow the divine nectar to the whole world. (35) (6)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੇਅਰਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਬੇਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੀਰੋ ਸ਼ਕਰ
transliteration: shaear goyaa baesh az sheero shakara
translation: The poetry of Goyaa is such a fruit in India

gurmukhi: ਮੇਵਾ ਦਰ ਹਿੰਦੁਸਤਾਣ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਲਜ਼ੀਜ਼ ||੩੫||੭||
transliteration: maevaa dhar hindhusathaan baashadh lazeez | 35 | 7 |
translation: That it is proclaimed as far sweeter than even sugar and milk. (35) (7)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਿ ਮਕਦਮਤ ਅੈ ਅਬਰੂੲਿ ਫ਼ਸਲਿ ਬਹਾਰ
transliteration: z faiz makadhamath ai abarooe fasal behaara
translation: O eyebrows (sprouts) of the crop of spring season! With the grace of your advent,

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਣ ਚੂ ਬਾਗ਼ਿ ੲਿਰਮ ਪੁਰ ਸ਼ੁਦਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ੁਲਜ਼ਾਰ ||੩੬||੧||
transliteration: jehaan choo baagh eiram pur shudhasath az ghulazaar | 36 | 1 |
translation: The entire world is filled with flowers like the garden of heavens. (36) (1)

gurmukhi: ਤਬ?ਸਮਿ ਤੂ ਜਹਾਣ ਰਾ ਹ?ਯਾਤ ਮੀ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: thabasam thoo jehaan raa hayaath mee bakhashadha
translation: O Guru! Your beautiful smile bestows and instills life to the world,

gurmukhi: ਕਰਾਰ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ ਸਾਹਿਬ-ਦਿਲਾਣ ਪੁਰ-ੲਿਸਰਾਰ ||੩੬||੨||
transliteration: karaar dheedhaae saahiba-dhilaan pura-eisaraar | 36 | 2 |
translation: And, this gives tranquility and stability to the mystical eyes of the saints and Pirs.? (36) (2)

gurmukhi: ਬਗ਼ੈਰ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹੀਚ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: baghair eishak khudhaa heech eishak kaaeim neesatha
translation: There is no ever-lasting love or devotion other than the love of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਬਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਾਸ਼ਿਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ਨਾਹ ਪਿੰਦਾਰ ||੩੬||੩||
transliteration: baghair aashik maaualaa hamaa fanaah pindhaar | 36 | 3 |
translation: And, one should deem everyone other than the devotees of Waaheguru as destructible. (36) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਕਿ ਨਿਗਾਹੇ ਕੁਨੀ ਰਵਾਣ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ੀ
transliteration: behar tharaf k nigaahae kunee ravaan bakhashee
translation: In whichever direction you look, you bestow and instil new life and spirit,

gurmukhi: ਨਿਗਾਹਿ ਤੁਸਤ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਬਵਦ ਜਾਣਬਾਰ ||੩੬||੪||
transliteration: nigaahi thusath k dhar har tharaf bavadh jaanabaar | 36 | 4 |
translation: It is your vision only that blesses showers of new life everywhere. (36) (4)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਹਮਾ ਹਾਲਸਤ ਹਾਜ਼ਰੋ ਨਾਜ਼ਿਰ
transliteration: khudhaa k dhar hamaa haalasath haazaro naazira
translation: Akaalpurakh is omnipresent at every place under all circumstances and with everyone all the times,

gurmukhi: ਕੁਜਾਸਤ ਦੀਦਾ ਕਿ ਬੀਨਦ ਬਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਦੀਦਾਰ ||੩੬||੫||
transliteration: kujaasath dheedhaa k beenadh behar tharaf dheedhaar | 36 | 5 |
translation: However, where is such an eye that is capable of visualizing His presence in every nook and corner? (36) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਾਰਫ਼ਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਕਸੇ ਨਜਾਤ ਨ-ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: baghair aaraf maaualaa kasae najaath na-yaafatha
translation: No one other than those dedicated to the love of God has ever been redeemed.

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ਲ ਜ਼ਮੀਨੋ ਜ਼ਮਾਂ ਰਾ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤਾ ਦਰ ਮਿਨਕਾਰ ||੩੬||੬||
transliteration: azal zameeno zamaa raa grifathaa dhar minakaar | 36 | 6 |
translation: The 'death' has captured both the 'earth' and the 'time' with its sharp beak. (36) (6)

gurmukhi: ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਬਵਦ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: hamaeshaa zindhaa bavadh bandhaae khudhaa goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, A devotee of Akaalpurakh becomes immortal,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਬੰਦਗੀਅਸ਼ ਨੀਸਤ ਦਰ ਅਹਾਣ ਅਾਸਾਰ ||੩੬||੭||
transliteration: k ghair bandhageeash neesath dhar ahaan aasaar | 36 | 7 |
translation: Because, without his meditation, no one else will ever leave a sign behind in this world. (36) (7)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਅਜ਼ ਜਵਾਣ ਕਿ ਪੀਰ ਸ਼ੁਦਮ ਦਰ ਕਿਨਾਰਿ ੳੁਮਰ
transliteration: man az javaan k peer shudham dhar kinaar oumara
translation: I became old from young in the lap of the 'age',

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਬਾ-ਤੋ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ਮਰਾ ਦਰ ਕਿਨਾਰਿ ੳੁਮਰ ||੩੭||੧||
transliteration: ai baa-tho khush guzashath maraa dhar kinaar oumar | 37 | 1 |
translation: How beautiful was my life that I spent in Your company! I owe the happiness of this journey to your grace!? (37) (1)

gurmukhi: ਦਮਹਾੲਿ ਮਾਣਦਾ ਰਾ ਤੂ ਚੁਨੀਣ ਮੁਗ਼ਤਨਮ ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰ
transliteration: dhamehaae maanadhaa raa thoo chuneen mughathanam shumaara
translation: Consider the remaining breaths of your life as blessed,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਖ਼ਿਰ ਖ਼ਿਜ਼ਾਣ ਬਰ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ ੲੀਣ ਨੌ ਬਹਾਰਿ ੳੁਮਰ ||੩੭||੨||
transliteration: aakhir khizaan bar aavuradh een naau behaar oumar | 37 | 2 |
translation: Because, it will be the autumn (old age) that will bring the spring (season of youth) of your life one day. (37) (2)

gurmukhi: ਹਾਣ ਮੁਗਤਨਮ ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰ ਦਮੇ ਰਾ ਬ-ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: haan mugathanam shumaar dhamae raa ba-zikar haka
translation: Yes, consider that moment as blessed that is spent in remembering God,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਬਾਦ ਮੀਰਵਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਦਰ ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰ ੳੁਮਰ ||੩੭||੩||
transliteration: choon baadh meeravadh z nazar dhar shumaar oumar | 37 | 3 |
translation: Otherwise, the whole life, while counting your breaths, will disappear just like the air, while we look on. (37) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਰਵਾਣ ਚੂ ਕਾਫ਼ਲਾੲਿ ਮੌਜ ਪੈ ਬ ਪੈ
transliteration: baashadh ravaan choo kaafalaae maauaj pai b pai
translation: The stream of life is flowing like an ever-moving caravan of tides of time,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਬੇ ਬਿਨੋਸ਼ ਯ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ੂੲਿ ਬਾਰਿ ੳੁਮਰ ||੩੭||੪||
transliteration: aabae binosh yak nafas az zooe baar oumar | 37 | 4 |
translation: If possible, then try to have a momentary sip with every breath from this  stream of life (37) (4)

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਕਾਰ ਕਰਦਾੲੀ ਕਿ ਨਯਾੲਿਦ ਬਕਾਰਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: sadh kaar karadhaaee k nayaaeidh bakaar thoo
translation: Goya says, You have indulged in hundreds of vain chores in life that will not be of any eventual use,

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਬਿਕੁਨ ਕਿ ਬਾਜ਼ ਬਿਅਾੲਿਦ ਬਕਾਰਿ ੳੁਮਰ ||੩੭||੫||
transliteration: goyaa bikun k baaz biaaeidh bakaar oumar | 37 | 5 |
translation: Therefore, engage yourself in such activities that will be useful again and hereafter (37) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਕਿ ਦੀਦੇਮ ਸਰਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਅੈ ਮਹਿਰਮਿ ਰਾਜ਼
transliteration: maa k dheedhaem sar kooe thoo ai mehiram raaza
translation: O Knower of all mysteries! We, who have seen the higher end of Your street,

gurmukhi: ਵਜ਼ ਹਮਾ ਰੂੲਿ ਫ਼ਗੰਦੇਮ ਸਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਨਿਅਾਜ਼ ||੩੮||੧||
transliteration: vaz hamaa rooe fagandhaem sar khudh niaaz | 38 | 1 |
translation: Did bow and put our head down on the dust of the area in utter humility and turned ourselves away from everything else. (38) (1)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਗਰਦੇ ਸਰਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਬਗਰਦੀਦ ਅਾਮ
transliteration: thaa bagaradhae sar kooe thoo bagaradheedh aama
translation: Since I made my visits to your street as a commonplace,

gurmukhi: ਰੋਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਲਦੀ ਬਰੀਣ ਰਾ ਬਿਕੁਨਮ ਪਾ ਅੰਦਾਜ਼ ||੩੮||੨||
transliteration: rozaae khuladhee bareen raa bikunam paa andhaaz | 38 | 2 |
translation: I have rejected the highest garden of heavens and considered it only as the floor under your doorsill. (38) (2)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ਮਿ ਕਾਕਲਿ ਮੁਸ਼ਕੀਣ ਦਿਲੋ ਦੀਣ ਬੁਰਦ ਅਜ਼ਮਾ
transliteration: az kham kaakal mushakeen dhilo dheen buradh azamaa
translation: The waves and the curls of your fragrant locks took away my heart and soul,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ੳੁਮਰ ਹਮੀਣ ਬੂਦ ਅਜ਼ੀਣ ੳੁਮਰਿ-ਦਰਾਜ਼ ||੩੮||੩||
transliteration: haasil oumar hameen boodh azeen oumari-dharaaz | 38 | 3 |
translation: And, this was the highest treasure gathered through my long life. (38) (3)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸਹਫ਼ਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਹਾਫ਼ਿਜ਼ ਹਮਾ ਰਾ ਹਮਾ ਦਰ ਹਾਲ
transliteration: musehaf rooe thoo haafiz hamaa raa hamaa dhar haala
translation: Your face's sight is that sacred text that protects everyone under all circumstances.

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਮਿ ਅਬਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਮਹਿਰਾਬਿ ਦਿਲ ਅਹਿਲਿ ਨਿਮਾਜ਼ ||੩੮||੪||
transliteration: kham abarooe thoo mehiraab dhil ahil nimaaz | 38 | 4 |
translation: A arcged wrinkle in Your eyebrow is the alcove of the mosque (meditation) in the minds of Your devotees. (38) (4)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਮਨ ਬੇ ਤੂ ਚੂਨਾਸਤ ਚਿਹ ਗੋੲਿਦਾ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: dhil man bae thoo choonaasath chih goeidhaa goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, How can I explain the condition of my mind when I am separated from you?

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂੰ ਅਾਣ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ ਕਿ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ-ਅਜ਼ ਸੋਜ਼ੋ ਗੁਦਾਜ਼ ||੩੮||੫||
transliteration: hamachoon aan shamaaa k dhaaeim bavadha-az sozo gudhaaz | 38 | 5 |
translation: It is like a lamp that always has to burn and melt its passions. (38) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬੇ ਤੂ ਅਾਲਮ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਹੈਰਾਨਸਤੋ ਬਸ
transliteration: bae thoo aalam jumalaa hairaanasatho basa
translation: O Guru! The whole world is bewildered and is confused without you,

gurmukhi: ਸੀਨਾ ਅਜ਼ ਹਿਜਰਿ ਤੂ ਬਿਰਯਾਣਸਤੋ ਬਸ ||੩੯||੧||
transliteration: seenaa az hijar thoo birayaanasatho bas | 39 | 1 |
translation: My heart and soul are getting charred and getting cooked on a grill like Kabab due to your separation. (39) (1)

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬ ਮੌਲਾ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: thaalib maaualaa hamaeshaa zindhaa asatha
translation: Any seeker of God lives for ever (He is remembered for ever),

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਜ਼ਬਾਨਸ਼ ਨਾਮਿ ਸੁਬਹਾਨ ਅਸਤੋ ਬਸ ||੩੯||੨||
transliteration: bar zabaanash naam subehaan asatho bas | 39 | 2 |
translation: Because, he meditates and has only Naam of the Omnipotent on his tongue. (39) (2)

gurmukhi: ਖਾਲਿ ਮੁਸ਼ਕੀਨਸ਼ ਦਿਲਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਰਬੂਦ
transliteration: khaal mushakeenash dhil aalam raboodha
translation: The fragrant black speckle, the mole, of your cheek, has enamored the entire world,

gurmukhi: ਕੁਫ਼ਰਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਸ਼ ਦਾਮਿ ੲੀਮਾਨਸਤੋ ਬਸ ||੩੯||੩||
transliteration: kufar zulafash dhaam eemaanasatho bas | 39 | 3 |
translation: And, your locks of hair are just like a snare for the faith and the religion and nothing else.(39) (3)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੂਦ ਬਿਨੁਮਾ ਅਾਣ ਰੁਖਿ ਚੂੰ ਅਾਫ਼ਤਾਬ
transliteration: zoodh binumaa aan rukh choon aafathaaba
translation: O Guru! Kindly show me your sun-like face as soon as possible,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ੲਿਲਾਜਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਗਿਰੀਅਾਨਸਤੋ ਬਸ ||੩੯||੪||
transliteration: een eilaaj chasham gireeaanasatho bas | 39 | 4 |
translation: Because, this is the only cure for my tearful eyes and nothing else. (39) (4)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲ ਨਿਸਾਰੀ ਕਾਮਤਿ ਰਾਅਨਾੲੀੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: dhil nisaaree kaamath raaanaaeee oo
translation: My heart and soul is simply captivated for his handsome stature and gait,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣ ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲੀ ਜਾਨਿ ਜਾਨਾਣ ਨਸਤੋ ਬਸ ||੩੯||੫||
transliteration: jaan fidhaaee jaan jaanaan nasatho bas | 39 | 5 |
translation: And, my life is for sacrifice to the dust of my beloved's feet. (39) (5)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਬਿ-ਪੁਰਸੀ ਹਾਲਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਯ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ
transliteration: gar bi-purasee haal goyaa yak nafasa
translation: Alas! I wish you had asked Goyaa even for a moment, How are you?

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ੲਿਲਾਜਿ ਦਰਦਿ ਹਰਮਾਨਸਤੋ ਬਸ ||੩੯||੬||
transliteration: een eilaaj dharadh haramaanasatho bas | 39 | 6 |
translation: Because, this is the only remedy for my painfully tortured heart. (39) (6)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਦਾਮ ਬਾਦਾ-ਕਸ਼ੋ ਸੂਫੀ ਓ ਸਫ਼ਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼
transliteration: mudhaam baadhaa-kasho soofee ou safaa mee baasha
translation: After getting drunk (with His Naam), one should become pious and chaste,

gurmukhi: ਤਮਾਮਿ ਜ਼ੁਹਦ ਸ਼ੌ ਵਰਿੰਦਿ ਬੀਨਵਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ ||੪੦||੧||
transliteration: thamaam zuhadh shaau varindh beenavaa mee baash | 40 | 1 |
translation: One should be inebriated and become indifferent to life and an embodiment of meditation.? (40) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬਸੂੲਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਮਿਅਫ਼ਗਨ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਕਿ ਬੇ-ਬਸਰੀ
transliteration: basooe ghair miafagan nazar k bae-basaree
translation: You should not cast your eyes just even to look towards any one else; this will be an act of blindness;

gurmukhi: ਤਮਾਮਿ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਸ਼ੌ ਵ ਸੂੲਿ ਦੋਸਤ ਵਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ ||੪੦||੨||
transliteration: thamaam chasham shaau v sooe dhosath vaa mee baash | 40 | 2 |
translation: You should become an eye from head to toe, and aim your vision only towards your Beloved. (40) (2)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਗਿਰਦਿ ਕਾਮਤਿ ਅਾਣ ਸ਼ਾਹਿ ਦਿਲਰੁਬਾ ਮੀ ਗਰਦ
transliteration: ba-giradh kaamath aan shaahi dhilarubaa mee garadha
translation: Circumambulate around the torso of heart-stealing king, the Guru,

gurmukhi: ਅਸੀਰਿ ਹਲਕਾੲਿ ਅਾਣ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਮੁਸ਼ਕ ਸਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ ||੪੦||੩||
transliteration: aseer halakaae aan zulaf mushak saa mee baash | 40 | 3 |
translation: And, assume yourself as the prisoner of the knot of the fragrant lock of his hair. (40) (3)

gurmukhi: ਨ ਗੋੲਿਮਤ ਕਿ ਸੂੲਿ ਦੈਰ ਯਾ ਹਰਮ ਮੀ ਰੌ
transliteration: n goeimath k sooe dhair yaa haram mee raaua
translation: I am not asking anyone to go to the temple or the Muslin shrine.

gurmukhi: ਬਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਕਿ ਰਵੀ ਜਾਨਿਬਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ ||੪੦||੪||
transliteration: behar tharaf k ravee jaanib khudhaa mee baash | 40 | 4 |
translation: I am simply suggesting that no matter where you decide to go, you should always keep your face towards the Almighty. (40) (4)

gurmukhi: ਬਸੂੲਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਚੂ ਬੇਗ਼ਾਨਗਾਣ ਚਿਹ ਮੀ ਗਰਦੀ
transliteration: basooe ghair choo baeghaanagaan chih mee garadhee
translation: Turning away from me like a stranger, why are you are paying attention to my rivals?

gurmukhi: ਹਮੀ ਜ਼ਿ ਹਾਲਿ ਦਿਲਿ ਖ਼ਸਤਾ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ ||੪੦||੫||
transliteration: hamee z haal dhil khasathaa aashanaa mee baash | 40 | 5 |
translation: Just look towards me even for a short while and get familiar with the condition of this broken heart. (40) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਦਾਮ ਸ਼ਾਕਿਰੋ ਸ਼ਾਦਾਬ ਚੂੰ ਦਿਲਿ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: mudhaam shaakiro shaadhaab choon dhil goyaa
translation: Goya says, Become content and pleasant like my heart, And do not become indifferent after having your desires fulfilled.

gurmukhi: ਤਮਾਮਿ ਮੁਤਲਿਬੋ ਫ਼ਾਰਿਗ਼ ਜ਼ਿ ਮੁਦਅਾ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ ||੪੦||੬||
transliteration: thamaam muthalibo faarigh z mudhaaa mee baash | 40 | 6 |
translation: In fact, rid yourself of all purpose and pursuits.(This way, one can attain the real goal) (40) (6)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਰਾ ਸੀਨਾ ਬਿਰੀਅਾਨਸਤੋ ਬਿਰੀਅਾਨਸਤੋ ਬਿਰੀਅਾਨਸ਼
transliteration: hamaa raa seenaa bireeaanasatho bireeaanasatho bireeaanasha
translation: Hearts of everyone in deep love are scorched and charred,

gurmukhi: ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਅਾਣ ਦੀਦਾਰ ਹੈਰਾਣਸਤੋ ਹੈਰਾਨਸ਼ ||੪੧||੧||
transliteration: dho aalam behir aan dheedhaar hairaanasatho hairaanash | 41 | 1 |
translation: Both the worlds are amazed and even desperately restless for his glimpse. (41) (1)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਕਾਣ ਸੁਰਮਾੲਿ ਅਹਿਲਿ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: z khaak kooe thoo kaan suramaae ahil nazar baashadha
translation: The dust of your street is like a collyrium for the eyes of those with divine sight,

gurmukhi: ਨਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ੲਿਲਾਜੇ ਬਿਹ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਗਿਰੀਅਾਨਸ਼ ||੪੧||੨||
transliteration: namee baashadh eilaajae bih baraae chasham gireeaanash | 41 | 2 |
translation: And for the tearful eyes, there is no other better cure than this. (41) (2)

gurmukhi: ਮਹੋ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦ ਗਿਰਦਿ ਕੂੲਿ ੳੂ ਗਰਦੰਦ ਰੂਜੌ ਸ਼ਬ
transliteration: meho khurasheedh giradh kooe oo garadhandh roojaau shaba
translation: Both the moon and the sun keep circling around His (God/Guru) abode night and day,

gurmukhi: ਅਜਾੲਿਬ ਰੌਸ਼ਨੀ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਿ ਦੋ-ਅਾਲਮ ਹਸਤ ਅਹਿਸਾਨਸ਼ ||੪੧||੩||
transliteration: ajaaeib raauashanee bakhash dho-aalam hasath ahisaanash | 41 | 3 |
translation: It is His blessing that He has bestowed them the capability of providing light to both the worlds. (41) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਸੂੲਿ ਕਿ ਮੀ ਬੀਨਮ ਜਮਾਲਸ਼ ਜਲਵਾਗਰ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: ba-har sooe k mee beenam jamaalash jalavaagar baashadha
translation: Wherever I see, I find His comeliness and splendor all over.

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਣ ਅਾਸ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਾ ਓ ਸ਼ੈਦਾ ਮਦਾਮ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ੁਲਫਿ ਪਹਿਚਾਨਸ਼ ||੪੧||੪||
transliteration: jehaan aashufathaa ou shaidhaa madhaam az zulaf pehichaanash | 41 | 4 |
translation: The whole world is anxious and daft because of His curly lock of hair. (41) (4)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਜੇਬਿ ਜ਼ਮੀਣ ਪੁਰ ਲੂਲੂੲਿ ਲਾਲਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਅਸ਼ਕਿ ਮਨ
transliteration: shudhaa jaeb zameen pur loolooe laalaa z ashak mana
translation: Goyaa says, The pockets of the earth are filled with the pearls like tears from my eyes.

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਣ ਬਿਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤਾ ਅਮ ਗੋਯਾ ਬ ਯਾਦਿ ਲਾਅਲਿ ਖ਼ੰਦਾਨਕ ||੪੧||੫||
transliteration: jehaan bigrifathaa am goyaa b yaadh laaal khandhaanak | 41 | 5 |
translation: I have captured the whole world when I remembered the smile from his red lips. (41) (5)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸ ਸ਼ਨੀਦਾ ਅਸਤ ਜ਼ਿ ਤੂ ਗ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਗੂੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਸ
transliteration: har kas shaneedhaa asath z thoo ghufathagooe khaasa
translation: Anyone who has listened to Guru's enchanted words during his blessed  company,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਸਦ ਗ਼ਮਿ ਸ਼ਦੀਦ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਜ਼ੂਦ ਤਰ ਖ਼ਲਾਸ ||੪੨||੧||
transliteration: az sadh gham shadheedh shudhaa zoodh thar khalaas | 42 | 1 |
translation: Gets redeemed from hundreds of dire sorrows just in moments. (42) (1)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਬਿ ਹਯ?ਾਤਿ ਮਾ ਸਖ਼ੁਨਿ ਪੀਰਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: aab hayaath maa sakhun peer kaamil asatha
translation: The word of a complete and perfect Guru is like a nectar-talisman for all of us.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਹਾੲਿ ਮੁਰਦਾ ਰਾ ਬਿਕੁਨਦ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਓ ਖ਼ਲਾਸ ||੪੨||੨||
transliteration: dhilehaae muradhaa raa bikunadh zindhaa ou khalaas | 42 | 2 |
translation: It can revive and give salvation to demoralized and half dead minds.(42) (2)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਨਮਾੲੀੲੇ ਤੂ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਸਤ ਦੂਰ ਤਰ
transliteration: az khudha-namaaeeeae thoo khudhaa hasath dhoor thara
translation: God Almighty is miles farther away from the deception of our ego,

gurmukhi: ਬੀਨੀ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਸ਼ਵੀ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦੀ ਖ਼ਲਾਸ ||੪੨||੩||
transliteration: beenee dharoon khaesh shavee az khudhee khalaas | 42 | 3 |
translation: If we were to do some introspection, we can get rid of this vanity. (42) (3)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਸਾਲਕਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਰਾ ਬਾ ਕੁਨੀ ਤੂ ਖ਼ਿਦਮਤੇ
transliteration: choon saalakaan khudhaae raa baa kunee thoo khidhamathae
translation: If you do service to the holy and noble souls,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਕੈਦਿ ਗ਼ਮਿ ਜਹਾਂ, ਬ-ਸ਼ਵਦ ਜਾਨਿ ਤੋ ਖ਼ਲਾਸ ||੪੨||੪||
transliteration: az kaidh gham jehaa(n), ba-shavadh jaan tho khalaas | 42 | 4 |
translation: You, then, can get rid of  all worldly agonies and sorrows. (42) (4)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਤੂ ਦਸਤਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਹਿਰਸ ਕੋਤਾਹ ਕੁਨ
transliteration: goyaa thoo dhasath khudhaa raa az hiras kothaah kuna
translation: O Goyaa! You must withdraw your hands from desire and greed,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਅੰਦਰੂਨਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਾ ਬੀਨੀ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਸ ||੪੨||੫||
transliteration: thaa andharoon khaanaa beenee khudhaae khaas | 42 | 5 |
translation: So that you could realize the eclat of Almighty all within yourself. (42) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਿਅਾ ਚੂ ਸਰਵਿ ਖ਼ਰਾਮਾਣ ਦਮੇ ਬ-ਸੈਰਿ ਰਿਅਾਜ਼
transliteration: biaa choo sarav kharaamaan dhamae ba-sair riaaza
translation: Like the carefree pace of cypress tree, if you, the Guru, could visit the garden even for a moment,

gurmukhi: ਸੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ ਮਾ-ਰਾ ਨਿਗਾਹ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਬਿਅਾਜ ||੪੩||੧||
transliteration: sooe thoo dheedhaae maa-raa nigaah gashath biaaj | 43 | 1 |
translation: My eyes (of my soul) have completely exhausted themselves waiting for this  for your arrival. (43) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬਰਾੲਿ ਰੇਸ਼ਿ ਦਿਲਮ ਖ਼ੰਦਾੲਿ ਤੂ ਮਰਹਮ ਬਸ
transliteration: baraae raesh dhilam khandhaae thoo mareham basa
translation: Just one smile of yours works as the unguent for my wounded (broken)  heart,

gurmukhi: ਤਬ?ਸੁਮਿ ਲਬਿ ਲਾਅਲਤ ਦਵਾੲੇ ਹਰ ੲਿਮਰਾਜ਼ ||੪੩||੨||
transliteration: thabasum lab laaalath dhavaaeae har eimaraaz | 43 | 2 |
translation: And the smile from your ruby red lips is the cure of all of my ills. (43) (2)

gurmukhi: ਨਿਗਾਹ ਕਰਦ ਵਾ ਮਤਾੲਿ ਦਿਲਮ ਬ-ਗ਼ਾਰਤ ਬੁਰਦ
transliteration: nigaah karadh vaa mathaae dhilam ba-ghaarath buradha
translation: He directed his vision towards me just for once, and stole all my inner assets;

gurmukhi: ਬੁਰੀਦ ਜੇਬਿ ਦਿਲਮ ਰਾ ਬਿ ਗ਼ਮਜ਼ਾ ਚੂੰ ਮਿਕਰਾਜ਼ ||੪੩||੩||
transliteration: bureedh jaeb dhilam raa b ghamazaa choon mikaraaz | 43 | 3 |
translation: With his skewed looks, he took away my heart, as if someone had cut my pockets with a pair of scissors. (43) (3)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਿ ਮਕਦਮਤ ਅੈ ਨੌ-ਬਹਾਰਿ ਗੁਲਸ਼ਨਿ ਹੁਸਨ
transliteration: z faiz makadhamath ai naaua-behaar gulashan husana
translation: O new spring season of the garden of elegance and radiance! With the blessings of your arrival,

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਣ ਚੂੰ ਬਾਗ਼ਿ ੲਿਰਮ ਕਰਦਾੲੀ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਫ਼ਿਅਾਜ਼ ||੪੩||੪||
transliteration: jehaan choon baagh eiram karadhaaee zehae fiaaz | 43 | 4 |
translation: You have converted this world into a heavenly garden of Paradise. How great is the grantor of such a boon! (43) (4)

gurmukhi: ਚਿਰਾ ਬਹਾਲਤਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਨਮੀ ਫ਼ਿਗਨੀ
transliteration: chiraa behaalath goyaa nazar namee figanee
translation: Goyaa says, Why don't you look towards my pitiable condition just for once?

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਯ?ਕ ਨਿਗਾਹਿ ਤੂ ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ਮੁਰਾਦਿ ਅਹਿਲਿ ੲਿਗ਼ਰਾਜ਼ ||੪੩||੫||
transliteration: k yak nigaahi thoo haasil muraadh ahil eigharaaz | 43 | 5 |
translation: Because, for the needy and indigent people, your one look fulfills all their desires and wishes. (43) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਸਕਿ ਮਾ ਰਾ ਹਸਤ ਬਾ ਤੋ ੲਿਰਤਬਾਤ
transliteration: basak maa raa hasath baa tho eirathabaatha
translation: O Guru! We have a special and close relationship with you.

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਕਦੂਮਿ ਤੁਸਤ ਦਰ ਅਾਲਮ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਤ ||੪੪||੧||
transliteration: az kadhoom thusath dhar aalam nishaath | 44 | 1 |
translation: Your advent and music of your footsteps has filled the whole world with overall happiness. (44) (1)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਰਸ਼ ਕਰਦਮ ਦਰ ਕਦੂਮਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: farash karadham dhar kadhoom raahi thoo
translation: I have spread my blossoming heart and wide-open eyes as a carpet

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਾ ਓ ਦਿਲ ਰਾ ਕਿ ਬੂਦਾ ਦਰ-ਬਸਾਤ ||੪੪||੨||
transliteration: dheedhaa ou dhil raa k boodhaa dhara-basaath | 44 | 2 |
translation: on the path of your arrival. (44) (2)

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਫ਼ਕੀਰਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਰਹਿਮੇ ਬਕੁਨ
transliteration: bar fakeeraan khudhaa rehimae bakuna
translation: You should be kind and benevolent to the mendicant-devotees of the Lord,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਦਰੀਣ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਬ-ਯਾਬੀ ੲਿੰਬਸਾਤ ||੪੪||੩||
transliteration: thaa dhareen dhuniaa ba-yaabee einbasaath | 44 | 3 |
translation: So that you may get ample happiness in this world. (44) (3)

gurmukhi: ਦਾੲਿਮਾ ਦਿਲ ਰਾ ਬਸੂੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਿਅਾਰ
transliteration: dhaaeimaa dhil raa basooe hak biaara
translation: lways keep your heart and soul directed towards the love of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬ-ਅਾਸਾਣ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰੀ ਜ਼ੀਣ ਪੁਲਿ ਸਰਾਤ ||੪੪||੪||
transliteration: thaa ba-aasaan biguzaree zeen pul saraath | 44 | 4 |
translation: So that you can spend your mundane life in this world with ease. (44) (4)

gurmukhi: ਨੀਸਤ ਅਾਸੂਦਾ ਕਸੇ ਦਰ ਜ਼ੇਰਿ ਚਰਖ਼
transliteration: neesath aasoodhaa kasae dhar zaer charakha
translation: No one under this sky is happy, content and prosperous.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰ ਅੈ ਗੋਯਾ ਅਜ਼ੀਣ ਕੁਹਨਾ ਰੁਬਾਤ ||੪੪||੫||
transliteration: biguzar ai goyaa azeen kuhanaa rubaath | 44 | 5 |
translation: O Goyaa! You should pass through and leave this old boarding house behind with caution. (44) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਕੁਜਾ ਕਿ ਰਵੀ ਜਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਫ਼ਿਜ਼
transliteration: ba-har kujaa k ravee jaan man khudhaa haafiza
translation: O my beloved (Guru)! May lmighty be your Protector wherever you choose

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਬੁਰਦਾੲੀ ਦਿਲਿ ੲੀਮਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਫ਼ਿਜ਼ ||੪੫||੧||
transliteration: ba-buradhaaee dhil eemaan man khudhaa haafiz | 45 | 1 |
translation: You have taken away my heart and faith; May Almighty be your protector every where.? (45) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬਿਅਾ ਕਿ ਬੁਲਬੁਲੋ ਗੁਲ ਹਰ ਦੋ ੲਿੰਤਜ਼ਾਰਿ ਤੂ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: biaa k bulabulo gul har dho einthazaar thoo andha
translation: Both the nightingale and the flowers are awaiting your arrival, O Guru!

gurmukhi: ਦਮੇ ਬਜਾਨਿਬਿ ਬੁਸਤਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਫ਼ਿਜ਼ ||੪੫||੨||
transliteration: dhamae bajaanib busathaan man khudhaa haafiz | 45 | 2 |
translation: Kindly drop in my garden for just a moment and may the Lord be your protector wherever you choose to prevail. (45) (2)

gurmukhi: ਨਮਕ ਜ਼ਿ ਲਾਲਿ ਲਬਤ ਰੇਜ਼ ਬਰਦਿਲਿ ਰੇਸ਼ਮ
transliteration: namak z laal labath raez baradhil raeshama
translation: Kindly sprinkle some salt on my wounded heart from your red lips,

gurmukhi: ਪਸ਼ੀਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਸੀਨਾੲਿ ਬਿਰੀਅਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਫ਼ਿਜ਼ ||੪੫||੩||
transliteration: pasheedh z seenaae bireeaan man khudhaa haafiz | 45 | 3 |
translation: And singe my Kabaab-like charred heart. May Providence be your protector wherever you decide to prevail.? (45) (3)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਖ਼ੁ?ਸ਼ ਬਵਦ ਕਿ ਖ਼ਰਾਮਤ ਕ?ਦਤ ਚੂ ਸਰਵਿ ਬੁਲੰਦ
transliteration: ch khush bavadh k kharaamath kadhath choo sarav bulandha
translation: How nice it would be if your Cyprus-like tall and slim stature

gurmukhi: ਦਮੇ ਬਸੂੲਿ ਗੁਲਿਸਤਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਫ਼ਿਜ਼ ||੪੫||੪||
transliteration: dhamae basooe gulisathaan man khudhaa haafiz | 45 | 4 |
translation: Would visit my garden for a walk even for a moment! May the Providence be your Protector wherever you choose to be! (45) (4)

gurmukhi: ਬਿਅਾ ਬ-ਮਰਦਮਕਿ ਦੀਦਾ ਅਮ ਕਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ਤੁਸਤ
transliteration: biaa ba-maradhamak dheedhaa am k khaanaae thusatha
translation: Goyaa says, Kindly come! Come and abide in the pupils of my eyes,

gurmukhi: ਦਰੂਨਿ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ ਗਿਰੀਅਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਫ਼ਿਜ ||੪੫||੫||
transliteration: dharoon dheedhaae gireeaan man khudhaa haafij | 45 | 5 |
translation: Because, your abode happens to be within my crying tearful eyes. May God be with you.(45)(5)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਤੂ ਰੌਨਿਕਿ ਬਾਜ਼ਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ
transliteration: ai rukh thoo raauanik baazaar shamaaa
translation: O Guru! Your face is the reason for the brightness and glamor of the lamp,

gurmukhi: ਅਸ਼ਕਿ ਰੇਜ਼ਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਗੌਹਰ-ਬਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ ||੪੬||੧||
transliteration: ashak raez chasham gaauehara-baar shamaaa | 46 | 1 |
translation: And, it is because of you, that the pearl-showering eyes of the (candle) lamp is shedding tears. (46) (1)

gurmukhi: ਮਹਰਮ ਹਰਫ਼ਾਤਿ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਗਸ਼ਤਾ ਅਸ਼ਤ
transliteration: meharam harafaath oo raa gashathaa ashatha
translation: When you secret qualities became known,

gurmukhi: ਅਸ਼ਕ ਮੇ ਰੇਜ਼ਦ, ਦਿਲਿ ਅਫ਼ਗਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਮਾਅ ||੪੬||੨||
transliteration: ashak mae raezadha, dhil afagaar shamaaa | 46 | 2 |
translation: The wounded delicate heart of the lamp was shedding tears. (46) (2)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕੁਜਾ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਚਰਾਗੇ ਕਰਦਾ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: har kujaa raauashan charaagae karadhaa andha
translation: Wherever the people have lit a lamp,

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਗੁਲੇ ਬੂਦ ਅਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਗੁਲਜ਼ਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ ||੪੬||੩||
transliteration: yak gulae boodh asath az gulazaar shamaaa | 46 | 3 |
translation: Consider that to be a floweer of the lamp's garden. (46) (3)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕਿਹ ਬਰ-ਅਫ਼ਰੋਖ਼ਤੀ ਰੁਖ਼ਸਾਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: thaa kih bara-afarokhathee rukhasaar khudha
translation: Since the time, you have shown the elegance of your face,

gurmukhi: ਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ਕੁਰਬਾਨਿ ਤੂ ਸਦ ਬਾਰ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ ||੪੬||੪||
transliteration: mee shavadh kurabaan thoo sadh baar shamaaa | 46 | 4 |
translation: The candle lamp, out of endearment, is offering itself as a sacrifice for you hundreds of times. (46) (4)

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰਦਿ ਰੁਖ਼ਸਾਰਿ ਤੂ ਅਜ਼ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਨਿਸਾਰ
transliteration: giradh rukhasaar thoo az behir nisaara
translation: In order to sacrifice themselves hundred times for your elegant face,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣ ਬਰੀਜ਼ਦ ਦੀਦਾਹਾੲਿ ਜ਼ਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ ||੪੬||੫||
transliteration: jaan bareezadh dheedhaahaae zaar shamaaa | 46 | 5 |
translation: The tearful eyes of the candle lamp are pouring their life. (46) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਸਕਿ ੲਿਮਸ਼ਬ ਨਾਮਦੀ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿੰਤਜ਼ਾਰ
transliteration: basak eimashab naamadhee az einthazaara
translation: You did not show up tonight when the light of candle had intense expectation of your arrival,

gurmukhi: ਸੋਖ਼ਤ ਮਹਿਫਲ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ ਬਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ ||੪੬||੬||
transliteration: sokhath mehifal chasham aathish baar shamaaa | 46 | 6 |
translation: Then the fire-sprinkling eye of the lamp burned down the entire gala assembly.? (46) (6)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਬਹ ਦਮ ਗੋਯਾ ਤਮਾਸ਼ਿਾੲਿ ਅਜੀਬ
transliteration: subeh dham goyaa thamaashiaae ajeeba
translation: Goyaa says, How wonderful and unusual is the sight in the early morning,

gurmukhi: ਜੁਮਲਾ ਅਾਲਮ ਖ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਾ ਓ ਬੇਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ ||੪੬||੭||
transliteration: jumalaa aalam khufathaa ou baedhaar shamaaa | 46 | 7 |
translation: When the whole world is sleeping but the sleeping lamp alone is absolutely awake. (46) (7)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਕੀਅਾ ਬਰਖ਼ੇਜ਼ ਵ ਹਾਣ ਪੁਰ ਕੁਨ ਅ?ਯਾਗ
transliteration: saakeeaa barakhaez v haan pur kun ayaaga
translation: O bartender ! Please get up and fill up the glass of my drink,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਨੋਸ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਕੁਨਮ ਰੰਗੀਣ ਦਿਮਾਗ ||੪੭||੧||
transliteration: thaa z nosh oo kunam rangeen dhimaag | 47 | 1 |
translation: So that, with it, I can change the complexion of my thought and brain into a colorful one. (47) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹਲਕਾੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਤ ਦਿਲਮ-ਰਾ ਬੁਰਦਾ ਬੂਦ
transliteration: halakaae zulafath dhilama-raa buradhaa boodha
translation: The noose of your lock of hair captured my heart and blew it away.

gurmukhi: ਯਾਫ਼ਤਮ ਅਜ਼ ਪੇਚ ਪੇਚਿ ੳੂ ਸੁਰਾਗ਼ ||੪੭||੨||
transliteration: yaafatham az paech paech oo suraagh | 47 | 2 |
translation: I was searching the same message of truth in each curl twist by twist. (47) (2)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਵਜੂਦੇ ਖ਼ਾਕੋ ਅਾਬੋ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: ee vajoodhae khaako aabo aathish asatha
translation: This body of dust is the interplay of fire and water,

gurmukhi: ਡਰ ਵਜੂਦੇ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ਹਰ ਚਾਰ ਬਾਗ਼ ||੪੭||੩||
transliteration: ddar vajoodhae khaeshathan har chaar baagh | 47 | 3 |
translation: You can relay your light from your own candle. (47) (3)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਅਾੲਿ ਪਰਤਵਿ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਪਾਕ
transliteration: az shuaae parathav dheedhaar paaka
translation: From the radiant rays of Your chaste glimpse,

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਣ ਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਚਿਰਾਗ਼ ||੪੭||੪||
transliteration: sadh hazaaraan har tharaf raauashan chiraagh | 47 | 4 |
translation: Hundreds and thousands of lamps were lighted every where. (47) (4)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਕੁਨ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਗੋਯਾ ਮੁਦਾਮ
transliteration: yaadh oo kun yaadh oo goyaa mudhaama
translation: O Goyaa! You should always remember Him, and meditate only on His Naam.

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਯਾਬੀ ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ਮਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਫ਼ਰਾਗ ||੪੭||੫||
transliteration: thaa bayaabee az gham aalam faraag | 47 | 5 |
translation: So that you could be redeemed and free from the worries here and the hereafter. (47) (5)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਜ਼ਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਸਾਜ਼ੀ ਸੀਨਾ ਸਾਫ਼
transliteration: gar z raahi saazee seenaa saafa
translation: If, in the interest of your love for your Beloved, you can cleanse your mind of the (five) vices without any doubt or suspicion,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੂਦ ਬੀਨੀ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ਰਾ ਬੇ ਗ਼ੁਜ਼ਾਫ਼ ||੪੮||੧||
transliteration: zoodh beenee khaeshathan raa bae ghuzaaf | 48 | 1 |
translation: Then, without any exaggeration, you will find your real self soon. (48) (1)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦੀ ਤੂ ਦੂਰ ਗਸ਼ਤਾ ਚੂੰ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: az khudhee thoo dhoor gashathaa choon khudhaa
translation: We have been driven farther away from the Almighty due to our egos;

gurmukhi: ਦੂਰ ਕੁ?ਨ ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਬੀਨੀ ਓ ਬੀਣ ਬੇ-ਗ਼ਿਲਾਫ਼ ||੪੮||੨||
transliteration: dhoor kun khudha-beenee ou been bae-ghilaaf | 48 | 2 |
translation: Therefore, get rid of your vanity; do not be driven by the whims of your mind, then you can see clearly the Reality, the Beneficient. (48) (2)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸ਼ਿਕਾਣ ਦਾਰੰਦ ਚੂੰ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ਮੁਦਾਮ
transliteration: aashikaan dhaarandh choon eishak mudhaama
translation: The real lovers (of God) are always imbued in His love,

gurmukhi: ਦਮ ਮਜ਼ਨ ਦਰ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾ ਅੈ ਮਰਦਿ ਲਾਫ਼ ||੪੮||੩||
transliteration: dham mazan dhar paesh shaa ai maradh laaf | 48 | 3 |
translation: O you bragger! Do not boast before them about love and devotion. (48) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰ ਅਜ਼ ਲ?ਜ਼ਤਿ ੲੀਣ ਖ਼ਮਸਾ ਹਵਾਸ
transliteration: biguzar az lazath een khamasaa havaasa
translation: You should give up the sensual pleasures of all the five sense organs,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਯਾਬੀ ਬਜ਼ਤੇ ਅਜ਼ ਜਾਮਿ ਸਾਫ਼ ||੪੮||੪||
transliteration: thaa bayaabee bazathae az jaam saaf | 48 | 4 |
translation: So that you could really taste the savor of a clean glass of holy elixir. (48) (4)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਬਜੋੲੀ ਰਾਹਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਰਾ ਮੁਦਾਮ
transliteration: gar bajoee raahi murashadh raa mudhaam
translation: Goyaa says, We should always be seeking and on the look out for the path of our Satguru,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਸ਼ਵੀ ਗੋਯਾ ਮੁ?ਬਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ਿਲਾਫ਼ ||੪੮||੫||
transliteration: thaa shavee goyaa mubaraa az khilaaf | 48 | 5 |
translation: So that, by traversing in the opposite direction, we may not lose our way;  we can be redeemed from (the sin of) double-mindedness and dilemma. (48) (5)

gurmukhi: ਰਬੂਦ ਮਕਦਮਿ ਵਸਲਸ਼ ਜ਼ਿ ਮਨ ੲਿਨਾਨਿ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕ
transliteration: raboodh makadham vasalash z man einaan firaaka
translation: When His (Guru's) arrival time came closer, I lost control of the reins of the pains of separation,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਹੇਮ ਤਾ ਬਕੁਜਾ ਸ਼ਰਹਾ ਦਾਸਤਾਨਿ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕ ||੪੯||੧||
transliteration: dhihaem thaa bakujaa sharehaa dhaasathaan firaak | 49 | 1 |
translation: and what transpired in my mind after this is a sad story; (49) (1)

gurmukhi: ਨ ਬੂਦ ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਤੂ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਚਸ਼ਮੇ ਅਬਰੂੲੇਮ
transliteration: n boodh ghair thoo dhar har dho chashamae abarooeaema
translation: There is no one else in my eyes and eyebrows except you, the Guru,

gurmukhi: ਨ ਯਾਫ਼ਤੇਮ ਦਰਾਣ ਜਾ ਦਿਗਰ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕ ||੪੯||੨||
transliteration: n yaafathaem dharaan jaa dhigar nishaan firaak | 49 | 2 |
translation: That is why I did not any sign of separation, except myself. (49) (2)

gurmukhi: ਹਨੂਜ਼ ਹਿਜਰ ਨਿਅਾਲੂਦਾ ਬੂਦ ਵਸਲਿ ਤੁਰਾ
transliteration: hanooz hijar niaaloodhaa boodh vasal thuraa
translation: The (pains of) 'separation' has not yet realized the (euphoria  of) 'meeting',

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਨੀਦਾੲਿਮ ਸੁਖ਼ਨਿ ਵਸਲ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ਬਾਨਿ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕ ||੪੯||੩||
transliteration: shaneedhaaeim sukhan vasal az zabaan firaak | 49 | 3 |
translation: I have been hearing stories about 'oneness and meeting' from 'separation'. (49) (3)

gurmukhi: ਚੁਨਾਣ ਜ਼ਿ ਹਿਜਰਤ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ ਫ਼ਿਤਾਦਾ ਦਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਮਨ
transliteration: chunaan z hijarath aathish fithaadhaa dhar dhil mana
translation: Ever since your 'separation' stoked such a fire in my heart, flaring it up

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਬਰਕਿ ਨਾਲਾੲਿ ਮਨ ਸੋਖ਼ਤ ਖ਼ਾਨਿਮਾਨਿ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕ ||੪੯||੪||
transliteration: k barak naalaae man sokhath khaanimaan firaak | 49 | 4 |
translation: That my wails and supplications fell on the abode of 'separation' (like a lightening) and burnt it down to ashes. (49) (4)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਕਰਦਾ-ਸਤ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕਿ ਤੂ ਬਰ ਸਰਿ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: ch karadhaa-sath firaak thoo bar sar goyaa
translation: Disunion from you has put Goyaa in such an unusual state of mind

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਦਰ ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰ ਨਿਅਾੲਿਦ ਮਰਾ ਬਿਅਾਨਿ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕ ||੪੯||੫||
transliteration: k dhar shumaar niaaeidh maraa biaan firaak | 49 | 5 |
translation: that he has related this painful saga continuously so many times that there is no count to it and my thought stands still. (49) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬਿਸ਼ਨੌ ਅਜ਼ ਮਨ ਹਰਫ਼ੇ ਅਜ਼ ਰਫ਼ਤਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ
transliteration: bishanaau az man harafae az rafathaar eishaka
translation: Please listen from me about the demeanor of 'love',

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬ-ਯਾਬੀ ਲ?ਜ਼ਤ ਅਜ਼ ਗੁਫ਼ਤਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੧||
transliteration: thaa ba-yaabee lazath az gufathaar eishak | 50 | 1 |
translation: So that you may begin to savor the taste of romantic tale. (50) (1)

gurmukhi: ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਹਰ ਕਿ ਰਾ ਮਿਸਮਾਰ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: eishak maaualaa har k raa misamaar karadha
translation: Even if the deep love for the Almighty ruins someone's worldly life,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਗ਼ਤਨਮ ਦਾਨਦ ਸਰੂਰਿ ਕਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੨||
transliteration: mughathanam dhaanadh saroor kaar eishak | 50 | 2 |
translation: He still considers this divine pleasure far superior than anything else. (50) (2)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਦਮ ਕੁ ਬਯਾਦਸ਼ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰਦ
transliteration: aan zehae dham k bayaadhash biguzaradha
translation: That moment and breath is blessed that is spent in His remembrance.

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਹਮਾ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਕੂ ਰਵਦ ਦਰ ਕਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੩||
transliteration: sar hamaa khush koo ravadh dhar kaar eishak | 50 | 3 |
translation: And only that head is fortunate that dedicates and sacrifices itself to the path of devotion. (50) (3)

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਣ ਜਾਣ ਬ-ਕਫ਼ ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: sadh hazaaraan jaan ba-kaf dhar raahi oo
translation: Thousands of devotees, having risked their lives, are standing and

gurmukhi: ੲੀਸਤਾਦਾ ਤਕੀਅਾ ਬਰ ਦੀਵਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੪||
transliteration: eesathaadhaa thakeeaa bar dheevaar eishak | 50 | 4 |
translation: Reclining against the wall of the passage to His abode. (50) (4)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਬੇ-ਅਦਬ
transliteration: har k shudh dhar raahi maaualaa bae-adhaba
translation: Anyone who has been sacrilegious in the Divine path,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਮਨਸੂਰਸ਼ ਸਜ਼ਦ ਬੇ ਦਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੫||
transliteration: hamachoo manasoorash sazadh bae dhaar eishak | 50 | 5 |
translation: Like Manssor, the crucifix (of love) is the befitting punishment for him. (50) (5)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਦਿਲ ਕੂ ਜ਼ਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਪੁਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: ai zehae dhil koo z eishak hak pur asatha
translation: Blessed is the heart that is imbued with its love for Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਮ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਪੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਫ਼ਲਕ ਅਜ਼ ਬਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੬||
transliteration: kham shudhaa pushath falak az baar eishak | 50 | 6 |
translation: In fact, it is the (heavy) weight of intense devotion that has bent the back of the heavenly sky. (50) (6)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਮਾਨੀ ਦਾੲਿਮਾ ਅੈ ਨੇਕ ਖ਼ੂ
transliteration: zindhaa maanee dhaaeimaa ai naek khoo
translation: O kind-hearted person and a person of resolve! If you could listen intently to just one note of the musical instrument (harp) of love and devotion,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਸ਼ਨਵੀ ਗਰ ਜ਼ਮਜ਼ਮਾ ਅਜ਼ ਤਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੭||
transliteration: bishanavee gar zamazamaa az thaar eishak | 50 | 7 |
translation: You will become immortal forever. (50) (7)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹਾਣ ਸਲਤਨਤ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਾਸ਼ਤੰਦ
transliteration: baadhashaahaan salathanath biguzaashathandha
translation: The kings abrogated their entire empires, So that

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਸ਼ਵੰਦ ਅਾਣ ਮਹਿਰਮਿ ਅਸਰਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੮||
transliteration: thaa shavandh aan mehiram asaraar eishak | 50 | 8 |
translation: They could understand and realize the mysteries and tempo of love. (50) (8)

gurmukhi: ਮਰਹਮੇ ਜੁਜ਼ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਦੀਗਰ ਨ ਦੀਦ
transliteration: marehamae juz bandhagee dheegar n dheedha
translation: Anyone who has been struck by the love-bug (disease), like Goyaa,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਗੋਯਾ ਹਰ ਕਿ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਬੀਮਾਰਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੫੦||੯||
transliteration: hamachoo goyaa har k shudh beemaar eishak | 50 | 9 |
translation: He has not seen any other ointment except submission and the meditation of (the Naam of) Waaheguru. (50) (9)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਅਾਫ਼ਰੀਦਾ ਅਸਤ ਮਰਾ ਅਾਣ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਪਾਕ
transliteration: thaa aafareedhaa asath maraa aan khudhaae paaka
translation: The chaste Akaalpurakh, the Protector of all, has given me birth for the reason,

gurmukhi: ਜੁਜ਼ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਨਿਅਾੲਿਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਜਿਸਮਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ||੫੧||੧||
transliteration: juz haraf naam hak niaaeidh z jisam khaak | 51 | 1 |
translation: That nothing else but the Naam of the Beneficient should come out of this torso of dust. (51) (1)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਿਜਰਿ ਤੁਸਤ ਜਾਨੋ ਦਿਲਿ ਅਾਸ਼ਕਾਣ ਚੁਨੀਣ
transliteration: dhar hijar thusath jaano dhil aashakaan chuneena
translation: The state of the heart and soul of your lovers during their separation from you is such,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਲਾਲਾ ਦਾਗ਼ ਬਰ ਜਿਗਰੋ ਸੀਨਾ ਚਾਕ ਚਾਕ ||੫੧||੨||
transliteration: choon laalaa dhaagh bar jigaro seenaa chaak chaak | 51 | 2 |
translation: That their heart is scarred like a poppy flower and their soul torn apart. (51) (2)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਗੁਫ਼ਤਾ ਅਸਤ ਮਰਗ ਕਿ ਬੇ-ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: een gufathaa asath marag k bae-yaadh hak bavadha
translation: The time spent without remembering You has been called the 'death',

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਸਾੲਿਅਾ ਤੂ ਹਸਤ ਨਦਾਰੇਮ ਹੀਚ ਬਾਕ ||੫੧||੩||
transliteration: choon saaeiaa thoo hasath nadhaaraem heech baak | 51 | 3 |
translation: But as long as I am blessed to be under your protection, I have no fear (of death). (51) (3)

gurmukhi: ਤਖ਼ਤੋ ਨਗੀਣ ਗੁਜ਼ਾਸ਼ਤਾ ਸ਼ਾਹਾਣ ਜ਼ ਬਹਿਰੇ ਤੂ
transliteration: thakhatho nageen guzaashathaa shaahaan z behirae thoo
translation: The kings and emperors gave up their thrones and crowns for you, O Guru,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਕੁਸ਼ਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਰੁਖ਼ ਨਕਾਬ ਕਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਲਾਕ ||੫੧||੪||
transliteration: bikushaa z rukh nakaab k aalam shudhaa halaak | 51 | 4 |
translation: Please take off the veil from your face, because the world is lying dead  (longing to see Your face). (51) (4)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਦਰਗਹਿ ਤੂ ਸ਼ਫ਼ਾ-ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: ai khaak dharagehi thoo shafaa-bakhash aalam asatha
translation: Your heavenly dust blesses the suffering world with healthiness, kindly

gurmukhi: ਰਹਿਮੇ ਬਿਕੁਨ ਬਹਾਲਿ ਗਰੀਬਾਨਿ ਦਰਦਨਾਕ ||੫੧||੫||
transliteration: rehimae bikun behaal gareebaan dharadhanaak | 51 | 5 |
translation: Be merciful on the painful conditions of these poor strangers. (51) (5)

gurmukhi: ਦੁਨਿਅਾ-ਸਤ ਕਾਣ ਖ਼ਰਾਬ ਕੁਨਿ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: dhuniaa-sath kaan kharaab kun har dho aalam asatha
translation: It is this world that destroys both the universes,

gurmukhi: ਦਾਰਾ ਬਖ਼ਾਕ ਰਫ਼ਤਾ ਓ ਕਾਰੂੰ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਲਾਕ ||੫੧||੬||
transliteration: dhaaraa bakhaak rafathaa ou kaaroon shudhaa halaak | 51 | 6 |
translation: Kings like blood-thirsty Daaraa were amalgamated with the dust and Kaaroon-like brave men were killed all in the avarice for this world. (51) (6)

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਮ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਬੇ ਤੂ ਗੁਹਰ ਬਾਰ ਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: chashamam hamaeshaa bae thoo guhar baar mee shavadha
translation: Goyaa says, Without you, O Guru! My eyes always keep dropping pearls like tears (in)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਮਿਸਾਲਿ ਦਾਨਾ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੋਸ਼ਾ-ਹਾੲਿ ਤਾਕ ||੫੧||੭||
transliteration: goyaa misaal dhaanaa k az khoshaa-haae thaak | 51 | 7 |
translation: The same manner that grapes keep falling from their bunches of vines. (51) (7)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਕਮਾਲਿ ਤੋ ਕਮਾਲਸਤੋ ਕਮਾਲਸਤੋ ਕਮਾਲ
transliteration: ai kamaal tho kamaalasatho kamaalasatho kamaala
translation: Your marvels and feats of skill are perfect, in fact perfection of perfections,

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜਮਾਲਿ ਤੋ ਅਸ ਜਮਾਲਸਤੋ ਜਮਾਲਸਤੋ ਜਮਾਲ ||੫੨||੧||
transliteration: ai jamaal tho as jamaalasatho jamaalasatho jamaal | 52 | 1 |
translation: Your beauty is the queen of beauty, you are the beauty of beauties. (52) (1)

gurmukhi: ਅਾੈ ਕਿ: ਨਜ਼ਦੀਕੀ ਤੋ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਰ?ਗ ਵ ਅਾਲਮ ਹੈਰਾਂ
transliteration: aaai ki: nazadheekee tho az shaah rag v aalam hairaa(n)
translation: My vein of breath is nearest to your ire; this completely surprises my doctor.

gurmukhi: ਯਾਰਿ ਮਾ ੲੀਂ ਚਿਅਾਂ ਖ਼ਿਅਾਲਸਤੋ ਖ਼ਿਅਾਲਸਤੋ ਖ਼ਿਅਾਲ ||੫੨||੨||
transliteration: yaar maa ee chiaaa(n) khiaalasatho khiaalasatho khiaal | 52 | 2 |
translation: Still, what thoughts we nurture about our self, O what thoughts we cherish! (52) (2)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਨਦਾਨਮ ਕਿ ਕੁਦਾਮਮ ਕਿ ਕੁਦਾਮਮ ਕਿ ਕੁਦਾਮਮ
transliteration: man nadhaanam k kudhaamam k kudhaamam k kudhaamama
translation: Goyaa says, I do not know who I am, nor how I am,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾੲਿ-ੳੂ ੲੇਮ ਵਾੳੂ ਹਾਫ਼ਿਜ਼ਿ ਮਨ ਦਰ ਰਮਾ ਹਾਲ ||੫੨||੩||
transliteration: bandhaaei-oo eaem vaaoo haafiz man dhar ramaa haal | 52 | 3 |
translation: I only know that I am the slave (creation) and prot?g? of the Almighty and that it is Him only who is my protector everywhere.? (52) (3)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਮਨ ਫ਼ਾਰਗ਼, ਵ ਦਰ ਕੂੲੇ ਤੋ, ਪਰਵਾਜ਼ ਕੁਨਦ,
transliteration: dhil man faaragha, v dhar kooeae tho, paravaaz kunadha,a
translation: My heart and soul while snapping all its bondages flies to your street,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਜ਼ਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਕਰਮਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼, ਬ-ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ੀ ਪਰੋ ਬਾਲ ||੫੨||੪||
transliteration: gar z raahi karam khaesha, ba-bakhashee paro baal | 52 | 4 |
translation: It is your blessing that makes my wings to spread for this flight. (52) (4)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਹਾਲ ਬਜੁਜ਼ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਦਮ ਨ-ਜ਼ਨਦ
transliteration: saahib haal bajuz haraf khudhaa dham na-zanadha
translation: The devotees of Akaalpurakh  who have mastered the self do not utter any word other that His Naam from their mouth,

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਸ਼ ਹਮਾ ਅਾਵਾਜ਼ ਬਵਦ ਕੀਲੋ ਮਕਾਲ ||੫੨||੫||
transliteration: ghair zikarash hamaa aavaaz bavadh keelo makaal | 52 | 5 |
translation: For them, any thing other than His meditation is just a farce and a meaningless  debate. (52) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲਿ ਮਾ ਬੰਦਗੀਅਤ ਫ਼ਰਮਾੲਿਦਾ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil maa bandhageeath faramaaeidhaa
translation: My perfect Guru directs everyone to meditate the kaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਕਾਲ ਮੁਬਾਰਿਕ ਕਿ ਕੁਨਦ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਹਾਲ ||੫੨||੬||
transliteration: ai zehae kaal mubaarik k kunadh saahib haal | 52 | 6 |
translation: Wonderful! How blessed is that word or expression that makes us His ardent adherent and leads to vanquishing the self. (52) (6)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ: ਗੋੲਿਦ ਤੌ ਚਿ: ਬਾਸ਼ੀ, ਵ ਚਿ: ਗੋੲਿਦ ਜੁਜ਼ਿ ਤੋ,
transliteration: har ki: goeidh thaau chi: baashee, v chi: goeidh juz tho,a
translation: Goyaa says, Every body is asking me, who are you? And what can I call you!

gurmukhi: ਗਸ਼ਤ ਹੈਰਾਂ ਹਮਾ ਅਾਲਮ ਹਮਾ ਦਰ ਅੈਨਿ ਜਮਾਲ ||੫੨||੭||
transliteration: gashath hairaa(n) hamaa aalam hamaa dhar ain jamaal | 52 | 7 |
translation: The world is in the grip of perceptive eddy and everyone is searching for your majesty.? (52) (7)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਜ਼ਿਰ ਅਸਤ ਦਰ ਹਮਾ ਹਾਲ
transliteration: choon khudhaa haazir asath dhar hamaa haal
translation: When Waaheguru is Omnipresent to shield us in all predicaments,

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਚਿਰਾ ਮੀ ਜ਼ਨੀ ਦਿਗਰ ਪਰੋ ਬਾਲ ||੫੩||੧||
transliteration: thoo chiraa mee zanee dhigar paro baal | 53 | 1 |
translation: Why are you then wasting your time in making other (useless) efforts? (53) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਗੋ ਦਿਗਰ ਮਗੋ ਅੈ ਜਾਣ
transliteration: hamadh hak go dhigar mago ai jaana
translation: You should praise the Lord, O my heart and soul! Do not utter any other word,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਕਾਲ ਬਾਸ਼ ਵ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ਹਾਲ ||੫੩||੨||
transliteration: saahib kaal baash v bandhaae haal | 53 | 2 |
translation: You should become a meditator of His Naam, and should become a true devotee of  the Master. (53) (2)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਦਮੇ ਕਿ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ
transliteration: ghair yaadh khudhaa dhamae k guzashatha
translation: A moment spent in an  activity except in the remembrance of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਜ਼ਵਾਲ ਅਸਤ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਅਹਿਲਿ ਕਮਾਲ ||੫੩||੩||
transliteration: een zavaal asath paesh ahil kamaal | 53 | 3 |
translation: In the eyes of noble souls, that is a complete waste and downfall. (53) (3)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਸਿਵਾ ਨੀਸਤ ਹਰ ਕੁਜਾ ਬੀਨੀ
transliteration: maa sivaa neesath har kujaa beenee
translation: Wherever you see, there is nothing but Him,

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਚਿਰਾ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਲੀ ਦਰ ਅੈਨਿ ਵਸਾਲ ||੫੩||੪||
transliteration: thoo chiraa ghaafalee dhar ain vasaal | 53 | 4 |
translation: Then, why are you so negligent (in remembering Him) when the meeting with Him is so obvious and clear? (53) (4)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਮਗੋ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: ghair haraf khudhaa mago goyaa
translation: Goyaa! You should not utter any other word except the Naam of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਦਿਗਰ ਪੂਚ ਹਸਤ ਕੀਲੋ ਕਾਲ ||੫੩||੫||
transliteration: k dhigar pooch hasath keelo kaal | 53 | 5 |
translation: Because, every other discourse is absolutely frivolous, hollow and baseless. (53) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਹਰ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਫ਼ਹਿਮੀਦਾ ੲੇਮ
transliteration: maa k khudh har bandhaae hak raa khudhaa fehimeedhaa eaema
translation: Goyaa says, I have recognized every human being created by God as God Himself,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੋਸ਼ੀਤਨ ਰਾ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ੲੀਣ ਬੰਦਾਹਾ ਫ਼ਹਿਮੀਦਾ ੲੇਮ ||੫੪||੧||
transliteration: khosheethan raa bandhaae een bandhaahaa fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 1 |
translation: And, I consider myself a slave (servant) of all these slaves of Truth. (54) (1)

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦੁਮਾਨਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਾ ਰਾ ੲੇਹਤਿਅਾਜਿ ਸੁਰਮਾ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: maradhumaan chasham maa raa eaehathiaaj suramaa neesatha
translation: My eyelids do not need any type of collyrium for existence,

gurmukhi: ਬਸਕਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਮਰਦੁਮ ਤੂਤੀਅਾ ਫ਼ਹਿਮੀਦਾ ੲੇਮ ||੫੪||੨||
transliteration: basak khaak raahi maradhum thootheeaa fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 2 |
translation: Because, I have always considered the dust of the path traversed by God's men as the apt collyrium.? (54) (2)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਸਰ ਬਰ ਜ਼ਮੀਣ ਦਾਰੇਮ ਅਜ਼ ਬਹਿਰੇ ਸਜੂਦ
transliteration: har nafas sar bar zameen dhaaraem az behirae sajoodha
translation: We prostrate our head on the ground in prayers every moment and breath,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਣ ਕਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਯਾਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਨੂਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਫ਼ਹਿਮੀਦਾ ੲੇਮ ||੫੪||੩||
transliteration: zaan k rooe yaar khudh noor khudhaa fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 3 |
translation: Because, we have considered the face of our beloved reflecting the refulgence of Almighty. (54) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹਾਣ ਰਾ ਫ਼ਕੀਰਾਣ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਦਾਦਾ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: baadhashaahaan raa fakeeraan baadhashaahee dhaadhaa andha
translation: God's holy men, the saints, have bestowed the kingdoms to the worldly kings,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਣ ਗਦਾੲਿ ਕੂੲਿ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹ ਫ਼ਹਿਮੀਦਾ ੲੇਮ ||੫੪||੪||
transliteration: zaan gadhaae kooe oo raa baadhashaah fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 4 |
translation: That is why I consider the noble souls (even lowly mendicants) in the street (abode) of my Beloved (Guru) as the kings (54) (4)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਨਮੀ ਖ਼ਾਹੇਮ ਮੁਲਕੋ ਮਾਲ ਰਾ ਗੋਯਾ ਅਜ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: maa namee khaahaem mulako maal raa goyaa azaana
translation: Goyaa says, I have absolutely no desire or value for wealth and property, O Guru!

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲਿਅਾੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਫ਼ਿ ਤੁਰਾ ਬਾਲਿ ਹੁਮਾ ਫ਼ਹਿਮੀਦਾ ੲੇਮ ||੫੪||੫||
transliteration: saaeiaae zulaf thuraa baal humaa fehimeedhaa eaem | 54 | 5 |
translation: Because, I have considered a shadow of a lock of your hair as the feather of Humaa, the Phoenix, the mythical bird whose shadow is supposed to bring luck. (54) (5)

gurmukhi: ਦਰੂੰ ਮਰਦਮੁਕਿ ਦੀਦਾ ਦਿਲਰੁਬਾ ਦੀਦਮ
transliteration: dharoon maradhamuk dheedhaa dhilarubaa dheedhama
translation: I have perceived the heart-abductor in the eyelids of the man of vision,

gurmukhi: ਬਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਕਿ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਕਰਦਮ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ ਦੀਦਮ ||੫੫||੧||
transliteration: behar tharaf k nazar karadham aashanaa dheedham | 55 | 1 |
translation: Then, wherever I cast a glance, I could only see my beloved Guru. (55) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਗਿਰਦਿ ਕਾਬਾ ਓ ਬੁਤਖ਼ਾਨਾ, ਹਰ ਦੋ ਗਰਦੀਦਮ,
transliteration: ba-giradh kaabaa ou buthakhaanaa, har dho garadheedhama,a
translation: I have circumambulated both the places, the Kaabaa and the temple,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਗ਼ਰ ਨ-ਯਾਫ਼ਤਮ ਅਾਂ ਜਾ, ਹਮੀਂ ਤੁਰਾ ਦੀਦਮ ||੫੫||੨||
transliteration: dhighar na-yaafatham aaa(n) jaa, hamee thuraa dheedham | 55 | 2 |
translation: I have not seen any one other than You anywhere. (55) (2)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਕੁਜਾ ਕਿ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਕਰਦਮ ਅਜ਼ ਰਹਿ ਤਹਕੀਕ
transliteration: ba-har kujaa k nazar karadham az rehi thehakeeka
translation: Wherever and whenever I saw with eyes of search and concentration,

transliteration: valae, ba-khaanaa-e dhila, khaanaa-e khudhaa dheedham | 55 | 3 |
translation: I have always found the abode of Akaalpurakh within my heart. (55) (3)

gurmukhi: ਗਦਾੲੀ ਕਰਦਨਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਬਿਹ ਜ਼ਿ ਸੁਲਤਾਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: gadhaaee karadhan kooe thoo bih z sulathaaneesatha
translation: (The elation of) Begging in Your street, O Guru, is far better than any kingdom,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਿਲਾਫ਼ਤਿ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਣ ਤਰਕਿ ਮੁਦਅਾ ਦੀਦਮ ||੫੫||੪||
transliteration: khilaafath dho jehaan tharak mudhaaa dheedham | 55 | 4 |
translation: The enjoyment I got after I gave up my vanity and self-pride, was that of being the chief of two worlds. (55) (4)

gurmukhi: ਮਰਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਰੂਜ਼ਿ ਅਜ਼ਲ ਅਾਮਦ ੲੀਣ ਨਿਦਾ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: maraa z rooz azal aamadh een nidhaa goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, I heard the monition in my ears the very first day,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ੲਿੰਤਹਾੲਿ ਜਹਾਣ ਰਾ ਦਰ ੲਿਬਤਦਾ ਦੀਦਮ ||੫੫||੫||
transliteration: k einthehaae jehaan raa dhar eibathadhaa dheedham | 55 | 5 |
translation: That I have seen the end of the world in its beginning. (55) (5)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਦੋਸਤ ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਦੋਸਤ ਤਮ?ਨਾ ਨਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ
transliteration: az dhosath ghair dhosath thamanaa namee kunaema
translation: Goya says, I have no unfriendly expectations or desires from my friend and beloved,

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਦਰਦਿ ਸਰਿ ਖ਼ੁੲੇਸ਼ ਮਦਾਵਾ ਨਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੬||੧||
transliteration: maa dharadh sar khueaesh madhaavaa namee kunaem | 56 | 1 |
translation: I am not seeking any cure even for the anguish of my mind. (56) (1)

gurmukhi: ਬੀਮਾਰ ਨਰਗਸੇਮ ਕਿ ਨਰਗਸ ਗ਼ੁਲਾਮਿ ੳੂ ਸਤ
transliteration: beemaar naragasaem k naragas ghulaam oo satha
translation: I am sick because of the Narcissus friend who has complete control on Narcissus itself as a slave,

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂੲਿ ਖ਼ਿਜ਼ਰੋ ਮਸੀਹਾ ਨਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੬||੨||
transliteration: maa aarazooe khizaro maseehaa namee kunaem | 56 | 2 |
translation: I do not hanker either for Khizar or Messiah who could play their part as healers of this illness. (56) (2)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਜਾ ਕਿ ਦੀਦਾ ੲੇਮ ਜਮਾਲਿ ਤੂ ਦੀਦਾ ੲੇਮ
transliteration: har jaa k dheedhaa eaem jamaal thoo dheedhaa eaema
translation: Wherever I see, I see only the splendor of Your beauty,

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਜੁਜ਼ ਜਮਾਲਿ ਦੂਸਤ ਤਮਾਸ਼ਾ ਨਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੬||੩||
transliteration: maa juz jamaal dhoosath thamaashaa namee kunaem | 56 | 3 |
translation: In fact, I do not look for any other show except the glow of my Beloved. (56) (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਯਾਰ ਹਮਦਮੇਮ ਨ ਬੀਨੇਮ ਗ਼ੈਰ ੳੂ
transliteration: baa yaar hamadhamaem n beenaem ghair oo
translation: When I  am in the company of my beloved, I do not look at anyone else,

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਬਰੂੲਿ ਕਸੇ ਵਾ ਨਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੬||੪||
transliteration: maa chasham khudh barooe kasae vaa namee kunaem | 56 | 4 |
translation: In fact, I do not even open my eyes in front of anyone else. (56) (4)

gurmukhi: ਪਰਵਾਨਾ-ਵਾਰ ਗ਼ਿਰਦਿ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਮਅਾ ਜਾਣ ਦਿਹੇਮ
transliteration: paravaanaa-vaar ghiradh rukh shamaaa jaan dhihaem
translation: I sacrifice my life like a moth while fluttering around the oil-lamp,

gurmukhi: ਚੂ ਅੰਦਲੀਬ ਬੇਹੁਦਾ ਗ਼ੋਗ਼ਾ ਨਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੬||੫||
transliteration: choo andhaleeb baehudhaa ghoghaa namee kunaem | 56 | 5 |
translation: But, I do not make any useless wails, screams and shrieks like a nightingale. (56) (5)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਖ਼ਮੋਸ਼ ਬਾਸ਼ ਕਿ ਸੌਦਾੲਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ਯਾਰ
transliteration: goyaa khamosh baash k saauadhaae eishak yaara
translation: Goyaa says to himself, Just keep quiet, do not utter even a word! The deal of my love for my Beloved is with my head,

gurmukhi: ਤਾਣ ੲੀਣ ਸਰਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਸਰਿ-ਖ਼ੁਦ ਵਾ ਨਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੬||੬||
transliteration: thaan een sarasath az sari-khudh vaa namee kunaem | 56 | 6 |
translation: As long as this head is there, this deal will not be annulled. (56) (6)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਬਾ-ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ-ੲੇਮ
transliteration: maa baa-yaadh hak hamaeshaa zindhaa-eaema
translation: ?I always spend my life's time in His remembrance; this life is meaningful only so long as we love the Truth,

gurmukhi: ਦਾੲਿਮ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਹਸਾਨਿ ੳੂ ਸ਼ਰਮੰਿਦਾ-ੲੇਮ ||੫੭||੧||
transliteration: dhaaeim az eihasaan oo sharamanidhaa-eaem | 57 | 1 |
translation: And, I am chagrined but eternally grateful of the enormous obligations and kindnesses bestowed on me by my Master.? (57) (1)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਨਮਾ ਰਾ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਮਨਜ਼ੂਰ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: khudha-namaa raa bandhagee manazoor neesatha
translation: A self centered egoist does not accept nor believe in meditation,

transliteration: oo hamaeshaan saahibo maa bandhaa-eaem | 57 | 2 |
translation: However, Akaalpurakh is always the Master and we, the worldly earthlings, His slaves for ever. (57) (2)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਵਜੂਦਿ ਖ਼ਾਕੀਅਾਣ ਪਾਕੀ ਅਜ਼ੋਸਤ
transliteration: dhar vajoodh khaakeeaan paakee azosatha
translation: These earthen dolls, human beings, have been made sacred only because of Him, since His own image abides in all of them,

transliteration: maa khudhaae paak raa beenindhaa-eaem | 57 | 3 |
translation: And, I have perceived the All-Protective Lord, and remain imbued in His remembrance. (57) (3)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਬਪਾੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਸਰ ਅਫ਼ਗੰਦਾ-ੲੇਮ
transliteration: maa bapaae shaah sar afagandhaa-eaema
translation: I have placed my head at the lotus feet of my great King Master,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਦਸਤ ਰਾ ਅਫ਼ਸ਼ਾਣਦਾ-ੲੇਮ ||੫੭||੪||
transliteration: az dho aalam dhasath raa afashaanadhaa-eaem | 57 | 4 |
translation: And, I have washed my hands off from both the worlds, this and the next. (57) (4)

gurmukhi: ਨੀਸਤ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਨੂਰਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: neesath dhar har chasham ghair az noor oo
translation: There is nothing else except his refulgence in everyone's eye,

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਜੋੲਿੰਦਾ-ੲੇਮ ||੫੭||੫||
transliteration: suhabath maradhaan hak joeindhaa-eaem | 57 | 5 |
translation: That is why, I have always sought the company of saintly persons. (57) (5)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਚੂ ਜ਼?ਰਾੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਪਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਸ਼ੁਦੇਮ
transliteration: maa choo zaraae khaak paae oo shudhaema
translation: Goyaa says, I have become a particle of the dust under His feet,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਦਾਮਨ ਦਸਤਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਅਫ਼ਗੰਦਾ ੲੇਮ ||੫੭||੬||
transliteration: thaa badhaaman dhasath khudh afagandhaa eaem | 57 | 6 |
translation: Since I have got hold of the strings of His robe surrendered myself and sought and got His shield. (57) (6)

gurmukhi: ਕੀਸਤ ਗੋਯਾ ਜ਼ਾਕਰਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: keesath goyaa zaakar naam khudhaa
translation: Goyaa asks, Who is Goyaa?  meditator of the Naam of kaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦ ਜਹਾਣ ਰਖ਼ਸ਼ੰਦਾ ੲੇਮ ||੫੭||੭||
transliteration: hamachoo khurasheedh jehaan rakhashandhaa eaem | 57 | 7 |
translation: That is the reason that he is shining in this world like the sun. (57) (7)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕੇਮ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਰਾ ਨਾ-ਸ਼ਨਾਸੇਮ
transliteration: maa bandhaae eishakaem khudhaa raa naa-shanaasaema
translation: Goyaa says, I am a man of love and devotion; I do not recognize God;

gurmukhi: ਦੁਸ਼ਨਾਮ ਨ ਦਾਨੇਮ ਦੁਅਾ ਰਾ ਨਾ-ਸ਼ਨਾਸੇਮ ||੫੮||੧||
transliteration: dhushanaam n dhaanaem dhuaa raa naa-shanaasaem  | 58 | 1 |
translation: I do not know blatant vulgar abuses and do not perceive blessings. (58) (1)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਾੲਿ ਅਾਨੇਮ ਕਿ ਅਾਸ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਾੲਿ ਮਾ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: aashufathaae aanaem k aashufathaae maa hasatha
translation: Goyaa says, I am madly in love with my Beloved who is also captivated by me,

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਨ ਦਾਨੇਮ ਓ ਗਦਾ ਰਾ ਨਾ-ਸ਼ਨਾਸੇਮ ||੫੮||੨||
transliteration: maa shaah n dhaanaem ou gadhaa raa naa-shanaasaem | 58 | 2 |
translation: I do not give any credence to a king nor do I recognize a beggar. (58) (2)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਗੈਰਿ ਤੂ ਕਸ ਨੀਸਤ ਬਤਹਿਕੀਕ ਦਰੀਣਜ਼ਾ
transliteration: choon gair thoo kas neesath bathehikeek dhareenazaa
translation: Goyaa says, The fact is that, in reality, after seeking and denouncing, there is no one else except You everywhere;

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਤ?ਫ਼ਰਕਾੲਿ ਮਾ ਓ ਸ਼ੁਮਾ ਰਾ ਨਾ-ਸ਼ਨਾਸੇਮ ||੫੮||੩||
transliteration: een thafarakaae maa ou shumaa raa naa-shanaasaem | 58 | 3 |
translation: Therefore I do not recognize any barriers between you and me. (58) (3)

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਪਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਪਾ ਸਰ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ਮੁਹ?ਬਤ
transliteration: sar paa shudh paa sar shudhaa dhar raahi muhabatha
translation: In the self-annhilating path of love, one gets so enamored that the head becomes the feet and the feet the head in oneness;

gurmukhi: ਗੋੲਿਮ ਵ ਲੇਕਨ ਸਰੋ ਪਾ ਰਾ ਨ-ਸ਼ਨਾਸੇਮ ||੫੮||੪||
transliteration: goeim v laekan saro paa raa na-shanaasaem | 58 | 4 |
translation: This cliche is often repeated; However, we do not distinguish the difference between the roles of head and feet. (58) (4)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਨੀਜ਼ ਚੂ ਗੋਯਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਅਜ਼ਲ ਮਸਤ ੲੀਸਤਮ
transliteration: maa neez choo goyaa z azal masath eesathama
translation: Drunk with ecstacy, we too, like Goyaa, have been derelict since the beginning of time,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਕਾੲਿਦਾੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਹਦੋ ਰਿਅਾ ਰਾ ਨਾ-ਸ਼ਨਾਸੇਮ ||੫੮||੫||
transliteration: een kaaeidhaae zuhadho riaa raa naa-shanaasaem | 58 | 5 |
translation: We have been completely oblivious to the modus operandi of meditation or fakery. (58) (5)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਗਾਹ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਬਜਾਨਿਬਿ ਦਿਲਦਾਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ
transliteration: har gaah nazar bajaanib dhiladhaar mee kunaema
translation: Whenever we open our eyes to look towards our Beloved Guru,

gurmukhi: ਦਰਿਅਾੲਿ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਗੁਹਰ-ਬਾਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੯||੧||
transliteration: dhariaae har dho chasham guhara-baar mee kunaem | 59 | 1 |
translation: Then the pearl-showering river-like eyes start streaming down with tears. (59) (1)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਜਾ ਕਿ ਦੀਦਾੲੇਮ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਯਾਰ ਦੀਦਾੲੇਮ
transliteration: har jaa k dheedhaaeaem rukh yaar dheedhaaeaema
translation: Goyaa says, Wherever I have looked, I see only the face of my Beloved,

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਕੈ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਬਜਾਨਿਬਿ ਅਗ਼ਯਾਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੯||੨||
transliteration: maa kai nazar bajaanib aghayaar mee kunaem | 59 | 2 |
translation: When did I ever have looked at a stranger, someone other than the Akaalpurakh Himself? (59) (2)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਹਿਦ ਮਰਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਦੀਦਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੂਬਾਣ ਮਨਅਾ ਮਕੁਨ
transliteration: zaahidh maraa z dheedhaan khoobaan manaaa makuna
translation: O meditating saint! Please do not forbid me from looking at beautiful objects;

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਬਸੂੲਿ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਯਾਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੯||੩||
transliteration: maa khudh nazar basooe rukh yaar mee kunaem | 59 | 3 |
translation: Because, I do not dare look at anyone else other than my true and loving Friend. (59) (3)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਜੁਜ਼ ਹਦੀਸਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਕੂਤੇ ਨਾ ਖ਼ੁਰਦਾੲੇਮ
transliteration: maa juz hadhees rooe thoo koothae naa khuradhaaeaema
translation: Goyaa says, I have never taken any other food stimulent  except the discourse about Your lovely face,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ੲੀਣ ਹਮਾ ਤਕਰਾਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੯||੪||
transliteration: dhar raahi eishak een hamaa thakaraar mee kunaem | 59 | 4 |
translation: While treading the path of love and affection, this has been enough, and I have been persistently asserting this. (59) (4)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਯਾਰ ਕਿ ਮਖ਼ਮੂਰ ਗਸ਼ਤਾੲੇਮ
transliteration: goyaa z chasham yaar k makhamoor gashathaaeaema
translation: Goyaa says, I am inebriated with the intoxicating looks of my Beloved,

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਖ਼ਾਹਸ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਰਾਬਿ ਪੁਰ ਅਸਰਾਰ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੇਮ ||੫੯||੫||
transliteration: kai khaahash sharaab pur asaraar mee kunaem | 59 | 5 |
translation: Then, why should I ever long for a sip of mysterious alcoholic drink? (59) (5)

gurmukhi: ਨਮੀ ਗੁਜੰਦ ਬਚਸ਼ਮਮ ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਸ਼ਾਹਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਪਸੰਦਿ ਮਨ
transliteration: namee gujandh bachashamam ghair shaahi khudha-pasandh mana
translation: Nothing permeates into my eyes except the king of my own choice;

gurmukhi: ਬਚਸ਼ਮਮ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਨਿਸ਼ਸਤ ਅਾਣ ਕਾਮਤਿ ਬਖ਼ਤਿ ਬੁਲੰਦਿ ਮਨ ||੬੦||੧||
transliteration: bachashamam khush nishasath aan kaamath bakhath bulandh man | 60 | 1 |
translation: His tall and well-built God-given stature has become comely to my eyes. (60) (1)

gurmukhi: ਤਮਾਮੀ ਮੁਰਦਾਹਾ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਤਬ?ਸੁਮ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਮੀ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ
transliteration: thamaamee muradhaahaa raa az thabasum zindhaa mee saazadha
translation: Goyaa says, He, the Guru, revives dead bodies into life with his smile,

gurmukhi: ਚੂ ਰੇਜ਼ਦ ਅਾਬ ਹੈਵਾਣ ਅਜ਼ ਦਹਾਨਿ ਗੁੰਚਾ-ਖ਼ੰਦਿ-ਮਨ ||੬੦||੨||
transliteration: choo raezadh aab haivaan az dhehaan gunchaa-khandhi-man | 60 | 2 |
translation: When he showers elixir-like expressions from his blossoming close-lipped bud-like mouth. (60) (2)

gurmukhi: ਬਰਾੲਿ ਦੀਦਨਿ ਤੂ ਦੀਦਾਅਮ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਚਸ਼ਮਾੲਿ ਕੌਸ਼ਰ
transliteration: baraae dheedhan thoo dheedhaaam shudh chashamaae kaauashara
translation: My eyes have become a source of an eternal fountain longing to have your glimpse;

gurmukhi: ਬਿਅਾ ਜਾਨਾਣ ਕਿ ਕੁਰਬਾਨਿ ਤੂ ਜਾਨਿ ਦਰਦ-ਮੰਦ ਮਨ ||੬੦||੩||
transliteration: biaa jaanaan k kurabaan thoo jaan dharadha-mandh man | 60 | 3 |
translation: Come my Beloved! My pitiable suffering sad life is willing to sacrifice itself for you. (60) (3)

gurmukhi: ਅਗਰ ਬੀਨੀ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਮਨ ਬਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਕੁਜਾ ਯਾਬੀ
transliteration: agar beenee dharoon man baghair az khudh kujaa yaabee
translation: If you, my Guru, would ever care to look deep into my heart, you will not find anything other than you there;

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਤੂੰ ਨਬੂਦ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਬੰਦ ਬੰਦਿ ਮਨ ||੬੦||੪||
transliteration: k ghair az zikar thoon naboodh dharoon bandh bandh man | 60 | 4 |
translation: Because, there is not even a mention of anyone except you in each and every limb of my body and every drop of my blood. (60) (4)

gurmukhi: ਮਨਮ ਯ?ਕ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਗਿਲ ਗੋਯਾ ਦਰੂਨਮ ਨੂਰਿ ਓ ਲਾਮਅ
transliteration: manam yak mushath gil goyaa dharoonam noor ou laamaa
translation: Gayaa says, I am a just a fistful of dust, but my inner self is bright and satiated with the glow of eternal light of his rays,

gurmukhi: ਬਗ਼ਰਦਿਸ਼ ਦਾੲਿਮਾ ਗਰਦਦ ਦਿਲਿ ਪੁਰ ਹੋਸ਼ਮੰਦਿ ਮਨ ||੬੦||੫||
transliteration: bagharadhish dhaaeimaa garadhadh dhil pur hoshamandh man | 60 | 5 |
translation: Therefore, my alert and sane mind always echoes that message. (60) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬੇਵਫ਼ਾ ਨੀਸਤ ਕਸੇ ਗਰ ਤੂ ਵਫ਼ਾਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ
transliteration: baevafaa neesath kasae gar thoo vafaadhaar shavee
translation: Goyaa says, If you become faithful, then no one would betray you,

gurmukhi: ਵਕਤ ਅਾਨਸਤ ਕਿ ਬਰ ਵਕਤ ਖ਼ਬਰਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੧||੧||
transliteration: vakath aanasath k bar vakath khabaradhaar shavee | 61 | 1 |
translation: The time has come that you should be alert of this truth on time. (61) (1)

gurmukhi: ਜਾਣ ਅਗਰ ਹਸਤ ਸਿਰਿ ਕਦਮਿ ਜਾਨਾਣ ਕੁਨ
transliteration: jaan agar hasath sir kadham jaanaan kuna
translation: If you are alive, then offer your heart as a sacrifice for His lotus feet,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲ ਬ-ਦਿਲਦਾਰ ਬਿਦਿਹ ਜ਼ਾਕਿ ਤੂ ਦਿਲਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੧||੨||
transliteration: dhil ba-dhiladhaar bidhih zaak thoo dhiladhaar shavee | 61 | 2 |
translation: Present your heart and mind to your Beloved, so that you, yourself, would become a beloved. (61) (2)

gurmukhi: ਮੰਜ਼ਿਲਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ਦਰਾਜ਼ ਅਸਤ ਬ-ਪਾ ਨਤਵਾਣ ਰਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: manzil eishak dharaaz asath ba-paa nathavaan rafatha
translation: The journey of love and devotion is extremely long and arduous; it cannot be traversed by walking on foot,

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਕਦਮ ਸਾਜ਼ ਕਿ ਤਾ ਦਰ ਰਹਿ ਅਾਣ ਯਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੧||੩||
transliteration: sar kadham saaz k thaa dhar rehi aan yaar shavee | 61 | 3 |
translation: We should walk making our head as our feet, so that we can travel on the path towards our Beloved and the trek can be completed. (61) (3)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਫ਼ਤਗੂੲਿ ਹਮਾ ਕਸ ਦਰ ਖ਼ੋਰਿ ੲਿਦਰਾਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: gufathagooe hamaa kas dhar khor eidharaak khudh asatha
translation: The conversation of each one of us is based upon our perception and knowledge,

gurmukhi: ਲਭ ਫ਼ਰੋਬੰਦ ਕਿ ਤਾ ਮਹਿਰਮਿ ਅਸਰਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੧||੪||
transliteration: labh farobandh k thaa mehiram asaraar shavee | 61 | 4 |
translation: But you should keep your lips sealed so that you can realize and appreciate the truth about His mysteries. (61) (4)

gurmukhi: ਮੀ ਫ਼ਰੋਸ਼ਦ ਦਿਲਿ ਦੀਵਾਨਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਰਾ ਗੋਯਾ
transliteration: mee faroshadh dhil dheevaanaae khudh raa goyaa
translation: Goyaa says, I am presenting my infatuated mind for sale on the hope that

gurmukhi: ਬ-ੳੁਮੀਦਿ ਕਰਮਿ ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਖ਼ਰੀਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੧||੫||
transliteration: ba-oumeedh karam aan k khareedhaar shavee | 61 | 5 |
translation: You, the Guru, with your benevolence, might become its purchaser. (61) (5)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਕੀ ਮਰਾ ਤੋ ਜੁ?ਰਾ-ੲਿ ਜਾਂ ੲਿਸਤਿਅਾਕ ਦੇਹ
transliteration: saakee maraa tho juraa-e jaa(n) eisathiaak dhaeha
translation: O bartender! Kindly put my beloved in the cup of life; the urge to survive,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਰੂੲੇ ਤੇ ਬੀਨਮ, ਦੂਰੀ ਫ਼ਰਾਕ ਦੇਹ ||੬੨||੧||
transliteration: thaa rooeae thae beenama, dhooree faraak dhaeh | 62 | 1 |
translation: So that I may live to see my beloved's face when I am free from separation.  (62) (1)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਰ ਤਰਫ਼ ਬੀਨਮ, ਚੂੰ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਤੁਰਾ ਮੁਦਾਮ
transliteration: dhar har tharaf beenama, choon rukh thuraa mudhaama
translation: I look for your glimpse in every direction, but in vain

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਦਿਲ ਮਰਾ ਖ਼ਲਾਸੀ, ਅਜ਼ ਅਫ਼ਤਰਾਕ ਦੇਹ ||੬੨||੨||
transliteration: baa dhil maraa khalaasee, az afatharaak dhaeh | 62 | 2 |
translation: O heart! Kindly release me from life so that I can surrender before separation sets in. (62) (2)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਬੇ ਤੋ ਹੇਚ ਨੇਸਤ ਚੂੰ ਬੀਨੇਮ ਬ-ਹਰ ਕੁਜਾਸਤ
transliteration: choon bae tho haech naesath choon beenaem ba-har kujaasatha
translation: Everything is futile and every place is void without you, this is so everywhere,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਦੀਦਹ ਓ ਦਿਲਿ ਮਰਾ, ਤੋ ੲਿੰਤਫ਼ਾਕ ਦੇਹ ||੬੨||੩||
transliteration: thaa dheedheh ou dhil maraa, tho einthafaak dhaeh | 62 | 3 |
translation: Grant me the unity for my worldly heart and eyes that I can see you. (62) (3)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਸਾਫ਼ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਅਾੲੀਨਾ-ੲਿ ਦਿਲ ਅਜ਼ ਸਵਾਦਿ ਗ਼ਮ
transliteration: choon saaf gashath aaeenaa-e dhil az savaadh ghama
translation: Scrape off the dross of sorrow from the mirror of my heart,

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਵਸਲ ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਨਮਾੲੀ, ਰਿਹਾੲੀ ਜ਼ਿ ਬਾਂਕ ਦੇਹ ||੬੨||੪||
transliteration: baa vasal khudha-namaaee, rihaaee z baa(n)k dhaeh | 62 | 4 |
translation: So that I see only your reflection in it and with it, the terror of separation is ended (62) (4)

gurmukhi: ਗੋੲਿਅਾ ਬ-ਹਰ ਕੁਜਾ ਕਿ ਬ-ਬੀਨਮ ਜਮਾਲਿ ਤੋ
transliteration: goeiaa ba-har kujaa k ba-beenam jamaal tho
translation: Goyaa says, I should be able to see only you and your splendid colors,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਦਿਲਿ ਮਰਾ ਖ਼ਲਾਸੀੲੇ, ਅਜ਼ ਦਰਦਨਾਕ ਦੇਹ ||੬੨||੫||
transliteration: thaa dhil maraa khalaaseeeae, az dharadhanaak dhaeh | 62 | 5 |
translation: I seek release from tis bondage and the pain of separation. (62 ) (5)

gurmukhi: ਬੇਵਫ਼ਾ ਨੇਸਤ ਕਸੇ, ਗਰ ਤੂ ਵਫ਼ਾਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ
transliteration: baevafaa naesath kasae, gar thoo vafaadhaar shavee
translation: If you believe in yourself, then no one shall be a non-believer or faithless,

gurmukhi: ਵਕਤ ਅਾਂਸੂ ਕਿ: ਬਰ ਵਕਤ, ਖ਼ਬਰਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੩||੧||
transliteration: vakath aaa(n)soo ki: bar vakatha, khabaradhaar shavee | 63 | 1 |
translation: Times are such that they will demand alertness every moment. (63) (1)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਂ ਅਗਰ ਹਸਤ, ਨਸਾਰਿ ਕਦਮਿ ਜਾਨਾਂ ਕੁਨ
transliteration: zaa(n) agar hasatha, nasaar kadham jaanaa(n) kuna
translation: If you have life in you, you should sacrifice it at the feet of the beloved,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲ ਬ-ਦਿਲਦਾਰ ਬਦਿਹ, ਜ਼ਾਂ ਕਿ: ਦਿਲਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੩||੨||
transliteration: dhil ba-dhiladhaar badhiha, zaa(n) ki: dhiladhaar shavee | 63 | 2 |
translation: O heart! You should offer yourself uninhibitingly to your beloved so that you would also be loved. (63) (2)

gurmukhi: ਮੰਜ਼ਲਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ਦਰਾਜ਼ ਅਸਤ ਬਾ-ਪਾ ਨ-ਤਤਵਾਂ ਰਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: manzal eishak dharaaz asath baa-paa na-thathavaa(n) rafatha
translation: Destination of love is too far and long; it cannot be reached using the feet,

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਕਦਮ ਸਾਜ਼, ਕਿ: ਤਾ ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ਅਾਂ ਯਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੩||੩||
transliteration: sar kadham saaza, ki: thaa dhar raahi aaa(n) yaar shavee | 63 | 3 |
translation: Sacrifice your head, make it your feet before you embark on the road to your beloved. (63) (3)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਫ਼ਤਗੂੲੇ ਹਮਾ ਕਸ ਦਰ ੲਿਦਰਾਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: gufathagooeae hamaa kas dhar eidharaak khudh asatha
translation: Everyone indulges into conversation according to his wits,

gurmukhi: ਲਬ ਫ਼ਿਰੋਬੰਦ ਕਿ: ਤਾ ਮਹਰਮਿ ੲਿਸਰਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੩||੪||
transliteration: lab firobandh ki: thaa meharam eisaraar shavee | 63 | 4 |
translation: However, you should keep your lips tightly closed if you are anxious to share the secrets of the beloved. (63) (4)

gurmukhi: ਮੇ ਫ਼ਰੋਸ਼ਦ ਦਿਲਿ ਦੀਵਾਨਾ-ੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਰਾ, ਗੋੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: mae faroshadh dhil dheevaanaa-e khudh raa, goeiaa
translation: Goyaa says, I want to sell myself and my insane heart to my beloved,

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ੳੁਮੀਦਿ ਕਰਮਿ ਅਾਂ, ਕਿ: ਖ਼ਰੀਦਾਰ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੬੩||੫||
transliteration: baa oumeedh karam aaa(n), ki: khareedhaar shavee | 63 | 5 |
translation: With my faith in his grace and mercy, I am sure he will find it worthy of buying. (63) (5)

gurmukhi: ਰੁਬਾੲੀਅਾਣ
transliteration: rubaaeeaana
translation: 4-Line Verses

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸ ਜ਼ਿ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਤੂ ਕਦਮ ਅਜ਼ ਸਰ ਸਾਖ਼ਤ
transliteration: har kas z shaauak thoo kadham az sar saakhatha
translation: Everyone, with his zeal for you, started to walk on his head,

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਨਹੁ ਤਬਕ ਚਰਖ਼ਿ ਅਲਮ ਸਰ ਅਫ਼ਰਾਖ਼ਤ
transliteration: bar nahu thabak charakh alam sar afaraakhatha
translation: And, he was able to pitch his flag over the nine skies,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਾਮਦਨਸ਼ ਮੁਬਾਰਿਕ ਰਫ਼ਤਨ ਹਮ
transliteration: shudh aamadhanash mubaarik rafathan hama
translation: Blessed is his coming to this world, and equally blessed is his departure,

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਅਾਣ ਕਸ ਕਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਬਿਸ਼ਨਾਖ਼ਤ ||੧||
transliteration: goyaa aan kas k raahi hak raa bishanaakhath | 1 |
translation: Goyaa says, The one who has perceived the Lord. (1)

gurmukhi: ਕੂਰ ਅਸਤ ਹਰ ਅਾਣ ਦੀਦਾ ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਨਭਸ਼ਨਾਖ਼ਤ
transliteration: koor asath har aan dheedhaa k hak raa nabhashanaakhatha
translation: Every such eye that did not recognize (the existence) of Akaalpurakh, can be considered as blind,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਗਿਰਾਣ ਮਾਯਾ ਬ-ਗ਼ਫ਼ਲਤ ਦਰਬਾਖ਼ਤ
transliteration: een oumar giraan maayaa ba-ghafalath dharabaakhatha
translation: He wasted this precious life in negligence and carelessness,

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਗਿਰੀਅਾਣ ਕੁਨਾਣ ਅਾਮਦ ਬ-ਹਸਰਤ ਮੁਰਦ
transliteration: oo gireeaan kunaan aamadh ba-hasarath muradha
translation: He came (to this world) crying and passed away taking all his yearnings and unfulfilled hopes with him,

gurmukhi: ਅਫ਼ਸੋਸ ਦਰੀਣ ਅਾਮਦ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਕਾਰੇ ਨਭਸਾਖ਼ਤ ||੨||
transliteration: afasos dhareen aamadh shudh kaarae nabhasaakhath | 2 |
translation: Alas! He was unable to better his disposition in this cycle of birth and death. (2)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਤੂ ਖ਼ਾਨਾ ਦਾਰਿ ਜਾਨਾਨਸਤ
transliteration: een chasham thoo khaanaa dhaar jaanaanasatha
translation: This eye of yours is the abode of the Beloved virtuous friend,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਤਖ਼ਤਿ ਵਜੂਦਿ ਮਸਨਦਿ ਸੁਲਤਾਨਸਤ
transliteration: een thakhath vajoodh masanadh sulathaanasatha
translation: Your personality is the seat of His royal throne,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਬੂਅਲਹਵਸੇ ਬਸੂੲਿ ੳੂ ਰਾਹ ਨ ਬੁਰਦ
transliteration: har booalehavasae basooe oo raah n buradha
translation: Anyone immersed in greed and lust cannot reach the powerful Almighty,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ੲੀਣ ਰਾਹ ਤਅ?ਲਕਿ ਮੰਜ਼ਲਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਸਤ ||੩||
transliteration: k een raah thaalak manzal maradhaanasath | 3 |
translation: Because this path is meant for the brave and the valiant devotees of Waaheguru. (3)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦਿਲ ਕਿ ਬਰਾਹਿ ਰਾਸਤ ਜਾਨਾਣ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: har dhil k baraahi raasath jaanaan shudhaa asatha
translation: Every such heart and mind that spontaneously (by acquiring the virtues of) became the divine Beloved,

gurmukhi: ਤਹਿਕੀਕ ਬਿਦਾਣ ਕਿ ਅੈਨਿ ਜਾਨਾਣ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: thehikeek bidhaan k ain jaanaan shudhaa asatha
translation: Rest assured! That he became the embodiment of Akaalpurakh Himself,

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਿ ਰਹਿਮਤਸ਼ ਖ਼ਾਲੀ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: yak zaraa z faiz rehimathash khaalee neesatha
translation: Not even a particle of dust is then without his benevolence and blessing,

gurmukhi: ਨ?ਕਾਸ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਨਕਸ਼ ਪਿਨਹਾਣ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੪||
transliteration: nakaas dharoon nakash pinehaan shudhaa asath | 4 |
translation: And, the Sculptor-Painter is camouflaging Himself behind His colors. (4)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਅਾਮਦੋ ਰਫ਼ਤ ਜੁਜ਼ ਦਮੇ ਬੇਸ਼ ਨਬੂਦ
transliteration: een aamadho rafath juz dhamae baesh naboodh
translation: This coming and departing in this world is no more than a moment,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਜਾ ਕਿ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਕੁਨੇਮ ਜੁਜ਼ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਨਬੂਦ
transliteration: har jaa k nazar kunaem juz khaesh naboodha
translation: Wherever we run our vision and see around, we see only our own images,

gurmukhi: ਮਾਣ ਜਾਨਿਬਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਚੂੰ ਂਨਿਗਾਹ ਬਿਕੁਨੇਮ
transliteration: maan jaanib ghair choon anigaah bikunaema
translation: How can we ever dare to look towards anyone else?
