gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਤੂ ਹੀਚ ਕਸੇ ਪਸੋ ਪੇਸ਼ ਨਬੂਦ ||੫||
transliteration: choon ghair thoo heech kasae paso paesh naboodh | 5 |
translation: Because, there is no one else (except Waaheguru) in the front or rear who is supporting us. (5)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਬੰਦਾ ਕੂ ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: har bandhaa koo thaalib maaualaa baashadha
translation: Every such person who is a seeker of the Divinity,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਣ ਰੁਤਬਾ-ਅੰਸ਼ ੳੂਲਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: dhar har dho jehaan ruthabaa-ansh oolaa baashadha
translation: Has a highest rank and status in both the worlds;

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਣ ਰਾ ਬ-ਜੌੲੇ ਬਿ-ਸਤਾਨੰਦ
transliteration: goyaa dho jehaan raa ba-jaaueae bi-sathaanandha
translation: Goyaa says, They can acquire both the worlds in exchange for just a grain of barley,

gurmukhi: ਮਜਨੂੰਨਿ ਤੂ ਕੈ ਅਾਸ਼ਕਿ ਲੈਲਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੬||
transliteration: majanoonn thoo kai aashak lailaa baashadh | 6 |
translation: When and how would I, Your beloved (like Majnoo was) become Your lover (like Lailaa)? (6)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦਹਿਰ ਕਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਅਾਮਦਾ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: dhar dhehir k maradhaan khudhaa aamadhaa andha
translation: When men of God manifest themselves in this world,

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਗ਼ੁਮ-ਸ਼ੁਦਗਾਨਿ ਰਹਿਨੁਮਾ ਅਾਮਦਾ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: bar ghuma-shudhagaan rehinumaa aamadhaa andha
translation: They come as leaders to put the strayed people on to the right path;

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਅਗਰ ੲੀਂ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਤੂ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਾਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: goyaa agar ee chasham thoo mushathaak khudhaa asatha
translation: Goyaa says, If your eye is desirous of the Almighty,

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਨੁਮਾ ਅਾਮਦਾ ਅੰਦ ||੭||
transliteration: maradhaan khudhaa khudhaa-numaa aamadhaa andh | 7 |
translation: Then realize that the noble souls of God come to this earth only to reveal Him. (7)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਮਜ਼ਹਬਿ ਮਾ ਗ਼ੈਰ-ਪਰਸਤੀ ਨ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: dhar mazehab maa ghaira-parasathee n kunandha
translation: People of our faith do not worship anyone else (other than Akaalpurakh),

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਤਾ ਬਕਦਮ ਬਹੋਸ਼ ਓ ਮਸਤੀ ਨ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: sar thaa bakadham behosh ou masathee n kunandha
translation: They are always mindful and alert and never act or behave wantonly,

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਲਿ ਨਸ਼ਵੰਦ ਯਕ ਦਮ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: ghaafal nashavandh yak dham az yaadh khudhaa
translation: They are not negligent of the remembrance of Waaheguru even for one moment/breath,

gurmukhi: ਦੀਗਰ ਸੁਖ਼ਨ ਅਜ਼ ਬੁਲੰਦੋ ਪਸਤੀ ਨ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੮||
transliteration: dheegar sukhan az bulandho pasathee n kunandh | 8 |
translation: Additionally, they do not get involved in topics relating to higher or lower classes of the society. (8)

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਅਗਰ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: yak zaraa agar shaauak eilaahee baashadha
translation: If one has even the slightest inkling of fondness for the Lord,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਹਤਰ ਕਿ ਹਜ਼ਾਰ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ
transliteration: bihathar k hazaar baadhashaahee baashadha
translation: Then, that is far superior to thousands of kingdoms,

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ-ਸਤ ਗ਼ੁਲਾਮਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼
transliteration: goyaa-sath ghulaam murashadh khaesha
translation: Goyaa says, I am the slave of my true Guru,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਖ਼ਤ ਨ ਮੁਹਤਾਜਿ ਗਵਾਹੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ||੯||
transliteration: een khath n muhathaaj gavaahee baashadh | 9 |
translation: And this written assertion does not need any witnesses. (9)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸ ਬ-ਜਹਾ ਨਸ਼ਵੋ ਨੁਮਾ ਮੀ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ
transliteration: har kas ba-jehaa nashavo numaa mee khaahadha
translation: Every human being in this world likes to progressively prosper and professionally advance,

gurmukhi: ਅਸਪੋ ਸ਼ੁਤਰੋ ਫ਼ੀਲੋ ਤਿਲਾ ਮੀ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ
transliteration: asapo shutharo feelo thilaa mee khaahadha
translation: He/She has strong desire to acquire horses, camels, elephants and gold;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸ ਜ਼ਿ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਚੀਜ਼ੇ ਮੀ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ
transliteration: har kas z baraae khaesh cheezae mee khaahadha
translation: Every one always longs to have something or the other for himself;

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਮੀ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ||੧੦||
transliteration: goyaa z khudhaa yaadh khudhaa mee khaahadh | 10 |
translation: However, Goyaa says, I always supplicate to the Lord to bless me only with His remembrance. (10)

gurmukhi: ਪੁਰ ਗਸ਼ਤਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਸਰ ਤਾ ਬ-ਕਦਮ ਨੂਰ-ੳੁਲ-ਨੂਰ
transliteration: pur gashathaa z sar thaa ba-kadham noora-oula-noora
translation: Goyaa says that His Guru is satiated with radiance and splendor from head to feet;

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲੀਨਾ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਵੈਨ ਬਵਦ ਹੀਚ ਕਸੂਰ
transliteration: aaeenaa k dhar vain bavadh heech kasoora
translation: He is a mirror that has no cracks;

gurmukhi: ਤਹਿਕੀਕ ਬਿਦਾਣ ਜ਼ਿ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲਾਣ ਦੂਰ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: thehikeek bidhaan z ghaafilaan dhoor bavadha
translation: Rest assured: That he shuns away from the careless and the negligent;

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਦਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਕਰਦਾ ਜ਼ਹੂਰ ||੧੧||
transliteration: oo dhar dhil aarif karadhaa zehoor | 11 |
translation: And he manifests only in the hearts of holy and pious persons. (11)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਗਿਰਾਣ-ਮਾਯਾ ਕਿ ਬਰਬਾਦ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: een oumar giraana-maayaa k barabaadh shavadha
translation: This priceless life that is wasted for nothing,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ਵੀਰਾਣ ਬ-ਚਿਹ ਅਾਬਾਦ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: een khaanaae veeraan ba-chih aabaadh shavadha
translation: And how can this desolate home be rehabilitated and settled?

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਨਦਿਹਦ ਦਸਤ ਬ੍ਰਹਮ
transliteration: thaa murashadh kaamil nadhihadh dhasath brehama
translation: Goyaa says, (This can happen) Only when a complete Guru stands by your side and helps; And this may be the only way that

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਦਿਲਿ ਗ਼ਮਗੀਨ ਤੂ ਚੂੰ ਸ਼ਾਦ ਬਵਦ ||੧੨||
transliteration: goyaa dhil ghamageen thoo choon shaadh bavadh | 12 |
translation: My heart filled with worries and griefs can be elevated to elation? (12)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਜ਼ਾਲਮਿ ਬ-ਕਸਦਿ ਕੁਸ਼ਤਨਿ ਮਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: dhil zaalam ba-kasadh kushathan maa-satha
translation: The fiendish has the intention to destroy us,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਮਜ਼ਲੂਮਿ ਮਨ ਬਸੂੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਸਤ
transliteration: dhil mazaloom man basooe khudhaa satha
translation: On the other hand, my vulnerable mind is expecting help and relief  from the Almighty;

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਦਰੀਣ ਫ਼ਿਕਰ ਤਾਣ ਬਮਾ ਚਿਹ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: oo dhareen fikar thaan bamaa chih kunadha
translation: The brute is concerned as to what should He do with him?

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਦਰੀਣ ਫ਼ਿਕਰ ਤਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਚਿਹ ਕੁਨਦ ||੧੩||
transliteration: maa dhareen fikar thaa khudhaa chih kunadh | 13 |
translation: And, we are concerned as to how does the Almighty respond to our plea? (13)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ੳੁਮਰ ਅਾਣ ਚਿਹ ਮਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ੲੇਮ
transliteration: dhar haasil oumar aan chih maa yaafathaa eaema
translation: What did we gain from this priceless life?

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਰ ਦੋ-ਜਹਾਣ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ੲੇਮ
transliteration: dhar har dho-jehaan yaadh khudhaa yaafathaa eaema
translation: We were able to achieve the remembrance of the Omnipotent in both the worlds;

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਸਤੀੲੇ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ਬਲਾ ਬੂਦ ਅਜ਼ੀਮ
transliteration: een hasatheeeae khaeshathan balaa boodh azeema
translation: This personality of ours was a huge monster,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤੇਮ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ੲੇਮ ||੧੪||
transliteration: az khaesh guzashathaem khudhaa yaafathaa eaem | 14 |
translation: When we gave up our ego and vanity, we attained the Ultimate, the Lord. (14)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਦਰਿ ਤੂ ਤੂਤੀਅਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾੲੇਮ
transliteration: az khaak dhar thoo thootheeaa yaafathaaeaema
translation: We obtained collyrium from the dust of Your door;

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਅਾਣ ਨਸ਼ਵੋ ਨੁਮਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾੲੇਮ
transliteration: kaz dhaaualath aan nashavo numaa yaafathaaeaema
translation: Because of which we gained the prosperity and progress;

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਸਿਜਦਾ ਬਰ ਰੂੲਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਦੀਗਰ ਨਭਕੁਨੇਮ
transliteration: maa sijadhaa bar rooe ghair dheegar nabhakunaema
translation: We have never bowed before anyone other than You,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ਦਿਲ ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾੲੇਮ ||੧੫||
transliteration: dhar khaanaae dhil nakash khudhaa yaafathaaeaem | 15 |
translation: We have discovered the symptoms of the Omnipresent within the abode of our heart. (15)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਖ਼ਬਰ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾੲੇਮ
transliteration: goyaa khabar az yaadh khudhaa yaafathaaeaema
translation: Goyaa says, I have been able to get the inkling about the kaalpurakh from His remembrance,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਜਾਮਿ ਲਬਾ-ਲਬ ਅਜ਼ ਕੁਜਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾੲੇਮ
transliteration: een jaam labaa-lab az kujaa yaafathaaeaema
translation: Otherwise, how could I have obtained this full-to-the-brim cup of devotion and affection?

gurmukhi: ਜੁਜ਼ ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਹ?ਕ ਨਸੀਬਿ ਹਰ ਕਸ ਨ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: juz thaalib hak naseeb har kas n bavadha
translation: Except the seeker of Lord, no one else is destined to have

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਨਾਯਾਬ ਕਿ ਮਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾੲੇਮ ||੧੬||
transliteration: een dhaaualath naayaab k maa yaafathaaeaem | 16 |
translation: This valuable treasure that I have had the good fortunate to obtain. (16)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਤਾ ਕੈ ਦਰੀਣ ਸਰਾੲੇ ਮਾਦੂਅਮ
transliteration: goyaa thaa kai dhareen saraaeae maadhooama
translation: Goyaa says, How long are you going to stay in this perishable world,

gurmukhi: ਗਾਹੇ ਲਾਜ਼ਮ ਸ਼ਵਦ ਵ ਗਾਹੇ ਮਲਜ਼ੂਮ
transliteration: gaahae laazam shavadh v gaahae malazooma
translation: That sometimes becomes so essential and other times so assigned?

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕੈ ਚੂ ਸਗਾਣ ਬਰ ੳੁਸਤਖ਼ਾਣ ਜੰਗ ਕੁਨੇਮ
transliteration: thaa kai choo sagaan bar ousathakhaan jang kunaema
translation: How long are we going to fight over bones like dogs ?

gurmukhi: ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਮਾਲੂਅਮ ਅਹਿਲਿ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਮਾਲੂਅਮ ||੧੭||
transliteration: dhuniaa maalooam ahil dhuniaa maalooam | 17 |
translation: We all know about this world and these worldly people, (how selfish and merciless they are). (17)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਯਾ ਅਗਰ ਅਾਣ ਜਮਾਲ ਦੀਦਨ ਦਾਰੀ
transliteration: goyaa agar aan jamaal dheedhan dhaaree
translation: Goyaa says, If you desire to see the splendor and glory of Waaheguru?

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਹਵਸ ਮੈਲਿ ਰਮੀਦਨ ਦਾਰੀ
transliteration: az khudh havas mail rameedhan dhaaree
translation: If you are trying to shun away from the sin of your greed and lust and have the stomach for meidtation?

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੀਣ ਦੀਦਾ ਮਬੀਣ ਕਿ ਹਜ਼ਾਬ ਸਤ ਤੁਰਾ
transliteration: zeen dheedhaa mabeen k hazaab sath thuraa
translation: Then you should not see with these overt and ostensible eyes, because they are the obstacle for you;

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਦੀਦਾ ਬਿਬੀਣ ਹਰ ਅਾਣ ਚਿਹ ਦੀਦਨ ਦਾਰੀ ||੧੮||
transliteration: bae-dheedhaa bibeen har aan chih dheedhan dhaaree | 18 |
translation: In fact, you should try to introspect without your eyes whatever you want to see. (And you would be successful) (18)

gurmukhi: ਮੌਜੂਦ ਖ਼ੁਦਾਸਤ ਤੂ ਕਿਰਾ ਮੀ ਜੋੲੀ
transliteration: maauajoodh khudhaasath thoo kiraa mee joee
translation: Akaalpurakh is Omnipresent. Then whom are you searching for?

gurmukhi: ਮਕਸੂਦ ਖ਼ੁਦਾਸਤ ਤੂ ਕੁਜਾ ਮੀ ਪੋੲੀ
transliteration: makasoodh khudhaasath thoo kujaa mee poee
translation: A meeting with the Benevolent is the aim of our life; where are you straying?

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਣ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਤੁਸਤ
transliteration: een har dho jehaan nishaan dhaaualath thusatha
translation: Both these worlds are the symbols of your mastery and control;

gurmukhi: ਯਾਅਨੀ ਸੁਖ਼ਨ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ਬਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੀ ਗੋੲੀ ||੧੯||
transliteration: yaaanee sukhan az zabaan hak mee goee | 19 |
translation: That is, you are speaking the word of God through your own tongue. (19)

gurmukhi: ਮਬਰ ਅੈ ਬਾਦ ਖ਼ਾਕਮ ਅਜ਼ ਦਰਿ ਦੂਸਤ
transliteration: mabar ai baadh khaakam az dhar dhoosatha
translation: O wind! Do not blow away my dust from the door of my Beloved,

gurmukhi: ਦੁਸ਼ਮਨਮ ਸਰਜ਼ਨਸ਼ ਕੁਨਦ ਕਿ ਹਰ ਜਾੲੀਸਤ ||੧||
transliteration: dhushamanam sarazanash kunadh k har jaaeesath | 1 |
translation: Otherwise, the adversary will slander (the claim) that He happens to be everywhere. (1)

gurmukhi: ਨੀਸਤ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਅਾਣ ਸਨਮ ਦਰ ਪਰਦਾੲਿ ਦੈਰੋ ਹਰਮ
transliteration: neesath ghair az aan sanam dhar paradhaae dhairo harama
translation: There is no one else other than the Waaheguru inside Kaabaa or the temple;

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਬਵਦ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ਿ ਦੋ ਰੰਗ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਖ਼ਤਲਾਫ਼ਿ ਸੰਗ ਹਾ ||੨||
transliteration: kai bavadh aathish dho rang az eikhathalaaf sang haa | 2 |
translation: How can the fire assume two different colors due to differences in the basic structure and make-up of stones? (2)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸਮਾਣ ਸਿਜਦਾ ਕੁਨਦ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਜ਼ਮੀਣ ਕਿ ਬਰ ੳੂ
transliteration: aasamaan sijadhaa kunadh paesh zameen k bar oo
translation: The sky is bowing before the earth,

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਦੋ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਅਜ਼ ਪੈੲੇ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਬਿਨਸ਼ੀਨੰਦ ||੩||
transliteration: yak dho nafas az paieae zikar khudhaa binasheenandh | 3 |
translation: Because of the fact, devotees of Akaalpurakh squat here for a moment or two in His meditation. (3)

gurmukhi: ਬਜ਼ੇਰਿ ਸਾੲਿਅਾੲਿ ਤੂਬਾ ਮੁਰਾਦ ਹਾ ਯਾਬੀ
transliteration: bazaer saaeiaae thoobaa muraadh haa yaabee
translation: Under the shade of Kalap tree, one can have all his wishes fulfilled,

gurmukhi: ਬਜ਼ੇਰ ਸਾੲਿਅਾ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਯਾਬੀ ||੪||
transliteration: bazaer saaeiaa maradhaan hak khudhaa yaabee | 4 |
translation: However, under the shade (protection) of men of God, the saintly persons, one can attain God Himself. (4)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਨਾਮਾ
transliteration: zindhagee naamaa
translation: ZINDAGEE NAAMAA

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਖ਼ੁਦਾਵੰਦਿ ਜ਼ਮੀਨੋ ਅਾਸਮਾਣ
transliteration: aan khudhaavandh zameeno aasamaana
translation: The Akaalpurakh is the Master of the earth and the skies,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਿ ਵਜੂਦਿ ੲਿਨਸੋ ਜਾਣ ||੧||
transliteration: zindhagee bakhash vajoodh einaso jaan | 1 |
translation: He is the one who bestows life to human beings and other living beings. (1)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਰਾਹਸ਼ ਤੂਤੀਯਾੲਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਾਸਤ
transliteration: khaak raahash thootheeyaae chasham maasatha
translation: The dust on the path of Waaheguru serves like a collyrium to our eyes.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਬਰੂ ਅਫ਼ਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਹਰ ਸ਼ਾਹੋ ਗਦਾ ਸਤ ||੨||
transliteration: aabaroo afazaae har shaaho gadhaa sath | 2 |
translation: In fact, He is the one who elevates the honor and esteem of every king and every saintly soul. (2)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿਹ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਦਾਯਮਾ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: har kih baashadh dhaayamaa dhar yaadh oo
translation: Anyone who lives his life under a constant remembrance of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਹਰ ਦਮ ਬਵਦ ੲਿਰਸ਼ਾਦਿ ੳੂ ||੩||
transliteration: yaadh hak har dham bavadh eirashaadh oo | 3 |
translation: Will always prompt and motivate others for the meditation of the Almighty. (3)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੂ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਬਾਸ਼ੀ ਮੁਦਾਮ
transliteration: gar thoo dhar yaadh khudhaa baashee mudhaam
translation: If you can constantly and always stay imbued in Akaalpurakh's meditation,

gurmukhi: ਮੀ ਸ਼ਵੀ ਅੈ ਜਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਮਰਦਿ ਤਮਾਮ ||੪||
transliteration: mee shavee ai jaan man maradh thamaam | 4 |
translation: Then, O my heart and soul! You can become a complete and perfect person. (4)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਫਤਾਬਿ ਹਸਤ ਪਿਨਹਾਣ ਜ਼ੇਰਿ ਅਬਰ
transliteration: aafathaab hasath pinehaan zaer abara
translation: He, the Akaalpurakh, like the sun, is hidden behind the clouds of the material world,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰ ਅਜ਼ ਅਬਰੋ ਨੁਮਾ ਰੁਖਿ ਹਮਚੂ ਬਦਰ ||੫||
transliteration: biguzar az abaro numaa rukh hamachoo badhar | 5 |
translation: Goyaa says, Kindly come out of the clouds and show me Your full-moon-like face. (5)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਤਨਤ ਅਬਰੇਸਤ ਦਰ ਵੈ ਅਾਫਤਾਬ
transliteration: een thanath abaraesath dhar vai aafathaaba
translation: This body of yours is like a cloud under which is hidden the Sun (God),

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੀਦਾਣ ਹਮੀਣ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਸਵਾਬ ||੬||
transliteration: yaadh hak meedhaan hameen baashadh savaab | 6 |
translation: Remember to engage yourself in the divine devotion because this is the only purpose (fruit) of this life. (6)

gurmukhi: ਹਰਕਿ ਵਾਕਿਫ਼ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਜ਼ ਅਸਰਾਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: harak vaakif shudh az asaraar khudhaa
translation: Whosoever has become cognizant of the mysteries of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਜੁਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਨ ਦਾਰਦ ਮੁਦਅਾ ||੭||
transliteration: har nafas juz hak n dhaaradh mudhaaa | 7 |
translation: He has no other purpose except to remember Him every moment of his life. (7)

gurmukhi: ਕਹ ਚਿਹ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਯਾਦਿ ਅਾਣ ਯਜ਼ਦਾਨਿ ਪਾਕ
transliteration: keh chih baashadh yaadh aan yazadhaan paaka
translation: What is the truth?  It is the memory of the Almighty that is the stark truth;

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਬਿਦਾਨਦ ਕਦਰਿ ੳੂ ਹਰ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ||੮||
transliteration: kai bidhaanadh kadhar oo har mushath khaak | 8 |
translation: In fact, how can a fistful of dirt or dust, the human body, appreciate His real value? (8)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਨੇਕਾਣ ਅਗਰ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਨਸੀਬ
transliteration: suhabath naekaan agar baashadh naseeba
translation: If you have the good fortune to have the company and association of the noble persons,

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਯਾਬੀ ਅੈ ਹਬੀਬ ||੯||
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh yaabee ai habeeb | 9 |
translation: Then my friend! You would have attained eternal wealth. (9)

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤ ਅੰਦਰ ਖ਼ਿਦਮਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ੳੁਸਤ
transliteration: dhaaualath andhar khidhamath maradhaan ousatha
translation: This (God given) wealth is meant to be used in the service of  His creations, the people;

gurmukhi: ਹਰਿ ਗਦਾ ਓ ਪਾਦਸ਼ਾਹ ਕੁਰਬਾਨਿ ੳੁਸਤ ||੧੦||
transliteration: har gadhaa ou paadhashaah kurabaan ousath | 10 |
translation: Every beggar and emperor is willing to sacrifice himself for it, the true wealth. (10)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੂੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਗੀਰ ਅੈ ਬ੍ਰਾਦਰ ਖ਼ੂੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: khooe shaan geer ai braadhar khooe shaana
translation: O brother! You should acquire the traits of those who constantly remember  the Beneficent;

gurmukhi: ਦਾਯਮਾ ਮੀ ਗਰਦ ਗਿਰਦਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੧||
transliteration: dhaayamaa mee garadh giradh kooe shaan | 11 |
translation: And, you should circle around the (street) locality they reside in again and again (so that you may get an opportunity to be blessed with their company.) (11)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿਹ ਗਿਰਦਿ ਕੂੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਗਰਦੀਦ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: har kih giradh kooe shaan garadheedh yaafatha
translation: If anyone keeps going around the streets of these noble souls,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਹਮ ਚੂ ਮਿਹਰੋ ਬਦਰ ਤਾਫ਼ਤ ||੧੨||
transliteration: dhar dho aalam ham choo miharo badhar thaafath | 12 |
translation: He would have attained the light and radiance of the sun and the moon in both the worlds. (12)

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਬੰਦਗੀ
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh baashadh bandhagee
translation: (We must realize) that meditation is an eternal treasure;

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀ ਕੁਨ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਕੁਨ ਬੰਦਗੀ ||੧੩||
transliteration: bandhagee kun bandhagee kun bandhagee | 13 |
translation: Therefore, we should engage ourselves in meditation, worship and prayers before the Almighty. (13)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਲਿਬਾਸਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਤੁਰਾਹਸਤ
transliteration: dhar libaas bandhagee shaahee thuraahasatha
translation: The entire kingdom (of the world) is encompassed in the remembrance of (the Naam of) Waaheguru;

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤੇ ਅਜ਼ ਮਾਹ ਤਾ ਮਾਹੀ ਤੁਰਾਹਸਤ ||੧੪||
transliteration: dhaaualathae az maah thaa maahee thuraahasath | 14 |
translation: And, it is only His realm extending from the moon to the sun. (14)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿਹ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਜ਼ੂ ਨਾਦਾਣ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: har kih ghaafil shudh azoo naadhaan bavadha
translation: Anyone who is oblivious and unmindful of (the existence of) Akaalpurakh, consider him as an idiot;

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਗਦਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਵਗਰ ਸੁਲਤਾਣ ਬਵਦ ||੧੫||
transliteration: gar gadhaa baashadh vagar sulathaan bavadh | 15 |
translation: No matter whether he is a beggar or the emperor king. (15)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਅਜ਼ ਹਮਾ ਬਾਲਾ ਤਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa az hamaa baalaa thar asatha
translation: The love of God is the loftiest of all the traits for us,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਯਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਬਰ ਸਰਿ ਮਾ ਅਫ਼ਸਰ ਅਸਤ ||੧੬||
transliteration: saayaae oo bar sar maa afasar asath | 16 |
translation: And His shadow (on our heads) is like a tiara on our heads. (16)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਮਾਅਨੀੲੇ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa maaaneeeae zikar khudhaa-satha
translation: Devotion for Akaalpurakh is considered as Aremembrance of Him,

gurmukhi: ਕਾਣ ਤਲਿਸਮਿ ਚਸ਼ਮ ਮਾ ਰਾ ਕੀਮੀਅਾ ਸਤ ||੧੭||
transliteration: kaan thalisam chasham maa raa keemeeaa sath | 17 |
translation: Because, his enchanting glance (towards us) is like a healing medicine for all of us. (17)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀੲਿ ਜਾਨਿ ਮਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa zindhageee jaan maa-satha
translation: The love of Waaheguru is the life of our heart and soul,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ੳੂ ਸਰਮਾਯਾੲਿ ੲੀਮਾਨਿ ਮਾ-ਸਤ ||੧੮||
transliteration: zikar oo saramaayaae eemaan maa-sath | 18 |
translation: And, meditation and remembrance of His Naam are the principle assets of our faith and religion. (18)

gurmukhi: ਰੂਜ਼ਿ ਜੁਮਅਾ ਮੋਮਨਾਨਿ ਪਾਕਬਾਜ਼
transliteration: rooz jumaaa momanaan paakabaaza
translation: Chaste and pious minded Muslims

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰਦ ਮੀ ਅਾੲਿੰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਨਿਮਾਜ਼ ||੧੯||
transliteration: giradh mee aaeindh az behir nimaaz | 19 |
translation: Get together on Friday for their religious prayers. (19)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੁਨਾਣ ਦਰ ਮਜ਼ਹਬਿ ਮਾ ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗ
transliteration: hamachunaan dhar mazehab maa saadh sanga
translation: In the same way, God's devotees in my religion come together in congregations of pious saints,

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਮੁਹ?ਬਤ ਬਾ-ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਦਾਰੰਦ ਰੰਗ ||੨੦||
transliteration: kaz muhabath baa-khudhaa dhaarandh rang | 20 |
translation: And have pleasant time getting elated in their love for Akaalpurakh. (20)

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰਦ ਮੀ ਅਾੲਿੰਦ ਦਰ ਮਾਹੇ ਦੋ ਬਾਰ
transliteration: giradh mee aaeindh dhar maahae dho baara
translation: They assemble at least twice a month

gurmukhi: ਬਹਿਰਿ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਖ਼ਾਸਾੲਿ ਪਰਵਰਦਗਾਰ ||੨੧||
transliteration: behir zikar khaasaae paravaradhagaar | 21 |
translation: In special remembrance of the Almighty. (21)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਹਜੂਮਿ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: aan hajoom khush k az behir khudhaa-satha
translation: That assembly is blessed that is held only for remembering Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਹਜੂਮਿ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ਦਫ਼ਾੲਿ ਬਲਾ-ਸਤ ||੨੨||
transliteration: aan hajoom khush k az dhafaae balaa-sath | 22 |
translation: That assembly is blessed that is held to dispel all our mental and physical  troubles. (22)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਹਜੂਮਿ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ
transliteration: aan hajoom khush k az behir yaadh oo-satha
translation: That congregation is fortunate that is held in commemoration of Waaheguru's (Naam);

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਹਜੂਮਿ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬੁਨਿਅਾਦਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ ||੨੩||
transliteration: aan hajoom khush k hak buniaadh oo-sath | 23 |
translation: That congregation is blessed that has its foundations only on Truth. (23)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਹਜੂਮਿ ਬਦ ਕਿ ਸ਼ੈਤਾਨੀ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: aan hajoom badh k shaithaanee bavadha
translation: That group of persons is evil and dissolute where Satan/Devil is playing its role;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਕਬਤ ਅਜ਼ ਵੈ ਪਸ਼ੇਮਾਨੀ ਬਵਦ ||੨੪||
transliteration: aakabath az vai pashaemaanee bavadh | 24 |
translation: Such a group is defiled that lends itself to future repentance and pennitence. (24)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਜਹਾਨੋ ਅਾਣ ਜਹਾਣ ਅਫ਼ਸਾਨਾ ੲੀਸਤ
transliteration: een jehaano aan jehaan afasaanaa eesatha
translation: The story of both the worlds, this and the next, is a fable,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਨੋ ਅਾਣ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ਿਰਮਨਸ਼ ਯ?ਕ ਦਾਨਾ ੲੀਸਤ ||੨੫||
transliteration: eeno aan az khiramanash yak dhaanaa eesath | 25 |
translation: Because, these two are just a grain out of Akaalpurakh's total heaps of produce. (25)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਜਹਾਨੋ ਅਾਣ ਜਹਾਣ ਫ਼ੁਰਮਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: een jehaano aan jehaan furamaan haka
translation: These two worlds are under the (constant) command of the true Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਅੌਲੀਅਾ ਓ ਅਬੀਅਾ ਕੁਰਬਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੨੬||
transliteration: aaualeeaa ou abeeaa kurabaan hak | 26 |
translation: And, the divine messengers and prophets are willing to sacrifice themselves for Him. (26)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: har k dhar yaadh khudhaa kaaeim bavadha
translation: Any one who become firm practitioner of meditation of (Naam of) Akaalpurakh

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ ||੨੭||
transliteration: thaa khudhaa kaaeim bavadh dhaaeim bavadh | 27 |
translation: As long as the Entity exists, he, too, becomes immortal. (27)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਜ਼?ਰਾੲਿ ਅਜ਼ ਨੂਰਿ ੳੂਸਤ
transliteration: een dho aalam zaraae az noor oosatha
translation: Both these worlds are just a ray of the radiance and splendor of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਮਿਹਰੋ ਮਾਹ ਮਸ਼ਅਲ-ਕਸ਼ਿ ਮਜ਼ਦੂਰਿ ੳੂਸਤ ||੨੮||
transliteration: miharo maah mashaala-kash mazadhoor oosath | 28 |
translation: The moon and the sun, both serve Him as His torch-bearers. (28)

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਹਮੀਣ ਦਰਦਿ-ਸਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: haasil dhuniaa hameen dharadhi-sar asatha
translation: The achievements in this world are nothing but a constant and severe headache,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਗਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਗਾਓ ਖ਼ਰ ਅਸਤ ||੨੯||
transliteration: har k gaafil shudh z hak gaaou khar asath | 29 |
translation: Anyone who becomes oblivious of the Trinity is either a bull or a donkey. (29)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਫ਼ਲਤ ਅਜ਼ ਵੈ ਯ?ਕ ਜ਼ਮਾਣ ਸਦ ਮਰਗ ਦਾਣ
transliteration: ghafalath az vai yak zamaan sadh marag dhaana
translation: To be careless, negligent, sluggish and apathetic of the memory of Akaalpurakh even for a moment is equivalent to hundreds of deaths.

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਯਾਦ ਅਸਤ ਨਿਜ਼ਦਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਣ ||੩੦||
transliteration: zindhagee yaadh asath nizadh aarifaan | 30 |
translation: For those enlightened and knowledgeable ones of Waaheguru, His meditation and remembrance is indeed the real life. (30)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦਮੇ ਕੁ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰਦ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: har dhamae k biguzaradh dhar yaadh oo
translation: Every moment that is spent in remembering Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ ਬੁਨਿਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ||੩੧||
transliteration: baa khudhaa kaaeim bavadh buniyaadh oo | 31 |
translation: Builds permanent foundations with Him. (31)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਸਰੇ ਕੂ ਸਿਜਦਾੲਿ ਸੁਬਹਾ ਨਾ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: har sarae koo sijadhaae subehaa naa karadha
translation: Whosoever prostrates before Waaheguru every morning

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਮਰ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ੲੀਮਾਨ ਕਰਦ ||੩੨||
transliteration: hak mar oo raa saahib eemaan karadh | 32 |
translation: Waaheguru makes him firm (believer) in contentment and faith. (32)

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਸਿਜਦਾ ਪੈਦਾ ਕਰਦਾ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: sar baraae sijadhaa paidhaa karadhaa andha
translation: The 'head' was created only to bow before the Almighty;

gurmukhi: ਦਰਦਿ ਹਰ ਸਰ ਰਾ ਮਦਾਵਾ ਕਰਦਾ ਅੰਦ ||੩੩||
transliteration: dharadh har sar raa madhaavaa karadhaa andh | 33 |
translation: And this is the cure for all headaches in (of) this world. (33)

gurmukhi: ਪਸ ਤੁਰਾ ਬਾੲਿਦ ਕੁਨੀ ਹਰਦਮ ਸਜੂਦ
transliteration: pas thuraa baaeidh kunee haradham sajoodha
translation: Therefore, we should always keep bowing our heads before the Beneficent;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਵੈ ਯ?ਕ ਜ਼ਮਾਣ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਨ ਬੂਦ ||੩੪||
transliteration: aarif az vai yak zamaan ghaafil n boodh | 34 |
translation: In fact, someone cognizant of Akaalpurakh will not be derelict even for a moment in remembering Him. (34)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਚਿਰਾ ਅਾਕਿਲ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: har k ghaafil shudh chiraa aakil bavadha
translation: How can anyone who has been oblivious in remembering Him be called wise and sane?

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਗਸ਼ਤ ੳੂ ਜ਼ਾਹਿਲ ਬਵਦ ||੩੫||
transliteration: har k ghaafil gashath oo zaahil bavadh | 35 |
translation: Anyone who has been negligent of Him should be considered an idiot and uncouth. (35)

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਫ਼ਾਰਿਗ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਚੁਨੋ ਚਿਰਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: maradh aarif faarigh az chuno chiraa-satha
translation: A knowledgeable and enlightened person does not get bogged down in verbal rhetorics,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ੳੁਮਰਸ਼ ਹਮੀਣ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ ||੩੬||
transliteration: haasil oumarash hameen yaadh khudhaa-sath | 36 |
translation: The achievement of his whole life is just the memory of Akaalpurakh. (36)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ੲੀਮਾਣ ਹਮਾਣ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਹਮਾਣ
transliteration: saahib eemaan hamaan baashadh hamaana
translation: The only person who is honest and religious-minded is the one

gurmukhi: ਕੂ ਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਅਜ਼ ਵੈ ਯ?ਕ ਜ਼ਮਾਣ ||੩੭||
transliteration: koo n baashadh ghaafil az vai yak zamaan | 37 |
translation: Who does not become derelict even for one moment in memorializing the Omnipotent. (37)

gurmukhi: ਕੁਫ਼ਰ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦਨ
transliteration: kufar baashadh az khudhaa ghaafil shudhana
translation: To be non-cognizant about Akaalpurakh and getting allured and enamored by the

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਲਿਬਾਸਿ ਦੁਨਯਵੀ ਮਾੲਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦਨ ||੩੮||
transliteration: bar libaas dhunayavee maaeil shudhan | 38 |
translation: Worldly guises is nothing short of blasphemy and paganism. (38)

gurmukhi: ਚੀਸਤ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਓ ਲਿਬਾਸਿ ਦੁਨਯਵੀ
transliteration: cheesath dhuniaa ou libaas dhunayavee
translation: O Maulavee! You should please tell us! How do the worldly lusts and

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦਨ ਅੈ ਮੌਲਵੀ ||੩੯||
transliteration: az khudhaa ghaafil shudhan ai maaualavee | 39 |
translation: pleasures matter if we become negligent of the memory of Waaheguru? (In fact, without Akaalpurakh, they have no value at all and are worthless) (39)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਲਿਬਾਸਿ ਦੁਨਯਵੀ ਫ਼ਾਨੀ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: een libaas dhunayavee faanee bavadha
translation: The life of lust and pleasures is inevitably perishable;

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਵੰਦੀਸ਼ ਅਰਜ਼ਾਨੀ ਬਵਦ ||੪੦||
transliteration: bar khudhaa vandheesh arazaanee bavadh | 40 |
translation: However, a person with deep devotion and mastery of the Omnipresent is always alive. (40)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਨੋ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: dheeno dhuniaa bandhaae faramaan oo
translation: Saintly and worldly people are all His own creations,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਅਜ਼ਾਣ ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਾੲਿ ੲਿਹਸਾਨਿ ੳੂ ||੪੧||
transliteration: een azaan sharamindhaae eihasaan oo | 41 |
translation: And, all of them are obligated under His countless favors. (41)

gurmukhi: ਚੀਸਤ ਅੈਹਸਾਨਿ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: cheesath aihasaan suhabath maradhaan haka
translation: How great is the debt that we all owe to those devotees of Akaalpurakh

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਮੀਖ਼ਾਨੰਦ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਸ਼ ਸਬਕ ||੪੨||
transliteration: aan k meekhaanandh az eishakash sabak | 42 |
translation: Who continue to educate themselves and receive instructions about the true love for Him. (42)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਸਰਮਾਯਾੲਿ ੲੀਮਾਣ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: yaadh oo saramaayaae eemaan bavadha
translation: Remembrance of Akaalpurakh is the repository of contentment and faith;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਗਦਾ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਸੁਲਤਾਣ ਬਵਦ ||੪੩||
transliteration: har gadhaa az yaadh oo sulathaan bavadh | 43 |
translation: And even a beggar who practices to meditate on Him feels elated like a king would with his pomp and powers. (43)

gurmukhi: ਰੂਜ਼ੋ ਸ਼ਬ ਦਰ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਬਾਸ਼ੰਦ ਸ਼ਾਦ
transliteration: roozo shab dhar bandhagee baashandh shaadha
translation: They, the noble souls, are always euphoric while in His meditation day and night,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀ ਓ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਓ ਯਾਦੋ ਯਾਦ ||੪੪||
transliteration: bandhagee ou bandhagee ou yaadho yaadh | 44 |
translation: For them, His meditation is real meditation and his remembrance a real remembrance. (44)

gurmukhi: ਚੀਸਤ ਸੁਲਤਾਨੀ ਵਾ ਦਰਵੇਸ਼ੀ ਬਿਦਾਣ
transliteration: cheesath sulathaanee vaa dharavaeshee bidhaana
translation: What is kingship and mendicancy? Understand that

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਅਾਣ ਜਾਣ ਅਾਫਰੀਨਿ ੲਿਨਸੋ ਜਾਣ ||੪੫||
transliteration: yaadh aan jaan aafareen einaso jaan | 45 |
translation: It is the memory of the Creator of the human beings and souls. (45)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਗਰ ਮੂਨਸਿ ਜਾਨਤ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: yaadh oo gar moonas jaanath bavadha
translation: If God's remembrance becomes a close friend of your life,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਜ਼ੇਰਿ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਨਤ ਬਵਦ ||੪੬||
transliteration: har dho aalam zaer faramaanath bavadh | 46 |
translation: Then, both the worlds would fall under your command. (46)

gurmukhi: ਬਸ ਬਜ਼ੁਰਗੀ ਹਸਤ ਅੰਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: bas bazuragee hasath andhar yaadh oo
translation: There is a great adulation and praise in remembering Him

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਕੁਨ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਕੁਨ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ||੪੭||
transliteration: yaadh oo kun yaadh oo kun yaadh oo | 47 |
translation: Therefore, we should meditate on His Naam; in fact, we should only remember Him. (47)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਬਜ਼ੁਰਗੀ ਬਾੲਿਦਤ ਕੁਨ ਬੰਦਗੀ
transliteration: gar bazuragee baaeidhath kun bandhagee
translation: If you are seeking compliments and praise, then get involved in meditation;

gurmukhi: ਵਰਨਾ ਅਾਖ਼ਿਰ ਮੀ-ਕਸ਼ੀ ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਗੀ ||੪੮||
transliteration: varanaa aakhir mee-kashee sharamindhagee | 48 |
translation: Otherwise, you will, ultimately, be chagrined and humiliated. (48)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਰਮ ਕੁਨ ਹਾਣ ਸ਼ਰਮ ਕੁਨ ਹਾਣ ਸ਼ਰਮ ਕੁਨ
transliteration: sharam kun haan sharam kun haan sharam kuna
translation: Be ashamed, should be somewhat abashed, you should be ashamed,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਦਿਲਿ ਚੂੰ ਸੰਗਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਰਾ ਨਰਮ ਕੁਨ ||੪੯||
transliteration: een dhil choon sang khudh raa naram kun | 49 |
translation: You should make your stone-hearted hard heart a little more malleable. (49)

gurmukhi: ਮਾਅਨੀੲੇ ਨਰਮੀ ਗ਼ਰੀਬੀ ਅਾਮਦਾ
transliteration: maaaneeeae naramee ghareebee aamadhaa
translation: Malleability implies humility,

gurmukhi: ਦਰਦਿ ਹਰ ਕਸ ਕਾ ਤਬੀਬੀ ਅਾਮਦਾ ||੫੦||
transliteration: dharadh har kas kaa thabeebee aamadhaa | 50 |
translation: And humility is the cure for everyone's  maladies. (50)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਪ੍ਰਸਤਾਣ ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਪ੍ਰਸਤੀ ਚੂੰ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: hak prasathaan khudha-prasathee choon kunandha
translation: How can the connoisseurs of truth get involved in self-ego?

gurmukhi: ਸਰ-ਬੁਲੰਦਾਣ ਮੋਲਿ ਪ੍ਰਸਤੀ ਚੂੰ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੫੧||
transliteration: sara-bulandhaan mol prasathee choon kunandh | 51 |
translation: How can the lofty-headed have any craving or cupidity for those lying in lower valleys (slopes)? (51)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਪ੍ਰਸਤੀ ਕਤਰਾੲਿ ਨਾਪਾਕਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: khudha-prasathee katharaae naapaak thoo
translation: This vanity is a dirty and soiled drop;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਜਾ ਕਰਦਾ ਬ-ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਤੂ ||੫੨||
transliteration: aan k jaa karadhaa ba-mushath khaak thoo | 52 |
translation: That has made an abode for itself in your body of fist-full dirt. (52)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਪ੍ਰਸਤੀ ਖ਼ਾਸਾੲਿ ਨਾਦਾਨਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: khudha-prasathee khaasaae naadhaan thoo
translation: This self-ego is the trait and characteristic of your stupidity;

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਪ੍ਰਸਤੀ ਮਾੲਿਅਾੲਿ ੲੀਮਾਨਿ ਤੂ ||੫੩||
transliteration: hak prasathee maaeiaae eemaan thoo | 53 |
translation: And, worship of truth is the asset of your faith and belief. (53)

gurmukhi: ਜਿਸਮਿ ਤੂ ਅਜ਼ ਬਾਦੋ ਖ਼ਾਕੋ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: jisam thoo az baadho khaako aathish asatha
translation: Your body is composed of wind, dust and fire;

gurmukhi: ਕਤਰਾੲਿ ਅਾਬੀ ਨੂਰਿ ਜ਼ਾਤਿਸ਼ ਅਸਤ ||੫੪||
transliteration: katharaae aabee noor zaathish asath | 54 |
translation: You are just a drop of water, and the radiance (life) in you is the bestowal of Akaalpurakh. (54)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਨਾਅਤ ਅਜ਼ ਨੂਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: khaanaaath az noor hak raauashan shudhaa
translation: Your abode-like mind has been radiant with the Divine splendor,

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਗੁਲੇ ਬੁਦੀ ਕਨੂੰ ਗੁਲਸ਼ਨ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ||੫੫||
transliteration: yak gulae budhee kanoon gulashan shudhaa | 55 |
translation: You were just a flower (not long ago), now you are a full fledged garden embellished with scores and scores of flowers. (55)

gurmukhi: ਪਸ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਗੁਲਸ਼ਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਸੈਰ ਕੁਨ
transliteration: pas dharoon gulashan khudh sair kuna
translation: You should (enjoy) taking a walk inside this garden;

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਮੁਰਗ਼ਿ ਮਕੁ?ਦਸਿ ਦਰ ਵੈ ਤੈਰ ਕੁਨ ||੫੬||
transliteration: hamachoo muragh makudhas dhar vai thair kun | 56 |
translation: And, soar around like a chaste and innocent bird in it. (56)

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਣ ਖ਼ੁਲਦ ਅੰਦਰ ਗ਼ੋਸ਼ਾ ਅਸ਼
transliteration: sadh hazaaraan khuladh andhar ghoshaa asha
translation: There are millions of heavenly gardens in His each and every nook and corner,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਦਾਨਾੲਿ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੋਸ਼ਾ ਅਸ਼ ||੫੭||
transliteration: har dho aalam dhaanaae az khoshaa ash | 57 |
translation: Both these worlds are like just a grain off the ear of His corn. (57)

gurmukhi: ਕੂਤਿ ਅਾਣ ਮੁਰਗ਼ਿ ਮੁਕ?ਦਸ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: kooth aan muragh mukadhas yaadh oo
translation: The feed of that pious bird is Akaalpurkah's remembrance,

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਹਾਣ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਹਾਣ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ||੫੮||
transliteration: yaadh oo haan yaadh oo haan yaadh oo | 58 |
translation: His remembrance, only His meditation, yes only His memory. (58)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਕੂ ਮਾੲਿਲਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: har kasae koo maaeil khudhaa-satha
translation: Anyone who is (sincerely) devoted to His meditation;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਰਾਹਸ਼ ਤੂਤਿਅਾੲਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਮਾ-ਸਤ ||੫੯||
transliteration: khaak raahash thoothiaae chasham maa-sath | 59 |
translation: The dust of his path is like a collyrium for our eyes. (59)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੁਰਾ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: gar thuraa yaadh khudhaa haasil shavadha
translation: If you can get attuned to the meditation of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਲਿ ਹਰ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਿਲ ਤੁਰਾ, ਅੈ ਦਿਲ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੬੦||
transliteration: hal har mushakil thuraa, ai dhil shavadh | 60 |
translation: Then O mind of mine! You should understand that all your difficulties have been solved (solutions to all the problems have been found). (60)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਲਿ ਹਰ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਿਲ ਹਮੀਣ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: hal har mushakil hameen yaadh khudhaa-satha
translation: The only solution to every predicament is remembering Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਕੁਨਦ ਜ਼ਾਤਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ ||੬੧||
transliteration: har k yaadh hak kunadh zaath khudhaa-sath | 61 |
translation: In fact, a rememberer of (the Naam of) Waaheguru conforms himself into the same category as the Waaheguru Himself. (61)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹ?ਕ ਮਨਜ਼ੂਰ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: dhar hakeekath ghair hak manazoor neesatha
translation: In reality, nothing but the Lord Himself is the acceptable Entity;

gurmukhi: ਕੀਸਤ ਅੈ ਜਾਨ ਕੂ ਸਰਾਪਾ ਨੂਰ ਨੀਸਤ ||੬੨||
transliteration: keesath ai jaan koo saraapaa noor neesath | 62 |
translation: O my mind! Who is such a person that does not reflect the radiance of Akaalpurakh from head to toes? (62)

gurmukhi: ਕਤਰਾੲਿ ਨੂਰੀ ਸਰਾਪਾ ਨੂਰ ਬਾਸ਼
transliteration: katharaae nooree saraapaa noor baasha
translation: O human being! You are one of the rays of the Divine glow, and become engulfed in divine radiance from head to toes,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰ ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ਮ ਦਾੲਿਮਾ ਮਸਰੂਰ ਬਾਸ਼ ||੬੩||
transliteration: biguzar az gham dhaaeimaa masaroor baash | 63 |
translation: Get rid of any worries or suspicions, and get inebriated permanently in His memory. (63)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਕੈ ਦਰ ਬੰਦਿ ਗ਼ਮ ਬਾਸ਼ੀ ਮਦਾਮ
transliteration: thaa bakai dhar bandh gham baashee madhaama
translation: How long would you be in the never-ending captivity of anxieties?

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰ ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ਮ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਕੁਨ ਵ-ਸਲਾਮ ||੬੪||
transliteration: biguzar az gham yaadh hak kun va-salaam | 64 |
translation: Get rid of sorrows and griefs; remember the Lord and stay safe and secure for ever. (64)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਮ ਚਿਹ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਗ਼ਫਲਤ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: gham chih baashadh ghafalath az yaadh khudhaa
translation: What is distress and depression? It is the negligence of His meditation;

gurmukhi: ਚੀਸਤ ਸ਼ਾਦੀ ਯਾਦਿ ਅਾਣ ਬੇ-ਮਿਨਤਹਾ ||੬੫||
transliteration: cheesath shaadhee yaadh aan bae-minathehaa | 65 |
translation: What is pleasure and joy? It is the remembrance of the Almighty of infinite dimensions. (65)

gurmukhi: ਮਾਅਨੀੲਿ ਬੇ-ਮਿੰਤਹਾ ਦਾਨੀ ਕਿ ਚੀਸਤ
transliteration: maaaneee bae-minthehaa dhaanee k cheesatha
translation: Do you know the meaning of the Illimitable?

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਨਾੲਿਦ ਬਕੈਦਿ ਮਰਗੋ ਜ਼ੀਸਤ ||੬੬||
transliteration: aan k oo naaeidh bakaidh marago zeesath | 66 |
translation: It is the Boundless, the Akaalpurakh, who is not subjected to births and deaths. (66)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਸਰਿ ਹਰ ਮਰਦੋ ਜ਼ਨ ਸੌਦਾੲਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ
transliteration: dhar sar har maradho zan saauadhaae oo-satha
translation: Every man and woman in his/her head is overwhelmed with His ardor;

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਸ਼ੋਰਸ਼ੇ ਗ਼ੌਗ਼ਾੲਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ ||੬੭||
transliteration: dhar dho aalam shorashae ghaauaghaae oo-sath | 67 |
translation: All this excitement in both the worlds is His creation. (67)

gurmukhi: ਮੰਜ਼ਲਿ ੳੂ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਨਿ ਅੌਲੀਅਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: manzal oo bar zubaan aaualeeaa-satha
translation: It is the tongue of the saints and noble souls where He has made His abode;

gurmukhi: ਰੂਜ਼ੇ ਸ਼ਬ ਕਾਣਦਰ ਦਿਲਸ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ ||੬੮||
transliteration: roozae shab kaanadhar dhilash yaadh khudhaa-sath | 68 |
translation: Or He abides in their hearts where there is constant remembrance of Him day and night. (68)

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ੳੂ ਬਰ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹਰਗ਼ਿਜ਼ ਵਾ ਨਾ-ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: chasham oo bar ghair haraghiz vaa naa-shudha
translation: The eyes of a meditator never open up to see anyone or anything else but Him;

gurmukhi: ਕਤਰਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਜੁਜ਼ ਸੂੲਿ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਨਭਸ਼ੁਦ ||੬੯||
transliteration: katharaae oo juz sooe dhariaa nabhashudh | 69 |
translation: And, his drop (of water), every breath, does not flow towards any other place except towards the vast ocean (the Akaalpurakh). (69)

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਸਰਾ
transliteration: bandhaae oo saahib har dho saraa
translation: A man of God is the master of both the worlds;

gurmukhi: ਕੂ ਨ ਬੀਨਦ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ਕਿਬਰੀਅਾ ||੭੦||
transliteration: koo n beenadh ghair nakash kibareeaa | 70 |
translation: Because, he does not see anything else other than the Great Embodiment of Truth. (70)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਜਹਾਨੋ ਅਾਣ ਜਹਾਣ ਫ਼ਾਨੀ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: een jehaano aan jehaan faanee bavadha
translation: This and the next world both are perishable;

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਯਾਦਸ਼ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਨਾਦਾਨੀ ਬਵਦ ||੭੧||
transliteration: ghair  yaadhash  jumalaa naadhaanee bavadh | 71 |
translation: Everything else other than His remembrance is a complete foolishness. (71)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦ ਕੁਨ ਹਾਣ ਤਾਣ ਤਵਾਨੀ ਯਾਦ ਕੁਨ
transliteration: yaadh kun haan thaan thavaanee yaadh kuna
translation: Remember Akaalpurakh: You should remember Him as much as you can;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਨਾ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਬਾਦ ਕੁਨ ||੭੨||
transliteration: khaanaa raa az yaadh hak aabaadh kun | 72 |
translation: And, populate your home-like heart/mind with His constant remembrance. (72)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਦਿਲਿ ਤੂ ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬੂਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: een dhil thoo khaanaae hak boodhaa asatha
translation: Your heart/mind is nothing but the abode of God;

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਕਿਹ ਗੋੲਿਮ ਹ?ਕ ਚੁਨੀਣ ਫ਼ਰਮੂਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੭੩||
transliteration: man kih goeim hak chuneen faramoodhaa asath | 73 |
translation: What can I say! This is what is the edict of God Himself (73)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਾਹ ਬਾ ਤੂ ਹਮਨਸ਼ੀਨੋ ਹਮ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਣ
transliteration: shaah baa thoo hamanasheeno ham zubaana
translation: Your (true) companion and constantly affirming your viewpoint is the King of the world, the Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਬ-ਸੂੲਿ ਹਰ ਕਸੋ ਨਾਕਸ ਦਵਾਣ ||੭੪||
transliteration: thoo ba-sooe har kaso naakas dhavaan | 74 |
translation: But, you keep running after every person for having your desires fulfilled. (74)

gurmukhi: ਵਾੲਿ ਤੂ ਬਰ ਜਾਨਿ ਤੂ ਅਹਿਵਾਲਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: vaae thoo bar jaan thoo ahivaal thoo
translation: Goyaa says, I feel sorry for you, for your life and for your state of mind;

gurmukhi: ਵਾੲਿ ਬਰ ੲੀਣ ਗ਼ਫਲਤੋ ਅਫ਼ਅਾਲਿ ਤੂ ||੭੫||
transliteration: vaae bar een ghafalatho afaaal thoo | 75 |
translation: I feel sorry for your negligence (for not remembering Him) and for the conduct of your life. (75)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਕੂ ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਦੀਦਾਰ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: har kasae koo thaalib dheedhaar shudha
translation: Anyone who is desirous and anxious to get a glimpse of Him,

gurmukhi: ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਸ਼ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ਯਾਰ ਸ਼ੁਦ ||੭੬||
transliteration: paesh chashamash jumalaa nakash yaar shudh | 76 |
translation: In his view, every visible and living thing conforms into His own image. (76)

gurmukhi: ਦਰਮਿਅਾਨਿ ਨਕਸ਼ ਨ?ਕਾਸ਼ ਅਸਤੋ ਬਸ
transliteration: dharamiaan nakash nakaash asatho basa
translation: It is the same Artist that sparkles Himself in every portrait,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਸਖ਼ੁਨ ਰਾ ਦਰ ਨਯਾਬਦ ਬੂਅਲ-ਹਵਸ ||੭੭||
transliteration: ee sakhun raa dhar nayaabadh booala-havas | 77 |
translation: However, this mystery cannot be understood by the human beings. (77)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੂ ਮੀਖ਼ਾਨੀ ਜ਼ਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸਬਕ
transliteration: gar thoo meekhaanee z eishak hak sabaka
translation: If you want to get a lesson on devotion to Waaheguru, then

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਕੁਨ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਕੁਨ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੭੮||
transliteration: yaadh hak kun yaadh hak kun yaadh hak | 78 |
translation: You should remember Him; in fact, you should constantly keep remembering Him. (78)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਬਰਾਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਾਨੀ ਕਿ ਚੀਸਤ
transliteration: ai baraadhar yaadh hak dhaanee k cheesatha
translation: O brother! Do you know how to define remembrance of Waaheguru?

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰੂਨਿ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਦਿਲਹਾੲਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੀਸਤ ||੭੯||
transliteration: andharoon jumalaa dhilehaae jaae keesath | 79 |
translation: And, who is it who abides in the hearts and minds of everyone ? (79)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਦਿਲਹਾ ਸਾੲਿ ੳੂਸਤ
transliteration: choon dharoon jumalaa dhilehaa saae oosatha
translation: When it is His image that prevails in the hearts of every one,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ਦਿਲ ਮੰਜ਼ਲੋ ਮਾਵਾੲਿ ੳੂਸਤ ||੮੦||
transliteration: khaanaae dhil manzalo maavaae oosath | 80 |
translation: That means that the home-like heart is the destination and asylum for Him.(80)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਬਿਦਾਨਿਸਤੀ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਦਿਲਹਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: choon bidhaanisathee k dhar dhilehaa khudhaa-satha
translation: When you learn that it is the Omnipotent who abides in everyone's heart and mind,

gurmukhi: ਪਸ ਤੁਰਾ ਅਾਦਾਬਿ ਹਰ ਦਿਲ ਮੁਦਅਾ-ਸਤ ||੮੧||
transliteration: pas thuraa aadhaab har dhil mudhaaa-sath | 81 |
translation: Then, it should be your principal purpose (of life) to be respectful to everyone's heart. (81)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ੲੀਨਸਤੋ ਦੀਗਰ ਯਾਦ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: yaadh hak eenasatho dheegar yaadh neesatha
translation: This is what is called the meditation of Waaheguru; there is no other remembrance,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿਰਾ ੲੀਣ ਗ਼ਮ ਨਭਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਸ਼ਾਦ ਨੀਸਤ ||੮੨||
transliteration: har kiraa een gham nabhabaashadh shaadh neesath | 82 |
translation: Whosoever is not anxious about this fact, is not a happy soul. (82)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ੲਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਣ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: zindhagee e aarifaan yaadh khudhaa-satha
translation: Meditation is (the chief aim of) the whole life of God-enlightened persons;

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਦੂਰ ਅਸਤ ਹਰ ਕੂ ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਨੁਮਾਸਤ ||੮੩||
transliteration: az khudhaa dhoor asath har koo khudha-numaasath | 83 |
translation: A person who is stuck in his self ego is driven farther and farther away from Waaheguru. (83)

gurmukhi: ਕੀਸਤ ਗੋਯਾ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਬੇਸ਼ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: keesath goyaa mushath khaak baesh neesatha
translation: O Goyaa! What is your existence in life?  It is no more than a handful of dust;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਹਮ ਅੰਦਰ ਅਖ਼ਤਿਅਾਰ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਨੀਸਤ ||੮੪||
transliteration: aan ham andhar akhathiaar khaesh neesath | 84 |
translation: And, even that is not under your control; The body that we claim to own is not under our control either. (84)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਕਿ ਹਫ਼ਤਾਦੋ ਦੋ ਮਿ?ਲਤ ਅਾਫਰੀਦ
transliteration: hak k hafathaadho dho mlith aafareedha
translation: Akaalpurakh created seventy two communities,

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਿਰਕਾੲਿ ਨਾਜੀ ਅਜ਼ੀਹਾਣ ਬਰ ਗੁਜ਼ੀਦ ||੮੫||
transliteration: firakaae naajee azeehaan bar guzeedh | 85 |
translation: Out of which, He designated the Naajee community as the most elite. (85)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਿਰਕਾੲਿ ਨਾਜੀ ਬਿਦਾਣ ਬੇ-ੲਿਸ਼ਤਬਾਹ
transliteration: firakaae naajee bidhaan bae-eishathabaaha
translation: We should consider the Naajee (who is considered above and beyond the cycles of transmigration) community, without any doubt,

gurmukhi: ਹਸਤ ਹਫ਼ਤਾਦੋ ਦੋ ਮਿ?ਲਤ ਰਾ ਪਨਾਹ ||੮੬||
transliteration: hasath hafathaadho dho mlith raa panaah | 86 |
translation: As the shelter for the seventy two clans. (86)

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦਮਾਨਸ਼ ਹਰ ਯਕੇ ਪਾਕੀਜ਼ਾ ਤਰ
transliteration: maradhamaanash har yakae paakeezaa thara
translation: Every member of this Najee community is sacred;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੂਬ-ਰੂ ਓ ਖ਼ੂਬ-ਖ਼ੂ ਓ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼-ਸੀਅਰ ||੮੭||
transliteration: khooba-roo ou khooba-khoo ou khusha-seear | 87 |
translation: Beautiful and handsome, well mannered with a noble disposition. (87)

gurmukhi: ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਜੁਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮਨਜ਼ੂਰ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: paesh shaan juz yaadh hak manazoor neesatha
translation: To these folks, nothing else but the remembrance of Akaalpurakh is acceptable;

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਦਸਤੂਰ ਨੀਸਤ ||੮੮||
transliteration: ghair haraf bandhagee dhasathoor neesath | 88 |
translation: And, they do not have any tradition or mannerism other than the recitation of the words of prayer. (88)

gurmukhi: ਮੀਚਕਦ ਅਜ਼ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਕੰਦੋ ਨਬਾਤ
transliteration: meechakadh az haraf shaan kandho nabaath
translation: Utter sweetness oozes out of their words and conversation,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਹਰ ਮੂੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਅਾਬਿ ਹਯਾਤ ||੮੯||
transliteration: baaradh az har mooe shaan aab hayaath | 89 |
translation: And, divine elixir is showered from every hair of theirs. (89)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਾਰਿਗ਼ ਅੰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਬੁਗ਼ਜ਼ੋ ਕੀਨਾ ਓ ਜ਼ਿ ਹਸਦ
transliteration: faarigh andh az bughazo keenaa ou z hasadha
translation: They are above and beyond any form of jealousy, hostility or enmity;

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਨਮੀ-ਅਾੲਿਦ ਅਜ਼ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਫ਼ਿਅਲਿ ਬਦ ||੯੦||
transliteration: bar namee-aaeidh az eaeshaan fial badh | 90 |
translation: They never commit any sinful acts. (90)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਰਾ ੲਿ?ਜ਼ਤੋ ਹੁਰਮਤ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: har kasae raa ezitho huramath kunandha
translation: They extend respect and honor to every one;

gurmukhi: ਮੁਫ਼ਲਸੇ ਰਾ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਦੌਲਤ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੯੧||
transliteration: mufalasae raa saahib dhaaualath kunandh | 91 |
translation: And, they help poor and needy to become rich and opulent. (91)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦਾ ਰਾ ਅਾਬਿ-ਹੈਵਾਣ ਮੀਦਿਹੰਦ
transliteration: muradhaa raa aabi-haivaan meedhihandha
translation: They bless the dead souls with divine nectar;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦਿਲੇ ਪਜ਼ਮੁਰਦਾ ਰਾ ਜਾਣ ਮੀਦਿਹੰਦ ||੯੨||
transliteration: har dhilae pazamuradhaa raa jaan meedhihandh | 92 |
translation: They bestow new and rejuvenated life to withered and demoralized minds. (92)

gurmukhi: ਸਬਜ਼ ਮੀਸਾਜ਼ੰਦ ਚੋਬਿ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ਕ ਰਾ
transliteration: sabaz meesaazandh chob khushak raa
translation: They can transform dry wood into green twigs;

gurmukhi: ਬੂੲੇ ਮੀਬਖਸ਼ੰਦ ਰੰਗਿ ਮੁਸ਼ਕ ਰਾ ||੯੩||
transliteration: booeae meebakhashandh rang mushak raa | 93 |
translation: They also can convert a stinking odor into scented musk. (93)

gurmukhi: ਜੁਮਲਾ ਅਸ਼ਰਾਫ਼ ਅੰਦ ਦਰ ਜ਼ਾਤੋ ਸਿਫ਼ਾਤ
transliteration: jumalaa asharaaf andh dhar zaatho sifaatha
translation: All these well-intentioned persons possess noble personal qualities;

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਜ਼ਾਤ ਅੰਦ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਹਮ ਅਾਨਿ ਜ਼ਾਤ ||੯੪||
transliteration: thaalib zaath andh khudh ham aan zaath | 94 |
translation: They are all seekers of Waaheguru's Entity; in fact, they are just like Him (are His image). (94)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੂੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ੲਿਲਮੋ ਅਦਬ ਰਾ ਮੁਜ਼ਹਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: khooe shaan eilamo adhab raa muzehar asatha
translation: Learning and literature emerges (spontaneously) from their behavior;

gurmukhi: ਰੂੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਜ਼ਿ ਮਿਹਰਿ ਅਨਵਰ ਅਸਤ ||੯੫||
transliteration: rooe shaan raauashan z mihar anavar asath | 95 |
translation: And, their faces radiate like the glowing divinely sun. (95)

gurmukhi: ਮਿ?ਲਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਕੌਮਿ ਮਸਕੀਨਾਣ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: mlith shaan kaauam masakeenaan bavadha
translation: Their clan consists of a group of humble, meek and gentle persons;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਸ਼ਾੲਿਕਿ ੲੀਨਾਣ ਬਵਦ ||੯੬||
transliteration: har dho aalam shaaeik eenaan bavadh | 96 |
translation: And they have devotees in both the worlds; People in both the worlds believe in them. (96)

gurmukhi: ਕੌਮਿ ਮਿਸਕੀਣ ਕੌਮਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: kaauam misakeen kaauam maradhaan khudhaa-satha
translation: This group of people is the community of gentle and humble souls, a community of God's men.

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ਾਨੀ ਵ ੳੂ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਕਾਸਤ ||੯੭||
transliteration: een hamaa faanee v oo dhaaeim bakaasath | 97 |
translation: Every thing that we see is destructible, but Akaalpurakh is the only One that prevails perpetually and is Imperishable. (97)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਰਾ ਅਕਸੀਰ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: suhabath shaan khaak raa akaseer karadha
translation: Their company and association transformed even the dust to an effective cure.

gurmukhi: ਲੁਤਫ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਬਰ ਹਰ ਦਿਲੇ ਤਾਸੀਰ ਕਰਦ ||੯੮||
transliteration: luthaf shaan bar har dhilae thaaseer karadh | 98 |
translation: Their blessings effectively impressed every heart. (98)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਬ-ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਨਸ਼ੀਨਦ ਯ?ਕ ਦਮੇ
transliteration: har k ba-eaeshaan nasheenadh yak dhamae
translation: Anyone who enjoys their company just once even for a moment,

gurmukhi: ਰੂਜ਼ਿ ਫ਼ਰਦਾ ਰਾ ਕੁਜਾ ਦਾਰਦ ਗ਼ਮੇਣ ||੯੯||
transliteration: rooz faradhaa raa kujaa dhaaradh ghamaen | 99 |
translation: He, then, does not have to be apprehensive about the day of reckoning. (99)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਚਿ ਦਰ ਸਦ-ਸਾਲਾ ੳੁਮਰਸ਼ ਨਭਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: aan ch dhar sadha-saalaa oumarash nabhayaafatha
translation: A person who could not attain much in spite of hundreds of years of life,

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਹਮਚੂ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਸ਼ ਬਿਤਾਖ਼ਤ ||੧੦੦||
transliteration: suhabath shaan hamachoo khurasheedhash bithaakhath | 100 |
translation: Shone like a sun when he joined the company of  these people. (100)

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਹਸਾਨਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਾ-ੲੇਮ
transliteration: maa k az eihasaan shaan sharamindhaa-eaema
translation: We are obligated and owe them a debt of gratitude,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ੲਿਹਸਾਨਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਰਾ ਬੰਦਾ ੲੇਮ ||੧੦੧||
transliteration: bandhaae eihasaan shaan raa bandhaa eaem | 101 |
translation: We are, in fact, persons/products of their favors and kindness. (101)

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਣ ਹਮਚੂ ਮਨ ਕੁਰਬਾਨਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: sadh hazaaraan hamachoo man kurabaan shaana
translation: Millions like me are willing to sacrifice themselves for these nobilities;

gurmukhi: ਹਬ ਚਿ ਗੋੲਿਮ ਕਮ ਬਵਦ ਦਰ ਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੦੨||
transliteration: hab ch goeim kam bavadh dhar shaan shaan | 102 |
translation: No matter how much I say in their honor and praise, it will be inadequate. (102)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਬੀਰੂੰ ਬਵਦ ਅਜ਼ ਗੁਫ਼ਤਗੂ
transliteration: shaan shaan beeroon bavadh az gufathagoo
translation: Their honor and appreciation is beyond any words or expression;

gurmukhi: ਜਾਮਾੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਪਾਕ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਸਤੋ ਸ਼ੂ ||੧੦੩||
transliteration: jaamaae shaan paak az shusatho shoo | 103 |
translation: The style (attire) of their life is cleaner and chaste than any amount of washing or rinsing. (103)

gurmukhi: ਦਾਣ ਯਕੀਣ ਤਾ ਚੰਦ ੲੀਣ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: dhaan yakeen thaa chandh een dhuniaa bavadha
translation: Believe me ! How long is this world going to last? Only for a short time;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਖ਼ਰਿਸ਼ ਕਾਰਿ ਤੂ ਬਾ ਮੌਲਾ ਬਵਦ ||੧੦੪||
transliteration: aakharish kaar thoo baa maaualaa bavadh | 104 |
translation: Ultimately, we have to develop and maintain a relationship with the Almighty. (104)

gurmukhi: ਪਸ ਜ਼ ਅ?ਵਲ ਕੁਨ ਹਦੀਸਿ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਰਾ
transliteration: pas z aval kun hadhees shaah raa
translation: Now you indulge yourself in the stories and discourses of (that) King, the Waaheguru.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰਵੀ ਕੁਨ ਹਾਦੀੲੇ ੲੀਣ ਰਾਹ ਰਾ ||੧੦੫||
transliteration: pairavee kun haadheeeae een raah raa | 105 |
translation: And, follow the Guide who shows you the direction (of life). (105)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਤੂ ਹਮ ਯਾਬੀ ਮੁਰਾਦਿ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ
transliteration: thaa thoo ham yaabee muraadh oumar raa
translation: So that your life's hopes and ambitions are fulfilled;

gurmukhi: ਲਜ਼ਤੇ ਯਾਬੀ ਜ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਕਿਬਰੀਅਾ ||੧੦੬||
transliteration: lazathae yaabee z shaauak kibareeaa | 106 |
translation: And, you can have the pleasure of the savor of the devotion for Akaalpurakh.(106)

gurmukhi: ਜਾਹਿਲ ਅਾਣ-ਜਾ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ-ਦਿਲ ਮੀਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: jaahil aana-jaa saahibi-dhil meeshavadha
translation: (With His grace) even s stupid person can become an intellectual and enlightened;

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਰਕਿ ਦਰਅਿਾਓ ਬਸਾਹਿਲ ਮੀਸ਼ਵਦ ||੧੦੭||
transliteration: gharak dharaaiaaou basaahil meeshavadh | 107 |
translation: And, a person drowning in deep waters of a river can reach the banks. (107)

gurmukhi: ਨਾ ਕਿਸ ਅਾਣ ਜਾ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: naa kis aan jaa aarif kaamil shavadha
translation: An insignificant person can become fully enlightened,

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਹਰ ਕਿ ਰਾ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੧੦੮||
transliteration: yaadh maaualaa har k raa haasil shavadh | 108 |
translation: When he engages himself in the remembrance of Waaheguru. (108)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਅਸਬ ਤਾਜਸਤ ਬਰ ਅਫ਼ਰਾਕਿ ਕਸ
transliteration: een asab thaajasath bar afaraak kasa
translation: A person is being adorned, as if, with a crown of learning and honor on his head,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਨੀਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਯ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ ||੧੦੯||
transliteration: aan k ghaafil neesath az hak yak nafas | 109 |
translation: Who does not become negligent even for one moment in remembering Akaalpurakh. (109)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਰਾ ਨੀਸਤ ੲੀਣ ਦੌਲਤ ਨਸੀਬ
transliteration: har kasae raa neesath een dhaaualath naseeba
translation: This treasure is not in the lot of everyone;

gurmukhi: ਦਰਦਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਰਾ ਨੀਸਤ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਤਬੀਬ ||੧੧੦||
transliteration: dharadh shaan raa neesath ghair az hak thabeeb | 110 |
translation: The cure for their pain is no one else other than the Waaheguru, the doctor. (110)

gurmukhi: ਦਾਰੂੲਿ ਹਰ ਦਰਦ ਰਾ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾਸਤ
transliteration: dhaarooe har dharadh raa yaadh khudhaasatha
translation: Remembrance of Akaalpurakh is the cure-all for every malady and pain;

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਣ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਹਾਲ ਹ?ਕ ਦਾਰਦ ਰਵਾ-ਸਤ ||੧੧੧||
transliteration: zaan k dhar har haal hak dhaaradh ravaa-sath | 111 |
translation: In whatever condition or state He keeps us, should be acceptable. (111)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਹਮਾ ਰਾ ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil hamaa raa aarazoo
translation: It is the wish and desire of everyone to seek a perfect Guru;

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਕਸ ਨ ਯਾਬਦ ਰਹਿ ਬਦੂ ||੧੧੨||
transliteration: ghair murashadh kas n yaabadh rehi badhoo | 112 |
translation: Without such a mentor, no one can reach the Almighty. (112)

gurmukhi: ਰਾਹ-ਰਵਾਣ ਰਾ ਰਾਹ ਬਿਸੀਅਾਰ ਅਾਮਦਾ
transliteration: raaha-ravaan raa raah biseeaar aamadhaa
translation: There are several paths for the travelers to traverse;

gurmukhi: ਕਾਰਵਾਣ ਰਾ ਰਾਹ ਦਰਕਾਰ ਅਾਮਦਾ ||੧੧੩||
transliteration: kaaravaan raa raah dharakaar aamadhaa | 113 |
translation: But what they need is the path of the caravan. (113)

gurmukhi: ਦਮ ਬਦਮ ਦਰ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਹਾਜ਼ਰ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: dham badham dhar zikar maaualaa haazar andha
translation: They are always alert and prepared for the remembrance of Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਮਨਜ਼ੂਰੋ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਰਾ ਨਾਜ਼ਿਰ ਅੰਦ ||੧੧੪||
transliteration: khaesh manazooro khudhaa raa naazir andh | 114 |
translation: They are acceptable to Him and they are His observers, on-lookers and spectators. (114)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਹਮਾਣ ਬਾਣਸ਼ਦ ਹਮਾਣ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil hamaan baanashadh hamaana
translation: A perfect Satguru is the one and the only one,

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਕਲਾਮਸ਼ ਬੂੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਦਿ ਅਯਾਣ ||੧੧੫||
transliteration: kaz kalaamash booe hak aadh ayaan | 115 |
translation: Whose conversation and Gurbaanee emits the Divine fragrance. (115)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਅਾੲਿਦ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਵਾਰ
transliteration: har k aaeidh paesh eaeshaan zaraa vaara
translation: Anyone who comes in front of such persons (Perfect Gurus) in humility like a dust particle,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੂਦ ਗਰਦਦ ਹਮਚੂ ਮਿਹਰਿ ਨੂਰ ਬਾਰ ||੧੧੬||
transliteration: zoodh garadhadh hamachoo mihar noor baar | 116 |
translation: He, soon, becomes capable to shower radiance like that of sun. (116)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ੲੀਨਸਤ ਬੇ ਚੁਨੋ ਚਿਰਾ
transliteration: zindhagee eenasath bae chuno chiraa
translation: That life is worth living that, without any delay or excuses,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰਦ ੲੀਣ ੳੁਮਰ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ||੧੧੭||
transliteration: biguzaradh een oumar dhar yaadh khudhaa | 117 |
translation: Is spent in the memory of the Providence in this lifetime. (117)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਪ੍ਰਸਤੀ ਕਾਰਿ ਨਾਦਾਣ ਅਾਮਦਾ
transliteration: khudha-prasathee kaar naadhaan aamadhaa
translation: To indulge in self-propaganda is the work of stupid people;

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਪ੍ਰਸਤੀ ਜ਼ਾਤਿ ੲੀਮਾਣ ਅਾਮਦਾ ||੧੧੮||
transliteration: hak prasathee zaath eemaan aamadhaa | 118 |
translation: While to get engaged in meditation is the characteristic of the faithful. (118)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦਮੇ ਗ਼ਫਲਤ ਬਵਦ ਮਰਗਿ ਅਜ਼ੀਮ
transliteration: har dhamae ghafalath bavadh marag azeema
translation: Negligence of every moment of not remembering Him is like a huge death;

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਨਿਗਾਹ ਦਾਰਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਸ਼ੈਤਾਨਿ ਰਜ਼ੀਮ ||੧੧੯||
transliteration: hak nigaah dhaaradh z shaithaan razeem | 119 |
translation: May God, with His eye, save us from the Satan of Hell. (119)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਰੂਜ਼ੋ ਸ਼ਬ ਬ-ਯਾਦਸ਼ ਮੁਬਤਲਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: aan k roozo shab ba-yaadhash mubathalaa-satha
translation: Anyone who is (constantly) imbued in remembering Him day and night,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਮਤਾਅ ਅੰਦਰ ਦੁਕਾਨਿ ਅੌਲੀਅਾ-ਸਤ ||੧੨੦||
transliteration: een mathaaa andhar dhukaan aaualeeaa-sath | 120 |
translation: (Knows very well that) This wealth, the memory of Akaalpurakh, is available only at the store (congregation) of saintly persons. (120)

gurmukhi: ਕਿਹਤਰੀਨਿ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ਦਰਗਾਹਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: kihathareen bandhaae dharagaahi shaana
translation: Even the lowest person in their court

gurmukhi: ਬਿਹਤਰ ਅਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਮਿਹਤਰਾਨਿ ੲੀਣ ਜਹਾਣ ||੧੨੧||
transliteration: bihathar asath az mihatharaan een jehaan | 121 |
translation: Is superior than the so called most respectable stalwarts of this world. (121)

gurmukhi: ਬਸ ਬਜ਼ੁਰਗ਼ਾਣ ਕੂ ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: bas bazuraghaan koo fidhaae raahi shaana
translation: Many wise and experienced persons are enamored and are prepared to make sacrifices on their paths,

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਮਾੲਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਮ ਜ਼ਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੨੨||
transliteration: suramaae chashamam z khaak raahi shaan | 122 |
translation: And, the dust of their paths is like a collyrium for my eyes. (122)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੁਨੀਣ ਪਿੰਦਾਰ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਰਾ ਅੈ ਅਜ਼ੀਜ਼
transliteration: hamachuneen pindhaar khudh raa ai azeeza
translation: You, too, my dear youngster! Consider yourself just like this,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਸ਼ਵੀ ਅੈ ਜਾਨਿ ਮਨ ਮਰਦਿ ਤਮੀਜ਼ ||੧੨੩||
transliteration: thaa shavee ai jaan man maradh thameez | 123 |
translation: So that, my dear! You, too, can transform yourself into a pious and saintly person. (123)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਾਣ ਰਾ ਬੰਦਾ ਬਿਸਅਾਰ ਅਾਮਦਾ
transliteration: saahibaan raa bandhaa bisaaar aamadhaa
translation: These masters, the noble souls, have numerous followers and devotees;

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਬਾ-ਬੰਦਗੀ ਕਾਰ ਅਾਮਦਾ ||੧੨੪||
transliteration: bandhaa raa baa-bandhagee kaar aamadhaa | 124 |
translation: The main task assigned to each and every one of us is only to meditate. (124)

gurmukhi: ਮਸ ਤੁਰਾ ਬਾੲਿਦ ਕਿ ਖ਼ਿਦਮਤਗਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: mas thuraa baaeidh k khidhamathagaar shaana
translation: Therefore, you should become their follower and a devotee;

gurmukhi: ਬਾਸ਼ੀ ਓ ਹਰਗਿਜ਼ ਨਭਬਾਸ਼ੀ ਬਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੨੫||
transliteration: baashee ou haragiz nabhabaashee baar shaan | 125 |
translation: But you should never be liability for them. (125)

gurmukhi: ਗਰਚਿਹ ਯਾਰੀ-ਦਿਹ ਨ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਸਾਲਕੇ-ਸਤ
transliteration: garachih yaaree-dhih n ghair az saalakae-satha
translation: Even though, there is no one else without them to connect us to the Almighty,

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਕਰ ਗ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਨ ਚੁਨੀਣ ਅੈਬੇ ਬਸੇ-ਸਤ ||੧੨੬||
transliteration: laek kar ghufathan chuneen aibae basae-sath | 126 |
translation: Still, for them to make such a claim would be a transgression. (126)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਰਾ ਦੀਦਮ ਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਿ ਜਹਾਣ
transliteration: zaraa raa dheedham k khurasheedh jehaana
translation: I realized that even a small particle became the sun for the whole world,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੁਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਿ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸਾਹਿਬ-ਦਿਲਾਣ ||੧੨੭||
transliteration: shudh z faiz suhabath saahiba-dhilaan | 127 |
translation: With the blessings of the association with the saintly persons. (127)

gurmukhi: ਕੀਸਤ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ-ਦਿਲ ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਿਸਨਾਸਦਸ਼
transliteration: keesath saahibi-dhil k hak bisanaasadhasha
translation: Who is that person with a great heart who can recognize the Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਲਕਾੲਿਸ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੀ-ਬਾਰਦਸ਼ ||੧੨੮||
transliteration: kaz lakaaeish shaauak hak mee-baaradhash | 128 |
translation: And whose face (constantly) radiates His splendor ? (128)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਦ ਤੁਰਾ
transliteration: suhabath shaan shaauak hak bakhashadh thuraa
translation: The company of such noble souls blesses you with the Devotion for the Lord,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਕਿਤਾਬਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸਬਕ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਦ ਤੁਰਾ ||੧੨੯||
transliteration: az kithaab hak sabak bakhashadh thuraa | 129 |
translation: And it is their company too that gives you spiritual lessons from the holy book. (129)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਰਾ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਿ ਅਨਵਰ ਮੀ-ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: zaraa raa khurasheedh anavar mee-kunandha
translation: They, the noble souls, can transform even a small particles into a sprightly sun;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਮੁਨ?ਵਰ ਮੀ-ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੧੩੦||
transliteration: khaak raa az hak munavar mee-kunandh | 130 |
translation: And, it is them who can sparkle even the common dust into the Light of Truth. (130)

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਤੂ ਖ਼ਾਕੀ ਵ ਦਰ ਵੈ ਨੂਰਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: chasham thoo khaakee v dhar vai noor haka
translation: Even though your eye is made of dust, still it has the Divine radiance,

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰੂਨਸ਼ ਚਾਰ ਸੂ ਵ ਨਹੁ ਤਬਕ ||੧੩੧||
transliteration: andharoonash chaar soo v nahu thabak | 131 |
translation: It also contains all the four directions, east, west, south and north, and the nine heavens. (131)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਿਦਮਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਬੰਦਗੀੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: khidhamath shaan bandhageee hak bavadha
translation: Any service performed for them, the saintly persons, is the worship of Waaheguru;

gurmukhi: ਕਾਣ ਕਬੂਲਿ ਕਾਦਰਿ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਬਵਦ ||੧੩੨||
transliteration: kaan kabool kaadhar muthalik bavadh | 132 |
translation: Because they are the ones who are acceptable to the Omnipotent. (132)

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀ ਕੁਨ ਜਾਣ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਬੂਲ
transliteration: bandhagee kun jaan k oo baashadh kaboola
translation: You, too, should meditate so that you be acceptable before the Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: ਕਦਰਿ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਕੈ ਬਿਦਾਨਦ ਹਰ ਜਹੂਲ ||੧੩੩||
transliteration: kadhar oo raa kai bidhaanadh har jehool | 133 |
translation: How can any stupid person appreciate His invaluable worth. (133)

gurmukhi: ਹਸਤ ਕਾਰਿ ਰੂਜ਼ੋ ਸ਼ਬ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: hasath kaar roozo shab dhar yaadh oo
translation: The only task we should be engaged day and night is to remember Him;

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਖ਼ਾਲੀ ਨਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਅਜ਼ੂ ||੧੩੪||
transliteration: yak nafas khaalee namee baashadh azoo | 134 |
translation: Not even one moment should be spared without His meditation and prayers. (134)

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਜ਼ਿ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਅ?ਲਾਹ
transliteration: chasham shaan raauashan z dheedhaar alaaha
translation: Their eyes are glistened because of His Divine glimpse,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਲਿਬਾਸ ਅੰਦਰ-ਗਦਾ ਓ ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹ ||੧੩੫||
transliteration: dhar libaas andhara-gadhaa ou baadhashaah | 135 |
translation: They may be in the guise of a mendicant, but they are the kings. (135)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: baadhashaahee aan k oo dhaaeim bavadha
translation: Only that kingdom is considered a real kingdom that lasts for ever,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਜਾਤਿ ਪਾਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ ||੧੩੬||
transliteration: hamachoo jaath paak hak kaaeim bavadh | 136 |
translation: And, like the pure and chaste Nature of God, should be eternal. (136)

gurmukhi: ਰਸਮਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਅਾੲੀਨਿ ਦਰਵੇਸ਼ੀ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: rasam shaan aaeen dharavaeshee bavadha
translation: Their custom and tradition is mostly that of mendicants;

gurmukhi: ਅਸ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਓ ਬਾਹਮਾ ਖ਼ੇਸੀ ਬਵਦ ||੧੩੭||
transliteration: as khudhaa ou baahamaa khaesee bavadh | 137 |
translation: They are the lineage and the scions of Waaheguru, and they have intimacy and familiarity with all. (137)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਗਦਾ ਰਾ ੲਿ?ਜ਼ੇ ਜਾਹੇ ਮੀਦਿਹੰਦ
transliteration: har gadhaa raa eziae jaahae meedhihandha
translation: The Akaalpurakh blesses every ascetic with honor and status;

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਬੇ-ੲਿਸ਼ਤਬਾਹੀ ਮੀਦਿਹੰਦ ||੧੩੮||
transliteration: dhaaualath bae-eishathabaahee meedhihandh | 138 |
translation: Without any doubt, He also bestows (everyone) with wealth and treasures. (138)

gurmukhi: ਨਾਕਸਾਣ ਰਾ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: naakasaan raa aarif kaamil kunandha
translation: They can transform trivial and paltry persons into perfectly knowledgeable ones;

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਦਿਲਾਣ ਰਾ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ-ਦਿਲ ਮੀਕੁਨੰਦ ||੧੩੯||
transliteration: bae-dhilaan raa saahibi-dhil meekunandh | 139 |
translation: And, the demoralized ones into courageous persons and masters of their destiny. (139)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਪ੍ਰਸਤੀ ਅਜ਼ ਮਿਅਾਣ ਬਰਦਾਸ਼ਤੰਦ
transliteration: khudha-prasathee az miaan baradhaashathandha
translation: They eject their vanities from their inner self;

gurmukhi: ਤੁਖ਼ਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਰ ਕਿਸ਼ਤਿ ਦਿਲਹਾ ਕਾਸ਼ਤੰਦ ||੧੪੦||
transliteration: thukham hak dhar kishath dhilehaa kaashathandh | 140 |
translation: And, they sow seeds of Truth, the Lord, in the field-like hearts of the people. (140)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ਰਾ ਹੀਚ ਮੀ ਦਾਨੰਦ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: khaeshathan raa heech mee dhaanandh shaana
translation: They always consider themselves insignificant and lowlier than others;

gurmukhi: ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਰੂਜ਼ੋ ਸ਼ਬ ਖ਼ਾਨੰਦ ਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੪੧||
transliteration: haraf hak raa roozo shab khaanandh shaan | 141 |
translation: And, they are absorbed in the meditation of Naam of Waaheguru day and night. (141)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕੁਜਾ ਅੌਸਾਫ਼ਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: thaa kujaa aauasaaf maradhaan khudhaa-satha
translation: How much can I praise the God's men, the saints and the Mahaatamaas?

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਣ ਗਰ ਯਕੇ ਗੋੲਿਮ ਰਵਾ-ਸਤ ||੧੪੨||
transliteration: az hazaaraan gar yakae goeim ravaa-sath | 142 |
translation: It would be just wonderful if I could describe even one of their thousands of  virtues. (142)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੁਨੀਣ ਮਰਦੁਮ ਬਜੂ ਕਅਾਣ ਕੀਸਤੰਦ
transliteration: hamachuneen maradhum bajoo kaaan keesathandha
translation: You, too, should try to find such noble persons (What kind of persons?) who are alive for ever;

gurmukhi: ਦੀਗਰਾਣ ਮੁਰਦੰਦ ੲੀਹਾਣ ਜ਼ੀਸਤੰਦ ||੧੪੩||
transliteration: dheegaraan muradhandh eehaan zeesathandh | 143 |
translation: The rest of them are apparently alive but are just like dead  bodies. (143)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੀਸਤਨ ਰਾ ਮਾਅਨੀ ਦਾਨੀ ਕਿਹ ਚੀਸਤ
transliteration: zeesathan raa maaanee dhaanee kih cheesatha
translation: Do you understand the meaning of 'being alive' ?

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ਾ ੳੁਮਰੇ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਸ਼ ਬਜ਼ੀਸਤ ||੧੪੪||
transliteration: ai khushaa oumarae k dhar yaadhash bazeesath | 144 |
translation: Only that life is worth living that is spent in remembering the Akaalpurakh. (144)

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਨਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ
transliteration: maradh aarif zindhaa az eirafaan oo-satha
translation: The enlightened persons are alive only because of the knowledge of the mysteries of God's attributes;

gurmukhi: ਨਿਅਮਤਿ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਣ ਦਰ ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ ||੧੪੫||
transliteration: niamath har dho jehaan dhar khaanaae oo-sath | 145 |
translation: (They know) that He has and can shower blessings of both of the worlds in His house. (145)

gurmukhi: ਮਾਅਨੀੲੇ ੲੀਣ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: maaaneeeae een zindhagee yaadh khudhaa-satha
translation: The main purpose of this life is to (constantly) remember Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਤੁਫ਼ੈਲਸ਼ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਜਾਨਿ ਅੌਲੀਅਾ-ਸਤ ||੧੪੬||
transliteration: kaz thufailash zindhaa jaan aaualeeaa-sath | 146 |
translation: The saints and prophets live only with this motive. (146)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ੳੂ ਬਰ ਹਰ ਜ਼ਬਾਨਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: zikar oo bar har zabaan goyaa shudha
translation: A mention of them is on every living tongue;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਰਾਹਿ ਹ?ਕ ਜੂਯਾ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ||੧੪੭||
transliteration: har dho aalam raahi hak jooyaa shudhaa | 147 |
translation: And, both the worlds are seekers of His path. (147)

gurmukhi: ਜੁਮਲਾ ਮੀ-ਖ਼ਾਨੰਦ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਜਲਾਲ
transliteration: jumalaa mee-khaanandh zikar zulajalaala
translation: Everyone meditates the awe-inspiring splendid Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਕੀਲੋ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਫ਼ਰਖ਼ੰਦਾ ਕਾਲ ||੧੪੮||
transliteration: ai zehae keelo zehae farakhandhaa kaal | 148 |
translation: Only then such a meditation is auspicious and such a discourse propitious. (148)

gurmukhi: ਕੀਲੋ ਕਾਲੇ ਗਰ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: keelo kaalae gar baraae hak bavadh
translation: If you want to converse and describe the Truth,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਕਾਦਰਿ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਬਵਦ ||੧੪੯||
transliteration: az baraae kaadhar muthalik bavadh | 149 |
translation: That is possible only to discourse the Omnipotent. (149)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ੲੀਣ ਸਰਮਾਯਾੲਿ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਨਜੀਬ
transliteration: yaafath een saramaayaae oumar najeeba
translation: Such an asset and the treasure of meditation for a spiritual life

gurmukhi: ਹਸਤ ਅੰਦਰ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਨਸੀਬ ||੧੫੦||
transliteration: hasath andhar suhabath eaeshaan naseeb | 150 |
translation: Was blessed through association and the company they kept with the saintly persons. (150)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਰਵਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਦਿਗਰ ਮਨਜ਼ੂਰ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: aan ravaa baashadh dhigar manazoor neesatha
translation: Any such treasure is not acceptable to them, and they do not like any thing other than the truth;

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਰਿ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਰਾਸਤੀ ਦਸਤੂਰ ਨੀਸਤ ||੧੫੧||
transliteration: ghar haraf raasathee dhasathoor neesath | 151 |
translation: It is not their tradition to speak any words but the words of truth. (151)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਤ ਨਾਮਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਦਰ ਹਿੰਦਵੀਸਤ
transliteration: saadh sangath naam shaan dhar hindhaveesatha
translation: In Hindi language, they are called the 'Saadh Sangat',

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਮਾ ਤਾਰੀਫ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਅੈ ਮੌਲਵੀਸਤ ||੧੫੨||
transliteration: een hamaa thaareef shaan ai maaualaveesath | 152 |
translation: O Maulvee ! All this is in their praise; and all this defines them. (152)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਬਵਦ ਲੁਤਫ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: suhabath eaeshaan bavadh luthaf khudhaa
translation: The attainment of their company happens only with His blessings;

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਨਸੀਬਿ ਕਸ ਸ਼ਵਦ ੲੀਣ ਰੂ-ਨਮਾ ||੧੫੩||
transliteration: thaa naseeb kas shavadh een roo-namaa | 153 |
translation: And, only with His grace, such persons are revealed. (153)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ੲੀਣ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: har kasae een dhaaualath jaaveedh yaafatha
translation: Anyone who is fortunate enough to have obtained this eternal wealth,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀੲੇ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ ੳੁਮੀਦ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ||੧੫੪||
transliteration: zindhageeeae oumar raa oumeedh yaafath | 154 |
translation: One may assume then that he has become full of hope for the duration of his whole life. (154)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ਾਨੀ ਵ ਅਾਣ ਬਾਕੀ ਬਿਦਾਣ
transliteration: een hamaa faanee v aan baakee bidhaana
translation: All these, the wealth and the life, are perishable, but they are eternal;

gurmukhi: ਜਾਮਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ਪਾਕ ਰਾ ਸਾਕੀ ਬਿਦਾਣ ||੧੫੫||
transliteration: jaam eishak paak raa saakee bidhaan | 155 |
translation: Consider them as bartenders who are serving glasses full of divine devotion.  (155)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿ ਹਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: har ch hasath az suhabath eaeshaan bavadha
translation: Whatever is seemingly apparent in this world is all because of their company;

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਤਫ਼ੈਲਸ਼ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਅਾਬਾਦਾ ਬਵਦ ||੧੫੬||
transliteration: kaz thafailash jumalaa aabaadhaa bavadh | 156 |
translation: It is their grace that we see all the habitation and prosperity here. (156)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਮਾ ਅਾਬਾਦੀ ਅਜ਼ ਲੁਤਫ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: een hamaa aabaadhee az luthaf khudhaa-satha
translation: All these habitations (of living beings) are the result of the blessings of Waaheguru;

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਫਲਤ ਅਜ਼ ਵੈ ਯ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਮਰਗੋ ਜਫ਼ਾ ਸਤ ||੧੫੭||
transliteration: ghafalath az vai yak nafas marago jafaa sath | 157 |
translation: To neglect Him even for one moment is equivalent to pain and death. (157)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਹਾਸਲਿ ੲੀਣ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀਸਤ
transliteration: suhabath shaan haasal een zindhageesatha
translation: To achieve an association with them, the noble persons, is the cornerstone of this life;

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ੲੀਣ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ੲੀਣ ਬੰਦਗੀ-ਸਤ ||੧੫੮||
transliteration: zindhagee een zindhagee een bandhagee-sath | 158 |
translation: That is life, that is indeed life which is spent in meditating His Naam. (158)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੂ ਮੀਖ਼ਾਹੀ ਕਿ ਮਰਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸ਼ਵੀ
transliteration: gar thoo meekhaahee k maradh hak shavee
translation: If you wish to become Waaheguru's true devotee,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੧੫੯||
transliteration: aarif oo kaamil muthalik shavee | 159 |
translation: Then, you should become knowledgeable and enlightened about the perfect Entity. (159)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਕੀਮੀਅਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਤੁਰਾ
transliteration: suhabath shaan keemeeaa baashadh thuraa
translation: Their company is like a cure-all for you;

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਚਿਹ ਮੀਖ਼ਾਹੀ ਰਵਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਤੁਰਾ ||੧੬੦||
transliteration: thaa chih meekhaahee ravaa baashadh thuraa | 160 |
translation: Then, whatever you wish shall be appropriate. (160)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਮਾ ਕੂ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਜਾਣ ਅਾਮਦੰਦ
transliteration: een hamaa koo saahib jaan aamadhandha
translation: All this breathing and living world that we see

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਅਾਮਦੰਦ ||੧੬੧||
transliteration: az baraae suhabath shaan aamadhandh | 161 |
translation: Is only because of the company of the noble souls. (161)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀੲੇ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਜ਼ਿਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਿ ਸਹੁਬਤ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: zindhageeeae shaan zifaiz sahubath asatha
translation: The existing lives of those living beings is the result of the company of saintly persons;

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਅਾੲਿਤਿ ਪੁਰ ਰਹਿਮਤ ਅਸਤ ||੧੬੨||
transliteration: suhabath shaan aaeith pur rehimath asath | 162 |
translation: And, the company of such noble persons is the proof of the kindness and compassion of Akaalpurakh. (162)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਰਾ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਬਾੲਿਦਸ਼
transliteration: har kasae raa suhabath shaan baaeidhasha
translation: Everyone, in fact, needs their company;

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਦਿਲ ਅਕਦਿ ਗੁਹਰ ਬਿਕੁਸ਼ਾੲਿਦਸ਼ ||੧੬੩||
transliteration: thaa z dhil akadh guhar bikushaaeidhash | 163 |
translation: So that they could unravel the chain of pearls (noble aspects) from their hearts. (163)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਗੰਜੀਨਾੲੀ ਅ ਬੇ-ਖ਼ਬਰ
transliteration: saahib ganjeenaaee a bae-khabara
translation: O naive! You are the master of priceless treasure;

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਜ਼ਾਣ ਗੰਜੇ ਤੁਰਾ ਨਭਬਵਦ ਖ਼ਬਰ ||੧੬੪||
transliteration: laek zaan ganjae thuraa nabhabavadh khabar | 164 |
translation: But alas! You have no realization of that hidden treasure. (164)

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਅਜ਼ਾਣ ਗੰਜੇ ਬ-ਯਾਬੀ ੲਿਤਲਾਅ
transliteration: kai azaan ganjae ba-yaabee eithalaaa
translation: How can you find out that invaluable treasure

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰੂਨਿ ਕੁਫ਼ਲ ਚੂੰ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਮਤਾਅ ||੧੬੫||
transliteration: andharoon kufal choon baashadh mathaaa | 165 |
translation: As to what kind of wealth is hidden inside the vault. (165)

gurmukhi: ਪਸ ਤੁਰਾ ਲਾਜ਼ਿਮ ਬਵਦ ਜੂੲੀ ਕੁਲੀਦ
transliteration: pas thuraa laazim bavadh jooee kuleedha
translation: Therefore, it is essential for you to strive to find the key to the treasure,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬ-ਬੀਨੀ ਗੰਜਿ ਖ਼ੁਫ਼ੀਅਾ ਰਾ ਪਦੀਦ ||੧੬੬||
transliteration: thaa ba-beenee ganj khufeeaa raa padheedh | 166 |
translation: So that you can have a clear realization of this covert, mysterious and valuable repository. (166)

gurmukhi: ਕੁਫ਼ਲ ਬਿਕੁਸ਼ਾ ਅਜ਼ ਕੁਲੀਦਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: kufal bikushaa az kuleedh naam haka
translation: You should use the Naam of Waaheguru as the key to open this hidden wealth;

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਕਿਤਾਬਿ ਗੰਜ ਮਖ਼ਫ਼ੀ ਖ਼ਾਣ ਸਬਕ ||੧੬੭||
transliteration: az kithaab ganj makhafee khaan sabak | 167 |
translation: And, learn the lessons from the Book of this hidden treasure, the Granth. (167)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਕੁਲੀਦਿ ਨਾਮ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: een kuleedh naam paesh shaan bavadha
translation: This key is found (only) with the saintly persons,

gurmukhi: ਮਰਹਮਿ ਦਿਲਹਾੲਿ ਰੇਸ਼ੇ ਜਾਣ ਬਵਦ ||੧੬੮||
transliteration: mareham dhilehaae raeshae jaan bavadh | 168 |
translation: And, this key serves as the ointment of lacerated hearts and lives. (168)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਕਸੇ ਰਾ ੲੀਣ ਕੁਲੀਦ ਅਾੲਿਦ ਬ-ਦਸਤ
transliteration: choon kasae raa een kuleedh aaeidh ba-dhasatha
translation: Anyone who can get hold of this key

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਗੰਜੀਨਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਹਰ ਕਿ ਹਸਤ ||੧੬੯||
transliteration: saahib ganjeenaa baashadh har k hasath | 169 |
translation: He may be anyone, he can become the master of this treasure. (169)

gurmukhi: ਗੰਜ ਰਾ ਚੂੰ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ਜੋਯਾੲਿ ਗੰਜ
transliteration: ganj raa choon yaafathaa joyaae ganja
translation: When the seeker of the treasure does find his goal,

gurmukhi: ਗਸ਼ਤ ਫ਼ਾਰਿਗ ਅਜ਼ ਹਮਾ ਤਸ਼ਵੀਸ਼ੋ ਰੰਜ ||੧੭੦||
transliteration: gashath faarig az hamaa thashaveesho ranj | 170 |
translation: Then consider that he has been salvaged from all worries and anxieties. (170)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਹਮ ਅਜ਼ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅੈ ਸ਼ਫ਼ੀਕ
transliteration: aan ham az maradhaan hak shudh ai shafeeka
translation: O my friend ! That person has joined the group of (true) devotees of God,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਕਿ ਰਾਹੇ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ਦਰ ਕੂੲਿ ਰਫ਼ੀਕ ||੧੭੧||
transliteration: aan k raahae yaafath dhar kooe rafeek | 171 |
translation: Who has discovered the direction to the streets of the Beloved Friend. (171)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਰਾ ਚੂੰ ਮਾਹ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: suhabath shaan zaraa raa choon maah karadha
translation: Their association transformed an insignificant dust particle to a shining moon.

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਗਦਾ ਰਾ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਕਰਦ ||੧੭੨||
transliteration: har gadhaa raa suhabath shaan shaah karadh | 172 |
translation: Again, it was their company that transformed every beggar into a king. (172)

gurmukhi: ਰਹਿਮਤਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਾਦ ਬਰ ਅੌਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: rehimath hak baadh bar aauazaae shaana
translation: May Akaalpurakh bless their disposition with His grace;

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਪਿਦਰ ਬਰ ਮਾਦਰੇ ੲਿਬਨਾੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੭੩||
transliteration: bar pidhar bar maadharae eibanaae shaan | 173 |
translation: And, also on their parents and children. (173)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਰਾ ਦੀਦ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਦੀਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: har k shaan raa dheedh hak raa dheedhaa asatha
translation: Whosoever gets a chance to see them, consider that they have seen the Almighty God;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਗੁਲ ਅਜ਼ ਬਾਗ਼ਿ ਮੁਹ?ਬਤ ਚੀਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੧੭੪||
transliteration: khush gul az baagh muhabath cheedhaa asath | 174 |
translation: And that he has been able to get a glimpse of a beautiful flower out of the garden of love. (174)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਲ ਜ਼ਿ ਬਾਗ਼ਿ ਮਾਅਰਫ਼ਤ ਬਰ-ਚੀਦਨ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: gul z baagh maaarafath bara-cheedhan asatha
translation: The association with such noble persons is like taking a beautiful flower out of the garden of divine knowledge;

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਨਿ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਰਾ ਦੀਦਨ ਅਸਤ ||੧੭੫||
transliteration: dheedhan eaeshaan khudhaa raa dheedhan asath | 175 |
