translation: And, a sight of such saints is like getting a glimpse of Akaalpurakh. (175)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸ਼ਕਿਲ ਅਾਮਦ ਦੀਦਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਬਿਅਾਣ
transliteration: mushakil aamadh dheedhan hak raa biaana
translation: It is difficult to describe the 'glimpse' of Waaheguru;

gurmukhi: ਮੀਦਿਹਦ ੲੀਣ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਰਾ ਕੁਦਰਤ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੭੬||
transliteration: meedhihadh een jumalaa raa kudharath nishaan | 176 |
translation: His powers are reflected in the entire Nature that He has created. (176)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਤੁਫ਼ੈਲਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਰਾ ਦੀਦਾ-ਅਮ
transliteration: az thufail shaan khudhaa raa dheedhaa-ama
translation: With their kindness, I have seen a glimpse of Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਲ ਜ਼ ਬਾਗ਼ਿ ਮਾਅਰਫ਼ਤ ਬਰ ਚੀਦਾ-ਅਮ ||੧੭੭||
transliteration: gul z baagh maaarafath bar cheedhaa-am | 177 |
translation: And, with their grace, I have selected a lively flower from the Divine Garden. (177)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮਾਅਨੀੲੇ ਦਾਰਦ ਸ਼ਰੀਫ਼
transliteration: dheedhan hak maaaneeeae dhaaradh shareefa
translation: Even to think of getting a glimpse of Akaalpurakh is indeed a sacred intention;

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਨਿ-ਅਮ ੲੀਣ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਅਾਣ ਜ਼ਾਤਿ ਲਤੀਫ ||੧੭੮||
transliteration: man ni-am een jumalaa aan zaath latheef | 178 |
translation: Goya says, I am nothing! ll this, including the above thought, is due to His abstract and mysterious Entity. (178)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਦਾਨਿਸਤ ੲੀਣ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਤਮਾਮ
transliteration: har k oo dhaanisath een haraf thamaama
translation: Whosoever has understood this complete message (word),

gurmukhi: ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ੳੂ ਅਾਣ ਗੰਜਿ ਮਖ਼ਫ਼ੀ ਰਾ ਮਕਾਮ ||੧੭੯||
transliteration: yaafath oo aan ganj makhafee raa makaam | 179 |
translation: As if he has discovered the location of the hidden treasure. (179)

gurmukhi: ਮਾਅਨੀੲੇ ਹ?ਕ ਸੂਰਤੇ ਦਾਰਦ ਨਿਕੂ-ਸਤ
transliteration: maaaneeeae hak soorathae dhaaradh nikoo-satha
translation: The reality of Waaheguru has an extremely attractive reflection;

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਤਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ ||੧੮੦||
transliteration: surath hak surath maradhaan oo-sath | 180 |
translation: The picture of Akaalpurakh is (can be seen) in His own men and women, the saintly persons. (180)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਲਵਤਿ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਬਵਦ ਦਰ ਅੰਜੁਮਨ
transliteration: khalavath eaeshaan bavadh dhar anjumana
translation: They feel they are in seclusion even when they are in the company of groups of people, the congregations;

gurmukhi: ਵਸਫ਼ਿ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਨਿ ਮਰਦੋ ਜ਼ਨ ||੧੮੧||
transliteration: vasaf eaeshaan bar zubaan maradho zan | 181 |
translation: Praises of their glory are on the tongues of everyone. (181)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੀਣ ਖ਼ਬਰ ਵਾਕਿਫ਼ ਕਸੇ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: zeen khabar vaakif kasae baashadh k oo
translation: Only that person can be cognizant of this mystery,

gurmukhi: ਦਾਰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੁਹ?ਬਤ ਗ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਗ਼ੂ ||੧੮੨||
transliteration: dhaaradh az shaauak muhabath ghufathaghoo | 182 |
translation: Who talks and discusses about the devotion for Akaalpurakh with enthusiasm. (182)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ-ਅਸ਼ ਗਿਰੇਬਾਣ ਗੀਰ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa-ash giraebaan geer shudha
translation: Anyone whose enthusiastic devotion for Waaheguru becomes a necklace (garland) for his neck,

gurmukhi: ਨਾਕਸੇ ਹਮ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਤਦਬੀਰ ਸ਼ੁਦ ||੧੮੩||
transliteration: naakasae ham saahib thadhabeer shudh | 183 |
translation: Even though he, being a lowly person, becomes wise and sagacious. (183)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾਯਤ ਚੂੰ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਦਸਤਗੀਰ
transliteration: shaauak maaualaayath choon baashadh dhasathageera
translation: When the enthusiasm of devotion for God becomes your supporter,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਗਰਦਦ ਰਸ਼ਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦ ਮੁਨੀਰ ||੧੮੪||
transliteration: zaraa garadhadh rashak khurasheedh muneer | 184 |
translation: Then even a particle of dust desires to emulate (and becomes) a bright sun. (184)

gurmukhi: ਬਸਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੀਬਾਰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ੁਫ਼ਤਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: basak hak meebaaradh az ghufathaar shaana
translation: When they talk, they shower (words of) the nectar of Truth,

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਾਹਾ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਜ਼ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੮੫||
transliteration: dheedhaahaa raauashan shudh az dheedhaar shaan | 185 |
translation: With their glimpse, the eyes become more bright and soothed. (185)

gurmukhi: ਰੂਜ਼ੋ ਸ਼ਬ ਬਾਸ਼ੰਦ ਦਰ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਸ਼ ਮੁਦਾਮ
transliteration: roozo shab baashandh dhar zikarash mudhaama
translation: They keep meditating on the Naam of Waaheguru day and night;

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਲਿਬਾਸਿ ਦੁਨਯਵੀ ਮਰਦਿ ਤਮਾਮ ||੧੮੬||
transliteration: dhar libaas dhunayavee maradh thamaam | 186 |
translation: Even in the worldly guise, living in this world, they become perfect human beings. (186)

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਹਮਾ ਅਜ਼ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਅਾਜ਼ਾਦੰਦ ਸ਼ਾਣ
transliteration: baa hamaa az jumalaa aazaadhandh shaana
translation: With everything around them, they are independent and are immune to the effects of these material distractions;

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਮਾ ਹਾਲ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਸ਼ਾਦੰਦ ਸ਼ਾਣ ||੧੮੭||
transliteration: dhar hamaa haal az khudhaa shaadhandh shaan | 187 |
translation: They are always satisfied and pleased under the Will of Akaalpurakh. (187)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਲਿਬਾਸਿ ਦੁਨਯਵੀਣ ਵ ਰਸਮਿ ਦੀਣ
transliteration: dhar libaas dhunayaveen v rasam dheena
translation: Even they are dressed in worldly clothes, their tradition and practice is religious.

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ੲੇਸਾਣ ਸਾਨੀੲੇ ਦੀਗਰ ਮਬੀਣ ||੧੮੮||
transliteration: hamachoo eaesaan saaneeeae dheegar mabeen | 188 |
translation: There is no one like them in this world. (188)

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਚੁਨਾਣ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਾਰੰਦ ਦਸਤ
transliteration: ham chunaan dhar yaadh hak dhaarandh dhasatha
translation: They are starkly steady, firm and adept in the memory of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਸ਼ਨਾਸੋ ਹ?ਕ ਪਸੰਦੋ ਹ?ਕ ਪ੍ਰਸਤ ||੧੮੯||
transliteration: hak shanaaso hak pasandho hak prasath | 189 |
translation: They appreciate and recognize Him, are dedicated to the Truth and also worship the Truth. (189)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਲਿਬਾਸਿ ਦੁਨਯਵੀ ਸਰ ਤਾ ਕਦਮ
transliteration: dhar libaas dhunayavee sar thaa kadhama
translation: Even though they are seen clad in worldly guise from head to toe,

gurmukhi: ਬੀਨੀ ਵਾ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਨਭਬੀਨੀ ਨੀਮ ਦਮ ||੧੯੦||
transliteration: beenee vaa ghaafil nabhabeenee neem dham | 190 |
translation: You will never find them to be negligent of remembering Waaheguru even for half a moment. (190)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਣ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਪਾਕ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਰਾ ਪਾਕ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: aan khudhaae paak shaan raa paak karadha
translation: The chaste Akaalpurakh transforms them into pure and holy beings,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਚਿਹ ਜਿਸਮਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਜ਼ਿ-ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਕਰਦ ||੧੯੧||
transliteration: gar chih jisam shaan zi-mushath khaak karadh | 191 |
translation: Even though their body is made up of just a fistful of dust. (191)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਵਜੂਦਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਪਾਕ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ
transliteration: een vajoodh khaak paak az yaadh oo-satha
translation: This human body made of dust becomes sacred with His remembrance;

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਣ ਕਿ ੲੇਸ਼ਾਣ ਮਜ਼ਹਰਿ ਬੁਨਿਅਾਦਿ ੳੂ-ਸਤ ||੧੯੨||
transliteration: zaan k eaeshaan mazehar buniaadh oo-sath | 192 |
translation: Because it is the manifestation of the foundation (personality) bestowed by Akaalpurakh. (192)

gurmukhi: ਰਸਮਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਅਾੲੀਨਿ ਦਿਲਦਾਰੀ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: rasam shaan aaeen dhiladhaaree bavadha
translation: It is their custom to remember the Almighty;

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਮਾ ਹਾਲ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਯਾਰੀ ਬਵਦ ||੧੯੩||
transliteration: dhar hamaa haal az khudhaa yaaree bavadh | 193 |
translation: And, it is their tradition to always generate love and devotion for Him. (193)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਰਾ ਕੈ ਨਸੀਬ ੲੀਣ ਦੌਲਤ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: har kasae raa kai naseeb een dhaaualath asatha
translation: How can every one be blessed with such a treasure?'

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਅੰਦਰ ਸੁਹਬਤ ਅਸਤ ||੧੯੪||
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh andhar suhabath asath | 194 |
translation: This non-perishable wealth is available only through their company. (194)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਣ ਹਮਾ ਅਜ਼ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ੳੂਸਤ
transliteration: een hamaa az suhabath maradhaan oosatha
translation: All these (material goods) are the result of the blessings of their company;

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਣ ਦਰ ਸ਼ਾਨਿ ੳੂਸਤ ||੧੯੫||
transliteration: dhaaualath har dho jehaan dhar shaan oosath | 195 |
translation: And, the wealth of both the worlds is in their praise and honor. (195)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਣ ਨਫ਼ੀਅਾ ਬਿਸੀਅਾਰ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ
transliteration: suhabath shaan nafeeaa biseeaar aavuradha
translation: An association with them is extremely profitable;

gurmukhi: ਨਖ਼ਲਿ ਜਿਸਮਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਹ?ਕ ਬਾਰ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ ||੧੯੬||
transliteration: nakhal jisam khaak hak baar aavuradh | 196 |
translation: The date-palm of the body of dust brings in the fruit of Truth. (196)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੁਨੀਣ ਸੁਹਬਤ ਕੁਜਾ ਬਾਜ਼ ਅਾੲਿਦਤ
transliteration: hamachuneen suhabath kujaa baaz aaeidhatha
translation: When would you be able to run into such (an exalted) company?

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲੇ ਮਰਦਮੀ ਮੀ-ਸ਼ਾੲਿਦਤ ||੧੯੭||
transliteration: kaz baraaeae maradhamee mee-shaaeidhath | 197 |
translation: Such a blessed company will bestow upon you the humaneness. (197)

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦਮੀ ਯਾਅਨੀ ਬ-ਹ?ਕ ਪੈਵਸਤਨ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: maradhamee yaaanee ba-hak paivasathan asatha
translation: The purpose of human life is (ultimately) to merge with the Creator;

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਹਮਾ ਵਾ ਰਿਸਤਨ ਅਸਤ ||੧੯੮||
transliteration: ghair zikarash az hamaa vaa risathan asath | 198 |
translation: Absence of His description and discourse is tantamount to breaking away from every one else. (198)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਦਿਲਿ ਬੰਦਾ ਬਜ਼ਿਕਰਸ਼ ਰਾਹ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: choon dhil bandhaa bazikarash raah yaafatha
translation: When a human being gets into the tradition of remembering Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ੳੁਮਰੋ ਦਿਲ ਅਾਗਾਾਹ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ||੧੯੯||
transliteration: haasil oumaro dhil aagaaaah yaafath | 199 |
translation: He becomes conversant with the attainment of both life and soul. (199)

gurmukhi: ਕਾਰਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਗਰਦੂਨਿ ਗਰਦਾਂ ਦਰ ਗੂਜ਼ਰਤ
transliteration: kaarash az garadhoon garadhaa dhar goozaratha
translation: He will be redeemed and set free from the attachments of this revolving world when someone breaks away his connections from it;

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਸਰਿ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਚੂ ਮਰਦਾਂ ਦਰ ਗੁਜ਼ਰਤ ||੨੦੦||
transliteration: bar sar dhuniaa choo maradhaa(n) dhar guzarath | 200 |
translation: Then, he would become detached from the material distractions like a seeker of spiritual knowledge. (200)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਜਹਾਨੋ ਅਾਂ ਜਹਾਂ ਤਹਿਸੀਂ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: ee jehaano aa jehaa(n) thehisee kunandha
translation: He was applauded in both the worlds,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਦਿਲ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰੰਗੀਂ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੦੧||
transliteration: aa k dhil az zikar hak rangee kunandh | 201 |
translation: When anyone imbued his heart and soul with the remembrance of Akaalpurakh. (201)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਵਜੂਦਸ਼ ਅਾਫਤਾਬੇ ਤਾਫ਼ਤਾ
transliteration: dhar vajoodhash aafathaabae thaafathaa
translation: The body of such a person begins to radiate like the sun,

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਰ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ||੨੦੨||
transliteration: naam hak dhar suhabath shaa(n) yaafathaa | 202 |
translation: When he, in the company of saintly persons, has attained the real Truth. (202)

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਜ਼ ਬਸਕਿ ਰੂਜ਼ੋ ਸ਼ਬ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: naam hak az basak roozo shab grifatha
translation: He remembered the Naam of Akaalpurakh day and night,

gurmukhi: ਦਸਤਿ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਬਰ-ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੨੦੩||
transliteration: dhasath oo raa zikar maaualaa bara-grifath | 203 |
translation: Then only the discourses and praises of the Lord became his support. (203)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਯਾਰੀ ਦਾਦਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: zikar maaualaa aa k yaaree dhaadhaa shudha
translation: Anyone who has received the support of Akaalpurakh due to his meditation,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ਵੀਰਾਂ ਜ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਬਾਦਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ ||੨੦੪||
transliteration: khaanaae veeraa(n) z hak aabaadhaa shudh | 204 |
translation: Will have his deserted house, with the achievement of the Truth, rehabilitated and revived again. (204)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਦੌਲਤੇ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਅਜ਼ੀਮ
transliteration: zikar maaualaa dhaaualathae baashadh azeema
translation: Meditation of God is one great treasure;

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਬਦਸਤ ਅਾੲਿਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਗੰਜੋ ਮਾਲੋ ਸੀਮ ||੨੦੫||
transliteration: kai badhasath aaeidh z ganjo maalo seem | 205 |
translation: How can one obtain such a magnificent treasure from the worldly riches like wealth and silver? (205)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਖਾਸਤ ਹ?ਕ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਬਖ਼ਾਸਤ
transliteration: har k hak raa khaasath hak oo raa bakhaasatha
translation: Whosoever developed a desire for (meeting with) the Lord, the Lord liked him;

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌੋਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਬਿਹਤਰੀਨਿ ਕੀਮੀਅਾ-ਸਤ ||੨੦੬||
transliteration: shaauok maaualaa bihathareen keemeeaa-sath | 206 |
translation: The love and devotion for Akaalpurakh is the best cure-all panacea. (206)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਹਰਿ ਮਕਸੂਦ ਤਨ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: gohar makasoodh than yaadh khudhaa-satha
translation: The deed of the main purpose of this body is only to remember Waaheguru;

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕਨ ੳੂ ਅੰਦਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਨਿ ਅੌਲੀਅਾ ਸਤ ||੨੦੭||
transliteration: laekan oo andhar zubaan aaualeeaa sath | 207 |
translation: However, He always abides and manifests on the tongues of the noble souls. (207)

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸਾੲੀ ਬਿਹ ਕਿ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: paarasaaee bih k behir hak bavadha
translation: That saintliness is really worthwhile if it is to seek the Truth;

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਂਚੀਸਤ ਕਾਂ ਨਾਹ?ਕ ਬਵਦ ||੨੦੮||
transliteration: baadhashaahee acheesath kaa(n) naahak bavadh | 208 |
translation: What is the worth of that kingdom that is useless if it is not aiming towards God. (208)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਾਕ ਅੰਦ ਰਿੰਦੋ ਪਾਰਸਾ
transliteration: har dho mushathaak andh rindho paarasaa
translation: Both the drunk and the holy person are desirous of Him;

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕਿਰਾ ਖ਼ਾਹਦ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਕਿਬਰੀਅਾ ||੨੦੯||
transliteration: thaa kiraa khaahadh khudhaae kibareeaa | 209 |
translation: Let us see! Whom does He, the transcendent Akaalpurakh likes?  (209)

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਤਾਂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਬੰਦਗੀਸਤ
transliteration: bandhaa thaa baashadh baraae bandhageesatha
translation: A human being deserves to be called a human being only if he directs himself towards meditation;

gurmukhi: ਗੈਰ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਹਮਾ ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਗੀਸਤ ||੨੧੦||
transliteration: gair haraf hak hamaa sharamindhageesath | 210|
translation: Without a description/word of Waaheguru, it is all humiliation. (210)

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਦਰ ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰ ਕਸੇ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਦਰੁਸਤ
transliteration: laek dhar zaahir kasae baashadh dharusatha
translation: However, it is apparent that only that person is on the right path,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਅਾਰਦ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਦਸਤ ||੨੧੧||
transliteration: aa k aaradh murashadh kaamil badhasath | 211 |
translation: Who has been able to attain (or attach himself to) a perfect Guru. (211)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਨੋ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਂ-ਦਾਰ ੳੂ
transliteration: dheeno dhuniaa har dho faramaa(n)-dhaar oo
translation: Both the Faith and the world are in complete obedience to the Almighty;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਸ਼ਾੲਿਕਿ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ੳੂ ||੨੧੨||
transliteration: har dho aalam shaaeik dheedhaar oo | 212 |
translation: Both the worlds are equally desirous to get just one glimpse of Him. (212)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਰਾ ੳੁਲਫ਼ਤ ਜ਼ਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: har k raa oulafath z naam hak bavadha
translation: Anyone who has developed deep love for the Naam of  Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਅਾਰਫ਼ਿ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਬਵਦ ||੨੧੩||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath aaraf muthalik bavadh | 213 |
translation: He becomes a perfect seeker of the divine knowledge in real terms. (213)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ੳੂ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: yaadh hak raa thaalib oo mee kunandha
translation: Seekers of Waaheguru are (actively) involved in His meditation;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਨੇਕੋ ਮੀ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੧੪||
transliteration: aarif hak jumalaa naeko mee kunandh | 214 |
translation: Seekers of Waaheguru transform everyone into something very attractive. (214)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਹਮਾਂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ਬਾਸ਼ੀ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ
transliteration: hak hamaa(n) baashadh k baashee bandhaaei
translation: The truth is that you should (always strive to) become a person of God,

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਅਦਬ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਸ਼ਰਮੰਿਦਾੲਿ ||੨੧੫||
transliteration: bae-adhab dhaaeim z hak sharamanidhaae | 215 |
translation: A disrespectful (apostate/atheist) person is always chagrined and ashamed before Him. (215)

gurmukhi: ੳੁਮਰ ਅਾਂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਦਰ ਯਾਦ ਰਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: oumar aa baashadh k oo dhar yaadh rafatha
translation: Only that life is worth living that is spent in remembering Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ੳੁਮਰ ਨਾ ਬੂਦ ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਬਰਬਾਦ ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੨੧੬||
transliteration: oumar naa boodh aa k barabaadh rafath | 216 |
translation: What use is that life that is spent needlessly and in vain. (216)

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਪੈਦਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਬਰਾੲੇ ਬੰਦਗੀ
transliteration: bandhaa paidhaa shudh baraaeae bandhagee
translation: A person is born (only) to be engaged in meditation;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ੲਿਲਾਜੇ ਹਸਤ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ||੨੧੭||
transliteration: khush eilaajae hasath behir bandhagee | 217 |
translation: In fact, religious devotion (and prayers) is a good cure to put this life in the proper perspective. (217)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ਾ ਚਸ਼ਮੇ ਕਿ ਦੀਦਾ ਰੂੲਿ ਦੂਸਤ
transliteration: ai khushaa chashamae k dheedhaa rooe dhoosatha
translation: How fortunate is that eye that has got a glimpse of the face of the Beloved!

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦੁਮਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਸੂੲਿ ੳੂ ਸਤ ||੨੧੮||
transliteration: maradhum chasham dho aalam sooe oo sath | 218 |
translation: Eyes of the people of both the worlds are fixed towards it. (218)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਜਹਾਨੋ ਅਾਂ ਜਹਾਂ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਪੁਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: ee jehaano aa jehaa(n) az hak pur asatha
translation: This and the other world are satiated with the Truth;

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਮਰਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬ-ਅਾਲਮ ਕਮਤਰ ਅਸਤ ||੨੧੯||
transliteration: laek maradh hak ba-aalam kamathar asath | 219 |
translation: But devoted men of God are rare in this world. (219)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਕੂ ਬ-ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਮਰੰਗ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: har kasae koo ba-khudhaa hamarang shudha
translation: If some one became indistinguishable with Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਵਸਫ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਦਰ ਮੁਲਕਿ ਰੂਮੋ ਜ਼ੰਗ ਸ਼ੁਦ ||੨੨੦||
transliteration: vasaf oo dhar mulak roomo zang shudh | 220 |
translation: Then his glory spreads in countries like Rome and Africa. (220)

gurmukhi: ਮਾਅਨੀੲੇ ਯਕਰੰਗੀ ਅਾਮਦ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: maaaneeeae yakarangee aamadh shaauak haka
translation: To get assimilated in the Entity of God is, in fact, real love for Him;

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਅਾਰਾਮ ਅੰਦਰ ਜ਼ੌਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੨੨੧||
transliteration: bandhaa raa aaraam andhar zaauak hak | 221 |
translation: And, it is only with a real devotion for Him that one gets eternal bliss. (221)

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਬਰੰਗਿ ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਬਾ ੲਿ?ਜ਼ੋ ਜਾਹ
transliteration: oo barang saahibee baa ezio jaaha
translation: Under the influence of Akaalpurakh, (Accepting the Will of Waaheguru)  he enjoys eclat and honors;

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਬਾਰੰਗ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਅੰਦਰ ਪਨਾਹ ||੨੨੨||
transliteration: maa baarang bandhagee andhar panaah | 222 |
translation: We, under the influence of meditation, have sought his (His) shelter and refuge. (222)

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਬਰੰਗਿ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਂ ਰਵਾ
transliteration: oo barang saahib faramaa(n) ravaa
translation: Accepting Waaheguru's Will, he is the king of the world and his command prevails all over;

gurmukhi: ਮਾ ਬਰੰਗਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਨਿਜ਼ਦਸ਼ ਗਦਾ ||੨੨੩||
transliteration: maa barang bandhagee nizadhash gadhaa | 223 |
translation: We, under the influence of meditation, are just beggars before him. (223)

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਬਰੰਗਿ ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਦਾਰਦ ਨਜ਼ਰ
transliteration: oo barang saahibee dhaaradh nazara
translation: He, while imbued in accepting Master's Will, keeps a close watch on us;

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਖ਼ਬਰ ||੨੨੪||
transliteration: bandhaa raa az bandhagee baashadh khabar | 224 |
translation: And, one can get to know him only through meditation. (224)

gurmukhi: ੳੁਮਰ ਹਾ ਜੋਯਾੲਿ ੲੀਂ ਦੌਲਤ ਸ਼ੁਦੰਦ
transliteration: oumar haa joyaae ee dhaaualath shudhandha
translation: They kept looking for such a treasure for ages;

gurmukhi: ਸਾਲਹਾ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਾਕਿ ੲੀਂ ਸੁਹਬਤ ਸ਼ੁਦੰਦ ||੨੨੫||
transliteration: saalehaa mushathaak ee suhabath shudhandh | 225 |
translation: They were anxiously desirous of such a company for years. (225)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਰਾ ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਜ਼ਾਂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਨਸੀਬ
transliteration: har kasae raa zaraa zaa(n) baashadh naseeba
translation: Anyone who was fortunate enough to attain even an atomic particle of such a wealth,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਬਖ਼ੂਬੀ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਿ ਨਜੀਬ ||੨੨੬||
transliteration: aa bakhoobee gashath khurasheedh najeeb | 226 |
translation: He became an extraordinary sun easily and spontaneously. (226)

gurmukhi: ਗੈਰ ੳੂ ਯਾਅਨੀ ਜ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਗਫ਼ਲਤ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: gair oo yaaanee z hak gafalath bavadha
translation: The underlying meaning of living without the memory of Waaheguru is complete ignorance and naivety.

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਸਰਮਾਯਾੲਿ ਦੌਲਤ ਬਵਦ ||੨੨੭||
transliteration: yaadh oo saramaayaae dhaaualath bavadh | 227 |
translation: The valuable asset of the remembrance of Akaalpurakh becomes the treasure of some fortunate beings. (227)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਤਾ ਮੁਯ?ਸਰ ਮੀ-ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: dheedhan hak thaa muyasar mee-shavadha
translation: One can get a glimpse of the Omnipotent only

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਂ ਤਅਸੁਰ ਮੀ-ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੨੮||
transliteration: suhabath maradhaa(n) thaasur mee-shavadh | 228 |
translation: When one's association with noble saints become fruitful. (228)

gurmukhi: ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਰ ਦਿਲ ਅਗਰ ਮਾਵਾ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: haraf hak dhar dhil agar maavaa kunadha
translation: If someone can abide even one word of Truth in his heart,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਬੁਨਿ ਹਰ ਮੂੲਿ ੳੂ ਹ?ਕ ਜਾ ਕੁਨਦ ||੨੨੯||
transliteration: dhar bun har mooe oo hak jaa kunadh | 229 |
translation: Then, Truth but nothing but the Truth gets assimilated to the roots of each of his hair. (229)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਰਾ ਸੂੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੀ-ਅਾਦਰਸ਼
transliteration: har k khudh raa sooe hak mee-aadharasha
translation: Anyone who can direct himself towards the divine path of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਨੂਰਿ-ਹ?ਕ ਮੀ-ਬਾਰਦਸ਼ ||੨੩੦||
transliteration: az rukh oo noori-hak mee-baaradhash | 230 |
translation: God's glory and splendor radiates from his face. (230)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ੈਜ ਅਜ਼ ਤੁਫ਼ੈਲਿ ਸੁਹਬਤ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: ee hamaa faij az thufail suhabath asatha
translation: All this benevolence and benignity is because of them and their blessings,

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਦੌਲਤ ਅਸਤ ||੨੩੧||
transliteration: suhabath maradhaan hak khush dhaaualath asath | 231 |
translation: The company of saintly persons (of God) is one priceless asset. (231)

gurmukhi: ਹੀਚ ਕਸ ਅਜ਼ ਹਾਲਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਅਾਗਾਹ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: heech kas az haal shaa(n) aagaah neesatha
translation: No one really understands or appreciates the state of mind of these noble royalties;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਓ ਮਿਹ ਰਾ ਦਰਾਂਜਾ ਰਾਹ ਨੀਸਤ ||੨੩੨||
transliteration: har k ou mih raa dharaa(n)jaa raah neesath | 232 |
translation: Every Tom, Dick or Harry does not have the wherewithal to reach there (them). (232)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਨਜ਼ਰ ਅਾੲਿੰਦ ਚੂੰ ਜ਼ਾਤਿ ਅ?ਲਾਹ
transliteration: dhar nazar aaeindh choon zaath alaaha
translation: In appearance, they look just like an embodiment of the specie of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਪਨਾਹ ||੨੩੩||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath har dho aalam apanaah | 233 |
translation: In reality, they are the refuge for everyone in both the worlds. (233)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਕਸਬ ਬਾਸ਼ੰਦ ਅਾਜ਼ਾਦ ਅਜ਼ ਕਸਬ
transliteration: dhar kasab baashandh aazaadh az kasaba
translation: While engaged in their professions or trades, they are still unattached and unduly engrossed in them;

gurmukhi: ੳੁਮਰ ਗੁਜ਼ਰਾਨੰਦ ਅੰਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਰ?ਬ ||੨੩੪||
transliteration: oumar guzaraanandh andhar yaadh rab | 234 |
translation: They spend their lives in remembering the Provident (day and night). (234)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਰਾ ਚੂੰ ਮੂਰ ਬਿਸ਼ਨਾਸੰਦ ਸ਼ਾਂ
transliteration: khaesh raa choon moor bishanaasandh shaa(n)
translation: They, the noble souls, consider themselves (out of humility) just like an ant,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਬਿਹਤਰ ਅਜ਼ ਪੀਲਿ ਦਮਾਂ ||੨੩੫||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath bihathar az peel dhamaa(n) | 235 |
translation: Even though they, in fact, might be more powerful than a ferocious and dangerous elephant. (235)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿ ਮੀ-ਬੀਨੀ ਹਮਾ ਹੈਰਾਨਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ
transliteration: har ch mee-beenee hamaa hairaan shaa
translation: Whatever you are seeing in this world is simply astonished and confounded about them;

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਬਿਹਤਰ ਬਵਦ ਅਜ਼ ੲਿਮਤਿਹਾਂ ||੨੩੬||
transliteration: shaan shaa(n) bihathar bavadh az eimathihaa(n) | 236 |
translation: Their splendor and aura is far superior than even that of the examinations. (236)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਰਮ
transliteration: suhabath maradhaan hak baashadh karama
translation: The company of the true devotees of Waaheguru is a great boon;

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤੇ ਕਅਾਂ ਰਾ ਨਭਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਹੀਚ ਗ਼ਮ ||੨੩੭||
transliteration: dhaaualathae kaaa raa nabhabaashadh heech gham | 237 |
translation: Such a wealth and virtuosity does not suffer from any anxiety or grief. (237)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦ ਬਜ਼ੁਰਗੋ ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਨਿਸ਼ਸਤ
transliteration: khudh bazurago har kasae shaa(n) nishasatha
translation: They, themselves, are elevated, mature and blessed; anyone who happens to  be bestowed with their company;

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਬਜ਼ੁਰਗੀ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ਤਾਂ ਹਰ ਜਾ ਕਿ ਹਸਤ ||੨੩੮||
transliteration: oo bazuragee yaafath thaa(n) har jaa k hasath | 238 |
translation: He, too, becomes elevated, mature and blessed, and receives laurels everywhere. (238)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਕੂ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਰਾ ਬਿਸ਼ਨਾਖ਼ਤਾ
transliteration: har kasae koo khaesh raa bishanaakhathaa
translation: Anyone who has recognized his own reality;

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਤਰੀਕਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਪਰਦਾਖ਼ਤਾ ||੨੩੯||
transliteration: dhar thareek bandhagee paradhaakhathaa | 239 |
translation: Consider that he has adopted the mode or the method of meditation. (239)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਜ਼ਮੀਨੋ ਅਾਸਮਾਂ ਪੁਰ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: ee zameeno aasamaa(n) pur az khudhaa-satha
translation: This earth and the skies are saturated with (the creations of ) God,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਲਮੇ ਹਰ ਸੂ ਦਵਾਂ ਕਅਾਂ ਸ਼ਹਿ ਕੁਜਾ-ਸਤ ||੨੪੦||
transliteration: aalamae har soo dhavaa(n) kaaa shehi kujaa-sath | 240 |
translation: But this world keeps wandering and straying in all directions to find out as to where He is. (240)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਾ ਬਰ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਗਰ ਮੁਬਤਲਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: dheedhaa bar dheedhaar hak gar mubathalaa-satha
translation: If you can aim your eyes fixedly on a glimpse of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਮੀ ਬੀਨੀ ਬਚਸ਼ਮਤ ਹ?ਕ-ਨੁਮਾ-ਸਤ ||੨੪੧||
transliteration: har chih mee beenee bachashamath haka-numaa-sath | 241 |
translation: Then, whatever you see will be a vision of the Almighty Waaheguru. (241)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਦੀਦ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਦੀਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: har k shaa(n) raa dheedh hak raa dheedhaa asatha
translation: Anyone who has seen that noble soul, consider that he has got a glimpse of the Omnipotent;

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਤਰੀਕਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਫ਼ਹਿਮੀਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੨੪੨||
transliteration: oo thareek bandhagee fehimeedhaa asath | 242 |
translation: And, that person has perceived and realized the path of meditation. (242)

gurmukhi: ਤਰਜ਼ਿ ਯ?ਕ-ਰੰਗੀ ਅਜਬ ਰੰਗ ਅਾਰਦਸ਼
transliteration: tharaz yaka-rangee ajab rang aaradhasha
translation: The focus on devotion for God brings in with it an unusual complexion of disposition,

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਬਦਨ ਨੂਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਮੀ-ਬਾਰਦਸ਼ ||੨੪੩||
transliteration: kaz badhan noor khudhaa mee-baaradhash | 243 |
translation: The splendor and radiance of Akaalpurakh then oozes out from each and every aspect of such a dedicated devotion. (243)

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਬਰੰਗਿ ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ੲੀਂ ਹਸਤੋ ਬੂਦ
transliteration: oo barang saahibee ee hasatho boodha
translation: He is the Master of all this illusion (of materialism), this is His own form;

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬ-ਅਾਦਾਬ ਸਜੂਦ ||੨੪੪||
transliteration: bandhagee dhaaeim ba-aadhaab sajoodh | 244 |
translation: And, His meditation, with respect and prostrations, always seems apt. (244)

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਬਰੰਗਿ ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਅਰਸ਼ਾਦਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: oo barang saahibee arashaadh oo
translation: He is the shape and form of the Master and only His command prevails;

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀ ਤਾ ਸਰ ਕਦਮ ਬੁਬਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ||੨੪੫||
transliteration: bandhagee thaa sar kadham bubayaadh oo | 245 |
translation: The meditation from head to toe also emerges out of (because of) Him. (245)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬੇ ਬਾ ਸਾਹਿਬਾਂ ਜ਼ੇਬਦ ਮੁਦਾਮ
transliteration: saahibae baa saahibaa(n) zaebadh mudhaama
translation: A Master looks graceful and befitting only among the Masters,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਦਰ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਿਅਾਮ ||੨੪੬||
transliteration: bandhaa raa dhar bandhagee baashadh kiaam | 246 |
translation: A person should, therefore, continue to stay in meditation all the times. (246)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਾਂ ਰਾ ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਸ਼ੁਅਾਰ
transliteration: saahibaa(n) raa saahibee baashadh shuaara
translation: The character of Masters is to be master-like,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਦਰ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਫ਼ਸਲਿ ਬਹਾਰ ||੨੪੭||
transliteration: bandhaa raa dhar bandhagee fasal behaar | 247 |
translation: And, a man has the spring season around him only when he meditates. (247)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਾਂ ਰਾ ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: saahibaa(n) raa saahibee dhaaeim bavadha
translation: The master-ship character, His praises, of the Master is eternal,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਹਮ ਦਰ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ ||੨੪੮||
transliteration: bandhaa ham dhar bandhagee kaaeim bavadh | 248 |
translation: And, the meditation of a human being is permanent. (248)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਤੂ ਸਰ-ਗਸ਼ਤਾੲੀ
transliteration: az baraae aa k thoo sara-gashathaaee
translation: For this, you have turned your head away from Him, you have strayed;

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਪੲੇ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਰ-ਗਸ਼ਤਾੲੀ ||੨੪੯||
transliteration: az peae dhuniaa z hak bara-gashathaaee | 249 |
translation: That you have turned your face away from Him just for the sake of this material  world. (249)

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਗੀਤੀ ਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਪਾੲਿਦਾਰ
transliteration: dhaaualath geethee n baashadh paaeidhaara
translation: The worldly riches are not going to last for ever,

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਰਾ ਬਸੂੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਿਅਾਰ ||੨੫੦||
transliteration: yak nafas khudh raa basooe hak biaar | 250 |
translation: (Therefore) You should turn yourself towards Waaheguru even for just one moment. (250)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਦਿਲਿ ਤੂ ਮਾੲਿਲਿ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: choon dhil thoo maaeil yaadh khudhaa-satha
translation: When your heart and soul becomes inclined towards remembering Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਪਾਕ ਕੈ ਅਜ਼ ਤੂ ਜੁਦਾ-ਸਤ ||੨੫੧||
transliteration: aa khudhaae paak kai az thoo judhaa-sath | 251 |
translation: Then, how and when would that pious and chaste Waaheguru be separated from you? (251)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੂ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ-ਬਾਸ਼ੀ ਅਜ਼ ਫ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਬੁਲੰਦ
transliteration: gar thoo ghaafila-baashee az fikar bulandha
translation: If you remain negligent about paying close attention to the remembrance of lofty Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਕੁਜਾ ਓ ੳੂ ਕੁਜਾ ਅੈ ਹੋਸ਼ਮੰਦ ||੨੫੨||
transliteration: thoo kujaa ou oo kujaa ai hoshamandh | 252 |
translation: Then, you mentally alert person! How can there be a meeting between you and Him (You are here and He is somewhere else)? (252)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਦਰਦਿ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਰਾ ਦਵਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: yaadh oo dharadh dho aalam raa dhavaa-satha
translation: Memory of Waaheguru is the cure-all for all pains and agonies of both the worlds;

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਹਰ ਗੁਮ-ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਰਾ ਰਾਹਨੁਮਾ ਸਤ ||੨੫੩||
transliteration: yaadh oo har guma-shudhaa raa raahanumaa sath | 253 |
translation: His memory also directs all lost and strayed ones to the correct path. (253)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ੲੀਂ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਰਾ ਲਾਜ਼ਮ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: yaadh oo ee jumalaa raa laazam bavadha
translation: His remembrance is absolutely imperative for everyone,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਮੁਲਜ਼ਮ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੨੫੪||
transliteration: har k ghaafil shudh azo mulazam shavadh | 254 |
translation: And, anyone who becomes negligent and forgets Him is indeed guilty. (254)

gurmukhi: ਯਾ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਤੌਫ਼ੀਕ ਦਿਹ
transliteration: yaa eilaahee bandhaa raa thaauafeek dhiha
translation: O Akaalpurakh ! Kindly bless me with such a courage and strength,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬ-ਯਾਦਤ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰਦ ੲੀਂ ੳੁਮਰ ਬਿਹ ||੨੫੫||
transliteration: thaa ba-yaadhath biguzaradh ee oumar bih | 255 |
translation: So that this life of mine is spent in a worthwhile manner in remembering You. (255)

gurmukhi: ੳੁਮਰ ਅਾਂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: oumar aa baashadh k dhar yaadh khudhaa
translation: That life is worth living that is spent in remembering Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰਦ ਦੀਗਰ ਨਭਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਮੁਦਅਾ ||੨੫੬||
transliteration: biguzaradh dheegar nabhabaashadh mudhaaa | 256 |
translation: Any part of it spent without His memory, is simply a waste and useless. (256)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਦਅਾ ਬਿਹਤਰ ਜੁਜ਼ ਯਾਦ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: mudhaaa bihathar juz yaadh neesatha
translation: There is no purpose (of life) better than the remembrance of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਯਾਦਸ਼ ੲੀਂ ਦਿਲਿ ਮਾ ਸ਼ਾਦ ਨੀਸਤ ||੨੫੭||
transliteration: ghair yaadhash ee dhil maa shaadh neesath | 257 |
translation: And, our hearts and minds can never be pleased without remembering Him. (257)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਾਦੀੲਿ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਵਦ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: shaadheee dhaaeim bavadh yaadh khudhaa
translation: The nostalgia about Waaheguru bestows upon us an eternal elation;

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਦੌਲਤ ਕਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਰਾਹਨੁਮਾ ||੨੫੮||
transliteration: ai zehae dhaaualath k baashadh raahanumaa | 258 |
translation: How fortunate we are that it shows us the direction (in our lives)!(258)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਚਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਰ ਜੁਮਲਾੲਿ ਦਿਲਹਾ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: gar ch hak dhar jumalaae dhilehaa bavadha
translation: Even though Akaalpurakh abides in the hearts of everyone,

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ੲੀਮਾਂ ਬਵਦ ||੨੫੯||
transliteration: laek aarif saahib eemaa(n) bavadh | 259 |
translation: Still, only an enlightened persons can be called 'a man of faith and religion'. (259)

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਕਾਬਲਿ ਦੀਦਾਰ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: chasham aarif kaabal dheedhaar hasatha
translation: Only the eye of an enlightened person deserves a glimpse of the Almighty;

gurmukhi: ਮਰਦਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ ਵਾਕਿਫ਼ਿ ਅਸਰਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੨੬੦||
transliteration: maradh aarif vaakif asaraar hasath | 260 |
translation: And, it is only the heart of a knowledgeable person who is familiar with His mysteries. (260)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਦੂਸਤ ਦਾਰ
transliteration: suhabath maradhaan hak raa dhoosath dhaara
translation: You should develop friendship with the noble souls and should keep their company;

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਤੂ ਹਮ ਗਰਦੀ ਜ਼ਿ ਯਮਨਸ਼ ਰੁਸਤਗਾਰ ||੨੬੧||
transliteration: thaa thoo ham garadhee z yamanash rusathagaar | 261 |
translation: So that, with the Providential blessings, you may be redeemed from the cycles of transmigration. (261)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਹਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ੲੀਸ਼ਾਂ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: har chih hasath az suhabath eeshaa(n) bavadha
translation: Whatever is visible in this world is all due to company of saintly persons;

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਂ ਕਿ ਜਿਸਮੋ ਜਾ ਸਰਾਪਾ ਜਾਂ ਬਵਦ ||੨੬੨||
transliteration: zaa(n) k jisamo jaa saraapaa jaa(n) bavadh | 262 |
translation: Because our bodies and souls are, in fact, the soul of the Provident. (262)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦੁਮਾਨਿ ਦੀਦਾ ਰੋਸ਼ਨ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਜ਼ੋ
transliteration: muradhumaan dheedhaa roshan shudh azo
translation: The pupils of my eyes are fully lighted only because of their company;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਜਿਸਮਮ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਗੁਲਸ਼ਨ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਜ਼ੋ ||੨੬੩||
transliteration: khaak jisamam jumalaa gulashan shudh azo | 263 |
translation: And, the dirt of my body, for the same reason, is transformed into a lush garden. (263)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਸਹੁਬਤ ਕਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਅਕਸੀਰ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: ai zehae sahubath k khaak akaseer karadha
translation: Blessed is that association that has transformed a dirt into a cure-all;

gurmukhi: ਨਾਕਸੇ ਰਾ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਤਦਬੀਰ ਕਰਦ ||੨੬੪||
transliteration: naakasae raa saahib thadhabeer karadh | 264 |
translation: And, converted every lowly uniformed person into knowledgeable and intelligent. (264)

gurmukhi: ਗੋਹਰੋ ਲਾਲੋ ਜਵਾਹਰ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ
transliteration: goharo laalo javaahar paesh shaa(n)
translation: I present myself in the form of pearls, rubies and gems to my Beloved,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦਮੇ ਕੂ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰਦ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਅਾਂ ||੨੬੫||
transliteration: har dhamae koo biguzaradh dhar yaadh aaa(n) | 265 |
translation: When I spend every moment of my life in His memory. (265)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਜਵਾਹਰ-ਹਾ ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ਾਨੀ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: ee javaahara-haa hamaa faanee bavadha
translation: All these worldly diamonds and pearls are perishable;

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਰ ਬੰਦਾ ਅਰਜ਼ਾਨੀ ਬਵਦ ||੨੬੬||
transliteration: yaadh hak bar bandhaa arazaanee bavadh | 266 |
translation: The remembrance of Waaheguru, however, is extremely valuable for a human being. (266)

gurmukhi: ਰਸਮਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਦਾਨੀ ਕਿ ਚੀਸਤ
transliteration: rasam maradhaan khudhaa dhaanee k cheesatha
translation: Do you know what is the custom and tradition of the devotees of Omnipotent?

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਾਰਿਗ਼ ਅੰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਕੈਦਹਾੲਿ ਮਰਜੋ ਜ਼ੀਸਤ ||੨੬੭||
transliteration: faarigh andh az kaidhehaae marajo zeesath | 267 |
translation: They are redeemed and are free from the imprisonment of the cycles of births and deaths for ever. (267)

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਬੇ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਨਭਗੁਜ਼ਾਸ਼ਤੰਦ
transliteration: yak nafas bae yaadh hak nabhaguzaashathandha
translation: They do not spend even one moment without remembering Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਅਾਲਮ ਬਰ ਨਹੁ ਤਬਕ ਅਫਰਾਸ਼ਤੰਦ ||੨੬੮||
transliteration: khush aalam bar nahu thabak afaraashathandh | 268 |
translation: They unfurl their beautiful flag (of meditation) over all the nine skies. (268)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੈਰਖ਼ਾਹਿ ਜੁਲਗੀ ਪੈਦਾੲਿਸ਼ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: khairakhaahi julagee paidhaaeish andha
translation: They wish and pray for the well-being of the entire created world,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੇਬ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਿ ੲੀਂ ਹਮਾ ਅਾਰਾੲਿਸ਼ ਅੰਦ ||੨੬੯||
transliteration: zaeb bakhash ee hamaa aaraaeish andh | 269 |
translation: It is them who bless all these creations and natural beauties with grace and elegance. (269)

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਜ਼ੇਵਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: naam hak maradhaan hak raa zaevar asatha
translation: The Naam of Waaheguru is an ornament for His noble and saintly devotees,

gurmukhi: ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਅਜ਼ ਨੂਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਪੁਰ ਗੌਹਰ ਅਸਤ ||੨੭੦||
transliteration: chasham shaa(n) az noor hak pur gaauehar asath | 270 |
translation: And, the eye of these nobilities is always full of pearls and gems because of the refulgent glow of the Almighty. (270)

gurmukhi: ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਤਾਅਲੀਮਿ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਜਾਵਿਦਾਂ
transliteration: haraf shaa(n) thaaaleem oumar jaavidhaa(n)
translation: Their words are a lessons for a permanent life,

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਾਰੰਦ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ ||੨੭੧||
transliteration: yaadh hak dhaarandh dhaaeim bar zubaa(n) | 271 |
translation: And, the memory of Akaalpurakh abides on their lips/tongue for ever. (271)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਮੀਗੋੲਿੰਦ ਅਰਸ਼ਾਦਸਤੋ ਬਸ
transliteration: har chih meegoeindh arashaadhasatho basa
translation: Their utterances have the status of the words of Divine,

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਨਮੀ ਅਾਰੰਦ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਨਫ਼ਸ ||੨੭੨||
transliteration: bar namee aarandh ghair az hak nafas | 272 |
translation: And, not even one breath of theirs is spent without remembering Him. (272)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਹਮਾ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਾਕਿ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: ee hamaa mushathaak dheedhaar khudhaa-satha
translation: All these saintly persons are really seekers of a Divine glimpse,

gurmukhi: ਬੋਸਤਾਨਿ ਦਹਿਰ ਗੁਲਜ਼ਾਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ ||੨੭੩||
transliteration: bosathaan dhehir gulazaar khudhaa-sath | 273 |
translation: And, this delightful worldly spread is, in fact, a heavenly flower bed. (273)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਬਾ-ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ
transliteration: har k baa-maradhaan hak shudh aashanaa
translation: Whosoever developed a friendship with the devotees of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਸਾੲਿਅਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਬਿਹਤਰ ਅਜ਼ ਬਾਲਿ ਹੁਮਾ ||੨੭੪||
transliteration: saaeiaae oo bihathar az baal humaa | 274 |
translation: Take it that his shadow (on them) will be many times more blessed than the shadow of the feathers of  the Humaa bird (It is said that a shadow of Humaa bird can bestow the kingdom of the world). (274)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਯਾਅਨੀ ਜ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਬਿਗ਼ੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤਨ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: yaadh hak yaaanee z khudh bighuzashathan asatha
translation: We should take it that getting absorbed in Waaheguru's meditation is to give up self-ego,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ਿਅਾਲਿ ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਵਾਰੁਸਤਨ ਅਸਤ ||੨੭੫||
transliteration: az khiaal ghair hak vaarusathan asath | 275 |
translation: And, not thinking about Him would get us stuck in every other worldly attraction. (275)

gurmukhi: ਰਸਤਗੀ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ਵਾਰਸਤਗੀ-ਸਤ
transliteration: rasathagee az khaeshathan vaarasathagee-satha
translation: To redeem ourselves from our egos is the real emancipation,

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ਦਿਲ-ਬਸਤਗੀ-ਸਤ ||੨੭੬||
transliteration: baa khudhaae khaeshathan dhila-basathagee-sath | 276 |
translation: And, to tie up our minds with Waaheguru's devotion is also real deliverance. (276)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸ ਕੂ ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਦਿਲ ਬਸਤਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: har kas koo baa khudhaa dhil basathaa asatha
translation: Whosoever has linked and attached his mind to the Almighty,

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਜ਼ ਚਰਖ਼ਿ ਨਹੁ ਤਬਕ ਬਰ-ਜਸਤਾ ਅਸਤ ||੨੭੭||
transliteration: oo z charakh nahu thabak bara-jasathaa asath | 277 |
translation: Take it that he has easily leaped over a sky equipped even with nine locks. (277)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਦਿਲ-ਬਸਤਗਾਨਿ ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: suhabath dhila-basathagaan baa khudhaa
translation: The company of such God-attached devotees,

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਮੁਯ?ਸਰ ਅਾੲਿਦਤ ੲੀਂ ਕੀਮੀਅਾ ||੨੭੮||
transliteration: kai muyasar aaeidhath ee keemeeaa | 278 |
translation: Take it that it is the cure-all; however, how can we be fortunate enough to obtain it? (278)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਨੋ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਹੈਰਾਂ ਮਾਂਦਾ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: dheeno dhuniaa har dho hairaa(n) maa(n)dhaa andha
translation: Both the faith and the religion are amazed,

gurmukhi: ਬਸ ਜ਼ ਹੈਰਾਨੀ ਪ੍ਰੀਸ਼ਾਂ ਮਾਂਦਾ ਅੰਦ ||੨੭੯||
transliteration: bas z hairaanee preeshaa(n) maa(n)dhaa andh | 279 |
translation: And in this amazement beyond limits they are perplexed. (279)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿਹ ਰਾ ੲੀਂ ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂੲੇ ਪਾਕ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: har kih raa ee aarazooeae paak hasatha
translation: Whosoever imbibes such a chaste and divine desire,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ੳੂ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਅਦਰਾਕ ਹਸਤ ||੨੮੦||
transliteration: murashadh oo saahib adharaak hasath | 280 |
translation: His Guru (teacher) is the master of innate and intrinsic knowledge. (280)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਸਿਲਾਨਿ-ਹ?ਕ ਤੁਰਾ ਵਾਸਿਲ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: vaasilaani-hak thuraa vaasil kunandha
translation: God connected noble saints can make your connection with Him,

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਰਾ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੮੧||
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh raa haasil kunandh | 281 |
translation: They can also help you to obtain the eternal treasure, the Naam. (281)

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh paesh aarif asatha
translation: This is an immortal achievement for an enlightened person,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਸਖ਼ੁਨ ਮਸ਼ਹੂਰ ਬਸ ਮੁਤਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਅਸਤ ||੨੮੨||
transliteration: ee sakhun mashehoor bas muthaaarif asath | 282 |
translation: This adage is commonly well known, and everyone is well acquainted with it. (282)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਨੋ ਕਾਮਿਲਾਨੋ ਵਾਸਿਲਾਂ
transliteration: aarifaano kaamilaano vaasilaa(n)
translation: The enlightened, perfect and submerged into the love of God devotees;

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਿ ੳੂ ਦਾਰਦ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ ||੨੮੩||
transliteration: naam oo dhaaradh dhaaeim bar zubaa(n) | 283 |
translation: They always have His Naam on their tongues and lips in meditation. (283)

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਬਵਦ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: bandhageee shaa(n) bavadh zikar khudhaa
translation: To continually meditate on His Naam is their worship;

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਹ?ਕ-ਨੁਮਾ ||੨੮੪||
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh baashadh haka-numaa | 284 |
translation: And, the eternal treasure blessed by Akaalpurakh directs one towards His path. (284)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਨੁਮਾੲਿਦ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਰੂ
transliteration: choon numaaeidh dhaaualath jaaveedh roo
translation: When the divine eternal treasure shows Its face,

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਬਾਸ਼ੀ ਵਾ ਹ?ਕ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਜ਼ ਤੂ ||੨੮੫||
transliteration: thoo z hak baashee vaa hak baashadh z thoo | 285 |
translation: You would then belong to Waaheguru and He would belong to you. (285)

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਦਿਲਤ ਗਰ ਪਰਤਵੇ ਹ?ਕ ਬਰਫ਼ਗੰਦ
transliteration: bar dhilath gar parathavae hak barafagandha
translation: If the shadow of Akaalpurakh falls on someone's heart and soul,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਰਿ ਹਿਜਰਤ ਰਾ ਜ਼ ਪਾੲਿ ਦਿਲ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੨੮੬||
transliteration: khaar hijarath raa z paae dhil kunandh | 286 |
translation: Then take it that the painful thorn of separation has been extracted out of the foot (depth) of our mind. (286)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਰਿ ਹਿਜਰ ਅਜ਼ ਪਾੲਿ ਦਿਲ ਚੂੰ ਦੂਰ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: khaar hijar az paae dhil choon dhoor shudha
translation: When the thorn of separation has been removed from the feet of the heart,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ਦਿਲ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਮਾਮੂਰ ਸ਼ੁਦ ||੨੮੭||
transliteration: khaanaae dhil az khudhaa maamoor shudh | 287 |
translation: Take it then that the Akaalpurakh has made the temple of our heart as His abode. (287)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਕਤਰਾ ਕੂ ਬਦਰਿਅਾ ਦਰ ਫ਼ਤਾਦ
transliteration: hamachoo katharaa koo badhariaa dhar fathaadha
translation: Like that drop of water that fell into a river or ocean, giving up its own identity (showing humility),

gurmukhi: ਅੈਨ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਗਸ਼ਤੋ ਵਸਲਸ਼ ਦਸਤਦਾਦ ||੨੮੮||
transliteration: ain dhariaa gashatho vasalash dhasathadhaadh | 288 |
translation: It itself became the river and the ocean; (thus falling on the feet of Aakaalpurakh), and convergence with Him took place. (288)

gurmukhi: ਕਤਰਾ ਚੂੰ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਬਦਰਿਅਾ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ
transliteration: katharaa choon shudh badhariaa aashanaa
translation: Once the drop merges into the ocean,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਅਦ ਅਜ਼ਾਂ ਤਫ਼ਰੀਕ ਨਤਵਾਂ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਜ਼ ਜਾ ||੨੮੯||
transliteration: baaadh azaa(n) thafareek nathavaa(n) shudh z jaa | 289 |
translation: After that, it cannot be separated from the ocean. (289)

gurmukhi: ਕਤਰਾ ਚੂੰ ਜਾਨਿਬਿ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਸ਼ਤਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: katharaa choon jaanib dhariaa shathaafatha
translation: When the drop started to rush in the direction of the ocean,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਰਹਿ ਤਫ਼ਰੀਕ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਰਾ ਕਤਰਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ||੨੯੦||
transliteration: az rehi thafareek khudh raa katharaa yaafath | 290 |
translation: It, then, realized the significance of being just a drop of water. (290)

gurmukhi: ਕਤਰਾ ਰਾ ੲੀਂ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਚੂੰ ਦਸਤਦਾਦ
transliteration: katharaa raa ee dhaaualath choon dhasathadhaadha
translation: When the drop was bestowed with this eternal meeting,

gurmukhi: ਕਤਰਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅੰਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਬਾ-ਮੁਰਾਦ ||੨੯੧||
transliteration: katharaa shudh andhar hakeekath baa-muraadh | 291 |
translation: The reality dawned on it, and its long-cherished desire was fulfilled. (291)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਫ਼ਤ ਮਨ ਯ?ਕ ਕਤਰਾ ਅਾਬੀ ਬੂਦਾ ਅਮ
transliteration: gufath man yak katharaa aabee boodhaa ama
translation: The droplet said, Even though I am a small drop of water,

gurmukhi: ਪੈਹਨਿ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਰਾ ਚੁਨਾਂ ਪੈਮੂਦਾ ਅਮ ||੨੯੨||
transliteration: paihan dhariaa raa chunaa(n) paimoodhaa am | 292 |
translation: I have been able to measure the expanse of this huge ocean. (292)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਮਰਾ ਦਰ ਬਾਜ਼ ਰਾਹਿ ਲੁਤਫ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼
transliteration: gar maraa dhar baaz raahi luthaf khaesha
translation: If the ocean, out of its extreme kindness, would agree to take me in,

gurmukhi: ਵਾਸਿਲ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਕਰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਅੰਦਾਜ਼ਾ ਬੇਸ਼ ||੨੯੩||
transliteration: vaasil khudh karadh az andhaazaa baesh | 293 |
translation: And, it agreed to merge me into itself even beyond its capacity; (293)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਮੌਜ ਅਜ਼ ਪੈਹਨਿ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਰੂ ਨਮੂਦ
transliteration: hamachoo maauaj az paihan dhariaa roo namoodha
translation: And, it rose like a tidal wave out of the span of the ocean,

gurmukhi: ਮੌਜ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਵਾ ਕਰਦ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਰਾ ਸਜੂਦ ||੨੯੪||
transliteration: maauaj gashath vaa karadh dhariaa raa sajoodh | 294 |
translation: It became another wave, and then bowed in reverence to the ocean. (294)

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਚੁਨਾਂ ਹਰ ਬੰਦਾ ਕੁ ਵਾਸਿਲ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: ham chunaa(n) har bandhaa k vaasil asatha
translation: In the same manner, every such person who had a confluence with the Almighty,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਤਰੀਕਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਬਸ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਅਸਤ ||੨੯੫||
transliteration: dhar thareek bandhagee bas kaamil asath | 295 |
translation: Became complete and perfect on the path of meditation. (295)

gurmukhi: ਮੌਜੌ ਦਰਿਅਾ ਗਰ ਚਿ ਦਰ ਮਾਅਨੀ ਯਕੇਸਤ
transliteration: maauajaau dhariaa gar ch dhar maaanee yakaesatha
translation: In reality, a wave and the ocean are one and the same,

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਅੰਦਰ ੲੀਨੋ ਅਾਂ ਫ਼ਰਕੇ ਬਸੇਸਤ ||੨੯੬||
transliteration: laek andhar eeno aa farakae basaesath | 296 |
translation: But still there is a vast difference between them. (296)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਯਕੇ ਮੌਜਮ ਤੂ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਬੇਕਰਾਂ
transliteration: man yakae maauajam thoo behir baekaraa(n)
translation: I am just a simple wave, while you are an enormously large ocean,

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਰਕ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ਮੀਨੋ ਅਾਸਮਾਂ ||੨੯੭||
transliteration: farak baashadh az zameeno aasamaa(n) | 297 |
translation: Thus, there is a big difference between you and me like that between the earth and the sky. (297)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਨੀਅ?ਮ ੲੀਂ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਅਜ਼ ਅਲਤਾਫ਼ਿ ਤੂ
transliteration: man neeam ee jumalaa az alathaaf thoo
translation: I am nothing; all this (that I am) is only because of your blessings,

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਯ?ਕ ਮੌਜਮ ਜ਼ ਤਬਅਾੲਿ ਸਾਫ਼ਿ ਤੂ ||੨੯੮||
transliteration: man yak maauajam z thabaaae saaf thoo | 298 |
translation: I am, too, one wave in Your vast manifest world. (298)

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਬਜ਼ੁਰਗਾਂ ਸੁਹਬਤੇ ਮੀ ਬਾੲਿਦਤ
transliteration: baa bazuragaa(n) suhabathae mee baaeidhatha
translation: You would need the association with the noble persons,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਹੁਮਾ ਅ?ਵਲ ਹਮੀਂ ਮੀ ਬਾੲਿਦਤ ||੨੯੯||
transliteration: az humaa aval hamee mee baaeidhath | 299 |
translation: This will be the first and the foremost thing that you will need. (299)

gurmukhi: ਕਾਦਰਿ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਬਕੁਦਰਤ ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: kaadhar muthalik bakudharath zaahir asatha
translation: That perfect and complete Creator is visible through His own creations,

gurmukhi: ਦਰਮਿਅਾਨਿ ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਕਾਦਰ ਅਸਤ ||੩੦੦||
transliteration: dharamiaan kudharath khudh kaadhar asath | 300 |
translation: The Creator, in fact, abides amidst His own Nature and manifestations. (300)

gurmukhi: ਕਾਦਰੋ ਕੁਦਰਤ ਬਹਮ ਅਾਮੇਖ਼ਤੰਦ
transliteration: kaadharo kudharath beham aamaekhathandha
translation: The Creator and His creations are one and the same,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਮਤਾੲਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਰੇਖ਼ਤੰਦ ||੩੦੧||
transliteration: aa mathaae ghair hak raa raekhathandh | 301 |
translation: They, the noble persons, renounce all material distractions except the Provident. (301)

gurmukhi: ਪਸ ਤੁਰਾ ਹਮ ਬਾੲਿਦ ਅੈ ਯਾਰਿ ਅਜ਼ੀਜ਼
transliteration: pas thuraa ham baaeidh ai yaar azeeza
translation: O my dear friend! Then you should also make a judgement and conclude,

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਕੁਦਾਮ ਵਾ ਤੂ ਕੁਦਾਮੀ ਕੁਨ ਤਮੀਜ਼ ||੩੦੨||
transliteration: hak kudhaam vaa thoo kudhaamee kun thameez | 302 |
translation: As to who is God, and who you are, and how to distinguish between the two. (302)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੂ ਵਾਸਿਲ ਗਸ਼ਤਾੲੀ ਦਰ ਜ਼ਾਤਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: gar thoo vaasil gashathaaee dhar zaath oo
translation: If, in your pursuits, you happen to have a meeting with the Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਦੀਗਰ ਮਗੂ ||੩੦੩||
transliteration: ghair haraf bandhagee dheegar magoo | 303 |
translation: Then you should not utter any other word except the word of worship and meditation. (303)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਹਮਾ ਅਜ਼ ਦੌਲਤਿ ੲੀਂ ਬੰਦਗੀਸਤ
transliteration: ee hamaa az dhaaualath ee bandhageesatha
translation: All this tangible and non-tangible boons are because of the meditation,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਬੇ-ਬੰਦਗੀ ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਗਸਿਤ ||੩੦੪||
transliteration: zindhagee bae-bandhagee sharamindhagasith | 304 |
translation: Without meditation, this life of ours is only mortification and humiliation. (304)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਤਾਅਲਾ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਫ਼ਰਮੂਦਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: hak thaaalaa bandhagee faramoodhaa asatha
translation: The Almighty God has also said,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਕੂ ਬੰਦਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅਾਸੂਦਾ ਅਸਤ ||੩੦੫||
transliteration: har kasae koo bandhaa shudh aasoodhaa asath | 305 |
translation: Anyone who transformed himself into a man of God is redeemed. (305)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਅਨਅਲਹ?ਕ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ ੲਿਜ਼ਹਾਰ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: choon anaalehak bar zubaa(n) eizehaar karadha
translation: Anyone who proclaimed through his own mouth that he was God,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਰਅਾ ਅਾਂ ਮਨਸੂਰ ਰਾ ਬਰ-ਦਾਰ ਕਰਦ ||੩੦੬||
transliteration: sharaaa aa manasoor raa bara-dhaar karadh | 306 |
translation: The Islamic religious law crucified him just like Mansoor. (306)

gurmukhi: ਮਸਤੀੲੇ ਹ?ਕ ਮਾਅਨੀੲਿ ਹੁਸ਼ਿਅਾਰੀ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: masatheeeae hak maaaneee hushiaaree asatha
translation: Inebriated with God is, in fact, to be always in a state of alertness,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਖ਼ਾਬ ਹਮ ਬੇਦਾਰੀ ਅਸਤ ||੩੦੭||
transliteration: aarifaa(n) raa khaab ham baedhaaree asath | 307 |
translation: Even dreaming while asleep for the knowledgeable is indeed like staying awake. (307)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਬੇ-ਅਦਬ ਯਾਬਦ ਸਜ਼ਾ
transliteration: dhar hakeekath bae-adhab yaabadh sazaa
translation: In reality, a disrespectful faces the consequences (reaps the fruits) of his own actions,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਅਾਦਬ ਅਮਦ ਹਮਾ ਰਾ ਰਹਾਨੁਮਾ ||੩੦੮||
transliteration: choon aadhab amadh hamaa raa rehaanumaa | 308 |
translation: Because, it is the 'respect' and 'civility' that is capable of showing all the direction of the right path. (308)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੂ ਸਰ ਤਾ ਪਾ ਹਮਾ ਹ?ਕ ਗਸ਼ਤਾੲੀ
transliteration: gar thoo sar thaa paa hamaa hak gashathaaee
translation: If you have transformed yourself from head to toe into Akaalpurakh's form,

gurmukhi: ਵਾਸਿਲਿ ਬੇ-ਚੂਨਿ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਗਸ਼ਤਾੲੀ ||੩੦੯||
transliteration: vaasil bae-choon muthalik gashathaaee | 309 |
translation: And, If you have merged into that unparalleled and matchless Waaheguru, (309)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜ਼ ਰਾਹਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਦਰ ਪੇਸ਼ ਗੀਰ
transliteration: baaz raahi bandhagee dhar paesh geera
translation: Then you should adopt the path of meditation,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ ਵਾ ਰਾਹਿ ਖੇਸ਼ ਗੀਰ ||੩੧੦||
transliteration: bandhaae oo baash vaa raahi khaesh geer | 310 |
translation: And, become His (favorite) person by holding on to the divine spiritual  passage  of meditation. (310)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਮਾ ਹਾਲਤ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਾਜ਼ਰ ਬਬੀਂ
transliteration: dhar hamaa haalath khudhaa haazar babee
translation: One should assume His presence under all circumstances,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਜ਼ਿਰੋ ਨਾਜ਼ਿਰ ਹਮਾਂ ਨਾਜ਼ਿਰ ਬਬੀਂ ||੩੧੧||
transliteration: haaziro naazir hamaa naazir babee | 311 |
translation: Considering Him Omnipresent and Immanent, and also take it that He is capable of seeing everything everywhere. (311)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ਹ?ਕ ਜੁਜ਼ ਅਦਬ ਤਾਅਲੀਮ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: dhar raahi hak juz adhab thaaaleem neesatha
translation: There is no education except that of respect and civility in the path of God,

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਬਜੁਜ਼ ਤਸਲੀਮ ਨੀਸਤ ||੩੧੨||
transliteration: thaalib oo raa bajuz thasaleem neesath | 312 |
translation: It is not prudent for His seeker-devotee to accept anything but His Order. (312)

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਬਾ ਅਦਬ
transliteration: thaalibaan hak hamaeshaa baa adhaba
translation: The seekers of the Divine Spirit are always respectful,

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਅਦਬ ਬਾਸ਼ੰਦ ਅੰਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਰ?ਬ ||੩੧੩||
transliteration: baa adhab baashandh andhar yaadh rab | 313 |
translation: They are also satiated with reverence while remembering Him. (313)

gurmukhi: ਬੇਅਦਬ ਰਾ ਕੈ ਜ਼ਿ ਰਾਹਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਖ਼ਬਰ
transliteration: baeadhab raa kai z raahi shaa(n) khabara
translation: What does an apostate know about the tradition of those noble persons?

gurmukhi: ਬੇਅਦਬ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾਂ ਬੇ-ਅਸਰ ||੩੧੪||
transliteration: baeadhab az hak hamaeshaa(n) bae-asar | 314 |
translation: The efforts of an atheist to get a glimpse of Akaalpurakh will always be ineffective. (314)

gurmukhi: ਬੇਅਦਬ ਹਰਗਿਜ਼ ਬ-ਹ?ਕ ਰਾਹਿ ਨਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: baeadhab haragiz ba-hak raahi nayaafatha
translation: A disrespectful can never find the path leading towards the Divine Spirit;

gurmukhi: ਰਾਹਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਰੀਚ ਗੁਮਰਾਹੇ ਨਯਾਫ਼ਤ ||੩੧੫||
transliteration: raahi hak raa reech gumaraahae nayaafath | 315 |
translation: No strayed person has ever been able to find the path of God and much less to reach Him. (315)

gurmukhi: ਹਾਦੀੲੇ ਰਾਹਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਅਾਮਦ ਅਦਬ
transliteration: haadheeeae raahi khudhaa aamadh adhaba
translation: It is reverence that is the guide to the path of Waaheguru;

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਅਦਬ ਖ਼ਾਲੀ-ਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਅਲਤਾਫ਼ਿ ਰ?ਬ ||੩੧੬||
transliteration: bae-adhab khaalee-sath az alathaaf rab | 316 |
translation: And, an atheist remains blank from receiving His blessings. (316)

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਅਦਬ ਰਾਹਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਕੈ ਦਾਨਦਸ਼
transliteration: bae-adhab raahi khudhaa kai dhaanadhasha
translation: How can an atheist find the way to the Almighty,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿਰਾ ਕਹਿਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਮੀਰਾਨਦਸ਼ ||੩੧੭||
transliteration: har kiraa kehir khudhaa meeraanadhash | 317 |
translation: Who has been condemned due to the anger of Waaheguru?(317)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਪਨਾਹਿ ਸਾੲਿਅਾੲਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: dhar panaahi saaeiaae maradhaan haka
translation: If you care to seek the shelter (and agree to function in their shadow) of the noble souls of God,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਰਵੀ ਅਾਂ ਜਾ ਅਦਬ ਯਾਬੀ ਸਬਕ ||੩੧੮||
transliteration: gar ravee aa jaa adhab yaabee sabak | 318 |
translation: You will receive teachings and instructions about respectability there. (318)

gurmukhi: ਬੇ ਅਦਬ ੲੀਂਜਾ ਅਦਬ ਅਾਮੋਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: bae adhab eejaa adhab aamoz shudha
translation: Coming to this place (of noble persons), even the apostates become capable to teach lessons of reverence,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਚਰਾਗ਼ਿ ਗੁਲ ਜਹਾਂ ਅਫ਼ਰੋਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਦ ||੩੧੯||
transliteration: ee charaagh gul jehaa(n) afaroz shudh | 319 |
translation: Here, even extinguished lamps begin to spread light throughout the world. (319)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਹਰ ਬੇ ਅਦਬ ਰਾ ਦਿਹ ਅਦਬ
transliteration: ai khudhaa har bae adhab raa dhih adhaba
translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly bestow reverence even on the irreverent,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਗੁਜ਼ਾਰਦ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ ਦਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਰ?ਬ ||੩੨੦||
transliteration: thaa guzaaradh oumar raa dhar yaadh rab | 320 |
translation: So that they can spend their lives in Your remembrance. (320)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਬਯਾਬੀ ਲ?ਜ਼ਤੇ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: gar bayaabee lazathae az yaadh oo
translation: If you can relish the savor (sweet taste) of Waaheguru's remembrance,

transliteration: zindhaa baashee dhaaeimaa ai naeka-khoo | 321 |
translation: Then O good man! You can become immortal. (321)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਵਜੂਦਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਰਾ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਬਦਾਂ
transliteration: ee vajoodh khaak raa kaaeim badhaa(n)
translation: Consider this body of dirt as permanent for this reason

gurmukhi: ਕਾੲਿਮ ਅਾਮਦ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੳੂ ਦਰ ਹਿਰਜ਼ਿ ਜਾਂ ||੩੨੨||
transliteration: kaaeim aamadh shaauak oo dhar hiraz jaa(n) | 322 |
translation: Because the devotion for Him have established permanently in the fortress of your heart. (322)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀੲੇ ਜਾਂ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa zindhageeeae jaa(n) bavadha
translation: The love and elation for Akaalpurakh are the life-line of the soul,

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਸਰਮਾਅਾੲਿ ੲੀਮਾਂ ਬਵਦ ||੩੨੩||
transliteration: yaadh oo saramaaaae eemaa(n) bavadh | 323 |
translation: There is a wealth of faith and religion in His memory. (323)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੳੂ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਦਿਲੇ ਕੈ ਜਾ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: shaauak oo dhar har dhilae kai jaa kunadha
translation: How can the euphoria and elation for Waaheguru abide in every heart,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਵਜੂਦਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਕੈ ਮਾਵਾ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੨੪||
transliteration: dhar vajoodh khaak kai maavaa kunadh | 324 |
translation: And, how can He take refuge in the body made up of dirt. (324)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਮਰ ਤੁਰਾ ਚੂੰ ਦਸਤਦਾਦ
transliteration: shaauak maaualaa mar thuraa choon dhasathadhaadha
translation: When your fondness for Akaalpurakh supported you,

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਬਦਸਤਤ ਦਰ-ਫ਼ਤਾਦ ||੩੨੫||
transliteration: dhaaualath dhaaeim badhasathath dhara-fathaadh | 325 |
translation: Then, take it for granted that you will obtain control and have the divine eternal wealth. (325)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਰਾਹਸ਼ ਸੁਰਮਾੲਿ ਸਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: khaak raahash suramaae sar asatha
translation: The dust of His path is like a collyrium for our eyes and head,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਬਿਹ ਜ਼ ਤਾਜ਼ੋ ਅਫ਼ਸਰ ਅਸਤ ||੩੨੬||
transliteration: aarifaa(n) raa bih z thaazo afasar asath | 326 |
translation: This dust is much more valuable than the crown and the thrones for the enlightened. (326)

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਨਭਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਪਾੲਿਦਾਰ
transliteration: dhaaualath dhuniaa nabhabaashadh paaeidhaara
translation: This worldly wealth is not ever lasting,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਤਰੀਕਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਗੁਜ਼ਾਰ ||੩੨੭||
transliteration: dhar thareek aarifaan hak guzaar | 327 |
translation: You should accept this according to the verdict of the true devotees of God. (327)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ੳੂ ਲਾਜ਼ਿਮ ਬਵਦ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਤੁਰਾ
transliteration: yaadh oo laazim bavadh dhaaeim thuraa
translation: Meditation of Waaheguru is always absolutely essential for you,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ੳੂ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਕੁਨਦ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਤੁਰਾ ||੩੨੮||
transliteration: zikar oo kaaeim kunadh kaaeim thuraa | 328 |
translation: And, the discourse about Him makes you steady and immovable forever. (328)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਂ ਦਾਰੰਦ ਬਾ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼
transliteration: aarifaa(n) dhaarandh baa eirafaan khaesha
translation: The devotees of Akaalpurakh are intimately connected to the divine knowledge,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਲਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਂ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਜਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ||੩੨੯||
transliteration: haasal eirafaa(n) dharoon jaan khaesh | 329 |
translation: And, the achievement of divine knowledge is completely absorbed inside their souls. (329)

gurmukhi: ਮਸਨਦਿ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ਬੇ-ਜ਼ਵਾਲ
transliteration: masanadh shaauak eilaahee bae-zavaala
translation: The throne of devotion for Akaalpurakh is permanent and indestructible,

gurmukhi: ਵਰਨਾ ਬੀਨੀ ਪੁਰ ਜ਼ਵਾਲੇ ਹਰ ਕਮਾਲ ||੩੩੦||
transliteration: varanaa beenee pur zavaalae har kamaal | 330 |
translation: Although every peak has a trough. (330)

gurmukhi: ਬੇ-ਜ਼ਵਾਲ ਅਾਮਦ ਕਮਾਲਿ ਜ਼ੌਕਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: bae-zavaal aamadh kamaal zaauak haka
translation: The marvel of the zest for God's love is eternal and non-destructible,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕਿ ਯਾਬਦ ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੩੩੧||
transliteration: thaa k yaabadh zaraa az shaauak hak | 331 |
translation: Wish were it that we can get just one particle of His devotion. (331)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਕੂ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ੳੂ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: har kasae koo yaafath oo jaaveedh shudha
translation: Whosoever is lucky enough to obtain such a particle, he becomes immortal,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ੳੁਮੀਦ ਸ਼ੁਦ ||੩੩੨||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath saahib oumeedh shudh | 332 |
translation: In reality, his desire (to meet with Akaalpurakh) is fulfilled. (332)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ੳੁਮੀਦਸ਼ ਸੂਰਤਿ ਹਾਸਲ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: choon oumeedhash soorath haasal grifatha
translation: When he reached the stage of fulfillment,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਜਾ ਦਰ ਦਿਲ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੩੩੩||
transliteration: zaraa az shaauak jaa dhar dhil grifath | 333 |
translation: That particle of the strong desire for His devotion gets seeded into his heart. (333)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਬਿ ਹੈਵਾਂ ਮੀਚਕਦ ਅਜ਼ ਮੂੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: aab haivaa(n) meechakadh az mooe oo
translation: The divine nectar oozes out of his every hair,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਮੀਗਰਦਦ ਜਹਾਂ ਅਜ਼ ਬੂੲਿ ੳੂ ||੩੩੪||
transliteration: zindhaa meegaradhadh jehaa(n) az booe oo | 334 |
translation: And the whole world, with his aroma, becomes alive and rises up. (334)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ੲਿਮਸਾਨ ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ
transliteration: ai zehae eimasaan k hak raa yaafathaa
translation: Fortunate is that person who has attained the Provident;

gurmukhi: ਰੂ ਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਗੈਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਰ-ਤਾਫ਼ਤਾ ||੩੩੫||
transliteration: roo z yaadh gair hak bara-thaafathaa | 335 |
translation: And, who has turned himself away (detached) from every worldly items except the memory of God. (335)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਲਿਬਾਸਿ ਦੁਨਿਯਵੀ ਫ਼ਾਰਿਗ਼ ਅਜ਼ਾਂ
transliteration: dhar libaas dhuniyavee faarigh azaa(n)
translation: Even while living in worldly guise, he is detached from every materialistic thing,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਚੂ ਜ਼ਾਤਿਸ਼ ਅਾਸ਼ਿਕਾਂ ਰਾ ੳੂ ਨਿਹਾਂ ||੩੩੬||
transliteration: hamachoo zaathish aashikaa(n) raa oo nihaa(n) | 336 |
translation: Like the Entity of God, he maintains a hidden profile. (336)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰਿਸ਼ ਦਰ ਕੈਦਿ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: zaahirish dhar kaidh mushath khaak hasatha
translation: Outwardly he might be appearing to be in the grip of a fistful of dust,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਤਨਿ ੳੂ ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਪਾਕ ਹਸਤ ||੩੩੭||
transliteration: baathan oo baa khudhaae paak hasath | 337 |
translation: Inwardly, he is always engaged in talking about the chaste Akaalpurakh and abides with Him. (337)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰ ਅੰਦਰ ਮਾੲਿਲਿ ਫਰਜ਼ੰਦੋ ਜ਼ਨ
transliteration: zaahir andhar maaeil farazandho zana
translation: Outwardly, he might appear to be immersed in love for his child and wife,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ||੩੩੮||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath baa khudhaae khaeshathan | 338 |
translation: In reality, he always abides (in thought and action) with his God. (338)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰ ਅੰਦਰ ਮਾੲਿਲਿ ਹਿਰਸੋ ਹਵਾ
transliteration: zaahir andhar maaeil hiraso havaa
translation: Outwardly, he might seem to be inclined towards 'desires and greed',

gurmukhi: ਬਾਤਨਿ ੳੂ ਪਾਕ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ||੩੩੯||
transliteration: baathan oo paak az yaadh khudhaa | 339 |
translation: But inwardly, he remains chaste and sacred in the memory of Waaheguru. (339)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰ ਅੰਦਰ ਮਾੲਿਲਿ ਅਸਪੋ ਸ਼ੁਤਰ
transliteration: zaahir andhar maaeil asapo shuthara
translation: Outwardly, he might appear to be paying attention to horses and camels,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਤਨਸ਼ ਫ਼ਾਰਿਗ਼ ਜ਼ ਕੈਦਿ ਸ਼ੋਰੋ ਸ਼ਰ ||੩੪੦||
transliteration: baathanash faarigh z kaidh shoro shar | 340 |
translation: But inwardly, he remains detached from the worldly hub-hub and noises. (340)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰ ਅੰਦਰ ਮਾੲਿਲਿ ਸੀਮੋ ਜ਼ਰ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: zaahir andhar maaeil seemo zar asatha
translation: He might appear to be involved in gold and silver outwardly,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਤਨ ਅੰਦਰ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਬਹਿਰੋ ਬਰ ਅਸਤ ||੩੪੧||
transliteration: baathan andhar saahib behiro bar asath | 341 |
translation: But he is, in fact, master of land and water inwardly. (341)

gurmukhi: ਰਫ਼ਤਾ ਰਫ਼ਤਾ ਬਾਤਨਸ਼ ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: rafathaa rafathaa baathanash zaahir shudhaa
translation: His intrinsic worth gets revealed slowly and gradually,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਤਿਬਲਾੲਿ ਅੰਬਰ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ||੩੪੨||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath thibalaae anbar shudhaa | 342 |
translation: In fact, he becomes a casket of fragrance. (342)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰੋ ਬਾਤਨ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਯਕਸਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: zaahiro baathan shudhaa yakasaan oo
translation: His internal and external selves become one and the same,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਨਿ ੳੂ ||੩੪੩||
transliteration: har dho aalam bandhaae faramaan oo | 343 |
translation: Both the worlds become followers of his command. (343)

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਬਦਿਲ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਵਾ ਰਾ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ
transliteration: ham badhil yaadh khudhaa vaa raa zubaa(n)
translation: His heart and tongue are completely immersed in Akaalpurkh's remembrance at all times and  for ever,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਨਸ਼ ਦਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਦਿਲ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ ||੩੪੪||
transliteration: ee zubaanash dhil shudhaa dhil shudh zubaa(n) | 344 |
translation: His tongue becomes his heart, and his heart his tongue. (344)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਸਿਲਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਚੁਨੀਂ ਫ਼ਰਮੂਦਾ ਅੰਦ
transliteration: vaasilaan hak chunee faramoodhaa andha
translation: Those saintly  souls who have converged with God have said clearly,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਹਾ ਦਰ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਅਾਸੂਦਾ ਅੰਦ ||੩੪੫||
transliteration: bandhaa haa dhar bandhagee aasoodhaa andh | 345 |
translation: That persons of God remain comfortable and happy while they are in meditation. (345)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਮੁਸ?ਲਮ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਰਾ
transliteration: saahibee baashadh musalam shaah raa
translation: The mastery and splendor of our True King, the Waaheguru, is well known,

gurmukhi: ਕੁਰਨਸ਼ਿ ਮਨ ਸਾਲਿਕਿ ੲੀਂ ਰਾਹ ਰਾ ||੩੪੬||
transliteration: kuranash man saalik ee raah raa | 346 |
translation: I bow before the pedestrian who is walking on this path. (346)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਲਾਕਿ ੲੀਂ ਰਾਹ ਬਮੰਜ਼ਲ ਰਾਹ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: saalaak ee raah bamanzal raah yaafatha
translation: The traveler on this path arrived at his destination,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਦਿਲ ਅਾਗਾਹ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ||੩੪੭||
transliteration: haasil oumar dhil aagaah yaafath | 347 |
translation: And, his heart became familiar with the real purpose and attainment of life. (347)

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਹਾ ਰਾ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਦਰਕਾਰ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: bandhaa haa raa bandhagee dharakaar hasatha
translation: Persons of God really need only His meditation,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਮਿ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਸਰਸ਼ਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੩੪੮||
transliteration: jaam shaauak bandhagee sarashaar hasath | 348 |
translation: And, the cup of the pleasure and elation of meditation continues to overflow for ever. (348)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬੀ ਜ਼ੇਬਦ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਪਾਕ ਰਾ
transliteration: saahibee zaebadh khudhaae paak raa
translation: The Mastery (of all creations in this world) is befitting and looks elegant only for the true and the chaste Master, the Akaalpurakh;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਜ਼ੀਨਤ ਦਾਦ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਰਾ ||੩੪੯||
transliteration: aa k zeenath dhaadh mushath khaak raa | 349 |
translation: And, it is Him alone who has blessed this fistful of dust the gaiety and prosperity. (349)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕਸ਼ ਮੁਮਤਾਜ਼ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: shaauak az yaadh hakash mumathaaz karadha
translation: The fondness to remember the Waaheguru blessed him with prominence,

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਫ਼ਰਾਜ਼ੋ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਹਰ ਰਾਜ਼ ਕਰਦ ||੩੫੦||
transliteration: sar faraazo saahib har raaz karadh | 350 |
translation: And, this tendency also blessed him with honor and eminence and made him familiar with His mysteries. (350)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰੌਣਕ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: mushath khaak az yaadh hak raauanak grifatha
translation: This fistful of dust, with the remembrance of Akaalpurakh, became bright and shiny,

gurmukhi: ਬਸਕਿ ਦਰ ਦਿਲ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਗਿ੍ਰਫ਼ਤ ||੩੫੧||
transliteration: basak dhar dhil shaauak yaadh hak grifath | 351 |
translation: And, the fondness to remember Him began to surge like a storm in his heart. (351)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਕਾਦਰ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ਯ?ਕ ਕਤਰਾ ਅਾਬ
transliteration: ai zehae kaadhar k az yak katharaa aaba
translation: May we express our deep devotion for the Omnipotent who from just one drop of water

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕ ਰਾਂ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਕੁਨਦ ਚੂੰ ਅਾਫ਼ਤਾਬ ||੩੫੨||
transliteration: khaak raa(n) raauashan kunadh choon aafathaab | 352 |
translation: Gave this lowly fistful of dust the brightness and shine of the sun. (352)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਖ਼ਾਕੇ ਕਿ ਨੂਰ-ਅਫ਼ਰੋਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਦ
transliteration: ai zehae khaakae k noora-afaroz shudha
translation: May we sacrifice ourselves for that dust that became enlightened and radiant,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਸਅਾਦਤ ਹਾ ਨਸੀਬ ਅੰਦੋਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਦ ||੩੫੩||
transliteration: ee saaadhath haa naseeb andhoz shudh | 353 |
translation: And, which was fortunate enough to deserve such boons and blessings. (353)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਕੁਦਰਤ ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਾਰ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ
transliteration: ai zehae kudharath k hak baar aavuradha
translation: Wonderful is the Nature that brings in the fruits of truth,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕੀ ਰਾ ਬਗੁਫ਼ਤਾਰ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ ||੩੫੪||
transliteration: mushath khaakee raa bagufathaar aavuradh | 354 |
translation: And, which blesses the humble fistful of dust the power to speak. (354)

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਲਿ ੲੀਂ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: haasal ee zindhagee yaadh khudhaa-satha
translation: It is the meditation of Waaheguru that is the achievement of this life;

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਚਸ਼ਮੇ ਕਿ ਬਰ ਹ?ਕ ਮੁਬਤਲਾ-ਸਤ ||੩੫੫||
transliteration: ai zehae chashamae k bar hak mubathalaa-sath | 355 |
translation: May we sacrifice ourselves for the eye that becomes overawed and gets obsessed with the Truth (God). (355)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਦਿਲ ਕਿ ਅੰਦਰਸ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕਸ਼ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: ai zehae dhil k andharash shaauakash bavadha
translation: How blessed is the heart that has an innocent eagerness for the love of God!

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਜ਼ੌਕਸ਼ ਬਵਦ ||੩੫੬||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath saahib zaauakash bavadh | 356 |
translation: In fact, he becomes a fervent and fascinated devotee for His love. (356)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਸਰ ਕੂ ਬਰਾਹਿਸ਼ ਦਰ ਸਜੂਦ
transliteration: aa zehae sar koo baraahish dhar sajoodha
translation: Blessed is the head that bows to the real path of Truth, the God;

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਚੂੰ ਚੌਗਾਂ ਗੁੲੇ ਸ਼ੌਕਸ਼ ਦਰ ਰਬੂਦ ||੩੫੭||
transliteration: ham choon chaauagaa(n) gueae shaauakash dhar raboodh | 357 |
translation: And, who like the crooked stick with a grip, ran away with the ball of elation. (357)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਦਸਤੇ ਕਿ ਵਸਫ਼ਸ਼ ੳੂ ਨਵਿਸ਼ਤ
transliteration: ai zehae dhasathae k vasafash oo navishatha
translation: Wonderful are those hands that have written His praises and lauds;

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਪਾੲੇ ਕੂ ਦਰ ਕੂੲਿਸ਼ ਗੁਜ਼ਸ਼ਤ ||੩੫੮||
transliteration: ai zehae paaeae koo dhar kooeish guzashath | 358 |
translation: Blessed are those feet that have passed through His street. (358)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਜ਼ਬਾਨੇ ਬਿਹ ਕਿ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ੳੂ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: aa zabaanae bih k zikar oo kunadha
translation: Noble is the tongue that meditates on His Naam;

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਤਰੇ ਅਾਂ ਬਿਹ ਕਿ ਫ਼ਿਕਰਿ ੳੂ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੫੯||
transliteration: khaatharae aa bih k fikar oo kunadh | 359 |
translation: And, virtuous is the mind that concentrates its thoughts on Waaheguru. (359)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਮਾ ੳੁਜ਼ਵੇ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਅੰਦਰ ਤਨਸਤ
transliteration: dhar hamaa ouzavae k oo andhar thanasatha
translation: Akaalpurakh abides in every limb of our bodies,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੳੂ ਅੰਦਰ ਸਰਿ ਮਰਦੋ ਜ਼ਨ ਅਸਤ ||੩੬੦||
transliteration: shaauak oo andhar sar maradho zan asath | 360 |
translation: And, the zeal and ardor for His love is assimilated in the heads of all men and women. (360)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂੲੇ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਸ਼ੂੲਿ ੳੂ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: aarazooeae jumalaa shooe oo bavadha
translation: All desires and wishes are concentrated in His direction,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੳੂ ਅਾਗੁਸ਼ਤਾ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਮੂ ਬਵਦ ||੩੬੧||
transliteration: shaauak oo aagushathaa dhar har moo bavadh | 361 |
translation: And, fondness for Him is absorbed in every hair of our bodies. (361)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਤੂ ਖ਼ਾਹੀ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਂ ਸ਼ਵੀ
transliteration: gar thoo khaahee saahib eirafaa(n) shavee
translation: If you want that you become master of divine thought,

transliteration: jaa(n) ba-jaanaa(n) dhih k thaa jaanaa(n) ashavee | 362 |
translation: Then, you should sacrifice your life for your Beloved Waaheguru, so that you will acquire the same shape and form that He has. (362)

gurmukhi: ਹਰਚਿ ਦਾਰੀ ਕੁਨ ਹਮਾ ਕੁਰਬਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: harach dhaaree kun hamaa kurabaan oo
translation: You should sacrifice all that you have for your true Beloved,

gurmukhi: ਰੇਜ਼ਾ-ਚੀਨੀ ਕੁਨ ਦਮੇ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ਾਨਿ ੳੂ ||੩੬੩||
transliteration: raezaa-cheenee kun dhamae az khaan oo | 363 |
translation: And, pick up scraps of food from His dining table just for a moment. (363)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਨਸ਼ ਅਗਰ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: shaauak eirafaanash agar kaamil bavadha
translation: If you become completely desirous of His true knowledge and enlightenment,

gurmukhi: ਗੌਹਰਿ ਮਕਸੂਦ ਤੂ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੩੬੪||
transliteration: gaauehar makasoodh thoo haasil shavadh | 364 |
translation: Then, you will, inevitably, achieve your purpose. (364)

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਹਮ ਅਜ਼ ੲੀਂ ੳੁਮਰ ਯਾਬੀ ਬਹਿਰਾੲਿ
transliteration: thoo ham az ee oumar yaabee behiraae
translation: You will receive your life's fruits,

gurmukhi: ਮਿਹਰਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਨਸ਼ ਚੂ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਦ ਜ਼?ਰਾੲਿ ||੩੬੫||
transliteration: mihar eirafaanash choo bakhashadh zaraae | 365 |
translation: When the sun of divine knowledge would bless you with just one ray of its radiance. (365)

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਿ ਤੂ ਅੰਦਰ ਜਹਾਂ ਗਰਦਦ ਬੁਲੰਦ
transliteration: naam thoo andhar jehaa(n) garadhadh bulandha
translation: Your name would become famous and illuminated;

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਨਤ ਕੁਨਦ ਬਸ ਅਰਜ਼ਮੰਦ ||੩੬੬||
transliteration: shaauak eirafaanath kunadh bas arazamandh | 366 |
translation: And, your ardor for divine knowledge would make you extremely popular in this world. (366)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਨਿਸ਼ ਕਸੇ ਰਾ ਦਸਤਬਾਦ
transliteration: shaauak eirafaanish kasae raa dhasathabaadha
translation: Whosoever developed special affection and fondness for divine love,

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਕੁਲੀਦਸ਼ ਕੁਫ਼ਲਿ ਦਿਲਹਾ ਰਾ ਕੁਸ਼ਾਦ ||੩੬੭||
transliteration: kaz kuleedhash kufal dhilehaa raa kushaadh | 367 |
translation: With his key, all locks of the hearts got opened up (realities became known). (367)

gurmukhi: ਕੁਫ਼ਲ ਰਾ ਬਿਕੁਸ਼ਾ ਵਾ ਮਾਲਿ ਬੇਕਰਾਂ
transliteration: kufal raa bikushaa vaa maal baekaraa(n)
translation: You should, too, open up the lock of your heart, and from the hidden

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਕਫ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਅਾਰ ਅਜ਼ ਗੰਜਿ ਨਿਹਾਂ ||੩੬੮||
transliteration: dhar kaf khudh aar az ganj nihaa(n) | 368 |
translation: treasure, should derive unlimited pleasure and elation. (368)

gurmukhi: ਕੰਦਰਾਂ ਲਾਲੋ ਗੁਹਰ ਬਿਸੀਅਾਰ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: kandharaa(n) laalo guhar biseeaar hasatha
translation: In the nooks of your heart, numerous gems and diamonds are lying hidden;

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਮਤਾੲਿ ਲੁਲੂੲੇ ਸ਼ਹਿਵਾਰ ਹਸਤ ||੩੬੯||
transliteration: az mathaae lulooeae shehivaar hasath | 369 |
translation: And, your treasure and wealth contain many royal pearls. (369)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਮੀਖ਼ਾਹੀ ਜ਼ਿ ਗੰਜਿ ਬੇਸ਼ੁਮਾਰ
transliteration: har chih meekhaahee z ganj baeshumaara
translation: Then whatever you would desire to obtain from this infinite treasure,

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿਦਤ ਦਰ ਦਸਤ ਅੈ ਅਾਾਲੀ ਤਬਾਰ ||੩੭੦||
transliteration: aaeidhath dhar dhasath ai aaaalee thabaar | 370 |
translation: O person of high status! You would be able to get. (370)

gurmukhi: ਪਸ ਬਖ਼ਾਨੀ ਸਾਹਿਬਾਨਿ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਰਾ
transliteration: pas bakhaanee saahibaan shaauak raa
translation: Therefore you should call upon the faithful devotees of Akaalpurakh,

transliteration: thaa z haasil kunee ee zaauak raa | 371 |
translation: So that you would be able to inculcate such an ardor and zeal for Him. (371)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੌਕਿ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਗਰ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਤੁਰਾ
transliteration: zaauak shaauak hak gar baashadh thuraa
translation: If you can acquire the strong desire for the love of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਿ ੲੀਂ ਸੁਹਬਤ ਅਸਰ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਦ ਤੁਰਾ ||੩੭੨||
transliteration: faiz ee suhabath asar bakhashadh thuraa | 372 |
translation: Then, the blessing of their company is bound to influence you and your personality. (372)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਚਿਹ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਦਿਲਹਾ ਨਭਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਜੁਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: gar chih baashadh dhilehaa nabhabaashadh juz khudhaa
translation: Even though, there is nothing else but the Almighty abides in the hearts of every one,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਮੰਜ਼ਲੇ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ੳੂਲਾ ||੩੭੩||
transliteration: aarifaa(n) raa manzalae baashadh oolaa | 373 |
translation: Still, the true and sincere enlightened persons have a high status and elevated destination. (373)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਵਾਕਿਫ਼ਿ ੲੀਂ ਹਾਲ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: ghair aarif vaakif ee haal neesatha
translation: No one other than the knowledgeable is aware of the condition(s) of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਸ਼ ਕਾਲ ਨੀਸਤ ||੩੭੪||
transliteration: aarifaa(n) raa ghair zikarash kaal neesath | 374 |
translation: The enlightened do not speak any words other than the discourses and meditation of the Naam of Waaheguru. (374)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹਾਂ ਸਲਤਨਤ ਬਿ-ਗੁਜ਼ਾਸ਼ਤਦ
transliteration: baadhashaahaa(n) salathanath bi-guzaashathadha
translation: The kings abdicated their thrones, luxurious living and royal powers,

gurmukhi: ਚੂ ਗਦਾਯਾਂ ਕੂ ਬਕੂ ਬਿਸ਼ਤਾਫ਼ਤੰਦ ||੩੭੫||
transliteration: choo gadhaayaa(n) koo bakoo bishathaafathandh | 375 |
translation: And they kept roaming around from street to street like beggars. (375)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਯਾਦਿ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: az baraae aa k yaadh kunandha
translation: For all of them, it is essential to continue to get engaged in the true memory of the Omnipotent;

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਮਕਾਫ਼ਾਤਿ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਵਾ ਰਹੰਦ ||੩੭੬||
transliteration: az makaafaath dho aalam vaa rehandh | 376 |
translation: And, thus, get redemption from the cycles of births and deaths in both the worlds. (376)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਕਫ਼ਿ ੲੀਂ ਰਾਹ ਅਗਰ ਦਸਤ ਅਾਮਦੇ
transliteration: vaakaf ee raah agar dhasath aamadhae
translation: If ever one can come across some one who is familiar with this path and tradition,

gurmukhi: ਮਕਸਦਸ਼ ਦਰ ਸਲਤਨਤ ਦਸਤ ਅਾਮਦੇ ||੩੭੭||
transliteration: makasadhash dhar salathanath dhasath aamadhae | 377 |
translation: Then, all aims and objectives of government administration would be fulfilled. (377)

gurmukhi: ਜੁਮਲਾ ਲਸ਼ਕਰ ਤਾਲਿਬਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸ਼ੁਦੇ
transliteration: jumalaa lashakar thaalibaan hak shudhae
translation: If all forces of the army were to becomes seekers of Divine Power,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਅਾਾਰਫ਼ਿ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਸ਼ੁਦੇ ||੩੭੮||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath aaaaraf muthalik shudhae | 378 |
translation: Then, in fact, they all can become enlightened persons indeed. (378)

gurmukhi: ਸਾਲਿਕਿ ੲੀਂ ਰਾਹ ਅਗਰ ਦਰਯਾਫ਼ਤੇ
transliteration: saalik ee raah agar dharayaafathae
translation: If we can run into a fellow traveler of this path, and ask him about its true  tradition;

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲ ਅਜ਼ੀਂ ਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਕੁਜਾ ਬਰਤਾਫ਼ਤੇ ||੩੭੯||
transliteration: dhil azee shaahee kujaa barathaafathae | 379 |
translation: Then, how can his mind turn away from this royal kingdom? (379)

gurmukhi: ਤੁਖ਼ਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਰ ਮਜ਼ਰਾੲਿ ਦਿਲ ਕਾਸ਼ਤੇ
transliteration: thukham hak dhar mazaraae dhil kaashathae
translation: If the seed of Truth can be cultivated in the fields of mind,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਗ਼ੁਬਾਰਿ ਦਿਲ ਜ਼ਿ ਦਿਲ ਬਰਦਾਸ਼ਤੇ ||੩੮੦||
transliteration: thaa ghubaar dhil z dhil baradhaashathae | 380 |
translation: Then, all suspicions and illusions of our mind will be eliminated. (380)

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਸਰਿ ਤਖ਼ਤਿ ਨਗੀਨ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਬੁਦੇ
transliteration: bar sar thakhath nageen kaaeim budhae
translation: They can sit on a diamond studded throne for good

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਗਰ ਬਦਿਲ ਕਾੲਿਮ ਸ਼ੁਦੇ ||੩੮੧||
transliteration: zikar maaualaa gar badhil kaaeim shudhae | 381 |
translation: If they can inculcate the meditation of Akaalpurakh in their minds, (381)

gurmukhi: ਬੂੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੀਅਾੲਿਦ ਅਜ਼ ਹਰ ਮੁੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ
transliteration: booe hak meeaaeidh az har mue shaa(n)
translation: Fragrance of Truth is emitting from their each and every hair,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਮੀ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਹਰ ਕਸੇ ਅਜ਼ ਬੂੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ||੩੮੨||
transliteration: zindhaa mee shudh har kasae az booe shaa(n) | 382 |
translation: In fact, every one is becoming alive and getting invigorated with the aroma of  the company of such people. (382)

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬੀਰੂੰ ਨ ਬੂਦ ਅਜ਼ ਜਿਸਮਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ
transliteration: naam hak beeroon n boodh az jisam shaa(n)
translation: Waaheguru's Naam would not have been outside their bodies,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਅਗਰ ਦਾਦੇ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਂ ||੩੮੩||
