transliteration: murashadh kaamil agar dhaadhae nishaa(n) | 383 |
translation: If the perfect Guru had indicated to them with the information about His whereabouts and location. (In stead of looking outside, they could have attained His convergence from within their own hearts.)(383)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਬਿ ਹੈਵਾਂ ਅੰਦਰੂਨਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਾ ਹਸਤ
transliteration: aab haivaa(n) andharoon khaanaa hasatha
translation: The elixir of life is, in fact, inside the heart's so called abode,

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਬੇ-ਹਾਦੀ ਜਹਾਂ ਬੇਗ਼ਾਨਾਂ ਹਸਤ ||੩੮੪||
transliteration: laek bae-haadhee jehaa(n) baeghaanaa(n) hasath | 384 |
translation: But the world would not know about this fact without a perfect Guru. (384)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਜ਼ ਸ਼ਹਿਰਗ਼ ਹਸਤ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਨਜ਼ਦੀਕ ਤਰ
transliteration: choon z shehiragh hasath shaah nazadheek thara
translation: When the True Master is nearer than even your main artery,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਬਸਹਿਰਾ ਮੀਰਵੀ ਅੈ ਬੇ-ਖ਼ਬਰ ||੩੮੫||
transliteration: choon basehiraa meeravee ai bae-khabar | 385 |
translation: O ignorant and amateur person! Then why are you roaming around jungles and wilderness. (385)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਕਫ਼ਿ ੲੀਂ ਰਾਹ ਚੂ ਗਰਦਦ ਰਾਹਨੁਮਾ
transliteration: vaakaf ee raah choo garadhadh raahanumaa
translation: When someone familair and well conversant with this path becomes your guide,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਲਵਤੇ ਦਰ ਅੰਜੁਮਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਤੁਰਾ ||੩੮੬||
transliteration: khalavathae dhar anjuman baashadh thuraa | 386 |
translation: You will be able to achieve solitude within the company of noble persons. (386)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਅੰਦਰ ਖ਼ਿਲਾਫ਼ਤ ਦਾਸ਼ਤੰਦ
transliteration: har ch shaa(n) andhar khilaafath dhaashathandha
translation: Whatever worldly possessions they have,

gurmukhi: ਜਮਲਾ ਰਾ ਯ?ਕ ਬਾਰੋਗੀ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਾਸ਼ਤੰਦ ||੩੮੭||
transliteration: jamalaa raa yak baarogee biguzaashathandh | 387 |
translation: They are willing to relinquish them in one instalment instantly. (387)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: az baraae aa k hak haasil kunandha
translation: So that they could achieve the Ultimate Entity,

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰਵੀੲਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੩੮੮||
transliteration: pairaveee aarif kaamil kunandh | 388 |
translation: For this reason, they follow completely the perfectly enlightened persons. (388)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਤੁਰਾ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਕੁਨੰਦ
transliteration: aarif kaamil thuraa kaamil kunandha
translation: Perfect saints can transform you also into perfect saints;

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਮੀਖ਼ਾਹੀ ਤੁਰਾ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਕੁਨੰਦ ||੩੮੯||
transliteration: har chih meekhaahee thuraa haasil kunandh | 389 |
translation: And, they can fulfill all your desires and wishes. (389)

gurmukhi: ਰਾਸਤੀ ੲੀਨਸਤ ਰਾਹਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਗੀਰ
transliteration: raasathee eenasath raahi hak bageera
translation: The truth in it is that you should adopt the path leading towards the Lord,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਤੂ ਹਮ ਗਰਦੀ ਚੂ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਿ ਮੁਨੀਰ ||੩੯੦||
transliteration: thaa thoo ham garadhee choo khurasheedh muneer | 390 |
translation: So that you, too, can shine like the brilliance of the sun. (390)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਦਿਲ ਕਿ ਦਿਲਦਾਰੀ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: hak dharoon dhil k dhiladhaaree kunadha
translation: The true Akaalpurakh, abiding in your heart, extends His love to you;

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਤੁਰਾ ਯਾਰੀ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੯੧||
transliteration: murashadh kaamil thuraa yaaree kunadh | 391 |
translation: And, the perfect and complete Guru like a true friend assists you in this process. (391)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਕਫ਼ਿ ੲੀਂ ਰਾਹ ਅਗਰ ਅਾਰੀ ਬਦਸਤ
transliteration: vaakaf ee raah agar aaree badhasatha
translation: If you can run into someone who is familiar with this (divine) path,

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰੂੰ ਯਾਬੀ ਮਤਾੲਿ ਹਰ ਚਿ ਹਸਤ ||੩੯੨||
transliteration: andharoon yaabee mathaae har ch hasath | 392 |
translation: Then, you will discover all types of material and non-material wealth and treasures inside you. (392)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਕਸੇ ਰਾ ਦਸਤ ਦਾਦ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil kasae raa dhasath dhaadha
translation: Whosoever has come across a true Guru,

gurmukhi: ਤਾਜਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਬਫ਼ਰਕਿ ੳੂ ਨਿਹਾਦ ||੩੯੩||
transliteration: thaaj eirafaa(n) raa bafarak oo nihaadh | 393 |
translation: The true Guru will put on the crown of true divine knowledge on his head. (393)

gurmukhi: ਮਹਿਰਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: mehiram hak murashadh kaamil kunadha
translation: The true and perfect Guru can make one conversant with the mysteries and love of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤਿ ਜਾਵੀਦ ਰਾ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਕੁਨਦ ||੩੯੪||
transliteration: dhaaualath jaaveedh raa haasil kunadh | 394 |
translation: And, helps in achieving the eternal divine wealth. (394)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: har dho aalam bandhaae faramaan oo
translation: Persons from both the worlds obey his (the Guru's) command spontaneously,

transliteration: ee jehaano aa jehaa(n) kurabaan oo | 395 |
translation: And, both the worlds are willing to lay their lives for him. (395)

gurmukhi: ਮਾਅਨੀੲਿੇ ੲਿਹਸਾਨ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ-ਸਤ
transliteration: maaaneeeiae eihasaan eirafaan khudhaa-satha
translation: The real gratitude for Akaalpurakh is the (achievement of) true divine knowledge,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਰੂ ਨੁਮਾ ਸਤ ||੩੯੬||
transliteration: aarifaa(n) raa dhaaualath khush roo numaa sath | 396 |
translation: And, the immortal wealth emerges showing its face to the enlightened persons. (396)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ਬਿਸ਼ਨਾਖ਼ਤਸ਼
transliteration: thaa khudhaae khaeshathan bishanaakhathasha
translation: When, by abiding the All-powerful in his heart, recognized His Entity,

gurmukhi: ਨਕਦਿ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਜਾਵਿਦਾਂ ਦਰਯਾਫ਼ਤਸ਼ ||੩੯੭||
transliteration: nakadh oumar jaavidhaa(n) dharayaafathash | 397 |
translation: Take it that he achieved the treasure of eternal life. (397)

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਦਿਲ ਤੂ ਬੀਰੂੰ ਮੀ-ਰਵੀ
transliteration: oo dharoon dhil thoo beeroon mee-ravee
translation: He, the Almighty Lord, abides inside your heart, but you keep running around outside,

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਬਖ਼ਾਨਾ ਤੂ ਬਹ?ਜ ਚੂੰ ਮੀ-ਰਵੀ ||੩੯੮||
transliteration: oo bakhaanaa thoo behaj choon mee-ravee | 398 |
translation: He is right inside your home, but you keep going (outside) for Hadj in search of Him. (398)

gurmukhi: ੳੂ ਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਹਰ ਮੂੲਿ ਤੂ ਚੂੰ ਅਾਸ਼ਕਾਰ
transliteration: oo sath az har mooe thoo choon aashakaara
translation: When He manifests Himself from each and every hair of your body,

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਕੁਜਾ ਬੀਰੂੰ ਰਵੀ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਸ਼ਿਕਾਰ ||੩੯੯||
transliteration: thoo kujaa beeroon ravee behir shikaar | 399 |
translation: Where do you stray outside to track Him out (to hunt for Him). (399)

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰੂਨਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਾ-ਅਤ ਨੂਰਿ ਅ?ਲਾਹ
transliteration: andharoon khaanaa-ath noor alaaha
translation: The splendor of Akaalpurakh radiates in your home-like-heart in such a way,

gurmukhi: ਤਾਫ਼ਤ ਚੂੰ ਬਰ ਅਾਸਮਾਂ ਰਖ਼ਸ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਮਾਹ ||੪੦੦||
transliteration: thaafath choon bar aasamaa(n) rakhashindhaa maah | 400 |
translation: Just like the bright moon shines (during moonlit nights) in the sky. (400)

gurmukhi: ਅੰਦਰੂਨਿ ਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਤਰ ਬੀਨਾ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: andharoon chasham thar beenaa shudhaa
translation: It is the Provident who enables you to see through your tearful eyes,

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਜ਼ਬਾਨਤ ਹੁਕਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਗੋਯਾ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ||੪੦੧||
transliteration: bar zabaanath hukam hak goyaa shudhaa | 401 |
translation: And, it is His command that speaks from your tongue. (401)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਵਜੂਦਤ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਅਜ਼ ਨੂਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: ee vajoodhath raauashan az noor hak asatha
translation: This body of yours is radiant because of the splendor of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਅਜ਼ ਨੂਰਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਮੁਤਲਿਕ ਅਸਤ ||੪੦੨||
transliteration: raauashan az noor khudhaae muthalik asath | 402 |
translation: This entire world is shining with His refulgence. (402)

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਵਾਕਿਫ਼ ਨੀਸਤੀ ਅਜ਼ ਹਾਲਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼
transliteration: laek vaakif neesathee az haal khaesha
translation: But you are not aware of your inside situation and condition,

gurmukhi: ਰੂਜ਼ੋ ਸ਼ਬ ਹੈਰਾਨੀ ਅਜ਼ ਅਫ਼ਅਾਲਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ||੪੦੩||
transliteration: roozo shab hairaanee az afaaal khaesh | 403 |
translation: You are distraught day and night because of your own actions and deeds. (403)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਤੁਰਾ ਮਹਿਰਮ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil thuraa mehiram kunadha
translation: The perfect true Guru makes you Waaheguru's confidant,

gurmukhi: ਦਰਦਿ ਰੇਸ਼ਿ ਹਿਜ਼ਰ ਰਾ ਮਰਹਮ ਕੁਨਦ ||੪੦੪||
transliteration: dharadh raesh hizar raa mareham kunadh | 404 |
translation: He provides ointment and dressing for the pain of the wounds of separation. (404)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਤੂ ਹਮ ਅਜ਼ ਵਾਸਿਲਾਨਿ ੳੂ ਸ਼ਵੀ
transliteration: thaa thoo ham az vaasilaan oo shavee
translation: So that you can also become one of Waaheguru's close companions,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਦਿਲ ਗਰਦੀ ਵਾ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ਬੂ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੪੦੫||
transliteration: saahib dhil garadhee vaa khushaboo shavee | 405 |
translation: And, you could become the master of your heart with a noble character. (405)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ਸਰ-ਗਰਦਾਂ ਸ਼ਵੀ
transliteration: az baraae aa k sara-garadhaa(n) shavee
translation: You have ever been perplexed and confused about the Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ੳੁਮਰ ਹਾ ਅੰਦਰ ਤਲਬ ਹੈਰਾਂ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੪੦੬||
transliteration: oumar haa andhar thalab hairaa(n) shavee | 406 |
translation: Because, you have been troubled for ages searching for Him. (406)

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਚਿਹ ਬਾਸ਼ੀ ਅਾਲਮੇ ਹੈਰਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: thoo chih baashee aalamae hairaan oo
translation: What to speak of you alone! The whole world is perplexed indeed for Him,

gurmukhi: ਅਰਸ਼ੋ ਕੁਰਸੀ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਸਰ-ਗਰਦਾਨਿ ੳੂ ||੪੦੭||
transliteration: arasho kurasee jumalaa sara-garadhaan oo | 407 |
translation: This sky and the fourth firmament are all distressed about Him. (407)

gurmukhi: ਚਰਖ਼ ਮੀ ਗਰਦਦ ਬਗਿਰਦਿ ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: charakh mee garadhadh bagiradh aa k oo
translation: This sky revolves around Him for the reason

gurmukhi: ਦਾਰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਫ਼ਰਖ਼ੰਦਾ ਖ਼ੂ ||੪੦੮||
transliteration: dhaaradh az shaauak khudhaa farakhandhaa khoo | 408 |
translation: That it, too, can adopt noble virtues because of its fondness for Him. (408)

gurmukhi: ਜੁਮਲਾ ਹੈਰਾਨੰਦ ਸਰ-ਗਰਦਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: jumalaa hairaanandh sara-garadhaan oo
translation: The people of the whole world are amazed and confused about Waaheguru,

transliteration: choon gadhaa joeidh oo raa koo ba-koo | 409 |
translation: Just like the beggars are looking for Him from street to street. (409)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦਸ਼ਾਹਿ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਦਰ ਦਿਲ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: baadhashaahi har dho aalam dhar dhil asatha
translation: The king of both the worlds is abiding inside the heart,

gurmukhi: ਲੈਕਨ ੲੀਂ ਅਾਗ਼ਿਸ਼ਤਾੲਿ ਅਾਬੋ ਗਿ?ਲ ਅਸਤ ||੪੧੦||
transliteration: laikan ee aaghishathaae aabo gl asath | 410 |
translation: But this body of our is mired in water and mud. (410)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਤੂ ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਚੂੰ ਨਕਸ਼ ਬਸਤ
transliteration: dhar dhil thoo nakash hak choon nakash basatha
translation: When the True Image of Waaheguru definitely made a stern image and abode  in your heart.

gurmukhi: ਜੁਮਲਾ ਨਫ਼ਸਿ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਅੈ ਹ?ਕ-ਪ੍ਰਸਤ ||੪੧੧||
transliteration: jumalaa nafas shaauak shudh ai haka-prasath | 411 |
translation: Then O devotee of True Akaalpurakh! Your entire family, out of elation and euphoria, will be transformed itself into His image. (411)

gurmukhi: ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਯਾਅਨੀ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: nakash hak yaaanee nishaan naam haka
translation: The form of Akaalpurakh is really the symbol of His Naam,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਬਿ ਹੈਵਾਂ ਰਾ ਬਨੋਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਜਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੪੧੨||
transliteration: aab haivaa(n) raa banosh az jaam hak | 412 |
translation: Therefore, you should drink the nectar from the cup of Truth. (412)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਜੁਸਤਮ ਅਜ਼ ਹਰ ਖ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ
transliteration: aa k oo raa jusatham az har khaanaaei
translation: The Lord that I have been looking for from home to home,

gurmukhi: ਯਾਫ਼ਤਮ ਨਾਗਾਹ ਦਰ ਕਾਸ਼ਾਨਾੲਿ ||੪੧੩||
transliteration: yaafatham naagaah dhar kaashaanaae | 413 |
translation: Suddenly, I discovered Him inside my own home (body). (413)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਤੁਫ਼ੈਲਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: ee thufail murashadh kaamil bavadha
translation: This blessing is from the true and perfect Guru,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਮੀ ਖ਼ਾਹੀ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੪੧੪||
transliteration: har chih mee khaahee azo haasil shavadh | 414 |
translation: Whatever I wanted or needed, I could get that from Him. (414)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਮੁਰਾਦਿ ਦਿਲ ਕਸੇ ਬੇ ਅਾਂ ਨ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: ee muraadh dhil kasae bae aa n yaafatha
translation: No one else can fulfill his heart's desire,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਗਦਾੲਿ ਦੌਲਤਿ ਸੁਲਤਾਂ ਨ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ||੪੧੫||
transliteration: har gadhaae dhaaualath sulathaa(n) n yaafath | 415 |
translation: And, every beggar is not able to acquire royal riches. (415)

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮ ਬੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਮਿਅਾ ਵਰ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ
transliteration: naam bae murashadh miaa var bar zubaa(n)
translation: Do not bring any name other than that of the Guru on your tongue,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਦਿਹਦ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਂ ||੪੧੬||
transliteration: murashadh kaamil dhihadh az hak nishaa(n) | 416 |
translation: In fact, a perfect Guru alone can give us the correct whereabouts of Akaalpurakh. (416)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਹਰ ਚੀਜ਼ ਮੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਬਸੇ
transliteration: murashadh har cheez mee baashadh basae
translation: There may be numerous teachers and instructors for every item (in this world),

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਕੁਜਾ ਯਾਬਦ ਕਸੇ ||੪੧੭||
transliteration: murashadh kaamil kujaa yaabadh kasae | 417 |
translation: However, when can one meet a perfect Guru? (417)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਪਾਕ ਦਿਲ ਰਾ ਕਾਮ ਦਾਦ
transliteration: aaa(n) khudhaae paak dhil raa kaam dhaadha
translation: The chaste Waaheguru fulfilled the keen desire of my heart,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਦਿਲਿ ਬਿਸ਼ਕਸਤਾ ਰਾ ਅਾਰਾਮ ਦਾਦ ||੪੧੮||
transliteration: ee dhil bishakasathaa raa aaraam dhaadh | 418 |
translation: And provided succor to the heart-broken. (418)

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: haasil hak murashadh kaamil bavadha
translation: To meet a perfect Guru is the real attainment of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਂ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਅਾਰਾਮਿ ਜਾਨੋ ਦਿਲ ਬਵਦ ||੪੧੯||
transliteration: zaa(n) k oo aaraam jaano dhil bavadh | 419 |
translation: Because it is him (Him) who can bestow tranquility to the mind and the soul. (419)

gurmukhi: ਅ?ਵਲਨ ਅੈ ਦਿਲ ਫ਼ਨਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਸ਼ੌ
transliteration: avalan ai dhil fanaae khaesh shaaua
translation: O my heart! Firstly, you must get rid of your vanity and ego,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਯਾਬੀ ਰਾਹਿ ਹ?ਕ ਦਰ ਕੂੲਿ ਓ ||੪੨੦||
transliteration: thaa bayaabee raahi hak dhar kooe ou | 420 |
translation: So that you could get the correct direction from His street to the path of Truth. (420)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਕਿਫ਼ ਅਰ ਅਜ਼ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਸ਼ਵੀ
transliteration: vaakif ar az murashadh kaamil shavee
translation: If you can get to know the perfect and complete true Guru,

gurmukhi: ਬੇ ਤਕ?ਲਫ਼ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ੲੀਂ ਦਿਲ ਸ਼ਵੀ ||੪੨੧||
transliteration: bae thakalaf saahib ee dhil shavee | 421 |
translation: Then, you can be the master of this heart without any (ritual) problems. (421)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਫ਼ਨਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਨ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: har k oo khudh fanaae oo n karadha
translation: Whosoever has not been able to eradicate his self ego,

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਮਰ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਂ ਨ ਕਰਦ ||੪੨੨||
transliteration: hak mar oo raa saahib eirafaa(n) n karadh | 422 |
translation: The Akaalpurakh does not divulge His mysteries to him. (422)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਹਸਤ ਅਾਂ ਅੰਦਰੂਨਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਾ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: har chih hasath aaa(n) andharoon khaanaa asatha
translation: Whatever is there, is inside the house, the human body,

gurmukhi: ਸੈਰ ਕੁਨ ਦਰ ਕਿਸ਼ਤਿ ਦਿਲ ੲੀਂ ਦਾਨਾ ਹਸਤ ||੪੨੩||
transliteration: sair kun dhar kishath dhil ee dhaanaa hasath | 423 |
translation: You should walk around your heart's field of crops; the grain of enlightenment is there only inside it. (423)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਚੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਰਾਹਨੁਮਾ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil choo baashadh raahanumaa
translation: When the complete and perfect true Guru becomes your guide and mentor,

gurmukhi: ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ਗਰਦੀ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ ||੪੨੪||
transliteration: baa khudhaae khaesh garadhee aashanaa | 424 |
translation: You would then become very well informed and conversant about your Waaheguru. (424)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਤੂ ਜਾਨਬਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਰਦਤ
transliteration: gar dhil thoo jaanab hak aaradhatha
translation: If your heart can be motivated and inspired towards the Omnipotent,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬੁਨਿ ਹਰ ਮੂੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੀ ਬਾਰਦਤ ||੪੨੫||
transliteration: az bun har mooe hak mee baaradhath | 425 |
translation: Then, there would be a pouring showers of His Naam in every hair of your body. (425)

gurmukhi: ਹਮ ਦਰੀਂ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਬ-ਯਾਬੀ ਕਾਮ ਰਾ
transliteration: ham dharee dhuniaa ba-yaabee kaam raa
translation: Then, all your desires in this world would be fulfilled,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕ ਬਰ ਸਰ ਕੁਨ ਗ਼ਮਿ ਅ?ਯਾਮ ਰਾ ||੪੨੬||
transliteration: khaak bar sar kun gham ayaam raa | 426 |
translation: And, you will bury all the worries and apprehensions of the time. (426)

gurmukhi: ਬੀਰੂੰ ਅਜ਼ ਜਿਸਮਿ ਤੂ ਨਭਬਵਦ ਹੀਚ ਚੀਜ਼
transliteration: beeroon az jisam thoo nabhabavadh heech cheeza
translation: Nothing exists in this world outside your body,

gurmukhi: ਯ?ਕ ਦਮੇ ਹਮ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ਤਨ ਤਾ ਕੁਨ ਤਮੀਜ਼ ||੪੨੭||
transliteration: yak dhamae ham khaeshathan thaa kun thameez | 427 |
translation: You should introspect just for a moment to realize your own self. (427)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬ-ਯਾਬੀ ੲੀਂ ਸਅਾਦਤ ਰਾ ਮਦਾਮ
transliteration: thaa ba-yaabee ee saaadhath raa madhaama
translation: You will be bestowed with the Waaheguru's true boon for ever,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਬਿਦਾਨੀ ਹ?ਕ ਕੁਦਾਮੋ ਮਨ ਕੁਦਾਮ ||੪੨੮||
transliteration: gar bidhaanee hak kudhaamo man kudhaam | 428 |
translation: If you can appreciate (the stark distinction) as to who you are and who God is? (428)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਚਿਹ ਜ਼?ਰਾ ਮੁਸ਼ਤੇ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਗ਼ਰੀਬ
transliteration: man chih zaraa mushathae az khaak ghareeba
translation: Who am I? I am just one particle of one fistful of dust of top-layer,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਹਮਾ ਦੌਲਤ ਜ਼ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਨਸੀਬ ||੪੨੯||
transliteration: ee hamaa dhaaualath z murashadh shudh naseeb | 429 |
translation: All this blessing, due to my good fortune, was bestowed upon me by my true Guru. (429)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਪਾਕ ਰਾ
transliteration: ai zehae murashadh k naam paak raa
translation: Great is the true Guru who has blessed me with Akaalpurakh's sacred Naam,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਕਰਮ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ੀਦ ਮੁਸ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਰਾ ||੪੩੦||
transliteration: az karam bakhasheedh mushath khaak raa | 430 |
translation: With his enormous kindness and compassion to this fistful of dust. (430)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਚੂ ਮਾ ਤੀਰਾ ਦਿਲਾਂ
transliteration: ai zehae murashadh choo maa theeraa dhilaa(n)
translation: Great is the true Guru who has, blind minds like mine,

gurmukhi: ਕਰਦ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਦਰ ਜ਼ਮੀਨੋਂ ਅਾਸਮਾਂ ||੪੩੧||
transliteration: karadh raauashan dhar zameeno aasamaa(n) | 431 |
translation: Made them refulgent on both the earth and the sky. (431)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ਦਿਲ ਰਾ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਦਾਦ
transliteration: ai zehae murashadh k dhil raa shaauak dhaadha
translation: Great is the true Guru who has blessed my heart with a keen desire and fondness,

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ਬੰਦਿ ਦਿਲ ਕੁਸ਼ਾਦ ||੪੩੨||
transliteration: ai zehae murashadh k bandh dhil kushaadh | 432 |
translation: Blessed is the true Guru who has broken all the limitations and shackles of my heart. (432)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ਬਾ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ
transliteration: ai zehae murashadh k baa hak aashanaa
translation: Great is the true Guru, Guru Gobind Singh, who introduced me to the Lord,

gurmukhi: ਕਰਦ ਫ਼ਾਰਿਗ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ਮਿ ਰੰਜੋ ਬਲਾ ||੪੩੩||
transliteration: karadh faarigh az gham ranjo balaa | 433 |
translation: And, got me redeemed from worldly worries and griefs. (433)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ੳੁਮਰਿ ਜਾਵਿਦਾਂ
transliteration: ai zehae murashadh k oumar jaavidhaa(n)
translation: Great is the true Guru who has blessed persons like me the eternal life only

gurmukhi: ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਦ ਅਜ਼ ਨਾਮਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲਿ ਬੇ-ਨਿਸ਼ਾਂ ||੪੩੪||
transliteration: bakhashadh az naam khudhaae bae-nishaa(n) | 434 |
translation: because of the Naam of the Untraceable Akaalpurakh. (434)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਅਜ਼ ਕਤਰਾ ਅਾਬ
transliteration: ai zehae murashadh k oo az katharaa aaba
translation: Great is the perfect and true Guru, who has

gurmukhi: ਕਰਦ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਹਮਚੂ ਮਾਹੋ ਅਾਫ਼ਤਾਬ ||੪੩੫||
transliteration: karadh raauashan hamachoo maaho aafathaab | 435 |
translation: Illuminated just a drop of water like the brightness of moon and the sun. (435)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਜ਼ਹੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਜ਼ਹੇ ੲਿਹਸਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: ai zehae murashadh zehae eihasaan oo
translation: Blessed is that true Guru and blessed are his numerous boons and bestowals,

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਹਮਚੂ ਮਨ ਕੁਰਬਾਨਿ ੳੂ ||੪੩੬||
transliteration: sadh hazaaraa(n) hamachoo man kurabaan oo | 436 |
translation: For whom millions of people like me are willing to sacrifice themselves. (436)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਜ਼ਮੀਨੋ ਅਾਸਮਾਂ ਨਾਮਸ਼ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: dhar zameeno aasamaa(n) naamash bavadha
translation: His Naam pervades and is prevalent over the earth and the sky,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਮੁਰੀਦੇ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਕਾਮਸ਼ ਬਵਦ ||੪੩੭||
transliteration: har mureedhae saahib kaamash bavadh | 437 |
translation: It is Him who fulfills all the strong desires of His disciples. (437)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਗੁਫ਼ਤੋ ਗੂੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: har k khush baashadh z gufatho gooe oo
translation: Whosoever is elated and satisfied on hearing His conversation,

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਰੂ-ਬਰੂ ||੪੩੮||
transliteration: hak hamaeshaa baashadh oo raa roo-baroo | 438 |
translation: Take it that he will be face to face with the Almighty for ever. (438)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾਂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਦਰ ਹਜ਼ੂਰ
transliteration: hak hamaeshaa(n) baashadh oo raa dhar hazoora
translation: The Akaalpurakh is always present before him,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਮਰ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਦਰ ਸਦੂਰ ||੪੩੯||
transliteration: zikar oo baashadh mar oo raa dhar sadhoor | 439 |
translation: And, the meditation and remembrance of Waaheguru always abides in his heart. (439)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਹਜ਼ੂਰੀ ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਬਾੲਿਦ ਬ-ਤੌ
transliteration: gar hazooree baa khudhaa baaeidh ba-thaaua
translation: If you have the yearning to be face to face to the Omnipotent,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਜ਼ੂਰਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਿਰੌ ||੪੪੦||
transliteration: dhar hazoor murashadh kaamil biraau | 440 |
translation: Then, you should try to be face to face to the perfect and complete Guru. (440)

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਤਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: soorath hak murashadh kaamil bavadha
translation: A perfect Guru is, in fact, the image of the Omnipresent,

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਨਸ਼ ਅਾਰਾਮਿ ਜਾਨੋ ਦਿਲ ਬਵਦ ||੪੪੧||
transliteration: dheedhanash aaraam jaano dhil bavadh | 441 |
translation: A glimpse of such a perfect Guru provides succor and serenity to the heart and soul. (441)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਤਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮਾਅਨੀ ਅਜ਼ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: surath hak maaanee az murashadh bavadha
translation: The perfect and true Guru is, indeed, an image of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਬਰ-ਗਰਦਦ ਅਜ਼ਾਂ ਮੁਰਤਦ ਬਵਦ ||੪੪੨||
transliteration: har k bara-garadhadh azaa(n) murathadh bavadh | 442 |
translation: Anyone who has turned himself away from him, was discarded and thrown away like a trash. (442)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਨਭਗੁਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil baghair az hak nabhagufatha
translation: The perfect and the true Guru does not utter anything but the truth,

gurmukhi: ਦੁ?ਰਿ ੲੀਂ ਮਾਅਨੀ ਬਗੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਅਾਂ ਨ ਗੁਫ਼ਤ ||੪੪੩||
transliteration: dhur ee maaanee bagair az aaa(n) n gufath | 443 |
translation: No one else but him has been able to pierce the pearl of this spiritual idea. (443)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਕੁਜਾ ਸ਼ੁਕਰੇ ਜ਼ ੲਿਹਸਾਨਸ਼ ਕੁਨਮ
transliteration: thaa kujaa shukarae z eihasaanash kunama
translation: How far and how much can I thank Him for His bestowals ?

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਅਾੲਿਦ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ ੲੀਂ ਮੁਗ਼ਤਨਮ ||੪੪੪||
transliteration: har chih aaeidh bar zubaa(n) ee mughathanam | 444 |
translation: Whatever comes on my lips and tongue, I would consider that as a boon. (444)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ਿਲਾਜ਼ਤਿ ਦਿਲ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਚੂੰ ਪਾਕ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: az ghilaazath dhil khudhaa choon paak karadha
translation: When Akaalpurakh cleansed the heart from filth, profanity and muck

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬ-ੲੀਂ ੲਿਦਰਾਕ ਕਰਦ ||੪੪੫||
transliteration: murashadh kaamil ba-ee eidharaak karadh | 445 |
translation: The complete and perfect Guru bestowed the good sense to it. (445)

gurmukhi: ਵਰਨਾ ੲੀਂ ਰਾਹਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਕੈ ਜਾਨਦੇ
transliteration: varanaa ee raahi khudhaa kai jaanadhae
translation: Otherwise, how could we find out the true path of God ?

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਕਿਤਾਬਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸਬਕ ਕੈ ਖ਼ਾਨਦੇ ||੪੪੬||
transliteration: az kithaab hak sabak kai khaanadhae | 446 |
translation: And, when and how could we learn a lesson from the book of Truth? (446)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਹਮਾ ਚੂੰ ਅਜ਼ ਤੁਫ਼ੈਲਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: ee hamaa choon az thufail murashadh asatha
translation: If all this is the bestowal of the true Guru out of his compassion and kindness,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿਹ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਰਾ ਨਾ-ਦਾਨਦ ਮੁਰਤਦ ਅਸਤ ||੪੪੭||
transliteration: har kih murashadh raa naa-dhaanadh murathadh asath | 447 |
translation: Then, those who do not know or appreciate the Guru, are, indeed, apostates. (447)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ੲਿਲਾਜਿ ਦਿਲ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil eilaaj dhil kunadha
translation: The perfect and true Guru removes the maladies of the heart,

gurmukhi: ਕਾਮਿ ਦਿਲ ਅੰਦਰ ਦਿਲਤ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਕੁਨਦ ||੪੪੮||
transliteration: kaam dhil andhar dhilath haasil kunadh | 448 |
translation: In fact, all your cravings are fulfilled within your heart itself (448)

gurmukhi: ਨਬਜ਼ਿ ਦਿਲ ਚੂੰ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਸ਼ਨਾਖ਼ਤ
transliteration: nabaz dhil choon murashadh kaamil shanaakhath
translation: When the perfect Guru correctly diagnosed the pulse of the heart,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀੲਿ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਸ਼ਨਾਖ਼ਤ ||੪੪੯||
transliteration: zindhageee oumar raa haasil shanaakhath | 449 |
translation: Then the life attained the purpose of its existence. (449)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀੲਿ ੳੁਮਰ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ
transliteration: zindhageee oumar haasil mee shavadha
translation: Because of the perfect and true Guru, the human being gets an eternal life,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਤੁਫ਼ੈਲਸ਼ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ ਦਿਲ ਮੀ ਸ਼ਵਦ ||੪੫੦||
transliteration: az thufailash saahib dhil mee shavadh | 450 |
translation: With his grace and kindness, one attains the mastery and control of the heart. (450)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਬਰਾੲਿ ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ੲੀਂ ਪੈਦਾ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ
transliteration: az baraae aa k ee paidhaa shudhaa
translation: This human being came into this world only to attain the Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਫ਼ਿਰਾਕਸ਼ ਵਾਲਾ ਓ ਸ਼ੈਦਾ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ||੪੫੧||
transliteration: dhar firaakash vaalaa ou shaidhaa shudhaa | 451 |
translation: And, keeps wandering in His separation as a lunatic. (451)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਮਤਾਅ ਅੰਦਰ ਦੁਕਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: ee mathaaa andhar dhukaan hak bavadha
translation: This true deal is available only at the shop of Truth,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬਵਦ ||੪੫੨||
transliteration: murashadh kaamil nishaan hak bavadh | 452 |
translation: The complete and perfect Guru is the symbolic image of Akaalpurakh Himself. (452)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਦਿਹਦ ਪਾਕੀ ਤੁਰਾ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil dhihadh paakee thuraa
translation: The perfect Guru, reference here is to Guru Gobind Singh Ji, bestows chastity and holiness upon you;

gurmukhi: ਮੀ ਕਸ਼ਦ ਅਜ਼ ਚਾਹਿ ਗ਼ਮਨਾਕੀ ਤੁਰਾ ||੪੫੩||
transliteration: mee kashadh az chaahi ghamanaakee thuraa | 453 |
translation: And, drags you out of the well (depths) of grief and sorrow. (453)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ੲਿਲਾਜਿ ਦਿਲ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil eilaaj dhil kunadha
translation: The perfect and true Guru removes the maladies of the heart,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਮੁਰਾਦਿ ਦਿਲ ਬਦਿਲ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਕੁਨਦ ||੪੫੪||
transliteration: ee muraadh dhil badhil haasil kunadh | 454 |
translation: With which, all the heart's desires are achieved (fulfilled) within the heart itself. (454)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ ਅਜਬ ਦੌਲਤ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: suhabath aarif ajab dhaaualath bavadha
translation: The company of noble souls is, by itself, an extraordinary wealth,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਹਮਾ ਮੌਕੂਫ਼ ਬਰ ਸੁਹਬਤ ਬਵਦ ||੪੫੫||
transliteration: ee hamaa maauakoof bar suhabath bavadh | 455 |
translation: All this (these) is attained only through the support of the noble persons' company. (455)

gurmukhi: ਅੈ ਅਜ਼ੀਜ਼ਿ ਮਨ ਸ਼ਿਨੌ ਅਜ਼ ਮਨ ਸਖ਼ੁਨ
transliteration: ai azeez man shinaau az man sakhuna
translation: O my dear ! Please listen to what I have to say,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਯਾਬੀ ਰਾਹ ਅੰਦਰ ਜਾਨੋ ਤਨ ||੪੫੬||
transliteration: thaa bayaabee raah andhar jaano than | 456 |
translation: So that you can realize the secret and mystery of life and the body. (456)

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਦੂਸਤਦਾਰ
transliteration: thaalib maradhaan hak raa dhoosathadhaara
translation: You should become friendly to the seekers of the Waaheguru's devotees,

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਸ਼ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ ਹਰਫ਼ੇ ਮਯਾਰ ||੪੫੭||
transliteration: ghair zikarash bar zubaa(n) harafae mayaar | 457 |
translation: And should not bring any word other than the meditation of the Naam of Akaalpurakh on your tongue and lips. (457)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕ ਸ਼ੌ ਮਰਦਾਨਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਬਾਸ਼
transliteration: khaak shaau maradhaan hak raa khaak baasha
translation: You should become and act like dust, i.e., be humble, and become the dust of the passage of the holy men,

gurmukhi: ਨੇ ਪੲੇ ਦੁਨੀਅਾੲਿ ਦੂੰ ਗ਼ਮਨਾਕ ਬਾਸ਼ ||੪੫੮||
transliteration: nae peae dhuneeaae dhoon ghamanaak baash | 458 |
translation: And, do not worry about this frivolous and undignified world. (458)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਰ ਤੂ ਖ਼ਾਨੀ ਨੁਸਖ਼ਾ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ਾਨਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ
transliteration: ghar thoo khaanee nusakhaa az shaan eishaka
translation: If you can read the book of glory of romance,

gurmukhi: ਮੀਸ਼ਵੀ ਸਰ ਦਫ਼ਤਰਿ ਦੀਵਾਨਿ ੲਿਸ਼ਕ ||੪੫੯||
transliteration: meeshavee sar dhafathar dheevaan eishak | 459 |
translation: Then, you could become the address and headline of the book of love. (459)

gurmukhi: ੲਿਸ਼ਕਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਮਰ ਤੁਰਾ ਮੌਲਾ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: eishak maaualaa mar thuraa maaualaa kunadha
translation: Love for Waaheguru transforms you into the very image of Waaheguru Himself,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਮਿਹਤਰੋ ਅੌਲਾ ਕੁਨਦ ||੪੬੦||
transliteration: dhar dho aalam mihatharo aaualaa kunadh | 460 |
translation: And, makes you lofty and famous in both the worlds. (460)

gurmukhi: ਯਾ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ੲੀਂ ਦਿਲਮ ਰਾ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਦਿਹ
transliteration: yaa eilaahee ee dhilam raa shaauak dhiha
translation: O my Akaalpurakh! Kindly bless this heart of mine with Your devotion and love,

gurmukhi: ਲਜ਼ਤੇ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੌਕਿ ਖ਼ਾਸੋ ਜ਼ੌਕ ਦਿਹ ||੪੬੧||
transliteration: lazathae az shaauak khaaso zaauak dhih | 461 |
translation: And, also bestow upon me the savor of the euphoria of Your love. (461)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬ-ਯਾਦਤ ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰਦ ਰੂਜ਼ੋ ਸ਼ਬਮ
transliteration: thaa ba-yaadhath biguzaradh roozo shabama
translation: So that, I can spend my days and nights remembering You,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਹ ਰਹਾੲੀ ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਬੰਦਿ ਗ਼ਮ ||੪੬੨||
transliteration: dhih rehaaee bandhaa raa az bandh gham | 462 |
translation: And, You bless me with redemption from the shackles of worries and griefs of this world. (462)

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤੇ ਅਾਂ ਦਿਹ ਕਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਪਾੲਿਦਾਰ
transliteration: dhaaualathae aa dhih k baashadh paaeidhaara
translation: Kindly bless me with such a treasure that should be permanent and everlasting,

gurmukhi: ਸੁਹਬਤੇ ਅਾਂ ਦਿਹ ਕਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਗ਼ਮਗ਼ੁਸਾਰ ||੪੬੩||
transliteration: suhabathae aa dhih k baashadh ghamaghusaar | 463 |
translation: Also bless me with the company (of such persons) that can dispel all my worries and griefs. (463)

gurmukhi: ਨੀਅਤੇ ਅਾਂ ਦਿਹ ਕਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਹ?ਕ ਗੁਜ਼ਾਰ
transliteration: neeathae aa dhih k baashadh hak guzaara
translation: Kindly bless me with such intentions and purposes that should worship the Truth,

gurmukhi: ਹਿੰਮਤੇ ਅਾਂ ਦਿਹ ਕਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਜਾਂ ਨਿਸਾਰ ||੪੬੪||
transliteration: hinmathae aa dhih k baashadh jaa(n) nisaar | 464 |
translation: Kindly bless me with such a courage and fortitude that I should be prepared to sacrifice my life to venture to go on the road to God. (464)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਦਾਰਦ ਦਰ ਰਹਿਤ ਕੁਰਬਾਂ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: har chih dhaaradh dhar rehith kurabaa(n) kunadha
translation: Whatever there is, he should be prepared to sacrifice on Your account,

gurmukhi: ਜਾਨੋ ਦਿਲ ਕੁਰਬਾਂ ਰਹਿ ਸੁਬਹਾਂ ਕੁਨਦ ||੪੬੫||
transliteration: jaano dhil kurabaa(n) rehi subehaa(n) kunadh | 465 |
translation: Should also be prepared to sacrifice both the life and the soul on the path of Akaalpurakh. (465)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਾ-ਅਮ ਰਾ ਲ?ਜ਼ਤਿ ਦੀਦਾਰ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼
transliteration: dheedhaa-am raa lazath dheedhaar bakhasha
translation: Bless my eyes with the sweet taste of Your glimpse,

gurmukhi: ਸੀਨਾ-ਅਮ ਰਾ ਮਖ਼ਜ਼ਨਿ ਅਸਰਾਰ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ ||੪੬੬||
transliteration: seenaa-am raa makhazan asaraar bakhash | 466 |
translation: And, bless my heart with the treasures of Your mysteries and secrets. (466)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਦਿਲਿ ਬਿਰਯਾਨਿ ਮਾ ਰਾ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਦਿਹ
transliteration: ee dhil birayaan maa raa shaauak dhiha
translation: Kindly bless our charred hearts with the fervor (of Your love)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਗ਼ੁਲੲੇਮ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਰਾ ਤੌਕ ਦਿਹ ||੪੬੭||
transliteration: dhar ghuleaem bandhagee raa thaauak dhih | 467 |
translation: And, bless us with a strap (dog-collar) of meditation in our necks. (467)

gurmukhi: ਹਿਜਰਿ ਮਾ ਰਾ ਅਾਰਜ਼ੂੲਿ ਵਸਲ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼
transliteration: hijar maa raa aarazooe vasal bakhasha
translation: Please bless our separation (from you) with a strong yearning to meet with You,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਖ਼ਿਜ਼ਾਨਿ ਜਿਸਮਿ ਮਾ ਰਾ ਫ਼ਜਲ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ ||੪੬੮||
transliteration: ee khizaan jisam maa raa fajal bakhash | 468 |
translation: And, bestow Your beneficence on the autumn-like-state of our bodies. (468)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਸਰਿ ਮੂੲੇਮ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ ਕੁਨ ਅਜ਼ ਕਰਮ
transliteration: har sar mooeaem zubaa(n) kun az karama
translation: Kindly transform, with your Benefaction, each hair on my body into a tongue,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਬਗੋੲੇਮ ਵਸਫ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਰਾ ਦਮ ਬਦਮ ||੪੬੯||
transliteration: thaa bagoeaem vasaf hak raa dham badham | 469 |
translation: So that I could keep uttering and singing Your kudos in my every breath after breath. (469)

gurmukhi: ਵਸਫ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਬੀਰੰ ਬਵਦ ਅਜ਼ ਗੁਫ਼ਤਗੂ
transliteration: vasaf hak beeran bavadh az gufathagoo
translation: The eclat and glories of Akaalpurakh are beyond any words or conversation,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਹਦੀਸਿ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕੂ ਬ ਕੈ ||੪੭੦||
transliteration: ee hadhees shaah baashadh koo b kai | 470 |
translation: This discourse and tale of the true King can be heard in every street after street. (470)

gurmukhi: ਮਾਅਨੀੲਿ ੲੀਂ ਕੂ ਬ-ਕੂ ਦਾਨੀ ਕਿ ਚੀਸਤ
transliteration: maaaneee ee koo ba-koo dhaanee k cheesatha
translation: Do you know as to what is the essence of this street?

gurmukhi: ਹਮਦ ਗੋ ਦੀਗਰ ਮਗੋ ੲੀਨਸਤ ਜ਼ੀਸਤ ||੪੭੧||
transliteration: hamadh go dheegar mago eenasath zeesath | 471 |
translation: You should utter only His approbations and nothing else. This is life. (471)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੀਸਤਨ ਦਰ ਬੰਦਗੀ ੳੂਲਾ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: zeesathan dhar bandhagee oolaa bavadha
translation: It is superb to live with His constant meditation,

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਚਿਹ ਸਰ ਤਾ ਪਾ ਹਮਾ ਮੂਲਾ ਬਵਦ ||੪੭੨||
transliteration: gar chih sar thaa paa hamaa moolaa bavadh | 472 |
translation: Even though we may be the masters of the body from head to toes. (472)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਦਿਹਦ ਤੌਫ਼ੀਕ ਫ਼ਜਲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਜਲਾਲ
transliteration: gar dhihadh thaauafeek fajal zulajalaala
translation: If the all Truth Akaalpurakh blesses someone with courage and capability,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਅਜ਼ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਮਾਲ ||੪੭੩||
transliteration: bandhaa raa az bandhagee baashadh kamaal | 473 |
translation: Then that person can earn laurels because of meditation. (473)

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਮਾਲਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ
transliteration: bandhagee baashadh kamaal bandhagee
translation: Meditation is the marvel and cornerstone of being a human being,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ||੪੭੪||
transliteration: bandhagee baashadh nishaan zindhagee | 474 |
translation: And, meditation is the real sign of being alive. (474)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀੲਿ ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ੲੀਂ ਬੰਦਗੀਸਤ
transliteration: zindhageee bandhaa raa ee bandhageesatha
translation: The (purpose of) life of a human being is indeed the meditation of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਕਿ ਅੈਨ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀਸਤ ||੪੭੫||
transliteration: bandhageee hak k ain zindhageesath | 475 |
translation: The remembrance of Waaheguru is the real (purpose of) life. (475)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਨਿ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਗੀ ਮੀ-ਬਾੲਿਦਤ
transliteration: gar nishaan zindhagee mee-baaeidhatha
translation: If you are looking for some signs and symbols of life for yourself,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ਤੁਰਾ ਮੀ-ਸ਼ਾੲਿਦਤ ||੪੭੬||
transliteration: bandhageee hak thuraa mee-shaaeidhath | 476 |
translation: Then, it is absolutely appropriate for you to keep on meditating(on the Naam of Akaalpurakh). (476)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਤਵਾਨੀ ਬੰਦਾ ਸ਼ੌ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਮਬਾਸ਼
transliteration: thaa thavaanee bandhaa shaau saahib mabaasha
translation: As far as possible, you should become an humble person like a servant, and not an arrogant master,

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਜੁਜ਼ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਨਬਵਦ ਤਲਾਸ਼ ||੪੭੭||
transliteration: bandhaa raa juz bandhagee nabavadh thalaash | 477 |
translation: A person should not be looking for anything in this world except meditation of the Almighty. (477)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਵਜੂਦਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ਪਾਕ ਅਜ਼ ਬੰਦਗੀਸਤ
transliteration: ee vajoodh khaak paak az bandhageesatha
translation: This body of dust becomes sacred only due to the remembrance of the Provident,

gurmukhi: ਗੁਫ਼ਤਗੂਹਾੲਿ ਦਿਗਰ ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਗੀਸਤ ||੪੭੮||
transliteration: gufathagoohaae dhigar sharamindhageesath | 478 |
translation: To get involved in any conversation other than the meditation will be nothing but an utter shame. (478)

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਗੀ ਕੁਨ ਜ਼ਾਂ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਕਬੂਲ
transliteration: bandhagee kun zaa(n) k oo baashadh kaboola
translation: You should meditate so that you become acceptable in His court,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਗੁਜ਼ਰ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ੁਦ-ਬੀਨੀ ਓ ਤਰਜ਼ਿ ਜ਼ਹੂਲ ||੪੭੯||
transliteration: biguzar az khudha-beenee ou tharaz zehool | 479 |
translation: And, give up the pattern of self ego and the way of life of that of an apostate. (479)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਸਾਹਿਬਿ-ਦਿਲਾਂ ਅਾੲਿਦ ਪਸੰਦ
transliteration: dhar dhil saahibi-dhilaa(n) aaeidh pasandh
translation: The meditation is extremely pleasing to the heart of the Master of all hearts,

gurmukhi: ਰੁਤਬਾ-ਅਤ ਗਰਦਦ ਅਜ਼ਾਂ ਹਰਦਮ ਬੁਲੰਦ ||੪੮੦||
transliteration: ruthabaa-ath garadhadh azaa(n) haradham bulandh | 480 |
translation: Your status in this world remains high at all times only because of meditation. (480)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਅਰਸ਼ਾਦ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil k oo arashaadh karadha
translation: The perfect and true Guru said like this,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਦਿਲਤ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਬਾਦ ਕਰਦ ||੪੮੧||
transliteration: ee dhilath az yaadh hak aabaadh karadh | 481 |
translation: He has inhabited you desolate heart with the remembrance of Waaheguru. (481)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਹਮਾ ਅਰਸ਼ਾਦ ਦਰ ਦਿਲ ਨਕਸ਼-ਬੰਦ
transliteration: ee hamaa arashaadh dhar dhil nakasha-bandha
translation: You should etch this command of the perfectly true Guru in your heart,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਸ਼ਵੀ ਦਰ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਸਰ ਬੁਲੰਦ ||੪੮੨||
transliteration: thaa shavee dhar har dho aalam sar bulandh | 482 |
translation: So that you can have your head high in both the worlds. (482)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਵਜੂਦਿ ਮਿਸ ਤੁਰਾ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ ਤਿਲਾ
transliteration: ee vajoodh mis thuraa saazadh thilaa
translation: This command of the perfect and true Guru transforms your body of copper into that of gold,

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਤਿਲਾ ਮਾਅਲੂਮ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ||੪੮੩||
transliteration: ee thilaa maaaloom az yaadh khudhaa | 483 |
translation: And, this gold is realized only through the memory of Akaalpurakh. (483)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਤਿਲਾ ਫ਼ਾਨੀ ਵਾ ਸਦ ਮੌਜ਼ਿ ਬਲਾ
transliteration: aaa(n) thilaa faanee vaa sadh maauaz balaa
translation: This materialistic gold is destructible and is the root cause and whirlpool of  numerous problems and conflicts,

transliteration: ee thilaa baakee choo zaath kibareeaa | 484 |
translation: The gold of meditation, however, like the Entity of Omnipresent and True Waaheguru is permanent. (484)

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤ ਅੰਦਰ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਪਾੲਿ ਮੁਕਬਲਾਂ
transliteration: dhaaualath andhar khaak paae mukabalaa(n)
translation: The (true) wealth is in the dust of the feet of the noble and accepted souls,

gurmukhi: ਦੌਲਤੇ ਕਾਂ ਰਾ ਨਮੀ ਅਾਯਦ ਜ਼ਿਅਾਂ ||੪੮੫||
transliteration: dhaaualathae kaa(n) raa namee aayadh ziaa | 485 |
translation: It is such a true wealth that it is above and beyond any damage or loss. (485)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਕਬਤ ਦੀਦੀ ਖ਼ਿਜ਼ਾਂ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ ਬਹਾਰ
transliteration: aakabath dheedhee khizaa(n) aavuradh behaara
translation: You must have noticed that every spring brings in the autumn,

gurmukhi: ਵਰਨਾ ਦਰ ਦੁਨਿਅਾ ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ਸਲਿ ਬਹਾਰ ||੪੮੬||
transliteration: varanaa dhar dhuniaa hamaa fasal behaar | 486 |
translation: Although the spring keeps coming into this world again and again. (486)

gurmukhi: ੲੀਂ ਬਹਾਰਿ ਤਾਜ਼ਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਤਾ ਅਬਦ
transliteration: ee behaar thaazaa baashadh thaa abadha
translation: However, this meditational form of spring remains fresh and new till the doomsday,

gurmukhi: ਯਾ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ਦੂਰ ਦਾਰ ਅਜ਼ ਂਚਸ਼ਮਿ ਬਦ ||੪੮੭||
transliteration: yaa eilaahee dhoor dhaar az achasham badh | 487 |
translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly keep the influence of the evil eye far away from this spring . (487)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਪਾੲਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਸੁਰਮਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ
transliteration: har k khaak paae shaa(n) raa suramaa yaafatha
translation: Anyone who happens to obtain the collyrium of the dust of the feet of the holy persons,

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਰੁਖ਼ਸ਼ ਤਹਿਕੀਕ ਨੂਰਿ ਮਿਹਰ ਤਾਫ਼ਤ ||੪੮੮||
transliteration: bar rukhash thehikeek noor mihar thaafath | 488 |
translation: Rest assured that his face will shine like the brilliance and radiance of the divine sun. (488)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਿ ਅ?ਲਾਹ ਦਰ ਦੁਨੀਅਾਂ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: aarif alaah dhar dhuneeaa bavadha
translation: Even though spiritually enlightened person lives in this world,

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਤਾਲਿਬਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਬਵਦ ||੪੮੯||
transliteration: dhar hakeekath thaalib maaualaa bavadh | 489 |
translation: He, in fact, is always a seeker-devotee of the Waaheguru. (489)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਮੌਲਾ ਦਮ ਬ-ਦਮ ਦਰ ਜਾਨਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: zikar maaualaa dham ba-dham dhar jaan oo
translation: He meditates and describes His virtues every breath of his life,

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿਤਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਦਰ ਸ਼ਾਨਿ ੳੂ ||੪੯੦||
transliteration: aaeith naam khudhaa dhar shaan oo | 490 |
translation: And, he recites verses of His Naam every moment in His honor. (490)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਨਫ਼ਸ ਦਾਰੰਦ ਦਿਲ ਰਾ ਸੂੲਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: har nafas dhaarandh dhil raa sooe haka
translation: They keep directing their hearts and concentrating towards thoughts about Him,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੁਦ ਮੁਅ?ਤਰ ਮਗ਼ਜ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਅਜ਼ ਬੂੲਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੪੯੧||
transliteration: shudh muathar maghaz shaa(n) az booe hak | 491 |
translation: They make their intellect fragrant with the aroma of the memory of Akaalpurakhb in every breath. (491)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਦਮੇ ਕੂ ਬਾ ਖ਼ੁਦਾ ਵਾਸਿਲ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: har dhamae koo baa khudhaa vaasil bavadha
translation: He always concentrates and is united with the Almighty at all times,

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ੲੀਂ ੳੁਮਰ ਰਾ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਬਵਦ ||੪੯੨||
transliteration: haasil ee oumar raa haasil bavadh | 492 |
translation: And, he has been able to achieve the real fruits of this life. (492)

gurmukhi: ਹਾਸਿਲਿ ੲੀਂ ੳੁਮਰ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਿਦ ਅਸਤ
transliteration: haasil ee oumar paesh murashidh asatha
translation: The real fruits of this life lies with the Guru,

gurmukhi: ਨਾਮਿ ਹ?ਕ ਚੂੰ ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਨਸ਼ ਵਾਰਿਦ ਅਸਤ ||੪੯੩||
transliteration: naam hak choon bar zubaanash vaaridh asath | 493 |
translation: And, silent repetition and meditation of His Naam is always on his tongue and the lips. (493)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਵਦ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: murashadh kaamil bavadh dheedhaar haka
translation: The true Guru is the apparent glimpse of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਨਿਸ਼ ਬਿਸ਼ਨਵੀ ਅਸਰਾਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੪੯੪||
transliteration: kaz zubaanish bishanavee asaraar hak | 494 |
translation: Therefore, you should listen to His mysteries from his tongue. (494)

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਤਿ ਹ?ਕ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਬਵਦ
transliteration: soorath hak murashadh kaamil bavadha
translation: A true Guru is indeed a perfect personification of the image of God,

gurmukhi: ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਦਾੲਿਮ ਦਰੂਨਿ ਦਿਲ ਬਵਦ ||੪੯੫||
transliteration: nakash oo dhaaeim dharoon dhil bavadh | 495 |
translation: And, the image of Akaalpurakh always abides in his heart. (495)

gurmukhi: ਨਕਸ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਦਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਕਸ ਜਾ ਕੁਨਦ
transliteration: nakash oo dhar dhil kas jaa kunadha
translation: When His image resides permanently in someone's heart,

gurmukhi: ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅੰਦਰ ਦਿਲਸ਼ ਮਾਵਾ ਕੁਨਦ ||੪੯੬||
transliteration: haraf hak andhar dhilash maavaa kunadh | 496 |
translation: Then, just one word of Akaalpurakh settles down in the depths of his heart. (496)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਸਤਮ ਤਰਤੀਬਿ ੲੀਂ ਦੁ?ਰ ਦਾਨਾ ਰਾ
transliteration: khaasatham tharatheeb ee dhur dhaanaa raa
translation: I have threaded these grains of pearls into a necklace,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਅਾਸ਼ਨਾ ਸਾਜ਼ਦ ਦਿਲਿ ਬੇਗਾਨਾ ਰਾ ||੪੯੭||
transliteration: k aashanaa saazadh dhil baegaanaa raa | 497 |
translation: So that this arrangement may make the ignorant hearts aware of the secrets of Waaheguru. (497)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਬਿ ਹੈਵਾਂ ਪੁਰ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਚੂ ਜਾਮਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: aab haivaa(n) pur shudhaa choo jaam oo
translation: (This compilation) Like a cup is filled to the brim with the divine elixir,

transliteration: zindhagee naamaa shudhaa zaa(n) naam oo | 498 |
translation: That is why, it has been given the name 'Zindagee Naamaa'. (498)

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ ਤਕ?ਲੁਮ ਬੂੲਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਂ ਅਾੲਿਦਸ਼
transliteration: kaz thakalum booe eirafaa(n) aaeidhasha
translation: From his speeches emerges the fragrance of divine knowledge,

gurmukhi: ਵਜ਼ ਦਿਲਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਗਿਰਾਹ ਬਿਕੁਸ਼ਾੲਿਦਸ਼ ||੪੯੯||
transliteration: vaz dhil aalam giraah bikushaaeidhash | 499 |
translation: With it, the knot (mysteries and suspicions) of the heart of the world is untangled. (499)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਦ ਅਜ਼ ਰਹਿ ਲੁਤਫ਼ੋ ਕਰਮ
transliteration: har k khaanadh az rehi luthafo karama
translation: Whosoever recites this with the grace and compassion of Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਗਰਦਦਸ਼ ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ੲਿਰਫ਼ਾਂ ਮੁਹਤਰਿਮ ||੫੦੦||
transliteration: garadhadhash dhar raahi eirafaa(n) muhatharim | 500 |
translation: He receives laurels among the enlightened persons. (500)

gurmukhi: ਹਸਤ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਅਾਰਿਫ਼ਾਨਿ ਪਾਕ ਰਾ
transliteration: hasath zikar aarifaan paak raa
translation: This volume contains description and delineation of sacred and divine men;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਕੁਨਦ ੲਿਦਰਾਕ ਰਾ ||੫੦੧||
transliteration: aa k oo raauashan kunadh eidharaak raa | 501 |
translation: This description lightens up the intelligence and the wisdom. (501)

gurmukhi: ਨੀਸਤ ਦਰ ਵੈ ਮੁੰਦਰਜ ਅੈ ਬਾ-ਖ਼ਬਰ
transliteration: neesath dhar vai mundharaj ai baa-khabara
translation: O informed person! In this volume,

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਦਿਗਰ ||੫੦੨||
transliteration: ghair haraf bandhagee haraf dhigar | 502 |
translation: there is no other word or expression except the words or expressions of remembrance and meditation of  Akaalpuralkh. (502)

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸਰਮਾਯਾ-ੲਿ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਦਿਲੀਸਤ
transliteration: yaadh hak saramaayaa-e raauashan dhileesatha
translation: Remembrance of Waaheguru is the treasure of the enlightened minds,

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਹਮਾ ਬੇ-ਹਾਸਲੀਅਤ ||੫੦੩||
transliteration: ghair yaadh hak hamaa bae-haasaleeath | 503 |
translation: Everything else other than the meditation of Waaheguru is (absolutely) useless. (503)

gurmukhi: ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਦੀਗਰ ਨੀਸਤ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: haraf dheegar neesath ghair az yaadh haka
translation: Do not read or even look at any word or expression except the ones about meditation of the Omnipotent,

gurmukhi: ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਹਾਂ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ਹਾਂ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੫੦੪||
transliteration: yaadh hak haa(n) yaadh hak haa(n) yaadh hak | 504 |
translation: Remembrance of God, yes remembrance of God, and only remembrance of God. (504)

gurmukhi: ਯਾ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ਹਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਪਜ਼ਮੁਰਦਾ ਰਾ
transliteration: yaa eilaahee har dhil pazamuradhaa raa
translation: O Akaalpurakh! Kindly make every withered and disheartened mind green and confident again,

gurmukhi: ਸਬਜ਼ ਕੁਨ ਹਰ ਖ਼ਾਤਿਰਿ ਅਫ਼ਸੁਰਦਾ ਰਾ ||੫੦੫||
transliteration: sabaz kun har khaathir afasuradhaa raa | 505 |
translation: And, refresh and rejuvenate every wilted and languishing mind. (505)

gurmukhi: ਯਾ ੲਿਲਾਹੀ ਯਾਵਰੀ ਕੁਨ ਬੰਦਾ ਰਾ
transliteration: yaa eilaahee yaavaree kun bandhaa raa
translation: O Waaheguru! Kindly help this person, yours truly,

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਖ਼ੁਰੂ ਕੁਨ ਹਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਸ਼ਰਮਿੰਦਾ ਰਾ ||੫੦੬||
transliteration: surakhuroo kun har dhil sharamindhaa raa | 506 |
translation: And, make every ashamed and timid person successful and triumphant. (506)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਦਿਲਿ ਗੋਯਾ ਹਵਾੲਿ ਸ਼ੌਕ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼
transliteration: dhar dhil goyaa havaae shaauak bakhasha
translation: O Akaalpurakh! (Kindly) bless the heart of Goyaa with the yearning of love (for You),

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਨਸ਼ ਜ਼?ਰਾ-ੲਿ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ੌਕ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ ||੫੦੭||
transliteration: bar zubaanash zaraa-e az zaauak bakhash | 507 |
translation: And, bestow upon the tongue of Goyaa just one particle of the fondness for Your love. (507)

gurmukhi: ਤਾਂ ਨ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਵਿਰਦਿ ਅਾਂ ਜੁਜ਼ ਯਾਦਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: thaa n baashadh viradh aaa(n) juz yaadh haka
translation: So that he would not meditate or remember anyone other than the Lord,

gurmukhi: ਤਾਂ ਨ ਖ਼ਾਨਦ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹ?ਕ ਦੀਗਰ ਸਬ?ਕ ||੫੦੮||
transliteration: thaa(n) n khaanadh ghair hak dheegar sabak | 508 |
translation: And, so that he would not learn or recite any other lesson except that of the love and devotion for Waaheguru. (508)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਨ ਗੀਰਦ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਨਾਮਿ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: thaa n geeradh ghair naam zikar haka
translation: So that he would not speak any other word except the meditation and remembrance of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਨ ਗੋੲਿਦ ਹਰਫ਼ਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਫ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ||੫੦੯||
transliteration: thaa n goeidh haraf ghair az fikar hak | 509 |
translation: So that he would not recite or read any other word or expression except that the one(s) on the concentration of spiritual thought. (509)

gurmukhi: ਦੀਦਾ ਅਜ਼ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ-ਹ?ਕ ਪੁਰ-ਨੂਰ ਕੁਨ
transliteration: dheedhaa az dheedhaari-hak pura-noor kuna
translation: (O Akaalpurakh!) Kindly make my eyes refulgent with glow by blessing  me with a glimpse of the Almighty,

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਹ?ਕ ਅਜ਼ ਖ਼ਾਤਰਿ ਦਿਲਿ ਦੂਰ ਕੁਨ ||੫੧੦||
transliteration: ghair hak az khaathar dhil dhoor kun | 510 |
translation: Kindly remove everything from my heart except the entity of God. (510)

gurmukhi: ਗੰਜ ਨਾਮਾ
transliteration: ganj naamaa
translation: Ganj Nama

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲੋ ਜਾਨਮ ਬ-ਹਰ ਸਬਾਹੋ ਮਸਾ
transliteration: dhilo jaanam ba-har sabaaho masaa
translation: Every morning and evening, my heart and soul,

gurmukhi: ਸਰੋ ਫ਼ਰਕਮ ਜ਼ਿ ਰੂੲਿ ਸਿਦਕੋ ਸਫ਼ਾ ||੧||
transliteration: saro farakam z rooe sidhako safaa | 1 |
translation: My head and forehead with faith and clarity (1)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਦ ਬਰ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਤਰੀਕਿ ਨਿਸਾਰ
transliteration: baadh bar murashadh thareek nisaara
translation: Shall sacrifice for my Guru,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਸਰਿ ੲਿਮਜ਼ ਸਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਬਾਰ ||੨||
transliteration: az sar eimaz sadh hazaaraa(n) baar | 2 |
translation: And sacrifice with humility by bowing my head millions of times. (2)

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਜ਼ਿ ੲਿਨਸਾਂ ਮਲਿਕ ਨਮੂਦਸਤ ੳੂ
transliteration: k z einasaa(n) malik namoodhasath oo
translation: Because, he created angels out of ordinary human beings,

gurmukhi: ੲਿਜ਼ਤਿ ਖ਼ਾਕੀਅਾਂ ਫ਼ਜ਼ੂਦਸਤ ੳੂ ||੩||
transliteration: eizath khaakeeaa fazoodhasath oo | 3 |
translation: And, he elevated the status and honor of the earthly beings. (3)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਸਗਾਂ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਪਾੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: khaasagaa jumalaa khaak paae oo
translation: All those honored by Him are, in fact, the dust of His feet,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਮਲਕੂਤੀਅਾਂ ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲਿ ੳੂ ||੪||
transliteration: hamaa malakootheeaa fidhaae oo | 4 |
translation: And, all gods and goddesses are willing to sacrifice themselves for Him. (4)

gurmukhi: ਗਰ ਫ਼ਿਰੋਜ਼ਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰ ਮਿਹਰੋ ਮਾਹ
transliteration: gar firozadh hazaar miharo maaha
translation: Even though, thousands of moons and suns might be shinig,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਲਮੇ ਦਾਂ ਜੁਜ਼ ੳੂ ਤਮਾਮ ਸਿਅਾਹ ||੫||
transliteration: aalamae dhaa(n) juz oo thamaam siaah | 5 |
translation: Still the whole world will be in pitch darkness without Him. (5)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦਿ ਪਾਕ ਨੂਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਮਦ
transliteration: murashadh paak noor hak aamadha
translation: Holy and chaste Guru is the image of Akaalpurakh Himself,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਾਂ ਸਬ?ਬ ਦਰ ਦਿਲਮ ਸਬਕ ਅਾਮਦ ||੬||
transliteration: zaa(n) sabab dhar dhilam sabak aamadh | 6 |
translation: That is the reason that I have settled Him inside my heart. (6)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਂ ਕਸਾਨੇ ਕਿ ਜ਼ੋ ਨ ਯਾਦ ਅਾਰੰਦ
transliteration: aaa(n) kasaanae k zo n yaadh aarandha
translation: Those persons who do not contemplate Him,

gurmukhi: ਸਮਰਾ-ੲੇ ਜਾਨੋ ਦਿਲ ਬਬਾਦ ਅਾਰੰਦ ||੭||
transliteration: samaraa-eae jaano dhil babaadh aarandh | 7 |
translation: Take it that they have wasted the fruit of their heart and soul for nothing. (7)

gurmukhi: ਮਜ਼ਰਾ-ੲਿ ਪੁਰ ਸਮਰ ਬ-ਅਰਜ਼ਾਨੀ
transliteration: mazaraa-e pur samar ba-arazaanee
translation: This field loaded with cheap fruits,

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਮ-ਬੀਨਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਦੂਰ ਸੇਰਾਨੀ ||੮||
transliteration: choon ma-beenadh z dhoor saeraanee | 8 |
translation: When he looks at them to his heart's content, (8)

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਬਸਾਤ ਅਾੲਿਦਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ਾਂ ਦੀਦਨ
transliteration: einbasaath aaeidhash azaa(n) dheedhana
translation: Then he gets a special kind of pleasure to look at them,

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਸ਼ਤਾਬਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਬਰਚੀਦਨ ||੯||
transliteration: bar shathaabadh z behir baracheedhan | 9 |
translation: And, he runs towards them to pluck them. (9)

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਹਾਸਿਲ ਨਿਅਾਰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਵੈ ਬਾਰ
transliteration: laek haasil niaaradh az vai baara
translation: However, he does not get any results from his fields,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜ਼ ਗਰਦਦ ਗੁਰਸਨਾ ਖ਼ੁਅਾਰੋ ਨਜ਼ਾਰ ||੧੦||
transliteration: baaz garadhadh gurasanaa khuaaro nazaar | 10 |
translation: And, returns disappointed hungry, thirsty and debilitated. (10)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਹਮਾ ਬ-ਦਾਂ ਮਾਨਦ
transliteration: ghair sathigur hamaa ba-dhaa(n) maanadha
translation: Without Satguru, you should consider everything to be like as if

gurmukhi: ਕਾਂ ਚੁਨਾਂ ਜ਼ਰੲਿ ਬਾਰ-ਵਰ ਦਾਨਦ ||੧੧||
transliteration: kaa(n) chunaa(n) zarae baara-var dhaanadh | 11 |
translation: The field is ripe and grown but full of weeds and thorns. (11)

gurmukhi: ਪਹਿਲੀ ਪਾਤਸ਼ਾਹੀ (ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਦੇਵ ਜੀ)
transliteration: pehilee paathashaahee aguroo naanak dhaev jee
translation: Pehlee Paatshaahee (Sri Guru Nanak Dev Ji)

gurmukhi: ਪਹਿਲੀ ਪਾਤਸ਼ਾਹੀ ੳੁਸ ਸ?ਚੇ ਅਤੇ ਸਮਰ?ਥ ਦੇ ਨੂਰ ਨੂੰ ਚਮਕਾੳੁਣ ਵਾਲੀ, ਅਤੇ ਰ?ਬ ਤੇ ਭਰੋਸੇ ਦੇ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਨੂੰ ਰੋਸ਼ਨ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲੀ ਹੈ [
transliteration: pehilee paathashaahee ous sachae athae samarath dhae noor noon chamakaaoun vaalee, athae rab thae bharosae dhae giaan noon roshan karan vaalee hai |
translation: The first Sikh Guru, Guur Nanak Dev Ji, was the one who glistened the true and all-powerful refulgence of the Almighty and to highlight the significance of knowledge of complete faith in Him.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਸਦੀਵੀ ਜਾਣਕਾਰੀ ਦਾ ਝੰਡਾ ੳੁ?ਚਂ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲੀ ਅਤੇ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਦੇ ਅੰਨ੍ਹੇਰੇ ਨੂੰ ਦੂਰ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲੀ, ਪਾਤਾਲ ਤੋਂ ਲੈਕੇ ਅਨੰਤ ਤਕ ੳੁਸ ਰ?ਬ ਦੇ ਫਰਮਾਨ ਦਾ ਪਲਾਨਾ ਅਾਪਣੇ ਮੋਢੇ ਤੇ ਰ?ਖੀ ਬੈ
transliteration: ous sadheevee jaanakaaree dhaa jhanddaa oucha karan vaalee athae giaan dhae annaaerae noon dhoor karan vaalee, paathaal tho laikae ananth thak ous rab dhae faramaan dhaa palaanaa aapanae motae thae ra
translation: He was the one who elevated the flag of eternal spirituality and eliminated the darkness of ignorance of divine enlightenment and who took upon his own shoulders the responsibility of propagating the message of Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਹੂੂਤ ਤੋਂ ਲੈਕੇ ੲਿਸ ਜਹਾਨ ਤ?ਕ ਸਭ ੳੁਸ ਦੇ ਦਰ ਦੀ ਖਾਕ ਹਨ [
transliteration: laahooooth tho laikae eis jehaan thak sabh ous dhae dhar dhee khaak han |a
translation: Beginning from the earliest time to the present world, everyone considers himself to be the dust at his door;

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦਾ ਜ?ਸ ਗਾੲਿਣ ਕਰਣ ਵਾਲਾ ਅਾਪ ਵ?ਡੇ ਮਰਤਬੇ ਵਾਲਾ ਰ?ਬ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਦਾ ਤਾਲਬ ਅਾਪ ਰ?ਬ ਦੀ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ ਜ਼ਾਤ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ous dhaa jas gaaein karan vaalaa aap vaddae marathabae vaalaa rab hai athae ous dhaa thaalab aap rab dhee abinaasee zaath hai |
translation: The highest-ranked, the Lord, Himself sings his praises; and his disciple-student is the divine lineage of Waaheguru Himself.

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚੌਥੇ ਅਤੇ ਛੇਵੇਂ ਫਰਿਸ਼ਤੇ ਦਾ ਕਲਾਮ ਵੀ ੳੁਸੇ ਦੀ ਸਿਫਤ ਸਾਲਾਹ ਕਰਣ ਤੋਂ ਅਸਮਰ?ਥ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਦਾ ਨੂਰ ਨਾਲ ਭਰਿਅਾ ਝੰਡਾ ਦੋਹਾਂ ਜਹਾਨਾਂ ਤੇ ਝੁਲਦਾ ਹੈ [
transliteration: har chaauathae athae shaevae farishathae dhaa kalaam vee ousae dhee sifath saalaah karan tho asamarath hai athae ous dhaa noor naal bhariaa jhanddaa dhohaa(n) jehaanaa(n) thae jhuladhaa hai |
translation: Every fourth and sixth angel is unable to describe Guru's eclat in their expressions; and his radiance filled flag is flying over both the worlds.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦੇ ਹੁਕਮ ਦੀ ਮਿਸਾਲ ਰ?ਬ ਦੀਅਾਂ ਨੂਰਾਨੀ ਕਿਰਨਾਂ ਹਨ ਅਤੇ ੳੁਸਦੇ ਸਾਹਮਣੇ ਲ?ਖਾਂ ਚੰਨ ਸੂਰਜ ਅੰਨ੍ਹੇਰੇ ਦੇ ਸਮੁੰਦਰ ਵਿਚ ਡੁਬ ਜਾਂਦੇ ਹਨ [
transliteration: ous dhae hukam dhee misaal rab dheeaa nooraanee kiranaa(n) han athae ousadhae saahamanae lakhaa(n) chann sooraj annaaerae dhae samundhar vich ddub jaa(n)dhae han |
translation: Examples of his command are the brilliant rays emanating from the Provident and when compared to him, millions of suns and moons get drowned in the oceans of darkness.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦੇ ਬਚਨ ਅਤੇ ਅਾਗਿਅਾ ਦੁਨੀਅਾਂ ਦੇ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਲੲੀ ਸਰਵੋਤਮ ਹਨ, ਅਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਦੀ ਸਫਾਰਸ਼ ਦੋਹਾਂ ਜਹਾਨਾਂ ਲੲੀ ਪਹਿਲਾ ਦਰਜਾ ਰਖਦੀ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ous dhae bachan athae aagiaa dhuneeaa dhae lokaa(n) lee saravotham hana, athae ous dhee safaarash dhohaa(n) jehaanaa(n) lee pehilaa dharajaa rakhadhee hai |
translation: His words, messages and orders are the supreme for the people of the world and his recommendations rank absolutely first in both the worlds.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦੇ ਸ?ਚੇ ਖਿਤਾਬ ਦੋਹਾਂ ਜਹਾਨਾਂ ਦੇ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਹਨ ਅਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਦੀ ਸ?ਚੀ ਜ਼ਾਤ ਗੁਨਾਹਗਾਰਾਂ ਲੲੀ ਰਹਿਮਤ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ous dhae sachae khithaab dhohaa(n) jehaanaa(n) dhae murashadh han athae ous dhee sachee zaath gunaahagaaraa(n) lee rehimath hai |
translation: His true titles are the guide for both the worlds; and his true disposition is the compassion for the sinful.

gurmukhi: ਰ?ਬ ਦੀ ਦਰਗਾਹ ਦੇ ਦੇਵਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਦੇ ਚਰਨਾਂ ਦੀ ਧੂੜ ਨੂੰ ਚੁੰਮਦੇ ਹਨ ਅਤੇ ੳੁਚੇਰੇ ਦਰਬਾਰ ਦੇ ਪਵਿ?ਤ੍ਰ ਫਰਸ਼ਿਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦ ਦੇ ਗੋਲੇ ਅਤੇ ਗੁਲਾਮ ਹਨ [
transliteration: rab dhee dharagaah dhae dhaevathae ous murashadh dhae charanaa(n) dhee dhoorr noon chunmadhae han athae ouchaerae dharabaar dhae pavthr farashithae ous murashadh dhae golae athae gulaam han |
translation: The gods in the court of Waaheguru consider it a privilege to kiss the dust of his lotus feet and the angles of the higher court are slaves and servitors of this mentor.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦੇ ਪਵਿ?ਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਮ ਦੇ ਦੋਵੇਂ ਨੂੰਨ ਨਿਅਾਮਤਾਂ ਬਖਸ਼ਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਅਤੇ ਸਹਾੲੀ ਹੋਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਹਨ [ ਵਿਚਕਾਰਲਾ ਅਲਿਫ ਅਕਾਲਪੁਰਖ ਦਾ ਲਖਾੲਿਕ ਹੈ, ਅਖੀਰਲਾ ਕਾਫ਼ ਅੰਤਮ ਮਹਾਂਪੁਰਖ ਦਾ ਸੂਚਕ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ous dhae pavthr naam dhae dhovae noonn niaamathaa(n) bakhashan vaalae athae sehaaee hon vaalae han | vichakaaralaa alif akaalapurakh dhaa lakhaaeik hai, akheeralaa kaaf antham mehaa(n)purakh dhaa sooc
translation: Both the ens (N's) in his name depict nurturer, nourisher ans neighborly (boons, support and benefactions); the middle A represents the Akaalpurakh, and the last K represents the Ultimate great prophet.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦੀ ਫਕੀਰੀ ਕਾਮਲ ਫਕਰ ਦਾ ਸਿਰ ੳੁ?ਚਾ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲੀ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਦੀ ਸਖਾਵਤ ਦੋਹਾਂ ਜਹਾਨਾਂ ਵਿਚ ਭਰਪੂਰ ਹੈ ||੧੨||
transliteration: ous dhee fakeeree kaamal fakar dhaa sir ouchaa karan vaalee hai athae ous dhee sakhaavath dhohaa(n) jehaanaa(n) vich bharapoor hai | 12 |
translation: His mendicancy raises the bar of detachment from the worldly distractions to the highest level and his generosity and benevolence prevails all over both the worlds. (12)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਜੀੳੁ ਸਤ
transliteration: vaahiguroo jeeo sath
translation: Waaheguru is the Truth,

gurmukhi: ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਜੀੳੁ ਹਾਜ਼ਰ ਨਾਜ਼ਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: vaahiguroo jeeo haazar naazar hai
translation: Waaheguru is Omnipresent

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦਾ ਨਾਮ ਨਾਨਕ ਪਾਤਸ਼ਾਹ ਹੈ ਤੇ ੳੁਹ ਸ?ਚੇ ਧਰਮ ਵਾਲਾ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ous dhaa naam naanak paathashaah hai thae ouh sachae dharam vaalaa hai |a
translation: His name is Nanak, the emperor and his religion is the truth,

gurmukhi: ਅਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਜਿਹਾ ਹੋਰ ਕੋੲੀ ਦਰਵੇਸ਼ ਸੰਸਾਰ ਵਿਚ ਨਹੀਂ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੩||
transliteration: athae ous jihaa hor koee dharavaesh sansaar vich nehee aaeiaa | 13 |
translation: And that, there has not been another prophet like him who emanated in this world. (13)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ੁਕਰੇ ੳੂ ਫ਼ਕਰ ਰਾ ਸਰ-ਫ਼ਰਾਜ਼ੀ
transliteration: fukarae oo fakar raa sara-faraazee
translation: His mendicancy (by precept and practice) lifts the head of saintly living to lofty heights,

gurmukhi: ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਕਾਰਿ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਜਾਨਬਾਜ਼ੀ ||੧੪||
transliteration: paesh oo kaar jumalaa jaanabaazee | 14 |
translation: And, in his view, everyone should be prepared to venture his life for the principles of truth and noble deeds. (14)

gurmukhi: ਤਾਲਿਬੇ ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ੳੂ ਚਿਹ ਖ਼ਾਸੋ ਚਿਹ ਅਾਮ
transliteration: thaalibae khaak oo chih khaaso chih aama
translation: Whether special person of high status or ordinary people, whether angels or

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਮਲਾੲਿਕ ਚਿਹ ਹਾਜ਼ਰਾਨਿ ਤਮਾਮ ||੧੫||
transliteration: chih malaaeik chih haazaraan thamaam | 15 |
translation: Whether onlookers of the heavenly court, all of them are desirous-petitioners of the dust of his lotus feet. (15)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕ ਚੂ ਖ਼ੁ?ਦ ਵਾਸਿਫ਼ਸ਼ ਚਿਗੋੲਿਮ ਮਨ
transliteration: hak choo khudh vaasifash chigoeim mana
translation: When God Himself is showering praises on him, what can I add to that?

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਰਾਹਿ ਵਸਫ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਚਿ ਪੋੲਿਮ ਮਨ ||੧੬||
transliteration: dhar raahi vasaf oo ch poeim man | 16 |
translation: In fact, how should I travel on the path of approbations? (16)

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਮੁਰੀਦਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਮਲਕੂਤ
transliteration: sadh hazaaraa(n) mureedhash az malakootha
translation: Millions from the world of souls, the angels, are his devotees,

gurmukhi: ਸਦ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਮੁਰੀਦਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਨਾਸੂਤ ||੧੭||
transliteration: sadh hazaaraa(n) mureedhash az naasooth | 17 |
translation: And, millions of people from this world are also his disciples. (17)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਜਬਰੂਤੀਅਾਂ ਫ਼ਿਦਾੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: hamaa jabarootheeaa fidhaae oo
translation: Gods of the metaphysical world are all willing to sacrifice themselves for him,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਲਾਹੂਤੀਅਾਂ ਬਪਾੲਿ ੳੂ ||੧੮||
transliteration: hamaa laahootheeaa bapaae oo | 18 |
translation: And, even all the angels of the spiritual world are also prepared to follow suit. (18)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਨਾਸੂਤੀਅਾਂ ਮਲਾੲਿਕਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: hamaa naasootheeaa malaaeik oo
translation: People of this world are all his creations as angels,

gurmukhi: ਜਲਵਾ-ਅਸ਼ ਦਾਂ ਤਹਿਤੋ ਫ਼ੌਕਿ ਨਿਕੂ ||੧੯||
transliteration: jalavaa-ash dhaa(n) thehitho faauak nikoo | 19 |
translation: And, his glimpse is clearly manifested on the lips of everyone. (19)

gurmukhi: ਜਾ-ਨਸ਼ੀਨਾਨਿ ੳੂ ਅਜ਼ ੳੂ ਲਾੲਿਕ
transliteration: jaa-nasheenaan oo az oo laaeika
translation: All his associates enjoying his company become knowledgeable (of spiritualism)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਕਰਿ ਤੌਸੀਫ਼ਿ ਜ਼ਾਤ ਰਾ ਲਾੲਿਕ ||੨੦||
transliteration: zikar thaauaseef zaath raa laaeik | 20 |
translation: And, they begin to describe the glories of Waaheguru in their speeches. (20)

gurmukhi: ਅਬਦ ਅਾਬਾਦ ਕਦਰੋ ਜਾਹੋ ਨਿਸ਼ਾਂ
transliteration: abadh aabaadh kadharo jaaho nishaa(n)
translation: Their honor and esteem, status and rank and name and imprints stay in this world forever;

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਅਫ਼ਰਾਜ਼ਦ ਜ਼ਿ ਯ?ਕ ਦਿਗਰ ਸੁਬਹਾਂ ||੨੧||
transliteration: bar afaraazadh z yak dhigar subehaa(n) | 21 |
translation: And, the chaste Creator bestows upon them a higher rank than others. (21)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦੁਲ-ਅਾਲਮੀਂ ਸ਼ੁਦਸ ਚੂ ਖ਼ਿਤਾਬ
transliteration: murashadhula-aalamee shudhas choo khithaaba
translation: When the prophet of both the world addressed

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਅਨਾਯਾਤਿ ਹਜ਼ਰਤਿ ਵਹਾਬ ||੨੨||
transliteration: az anaayaath hazarath vehaab | 22 |
translation: Through his benefaction, the all-powerful Waaheguru, he said (22)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਫ਼ਤ ਮਨ ਬੰਦਾ ਓ ਗ਼ੁਲਾਮਿ ਤੂ ਅਮ
transliteration: gufath man bandhaa ou ghulaam thoo ama
translation: Then he said, I am Your servitor, and I am Your slave,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਅਕਦਾਮਿ ਖ਼ਾਸੋ ਅਾਮਿ ਤੂ ਅਮ ||੨੩||
transliteration: khaak akadhaam khaaso aam thoo am | 23 |
translation: And, I am the dust of the feet of all of Your ordinary and special people. (23)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜ਼ ਚੂੰ ਹਮਚੁਨੀਂ ਖ਼ਿਤਾਬ ਅਾਮਦ
transliteration: baaz choon hamachunee khithaab aamadha
translation: Thus when he addressed Him like this (in stark humility)

gurmukhi: ਮਤਵਾਤਰ ਚੁਨੀਂ ਜਵਾਬ ਅਾਮਦ ||੨੪||
transliteration: mathavaathar chunee javaab aamadh | 24 |
translation: Then he got the same response again and again. (24)

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਮਨਮ ਦਰ ਤੂ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਤੂ ਕਸ ਨੀਸਤ
transliteration: k manam dhar thoo ghair thoo kas neesatha
translation: That I, the Akaalpurkh, abide in you and I do not recognize anyone other than you,

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਖ਼ਾਹਮ ਕੁਨਮ ਹਮਾ ਅਦਲੀਸਤ ||੨੫||
transliteration: har chih khaaham kunam hamaa adhaleesath | 25 |
translation: Whatever I, the Waheeguru, desire, I do; and I do only the justice. (25)

gurmukhi: ਰਾਹਿ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਮ ਬ ਅਾਲਮੇ ਬਿਨੁਮਾ
transliteration: raahi zikaram b aalamae binumaa
translation: You should show the meditation (of my Naam) to the entire world,

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਮਾ ਸ਼ੋ ਜ਼ਿ ਵਸਫ਼ਿ ਮਨ ਗੋਯਾ ||੨੬||
transliteration: ba-hamaa sho z vasaf man goyaa | 26 |
translation: And, make every one chaste and sacred through My (Akaalpurakh's) kudos. (26)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਮਾ ਜਾ ਪਨਾਹੋ ਯਾਰਿ ਤੂ ਅਮ
transliteration: dhar hamaa jaa panaaho yaar thoo ama
translation: I am your friend and well wisher at all places and in all situations, and I am your refuge;

gurmukhi: ਯਾਵਰੀ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ੋ ਖ਼ਾਸਤਗਾਰਿ ਤੂ ਅਮ ||੨੭||
transliteration: yaavaree bakhasho khaasathagaar thoo am | 27 |
translation: I am there to support you, and I am your avid fan. (27)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਤੂ ਬਰਤਰੀਂ ਦਾਨਦ
transliteration: har k naam thoo baratharee dhaanadha
translation: Anyone who would try to elevate your name and make you famous,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਦਿਲੋ ਜਾਂ ਬ-ਵਸਫ਼ਿ ਮਨ ਖ਼ਾਨਦ ||੨੮||
transliteration: az dhilo jaa(n) ba-vasaf man khaanadh | 28 |
translation: He would, in fact, be approbating Me with his heart and soul. (28)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਜ਼ਾਤਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਨੁਮਾੲਿਮ ਬਾਜ਼
transliteration: man oo raa zaath khudh numaaeim baaza
translation: Then, kindly show me Your Limitless Entity,

gurmukhi: ਅੈਹਦਿ ਮਨ ਸਖ਼ਤਗੀਰ ਬਰ ਕੁਨ ਸਾਜ਼ ||੨੯||
transliteration: aihadh man sakhathageer bar kun saaz | 29 |
translation: And, thus make my difficult resolves and situations eased up. (29)

gurmukhi: ਗਿਰਦਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਬਰਅਾ ਵਾ ਹਾਦੀ ਸ਼ੌ
transliteration: giradh aalam baraaa vaa haadhee shaaua
translation: You should come to this world and act like a guide and captain,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਜਹਾਂ ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਮਨ ਨਿਯਰਜ਼ਦ ਜੌ ||੩੦||
transliteration: k jehaa(n) ghair man niyarazadh jaau | 30 |
translation: Because this world is not worth even a grain of barley without Me, the Akaalpurakh. (30)

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਮਨਮ ਚੂ ਰਾਹ-ਨੁਮਾ
transliteration: dhar hakeekath manam choo raaha-numaa
translation: In reality, when I am your guide and steer,

gurmukhi: ਤੂ ਜਹਾਂ ਰਾ ਬਪਾੲਿ ਖ਼ੁਦ ਪੈਮਾ ||੩੧||
transliteration: thoo jehaa(n) raa bapaae khudh paimaa | 31 |
translation: Then, you should traverse the journey of this world with your own feet. (31)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਕਿ ਰਾ ਖ਼ਾਹਮ ਵ ਸ਼ਵਮ ਹਾਦੀ
transliteration: har k raa khaaham v shavam haadhee
translation: Whomsoever I like and I show him the direction in this world,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ ਤੂ ਦਰ ਦਿਲ ਦਰ-ਅਾਰਮਸ਼ ਸਾਦੀ ||੩੨||
transliteration: az thoo dhar dhil dhara-aaramash saadhee | 32 |
translation: Then, for his sake, I bring elation and happiness in his heart. (32)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਂ ਕਿ ਗੁਮਰਾਹ ਸਾਜ਼ਮਸ਼ ਜ਼ਿ ਗਜ਼ਬ
transliteration: vaa(n) k gumaraah saazamash z gazaba
translation: Whomsoever I will misdirect and put him on a wrong track out of My indignation for him,

gurmukhi: ਨਭਰਸਦ ਅਜ਼ ਹਦਾੲਿਤਿ ਤੂ ਬ-ਰ?ਬ ||੩੩||
transliteration: nabharasadh az hadhaaeith thoo ba-rab | 33 |
translation: He will not be able to reach Me, the Akaalpurakh, in spite of your advice and counsel. (33)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਗੁਨਰਾਹ ਅਾਲਮੇ ਬੇਮਨ
transliteration: shudhaa gunaraah aalamae baemana
translation: This world is being misdirected and strayed without me,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿਰਾਂ ਗਸ਼ਤਾ ਅੰਦ ਜਾਦੂੲਿ ਮਨ ||੩੪||
transliteration: saahiraa(n) gashathaa andh jaadhooe man | 34 |
translation: My sorcery has become the sorcerer himself. (34)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦਗਾਂ ਰਾ ਕੁਨੰਦ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਹਮੀ
transliteration: muradhagaa(n) raa kunandh zindhaa hamee
translation: My charms and spells bring the dead back alive,

transliteration: zindhagaa(n) raa bajaa(n) kushandhaa hamee | 35 |
translation: And, those who are living (in sin) kill them. (35)

gurmukhi: ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ੇ ਰਾ ਕੁਨੰਦ ਅਾਬ ਵਸ਼
transliteration: aathishae raa kunandh aab vasha
translation: My charms transform the 'fire' into ordinary water,

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਸਰੇ ਅਾਬ ਜ਼ਨੰਦ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ ||੩੬||
transliteration: bar sarae aab zanandh aathish | 36 |
translation: And, with the ordinary water, they extinguish and cool off the fires. (36)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਚਿਹ ਖ਼ਾਹੰਦ ਮੀ-ਕੁਨੰਦ ਹਮਾਂ
transliteration: har chih khaahandh mee-kunandh hamaa(n)
translation: My charms do whatever they like;

gurmukhi: ਜੁਮਲਾ ਜਾਦੂ ਫ਼ਨ ਅੰਦ ਬਰ ਸਾਮਾਂ ||੩੭||
transliteration: jumalaa jaadhoo fan andh bar saamaa(n) | 37 |
translation: And, they mystify with their spell all material and non-material things. (37)

gurmukhi: ਰਾਹਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਨੁਮਾ ਬ-ਸੂੲਿ ਮਨ
transliteration: raahi shaa(n) raa numaa ba-sooe mana
translation: Please divert their path in my direction,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਪਜ਼ੀਰੰਦ ਗੁਫ਼ਤਗੂੲਿ ਮਨ ||੩੮||
transliteration: k pazeerandh gufathagooe man | 38 |
translation: So that they can adopt and acquisition my words and message. (38)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੈਰ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਮ ਬ-ਜਾਦੁੲੇ ਨਭਰਵੰਦ
transliteration: ghair zikaram ba-jaadhueae nabharavandha
translation: They do not go for any spells except My meditation,

gurmukhi: ਜੁਜ਼ ਦਰਿ ਮਨ ਬਜਾਨਬੇ ਨਭਰਵੰਦ ||੩੯||
transliteration: juz dhar man bajaanabae nabharavandh | 39 |
translation: And, they do not move in any direction other than towards My door. (39)

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਜ਼ਿ ਦੋਜ਼ਖ਼ ਸ਼ਵੰਦ ਰੁਸਤਾ ਹਮੇ
transliteration: k z dhozakh shavandh rusathaa hamae
translation: Because they have been spared of the Hades,

gurmukhi: ਵਰਨਾ ੳੁਫ਼ਤੰਦ ਦਸਤ-ਬਸਤਾ ਹਮੇ ||੪੦||
transliteration: varanaa oufathandh dhasatha-basathaa hamae | 40 |
translation: Otherwise, they would fall with their hands tied down. (40)

gurmukhi: ਕਾਫ਼ ਤਾ ਕਾਫ਼ ਅਾਲਮੇ ਜੁਮਲਾ
transliteration: kaaf thaa kaaf aalamae jumalaa
translation: This whole world, from one end to the other,

gurmukhi: ਦਾਅਵਤ ਅਾਮੋਜ਼ੋ ਜ਼ਾਲਮੇ ਜੁਮਲਾ ||੪੧||
transliteration: dhaaavath aamozo zaalamae jumalaa | 41 |
translation: Is relaying the message that this world is cruel and corrupt. (41)

gurmukhi: ਰੰਜੇ ਫ਼ਰਹਤ ਜ਼ਿ ਮਨ ਨ ਮੀ-ਦਾਨੰਦ
transliteration: ranjae farehath z man n mee-dhaanandha
translation: They do not realize any grief or happiness because of me,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਅਜ਼ ਗ਼ੈਰਿ ਮਨ ਪਰੇਸ਼ਾਨੰਦ ||੪੨||
transliteration: hamaa az ghair man paraeshaanandh | 42 |
translation: And, without me, they all are confused and perplexed. (42)

gurmukhi: ਅੌਜੁਮਨ ਮੀ-ਕੁਨੰਦ ਵ ਅਜ਼ ਅੰਜਮ
transliteration: aauajuman mee-kunandh v az anjama
translation: They congregate and from the stars

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰੰਦ ਰੂਜ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਾਦੀ ਓ ਗ਼ਮ ||੪੩||
transliteration: bar shumaarandh rooz shaadhee ou gham | 43 |
translation: They count the number of days of sorrow and happiness. (43)

gurmukhi: ਬਰ ਨਿਗਾਰੰਦ ਨਹਿਸੋ ਸਾਅਾਦ ਹਮੇ
transliteration: bar nigaarandh nehiso saaaadh hamae
translation: Then they pen down their good and not-so-good fortunes in their horoscopes,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜ਼ ਗੋੲਿੰਦ ਕਬਲੋ ਬਾਅਦ ਹਮੇ ||੪੪||
transliteration: baaz goeindh kabalo baaadh hamae | 44 |
translation: And say, sometimes before and other times afterwards, as: (44)

gurmukhi: ਨੀਸਤ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਰਾ ਬ-ਜ਼ਿਕਰ ੲਿਸਤਿਕਲਾਲ
transliteration: neesath shaa(n) raa ba-zikar eisathikalaala
translation: They are not firm and consistent in their meditation chores,

gurmukhi: ਕਾਲ ਦਾਨੰਦ ਜੁਮਲਗਾਂ ਬੇ-ਹਾਲ ||੪੫||
transliteration: kaal dhaanandh jumalagaa(n) bae-haal | 45 |
translation: And, they talk and project themselves like confused and perplexed persons. (45)

gurmukhi: ਰੂ ਨੁਮਾ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਰਾ ਸੂੲਿ ਫ਼ਿਕਰਮ
transliteration: roo numaa jumalaa raa sooe fikarama
translation: Divert their attention and face towards My meditation

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਨਦਾਰੰਦ ਦੋਸਤ ਜੁਜ਼ ਜ਼ਿਕਰਮ ||੪੬||
transliteration: k nadhaarandh dhosath juz zikaram | 46 |
translation: So that they will not consider anything other than discourses about Me as their friend. (46)

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਹਮਾ ਕਾਰਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਨਿਕੋ ਸਾਜ਼ਮ
transliteration: thaa hamaa kaar shaa(n) niko saazama
translation: So that I could set their worldly tasks on the right path,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਾਤਰਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਜ਼ਿ ਨੂਰ ਬਿਤਰਾਜ਼ਮ ||੪੭||
transliteration: khaathar shaa(n) z noor bitharaazam | 47 |
translation: And, I could improve and refine their inclinations and tendencies with the divine glow. (47)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਤੁਰਾ ਅਾਫਰੀਦਮ ਅਜ਼ ਪੲੇ ਅਾਂ
transliteration: man thuraa aafareedham az peae aa
translation: I have created you for this purpose

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਸ਼ਵੀ ਰਹਿਨੁਮਾ ਬ-ਜੁਮਲਾ ਜਹਾਂ ||੪੮||
transliteration: k shavee rehinumaa ba-jumalaa jehaa(n) | 48 |
translation: So that you should be the leader to steer the whole world towrads the right path. (48)

gurmukhi: ਹੁ?ਬਿ ਗ਼ੈਰ ਅਜ਼ ਜ਼ਮੀਰਿ ਸ਼ਾਂ ਬਜ਼ਦਾੲਿ
transliteration: hub ghair az zameer shaa(n) bazadhaaei
translation: You should dispel the love for dualism from their hearts and minds,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਗਨਾਂ ਰਾ ਤੂ ਰਾਹਿ ਰਾਸਤ ਨੁਮਾੲਿ ||੪੯||
transliteration: hamaganaa(n) raa thoo raahi raasath numaae | 49 |
translation: And, you should direct them towards the true path. (49)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਾਹ ਗੁਫ਼ਤਾ ਚਿ ਲਾੲਿਕ ਅਾਨਮ
transliteration: shaah gufathaa ch laaeik aanama
translation: The Guru (Nanak) said, How can I be so capable of this stupendous task

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਦਿਲਿ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਬਾਜ਼ ਗਰਦਾਨਮ ||੫੦||
transliteration: k dhil jumalaa baaz garadhaanam | 50 |
translation: That I should be able to divert the minds of everyone towards the true path. (50)

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਕੁਜਾ ਵ ਚੁਨੀਂ ਕਮਾਲ ਕੁਜਾ
transliteration: man kujaa v chunee kamaal kujaa
translation: The Guru said, I am no where near such a miracle,

gurmukhi: ਮਨ ਕਿਹ ਵ ਫ਼?ਰੇ ਜ਼ੁਲਜਲਾਲ ਕੁਜਾ ||੫੧||
transliteration: man kih v farae zulajalaal kujaa | 51 |
translation: I am lowly without any virtues compared to the grandiose and exquisiteness of the form of Akaalpurakh. (51)

gurmukhi: ਲੇਕ ਹੁਕਮਤ ਕਸ਼ਮ ਬਜਾਨਿ ਬਦਿਲ
transliteration: laek hukamath kasham bajaan badhila
translation: However, Your command is entirely acceptable to my heart and soul,

gurmukhi: ਨਸ਼ਵਮ ਯ?ਕ ਜ਼ਮਾਂ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਗ਼ਾਫ਼ਿਲ ||੫੨||
transliteration: nashavam yak zamaa(n) azo ghaafil | 52 |
translation: And, I shall not be negligent of Your order even for a moment. (52)

gurmukhi: ਹਾਦੀ ਓ ਰਹਿਨੁਮਾੲਿ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਤੂੲੀ
transliteration: haadhee ou rehinumaae jumalaa thooee
translation: Only you are the guide to lead the people to the right path, and you are the mentor for all;

gurmukhi: ਰਹਿਬਰੋ ਦਿਲ-ਗਿਰਾਮੀੲਿ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਤੂੲੀ ||੫੩||
transliteration: rehibaro dhila-giraameee jumalaa thooee | 53 |
translation: You are the one who can lead the way and who can mold the minds of all people to your way of thinking. (53)

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜੀ ਪਾਤਸ਼ਾਹੀ (ਗੁਰੂ ਅੰਗਦ ਦੇਵ ਜੀ)
transliteration: dhoojee paathashaahee aguroo angadh dhaev jee
translation: Second Guru, Guru Angad Dev Ji

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜੀ ਪਾਤਸ਼ਾਹੀ ਗੁਰੂ ਨਾਨਕ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਦਾ ਪਹਿਲਾ ਬੰਦਨਾ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲਾ ਸੇਵਕ ਬਣਿਅਾ ਅਤੇ ਅਖੀਰ ਵਿਚ ਬੰਦਨਾਯੋਗ ਗੁਰੂ ਬਣਿਅਾ [
transliteration: dhoojee paathashaahee guroo naanak saahib dhaa pehilaa bandhanaa karan vaalaa saevak baniaa athae akheer vich bandhanaayog guroo baniaa |
translation: The second Guru, Guru Angad Dev Ji, became the first supplicating disciple of Guru Nanak Sahib. Then he transformed himself into a mentor worth supplicating to.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਸ?ਚ ਤੇ ਯਕੀਨ ਦੀ ਮਸ਼ਾਲ ਦੀ ਰੋਸ਼ਨੀ ੳੁਸ ਦੀ ਜ਼ਾਤ ਸਦਕਾ ਦਿਨ ਨਾਲੋਂ ਵੀ ਵਧੇਰੇ ਸੀ [
transliteration: ous sach thae yakeen dhee mashaal dhee roshanee ous dhee zaath sadhakaa dhin naalo vee vadhaerae see |
translation: The light emitted from the flame of his strong faith in truth and belief, due to his disposition and personality, was far greater than that of the day.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਹ ਅਸਲ ਵਿਚ ੲਿ?ਕੋ ਪਰ ਜ਼ਾਹਰਾ ਤੌਰ ਤੇ ਦੋ ਜਾਨ ਅਤੇ ਅਾਤਮਾ ਨੂੰ ਚਮਕਾੳੁਣ ਵਾਲੀਅਾਂ ਮਸ਼ਾਲਾਂ ਸਨ [
transliteration: ouh asal vich ekio par zaaharaa thaauar thae dho jaan athae aathamaa noon chamakaaoun vaaleeaa mashaalaa san |
translation: Both he and his mentor, Guru Nanak, had, in fact, one soul but outwardly were two torches to glisten the minds and the hearts of the people.

gurmukhi: ਅਸਲ ਵਿਚ ੳੁਹ ੲਿ?ਕੋ ਸਨ ਪਰ ਵੇਖਣ ਵਿਚ ਦੋ ਚਿੰਗਾੜੀਅਾਂ ਸਨ ਜਿਹੜੀਅਾਂ ਸ?ਚ ਤੋਂ ਬਿਨਾਂ ਸਭ ਕੁਝ ਸਾੜ ਦਿੰਦੀਅਾਂ ਹਨ [
transliteration: asal vich ouh ekio san par vaekhan vich dho chingaarreeaa san jiharreeaa sach tho binaa(n) sabh kujh saarr dhindheeaa han |
translation: Intrinsically, they were one but overtly were two sparks that could singe everything but the truth.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਹ ੲਿ?ਕ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰ ਦੀ ਦਰਗਾਹ ਦੇ ਖਾਸ ਮਨੁ?ਖਾਂ ਦਾ ਮਾਲ ਮਤਾਅ ਅਰਥਾਤ ਅਾਗੂ ਹਨ [
transliteration: ouh ek nirankaar dhee dharagaah dhae khaas manukhaa(n) dhaa maal mathaaa arathaath aagoo han |
translation: The second Guru was the wealth and treasure and the leader of the special persons of the court of the Akaalpurakh.

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ੁਰੂ ਅੰਗਦ ਦੇਵ ਜੀ ਸ?ਚਖੰਡ ਦੇ ਪਰਵਾਨ ਬੰਦਿਅਾਂ ਦੀ ਥਾੳੁਂ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ghuroo angadh dhaev jee sachakhandd dhae paravaan bandhiaa dhee thaao hai |
translation: He became the anchor for the people who were acceptable in the divine court.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਹ ੳੁ?ਚੇ ਰ?ਬ ਦਾ ਸਲਾਹਿਅਾ ਅਤੇ ਜਲਾਲ ਵਾਲੇ ਰ?ਬ ਦੀ ਦਰਗਾਹ ਦਾ ਚੁਨਿਅਾ ਹੋੲਿਅਾ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ouh ouchae rab dhaa salaahiaa athae jalaal vaalae rab dhee dharagaah dhaa chuniaa hoeiaa hai |
translation: He was a selected member of the heavenly court of the majestic and awe-inspiring Waaheguru and had received high praises from Him.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦੇ ਪਵਿ?ਤ੍ਰ ਨਾਮ, ਅੰਗਦ, ਦਾ ਅਲਿਫ ਹਰ ਫਕੀਰ ਅਮੀਰ ਅਤੇ ਵ?ਡੇ ਛੋਟੇ ਦੀ ਬਖਸ਼ਿਸ਼ ਅਤੇ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ਨੂੰ ਅਾਪਣੇ ਘੇਰੇ ਵਿਚ ਲੈਣ ਵਾਲਾ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ous dhae pavthr naama, angadha, dhaa alif har fakeer ameer athae vaddae shottae dhee bakhashish athae vaddiaaee noon aapanae ghaerae vich lain vaalaa hai |
translation: The first letter of his name, 'Aliph', is the one that encompasses the virtues and blessings of high and low, rich and poor, and the king and the mendicant.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦੇ ਨਾਮ ਦੀ ਸਚਾੲੀ ਨਾਲ ਭਰੇ ਨੂਨ ਦੀ ਸੁਗੰਧੀ ਹਰ ਛੋਟੇ ਵ?ਡੇ ਅਤੇ ਹਰ ਕਮੀਂ ਕਮੀਨ ਨੂੰ ਨਿਵਾਜਨ ਵਾਲਾ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ous dhae naam dhee sachaaee naal bharae noon dhee sugandhee har shottae vaddae athae har kamee kameen noon nivaajan vaalaa hai |
translation: The aroma of the truth-filled letter 'Noon' in his name bestows and cares for the high rulers and the low like menials.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸ ਦੇ ਨਾਮ ਦੇ ਅਗਲੇ ਅ?ਖਰ ਗਾਫ਼ ੳੁਸ ਦਸੀਵੀ ਦੀਵਾਨ ਅਤੇ ੳੁਸ ਮਾਲਕ ਦੇ ਸਦਾ ਚੜ੍ਹਦੀਅਾਂ ਕਲਾਂ ਵਿਚ ਰਹਿਣ ਵਾਲੇ ਜਹਾਨ ਦੇ ਮਾਰਗ ਦਾ ਪਾਂਧੀ ਹੈ [
transliteration: ous dhae naam dhae agalae akhar gaaf ous dhaseevee dheevaan athae ous maalak dhae sadhaa charraadheeaa kalaa(n) vich rehin vaalae jehaan dhae maarag dhaa paa(n)dhee hai |
translation: The next letter in his name 'Gaaf' represents the traveler of the path to the eternal congregation and for the world to stay in the highest spirits.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਸਦੇ ਨਾਮ ਦੇ ਅੰਤਮ ਅ?ਖਰ ਦਾਲ ਹਰ ਦੁਖ ਅਤੇ ਦਰਦ ਦੀ ਦਵਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਵਧਣ ਘਟਣ ਤੋ ਪਰ੍ਹਾਂ ਪਰੇਰੇ ਹੈ ||੫੪||
transliteration: ousadhae naam dhae antham akhar dhaal har dhukh athae dharadh dhee dhavaa hai athae vadhan ghattan tho paraaa(n) paraerae hai | 54 |
translation: The last letter in his name, 'Daal' is the cure for all diseases and pains and is above and beyond progression and recession. (54)

gurmukhi: ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਜੀੳੁ ਸਤ
transliteration: vaahiguroo jeeo satha
translation: Waaheguru is the Truth,

gurmukhi: ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਜੀੳੁ ਹਾਜ਼ਰ ਨਾਜ਼ਰ ਹੈ
transliteration: vaahiguroo jeeo haazar naazar hai
translation: Waaheguru is Omnipresent

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੂ ਅੰਗਦ ਅਾਂ ਮੁਰਸ਼ਦੁਲ-ਅਾਲਮੀਂ
transliteration: guroo angadh aa murashadhula-aalamee
translation: Guru Angad is the prophet for both the worlds,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਫ਼ਜਲਿ ਅਹਦ ਰਹਿਮਤੁਲ ਮਜ਼ਨਬੀਨ ||੫੫||
transliteration: z fajal ahadh rehimathul mazanabeen | 55 |
translation: With the grace of Akaalpurakh, he is the blessing for the sinners. (55)

gurmukhi: ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਚਿ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਹਜ਼ਂਰਾਂ ਜਹਾਂ
transliteration: dho aalam ch baashadh hazaaraa(n) jehaa(n)
translation: What to talk of just two worlds! With his bestowals,

gurmukhi: ਤੁਫੈਲਿ ਕਰਮਹਾੲਿ ਓ ਕਾਮਾਰਾਂ ||੫੬||
transliteration: thufail karamehaae ou kaamaaraa(n) | 56 |
translation: Thousands worlds are successful to get redemption. (56)

gurmukhi: ਵਜੂਦਸ਼ ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ਜਲੋ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਿ ਕਰੀਮ
transliteration: vajoodhash hamaa fajalo faiz kareema
translation: His body is the treasure of the graces of the forgiving Waaheguru,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਮਦੋ ਹਮ ਬਹ?ਕ ਮੁਸਤਕੀਮ ||੫੭||
transliteration: z hak aamadho ham behak musathakeem | 57 |
translation: He manifested from Him and at the end, he got absorbed in Him as well. (57)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਅਾਸ਼ਕਾਰੋ ਨਿਹਾਂ ਜ਼ਾਹਿਰਸ਼
transliteration: hamaa aashakaaro nihaa(n) zaahirasha
translation: He is always manifest whether he is visible or hidden,

gurmukhi: ਬਤੂਨੋ ੲਿਯਾਂ ਜੁਮਲਗੀ ਬਾਹਿਰਸ਼ ||੫੮||
transliteration: bathoono eiyaa(n) jumalagee baahirash | 58 |
translation: He is present everywhere here and there, inside and outside. (58)

gurmukhi: ਚੂ ਵ?ਸਾਫ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਜ਼ਾਤਿ ਹ?ਕ ਅਾਮਦਾ
transliteration: choo vasaaf oo zaath hak aamadhaa
translation: His admirer is, in fact, an admirer of Akaalpurakh,

gurmukhi: ਵਜੂਦਸ਼ ਜ਼ਿ ਕੁਦਸੀ ਵਰਕ ਅਾਮਦਾ ||੫੯||
transliteration: vajoodhash z kudhasee varak aamadhaa | 59 |
translation: And, his disposition is a page from the tome of the gods. (59)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਵਸਫ਼ਸ਼ ਜ਼ਬਾਨਿ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਕਸੀਰ
transliteration: z vasafash zabaan dho aalam kaseera
translation: He cannot be admired enough by the tongues of both the worlds,

gurmukhi: ਬਵਦ ਤੰਗ ਪੇਸ਼ਸ਼ ਫ਼ਜ਼ਾੲਿ ਜ਼ਮੀਰ ||੬੦||
transliteration: bavadh thang paeshash fazaae zameer | 60 |
translation: And, for him, the vast courtyard of the soul is not large enough. (60)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾਂ ਬਿਹ ਕਿ ਖ਼ਾਹੇਮ ਅਜ਼ ਫ਼ਜਲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: hamaa(n) bih k khaahaem az fajal oo
translation: Therefore, it would be prudent for us that we should, from his eclat and beneficence

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਅਲਤਾਫ਼ੋ ਅਕਰਾਮ ਹ?ਕ ਅਦਲਿ ੳੂ ||੬੧||
transliteration: z alathaafo akaraam hak adhal oo | 61 |
translation: And His kindness and generosity, obtain His command. (61)

gurmukhi: ਸਰਿ ਮਾ ਬਪਾੲਿਸ਼ ਬਵਦ ਬਰ ਦਵਾਮ
transliteration: sar maa bapaaeish bavadh bar dhavaama
