translation: Guru Gobind Singh and Guru Nanak are one and the same,

gurmukhi: ਹਮੂ ਸ਼ਬਦਿ ੳੂ ਜ਼ੌਹਰੋ ਮਾਨਕ ਅਸਤ ||੨੮||
transliteration: hamoo shabadh oo zaaueharo maanak asath | 28 |
translation: Whose words and messages are diamonds and pearls. (28)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਜੌਹਰ ਚੁਨਾਂ ਜੌਹਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਜਲਾ
transliteration: ch jaauehar chunaa(n) jaauehar hak jalaa
translation: His word is a precious jewel that has been tempered with the real Truth,

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਮਾਨਕ ਚੁਨਾਂ ਮਾਨਕਿ ਹ?ਕ ਜ਼ਿਅਾ ||੨੯||
transliteration: ch maanak chunaa(n) maanak hak ziaa | 29 |
translation: His word is a diamond which has been blessed with the shine of the real Truth. (29)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਹਰ ਕਾਲਿ ਕੁਦੁਸ ਅਾਮਦਾ ਕੁਦੁਸਤਰ
transliteration: z har kaal kudhus aamadhaa kudhusathara
translation: He is more sacred than every sacred word,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਹਰ ਰੁਬਾਅ ਸੁਦਸ ਅਾਮਦਾ ਸੁਬੁਸਤਰ ||੩੦||
transliteration: z har rubaaa sudhas aamadhaa subusathar | 30 |
translation: And, he is more elevated than all the four types of mineral resources and six types of manifestations. (30)

gurmukhi: ਪਜ਼ੀਰਾੲਿ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਨਿ ੳੂ ਸ਼ਸ਼ ਜਿਹਤ
transliteration: pazeeraae faramaan oo shash jihatha
translation: His command is obeyed in all the six directions,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਨ?ਵਰ ਅਜ਼ੇ ਦਾੲਿਮਾ ਸਲਤਨਤ ||੩੧||
transliteration: munavar azae dhaaeimaa salathanath | 31 |
translation: And, the entire kingdom is illuminated because of him. (31)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਂ ਕੌਸਿ ਸਾਹੀੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: ba-har dho jehaa(n) kaauas saaheee oo
translation: The beat of His kettle-drum resonates in both the worlds,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਹੇ ਫ਼ਲਰਿ-ਗੀਹਾਂ ਖ਼ੁਦਾੲੀੲਿ ੳੂ ||੩੨||
transliteration: zehae falari-geehaa(n) khudhaaeee oo | 32 |
translation: And, His godliness is the glory of the world. (32)

gurmukhi: ਬੁਲੰਦ ਅਖ਼ਤਰਸ਼ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਫ਼ਰੋਜ਼
transliteration: bulandh akhatharash har dho aalam faroza
translation: His elevated prominence illuminates both the worlds,

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ੋ ਅਾਮਦਾ ਦੁਸ਼ਮਨਾਨਸ਼ ਬਸੋਜ਼ ||੩੩||
transliteration: kazo aamadhaa dhushamanaanash basoz | 33 |
translation: And, it burns down the enemies. (33)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਮਾਹੀ ਜ਼ਮੀਂ ਤਾ ਸਰਿ ਲਾ-ਮਕਾਂ
transliteration: z maahee zamee thaa sar laa-makaa(n)
translation: From the fish in the netherworld to the highest eternal limits,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ਿਦਵੀੲਿ ਨਾਮਿ ਪਾਕਿਸ਼ ਬਜਾਂ ||੩੪||
transliteration: hamaa fidhaveee naam paakish bajaa(n) | 34 |
translation: The whole world follows his sacred Naam with their heart and soul. (34)

gurmukhi: ਮਲੂਕਿ ਮਲਿਕ ਤਾਅਤ ਅੰਦੇਸ਼ਿ
transliteration: malook malik thaaath andhaeshi
translation: Kings and gods remember and worship Him in their meditation,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਹਰ ਕੇਸ਼ ਫ਼ਰਖ਼ੰਦਾ-ਤਰ ਕੇਸ਼ਿ ੳੂ ||੩੫||
transliteration: z har kaesh farakhandhaa-thar kaesh oo | 35 |
translation: And, His belief and faith are much more fortunate and sublime than every other religion. (35)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਕੈਸਰ ਚਿ ਖ਼ਾਕਾਂ ਹਜਾਰਾਂ ਹਜ਼ਾਰ
transliteration: ch kaisar ch khaakaa(n) hajaaraa(n) hazaara
translation: How about millions of Kaisers, emperors of Germany and millions of Mongolian kings

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਕਿਸਰਾ ਚਿ ਕਾੳੂਸ ਬੇਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰ ||੩੬||
transliteration: ch kisaraa ch kaaoos baesh az shumaar | 36 |
translation: How about innumerable Nausheervaans and countless emperors of Iran (36)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਫ਼ੈਰੋ ਚਿ ਫ਼ਗਫ਼ੂਰਿ ਵਾਲਾ-ਗਾਹ
transliteration: ch fairo ch fagafoor vaalaa-gaaha
translation: Whether we talk abouit Egyptian kings or Chinese rulers of high rank,

gurmukhi: ਬਪਾੲਿਸ਼ ਹਮਾ ਬੰਦਾ-ੲਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ-ਰਾਹ ||੩੭||
transliteration: bapaaeish hamaa bandhaa-e khaaka-raah | 37 |
translation: They all are the dust of his lotus feet (dust of the path on which he treads) (37)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਫ਼ਿਦਵੀ ਓ ਬੰਦਾ-ੲਿ ਪਾੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: hamaa fidhavee ou bandhaa-e paae oo
translation: All these people adore his feet and are his servitors and sleves,

gurmukhi: ਪਜ਼ੀਰਿੰਦਾੲਿ ਹੁਕਮਿ ਅਾਲਾੲਿ ੳੂ ||੩੮||
transliteration: pazeerindhaae hukam aalaae oo | 38 |
translation: And, all of them are the followers of his divine commands. (38)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਸੁਲਤਾਨਿ ੲੀਰਾਂ ਚਿ ਖ਼ਾਨਿ ਖ਼ੁਤਨ
transliteration: ch sulathaan eeraa(n) ch khaan khuthana
translation: Whether it be the Sultaan of Iran, or Khan of Khutan

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਦਾਰਾੲਿ ਤੂਰਾਂ ਸ਼ਾਹਿ ਯਮਨ ||੩੯||
transliteration: ch dhaaraae thooraa(n) shaahi yaman | 39 |
translation: Whether it be the Daaraa of Tooraan, or the king of Yemen (39)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਕੁੰਤਾਲਿ ਰੂਸੋ ਚਿ ਸੁਲਤਾਨਿ ਹਿੰਦ
transliteration: ch kunthaal rooso ch sulathaan hindha
translation: Whether it be the Tsar of Russia, or the ruler of India

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਹੁ?ਕਾਮਿ ਦ?ਕਨ ਚਿ ਰਾੲਿ ਖ਼ਜ਼ੰਦ ||੪੦||
transliteration: ch hukaam dhakan ch raae khazandh | 40 |
translation: Whether it be the officials of the South or those fortunate Raos (40)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਮਸ਼ਰਿਕ ਬ-ਮਗ਼ਰਿਬ ਹਮਾ ਸਰਵਰਾਂ
transliteration: z masharik ba-magharib hamaa saravaraa(n)
translation: All the chiefs and the kings from the east to the west

gurmukhi: ਪਜ਼ੀਰਾੲਿ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਨਿ ਕੁਦਸਸ਼ ਬਜਾਂ ||੪੧||
transliteration: pazeeraae faramaan kudhasash bajaa(n) | 41 |
translation: Are obeying his sacred command even at the cost of their lives. (41)

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਕਿੳੂਮਰਸੋ ਜਮਸ਼ੇਦੋ ਜ਼ਾਰ
transliteration: hazaaraa(n) kioomaraso jamashaedho zaara
translation: Thousands of emperors of olden Iran and tzars of Russsia

gurmukhi: ਕਮਰ ਬਸਤਾ ਦਰ ਖ਼ਿਦਮਤਸ਼ ਬੰਦਾ ਵਾਰ ||੪੨||
transliteration: kamar basathaa dhar khidhamathash bandhaa vaar | 42 |
translation: Are standing by, with their folded hands like slaves, ready to serve him. (42)

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਚੂੰ ਰੁਸਤਮ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਚੂੰ ਸਾਮ
transliteration: hazaaraa(n) choon rusatham hazaaraa(n) choon saama
translation: Thousands like Rustam and Saam, father of Rustam

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਚੂੰ ਅਸਫ਼ੰਦ ਯਾਰਸ਼ ਗ਼ੁਲਾਮ ||੪੩||
transliteration: hazaaraa(n) choon asafandh yaarash ghulaam | 43 |
translation: And thousands of Asfand Yaars, the son of Gustapus who was blinded by Rustam with his arrow and then killed, are his slaves. (43)

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਚੂੰ ਜਮਨਾ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਚੂੰ ਗੰਗ
transliteration: hazaaraa(n) choon jamanaa hazaaraa(n) choon ganga
translation: Thousands of rivers like Jamnaa and Gangaa

gurmukhi: ਬਪਾ ਅੰਦਰਸ਼ ਸਰ ਨਿਹਾਦਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਨੰਗ ||੪੪||
transliteration: bapaa andharash sar nihaadhaa z nang | 44 |
translation: Bow their heads respectfully on his lotus feet. (44)

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ੲਿੰਦਰ-ਅਾਦਿਕਾਨੋ ਚਿਹ ਬ੍ਰਹਮ-ਅਾਦਿਕਾਂ
transliteration: chih eindhara-aadhikaano chih brehama-aadhikaa(n)
translation: Whether (we talk of) gods like Indar or Brahmaa

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਰਾਮ-ਅਾਦਿਕਾਨੋ ਚਿਹ ਕਿ੍ਰਸ਼ਨ-ਅਾਦਕਾਂ ||੪੫||
transliteration: chih raama-aadhikaano chih krishana-aadhakaa(n) | 45 |
translation: Whether (we talk about) gods like Raam or Krishen (45)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਬਾਨਿ ਹਮਾ ਕਾਸਿਰ ਅਜ਼ ਵਸਫ਼ਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: zabaan hamaa kaasir az vasaf oo
translation: All of them are unable and inadequate to describe his eclats,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਖ਼ਾਸਤਗਾਰਿੰਦਾੲਿ ਲੁਤਫ਼ਿ ੳੂ ||੪੬||
transliteration: hamaa khaasathagaarindhaae luthaf oo | 46 |
translation: And, All of them are the seekers of his blessings and bestowals. (46)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਦੀਪੋ ਹਰ ਸੂੲਿ ਕੌਸ਼ਸ਼ ਬੁਲੰਦ
transliteration: ba-har dheepo har sooe kaauashash bulandha
translation: His fame is being celebrated on the beat of a drum in all islands and directions,

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਮਮਿਲਕਤ ਨਾਮਿ ੳੂ ਅਰਜ਼ਮੰਦ ||੪੭||
transliteration: ba-har mamilakath naam oo arazamandh | 47 |
translation: And, his name is being honored in every country and region. (47)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਰ ਖ਼ੰਦੋ ਬ੍ਰਹਿਮੰਡ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਦਾਸਤਾਂ
transliteration: ba-har khandho brehimandd azo dhaasathaa(n)
translation: His tales are talked about and discussed in every universe and cosmic region,

gurmukhi: ਪਜ਼ੀਰਾੲਿ ਹੁਕਮਸ਼ ਹਮਾਂ ਰਾਸਤਾਂ ||੪੮||
transliteration: pazeeraae hukamash hamaa(n) raasathaa(n) | 48 |
translation: And, all the connoisseurs of truth delightfully accept and follow his command. (48)

gurmukhi: ਸੁਰਾ ਤਾ ਸਮਾ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਫ਼ਰਮਾਂ-ਬਰਸ਼
transliteration: suraa thaa samaa jumalaa faramaa(n)-barasha
translation: Everyone from the nethgerworld to the seventh sky are the followers of his orders,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਮਹਿਤਾਬੋ ਮਾਹੀ ਹਮਾ ਚਾਕਰਸ਼ ||੪੯||
transliteration: z mehithaabo maahee hamaa chaakarash | 49 |
translation: And, everyone from the moon to the fish deep below the earth are his servitors and slaves. (49)

gurmukhi: ਕਰਮਹਾ ਵ ਅਫ਼ਜ਼ਾਲਿ ੳੂ ਬੇ ਹਸਾ
transliteration: karamehaa v afazaal oo bae hasaa
translation: His blessings and bestowals are infinite,

gurmukhi: ਕਰਾਮਾਤੋ ੲਿਹਜਾਜ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਕਿਬਰੀਅਾ ||੫੦||
transliteration: karaamaatho eihajaaz oo kibareeaa | 50 |
translation: And, His miracles and antics are divine and celestial. (50)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ-ਹਾ ਬ-ਤੌਸੀਫ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਗੁੰਗੋ ਲਾਲ
transliteration: zubaa(n)-haa ba-thaauaseef oo gungo laala
translation: All the tongues are dumbstruck in praising him,

gurmukhi: ਸਖ਼ੁਨ ਰਾ ਬ-ਵਸਫ਼ਸ਼ ਚਿ ਹ?ਦੋ ਮਜਾਲ ||੫੧||
transliteration: sakhun raa ba-vasafash ch hadho majaal | 51 |
translation: Neither any one can describe his eclat to any limits nor has enough courage to do so. (51)

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀਮੁਲ-ਸਜਾੲਿਅਾ ਜ਼ਮੀਲੁਲ ਖ਼ਸਾਲ
transliteration: kareemula-sajaaeiaa zameelul khasaala
translation: By nature, he is generous, and comeliness is in his character,

gurmukhi: ਅਮੂਮੁਲ-ਅਤਾੲਿਅਾ ਸ਼ਮੂਮਲ ਨਵਾਲ ||੫੨||
transliteration: amoomula-athaaeiaa shamoomal navaal | 52 |
translation: He is known for his generosities, and is remembered for his unlimited gifts. (52)

gurmukhi: ਸਫ਼ੀੳੁਲ-ਵਰਾੲਿਅਾ ਜ਼ਮਾਨੁਲ-ਵੁਰਾ
transliteration: safeeoula-varaaeiaa zamaanula-vuraa
translation: He is desirous of condoning the sins of the populace,

gurmukhi: ਮਹੀਤੁਲ-ਸਖ਼ਾੲਿਅਾ ਜ਼ਕਾ-ੳੁਲ-ਹੁਦਾ ||੫੩||
transliteration: meheethula-sakhaaeiaa zakaa-oula-hudhaa | 53 |
translation: and he is the guarantor of the entire creations. (53)

gurmukhi: ਨਜਾਤੁਲ-ਅਵਾਮੋ ਅਮਾਨੁਲ-ਅਨਾਮ
transliteration: najaathula-avaamo amaanula-anaama
translation: He is the redeemer of the people and he is the deposit in trust for all of them;

gurmukhi: ਜਲਾ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ਜ਼ੂ ਗ਼ਮਾਮਿ ਜ਼ਲਾਮ ||੫੪||
transliteration: jalaa yaafathaa zoo ghamaam zalaam | 54 |
translation: Even the darkest clouds become shining with his touch. (54)

gurmukhi: ਵਫ਼ੂਰੁਲ ਅਤਾ ਓ ਅਮੀਮੁਲ ਨਅਮ
transliteration: vafoorul athaa ou ameemul naama
translation: He is the treasure of bestowals and a great collection of blessings,

gurmukhi: ਕਸੀਰੁਲ ਫ਼ਯੂਜ਼ੋ ਕਫ਼ੀੳੁਲ ਕਰਮ ||੫੫||
transliteration: kaseerul fayoozo kafeeoul karam | 55 |
translation: He is the abundance of beneficence and ultimate in generosity. (55)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਰਾਜ਼ਿੰਦਾੲਿ ਰਾੲਿਤਿ ਅਦਲੋ ਦਾਦ
transliteration: faraazindhaae raaeith adhalo dhaadha
translation: He unfurls and waves the flag of wisdom and justice,

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਰਾਜ਼ਿੰਦਾੲਿ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ ੲਿਅਤਕਾਦ ||੫੬||
transliteration: faraazindhaae dheedhaae eiathakaadh | 56 |
translation: He further glistens the eyes of trust. (56)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ੀਮੁਲ-ਮਨਾਜ਼ਿਲ ਰਫ਼ੀ-ੳੁਲ-ਮਕਾਂ
transliteration: azeemula-manaazil rafee-oula-makaa(n)
translation: He is the one with lofty palaces and tall mansions,

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀਮੁਲ-ਸ਼ਮਾੲਿਲ ਮਨੀਅ-ੳੁਲ-ਨਿਸ਼ਾਂ ||੫੭||
transliteration: kareemula-shamaaeil maneea-oula-nishaa(n) | 57 |
translation: He is generous in his character and habits, and gentle and suave in his facial features. (57)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਕ?ਦਸ ਜਨਾਬੋ ਮੁਅ?ਲਾ ਖ਼ਿਤਾਬ
transliteration: mukadhas janaabo mualaa khithaaba
translation: Sacred is His court, and higher is His title,

gurmukhi: ਗਦਾੲਿਸ਼ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਮਹਿ ਓ ਅਾਫਤਾਬ ||੫੮||
transliteration: gadhaaeish hazaaraa(n) mehi ou aafathaab | 58 |
translation: Thousands of moons and suns are begging at His door. (58)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਅਾਲੀ ਮਦਾਰਿਜ ਅਵਾਲੀ ਪਨਾਹ
transliteration: muaalee madhaarij avaalee panaaha
translation: His ranks are higher and He is a great refuge,

gurmukhi: ਅਲੀਮਿ ਰਮੁਜ਼ਿ ਸਫ਼ੇਦੋ ਸਿਅਾਹ ||੫੯||
transliteration: aleem ramuz safaedho siaah | 59 |
translation: He is the Knower of all the good and the bad secrets. (59)

gurmukhi: ਮਕ?ਦੁਸ ਮਦਾਰਿਜ ਫ਼ਖ਼ੀਮੁਲ ਨਵਾਲ
transliteration: makadhus madhaarij fakheemul navaala
translation: He sanctifies different regions and is the donor of benedictions,

gurmukhi: ਤਅਾਾਲਾ ਮਰਾਤਬ ਅਮੀਮੁਲ-ਫ਼ਜ਼ਾਲ ||੬੦||
transliteration: thaaaaalaa maraathab ameemula-fazaal | 60 |
translation: He elevates the status and is the embodiment of compassion. (60)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਅ?ਜ਼ਮ ਸ਼ਰਾਫ਼ਿ ਸਤੂਦਾ ਖ਼ਸਾਲ
transliteration: muazam sharaaf sathoodhaa khasaala
translation: He is great in His nobility and is most appreciated for His characteristics,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਕ?ਰਮ ਖ਼ਸਾੲਿਲ ਮੁਨ?ਵਰ ਜਮਾਲ ||੬੧||
transliteration: mukaram khasaaeil munavar jamaal | 61 |
translation: He is respected for His customs and habits, and is praiseworthy for His form and shape. (61)

gurmukhi: ਜਮਾਲਿਸ਼ ਹਮਾ ਕੂਰਾ-ੲਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਜਲਾਲ
transliteration: jamaalish hamaa kooraa-e zulajalaala
translation: His elegance and radiance is the circumference of the Divine grandeur,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਕੋਹਸ਼ ਹਮਾ ਅਜ਼ਮਤਿ ਲਾ-ਜ਼ਵਾਲ ||੬੨||
transliteration: shakohash hamaa azamath laa-zavaal | 62 |
translation: His glory and pomp is eternal and his eclat indestructible. (62)

gurmukhi: ਜਮੀਮੁਲ ਸਫ਼ਾਤੋ ਜਜ਼ੀਲੁਲ ਸਨਾ
transliteration: jameemul safaatho jazeelul sanaa
translation: He is beautiful because of his noble qualities, and is perfect in his virtues,

gurmukhi: ਕਫ਼ੀਲੁਲ ਜਰਾੲਿਮ ਵਕੀਲੁਲ ਵਰਾ ||੬੩||
transliteration: kafeelul jaraaeim vakeelul varaa | 63 |
translation: He is condoner of the sins and is the supporter of and advocates the cause of the world. (63)

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀਮੁਲ ਮਨਿਸ਼ ਮਾਲਕਿ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ੋ ਜੂਦ
transliteration: kareemul manish maalak faizo joodha
translation: He is generous by nature and is the master of blessings and generosity,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਕੁਦਸੀਅਾਂ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ੳੂ ਦਰ ਸਜੂਦ ||੬੪||
transliteration: hamaa kudhaseeaa paesh oo dhar sajoodh | 64 |
translation: All angels prostrate before him. (64)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦਾਵੰਦਿ ਅਰਜ਼ੋ ਸਮਾਵਾਤੋ ਅਰਸ਼
transliteration: khudhaavandh arazo samaavaatho arasha
translation: He is the All-powerful master of the earth, the skies and the cosmos,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਨ?ਵਰ-ਕੁਨਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਮਤ ਅਾਬਾਦ ਫ਼ਰਸ਼ ||੬੫||
transliteration: munavara-kun zulamath aabaadh farash | 65 |
translation: He provides illumination in the darkest porches of the world. (65)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ੂੲੇ ਮਜਦੋ ਤਖ਼ਸੀਸੋ ਤਫ਼ਖ਼ੀਰ ਹਾ[
transliteration: zooeae majadho thakhaseeso thafakheer haa|a
translation: He is, in fact, is the light of maturity and courtesy,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦਾਵੰਦਿ ਤਮਜ਼ੀਦੋ ਤੌਕੀਰ ਹਾ ||੬੬||
transliteration: khudhaavandh thamazeedho thaauakeer haa | 66 |
translation: He is the master of status and praises. (66)

gurmukhi: ਵਲੀ-ੳੁਲ-ਤਫ਼ਾਜ਼ੀਲੋ ਤਕਰੀਮ ਹਾ
transliteration: valee-oula-thafaazeelo thakareem haa
translation: He is the prophet of virtues and blessings,

gurmukhi: ਅਮੀਮੁਲ ਤਕਰੀਮੋ ਤਨੲੀਮ ਹਾ ||੬੭||
transliteration: ameemul thakareemo thaneem haa | 67 |
translation: He is the embodiment of boons and bestowals. (67)

gurmukhi: ਵਫ਼ੂਰੁਲ ਤਜ਼ਾਜ਼ੀਲੋ ੲਿਜਲਾਲ ਹਾ
transliteration: vafoorul thazaazeelo eijalaal haa
translation: He is the 'abundance' of generosities and wisdom,

gurmukhi: ਕਸੀਰੁਲ ਤਕਾਮੀਲੋ ੲਿਕਮਾਲ ਹਾ ||੬੮||
transliteration: kaseerul thakaameelo eikamaal haa | 68 |
translation: He is the 'collection' of accomplished and perfect persons. (68)

gurmukhi: ਅਮੀਮੁਲ ਅਤੀਅਾਤ ਕਾਮਿਲ ਅਯਾਰ
transliteration: ameemul atheeaath kaamil ayaara
translation: He is the manifestation and perfect jeweler of the offers and gifts.

gurmukhi: ਪਜ਼ੀਰਿੰਦਾੲਿ ੲਿਜਜ਼ਿ ਹਰ ਖ਼ਾਕਸਾਰ ||੬੯||
transliteration: pazeerindhaae eijaz har khaakasaar | 69 |
translation: He recognizes and accedes to the helplessness of the lowly and meek.(69)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਫ਼ਖ਼?ਰੁਲ ਨਬਾੲਿਲ ਜਜ਼ੀਲੁਲ ਜਮੀਲ
transliteration: mufakharul nabaaeil jazeelul jameela
translation: He is the pride of the elderly and kings and chief of the amiable and the suave.

gurmukhi: ਕਸੀਰੁਲ ਫ਼ਜ਼ਾੲਿਲ ਜਲੀਲੁਲ ਨਬੀਲ ||੭੦||
transliteration: kaseerul fazaaeil jaleelul nabeel | 70 |
translation: He is the abundance of blessings and representative of the competent, dexterous and the intelligent. (70)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਨੁਰਸ਼ ਜਹਾਂ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ਜ਼ੇਬੋ ਫ਼ਰ
transliteration: z nurash jehaa(n) yaafathaa zaebo fara
translation: The world has gained beauty, splendor and glory from his radiance,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਸ਼ ਮਕੀਨੋ ਮਕਾਂ ਬਹਿਰਾਵਰ ||੭੧||
transliteration: z faizash makeeno makaa(n) behiraavar | 71 |
translation: The world and its people have profited a great deal from his blessings. (71)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਦਸਤਸ਼ ਫ਼ਰੋਜ਼ਾਂ ਦੋ ਗੌਹਰ ਚੂੰ ਮਿਹਰ
transliteration: ba-dhasathash farozaa(n) dho gaauehar choon mihara
translation: He has two diamonds in his hand that are brilliant like the Sun,

gurmukhi: ਯਕੇ ਜਾੲਿ ਫ਼ਜਲੋ ਦਿਗਰ ਜਾੲਿ ਕਹਿਰ ||੭੨||
transliteration: yakae jaae fajalo dhigar jaae kehir | 72 |
translation: One of them represents beneficence and the other disaster and wrath. (72)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਅ?ਵਲ ਜਹਾਂ ਰਾ ਸ਼ੁਦਾ ਹ?ਕ ਨੁਮਾ
transliteration: ba-aval jehaa(n) raa shudhaa hak numaa
translation: Due to the first (diamond), this world becomes a demonstration of truth,

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਸਾਨੀ ਹਮਾ ਜ਼ੁਲਮੋ ਜ਼ੁਲਮਤ ਜ਼ਦਾ ||੭੩||
transliteration: ba-saanee hamaa zulamo zulamath zadhaa | 73 |
translation: And, second is capable to dispel all darkness and tyranny. (73)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਜ਼ੁਲਮਤੋ ਜ਼ੁਲਮ ਰਾ ਸਾਖ਼ਤ ਦੂਰ
transliteration: hamaa zulamatho zulam raa saakhath dhoora
translation: He has dispelled all the darkness and cruelty from this world,

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਂ ਦਰ ਜਹਾਂ ਜ਼ੇ ਰਯਾਹੋ ਸਰੂਰ ||੭੪||
transliteration: jehaa(n) dhar jehaa(n) zae rayaaho saroor | 74 |
translation: And, it is because of him that the whole world is filled with aroma and ecstacy. (74)

gurmukhi: ਲਕਾੲਿਸ਼ ਮੁਨ?ਵਰ ਜ਼ਿ ਨੂਰਿ ਅਜ਼ਲ
transliteration: lakaaeish munavar z noor azala
translation: His face is lit with the Devine eclat,

gurmukhi: ਵਜੂਦਸ਼ ਵ-ਅਨਵਾਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਲਮ ਯਜ਼ਲ ||੭੫||
transliteration: vajoodhash va-anavaar hak lam yazal | 75 |
translation: And his body is eternal due to the refulgence of Akaalpurakh. (75)

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਅਾਅਲਾ ਚਿਹ ਅਦਨਾ ਹਮ ਬਰ ਦਰਸ਼
transliteration: chih aaalaa chih adhanaa ham bar dharasha
translation: Whether big or small, high or low, all, on his doorsteps,

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਅਫ਼ਗੰਦਾ ਵ ਬੰਦਾ ਓ ਚਾਕਰਸ਼ ||੭੬||
transliteration: sar afagandhaa v bandhaa ou chaakarash | 76 |
translation: Are standing as slaves and servitors with their heads bowed. (76)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਸੁਲਤਾਂ ਚਿ ਦਰਵੇਸ਼ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਬਹਿਰਾਮੰਦ
transliteration: ch sulathaa(n) ch dharavaesh azo behiraamandha
translation: Whether kings or whether beggars, all profit from his kindness,

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ੳੁਲਵੀ ਚਿ ਸਿਫ਼ਲੀ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਸਰਬੁਲੰਦ ||੭੭||
transliteration: ch oulavee ch sifalee azo sarabulandh | 77 |
translation: Whether heavenly or whether earthly people, all become respectable because of him. (77)

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਪੀਰੋ ਚਿਹ ਬਰਨਾ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਕਾਮਯਾਬ
transliteration: chih peero chih baranaa azo kaamayaaba
translation: Whether older folks or the youngsters, all have their wishes fulfilled from him,

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਦਾਨਾ ਚਿਹ ਨਾਦਾਂ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਪੁਰ ਸਵਾਬ ||੭੮||
transliteration: chih dhaanaa chih naadhaa(n) azo pur savaab | 78 |
translation: Whether the wise or the naive, all are able to do good, virtuous and charitable deeds because of him. (78)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਕਲਜੁਗ ਚੁਨਾਂ ਸਤਿਜੁਗ ਅਾਵਰਦ ਬਾਜ਼
transliteration: ba-kalajug chunaa(n) sathijug aavaradh baaza
translation: He has brought Satgujj during the age of Kaljugg in such a way

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਖ਼ੁਰਦੋ ਬਜ਼ੁਰਗ ਅਾਮਦਾ ਰਾਸਤ-ਬਾਜ਼ ||੭੯||
transliteration: k khuradho bazurag aamadhaa raasatha-baaz | 79 |
translation: That, young and old, all have become disciples and followers of truth. (79)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਕਿਜ਼ਬੋ ਨਾਰਾਸਤੀ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਦੂਰ
transliteration: hamaa kizabo naaraasathee gashath dhoora
translation: All falsehood and fraud were driven away,

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਬਿ ਤੀਰਹ ਰਖ਼ਸ਼ਾਂ ਸ਼ਦਾ ਹਮਚੂ ਨੂਰ ||੮੦||
transliteration: shab theereh rakhashaa(n) shadhaa hamachoo noor | 80 |
translation: And, the pitch-dark night became brightened emitting refulgence. (80)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਦੈਤੋ ਜ਼ਿ ਦਾਨਬ ਜਹਾਂ ਕਰਦ ਪਾਕ
transliteration: z dhaitho z dhaanab jehaa(n) karadh paaka
translation: He spared the world from the evils of monsters and demons and made it sacred,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਜ਼ੁਲਮੋ ਜ਼ੁਲਮਤ ਜ਼ਦੂਦਾ ਜ਼ਿ ਖ਼ਾਕ ||੮੧||
transliteration: hamaa zulamo zulamath zadhoodhaa z khaak | 81 |
translation: And he reduced to dust all darkness and tyranny from the face of the earth. (81)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ੋ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਅਾਮਦ ਸ਼ਬਿ ਅਾਲਮੋ
transliteration: azo raauashan aamadh shab aalamo
translation: The dark night of the world became brightened due to him,

gurmukhi: ਨਮਾਂਦਾ ਬ-ਗੀਤੀ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਜ਼ਾਲਿਮੋ ||੮੨||
transliteration: namaa(n)dhaa ba-geethee azo zaalimo | 82 |
translation: And, there remained no tyrants any more because of him. (82)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਮਾਨੇ ਬਰ ਅਾਰਾਸਤ ਅਜ਼ ਰਾੲਿ ਓ ਹੋਸ਼
transliteration: zamaanae bar aaraasath az raae ou hosha
translation: This world is ornamented because of his wisdom and viewpoint,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ੋ ਦੇਗਿ ਹਰ ਦਾਨਿਸ਼ ਅਾਮਦ ਬਜ਼ੋਸ਼ ||੮੩||
transliteration: azo dhaeg har dhaanish aamadh bazosh | 83 |
translation: And, it is because of him that every level of intellect gets excited and outbursts with passion. (83)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਦੀਦਾ ਅਾਮਦ ਤਨਿ ਕੁਦਸਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: hamaa dheedhaa aamadh than kudhas oo
translation: His entire chaste body is all eyes and eyes alone,

gurmukhi: ਹਵੈਦਾ ਬ-ਚਸ਼ਮਸ਼ ਹਮਾ ਪੁਸ਼ਤ ਰੂ ||੮੪||
transliteration: havaidhaa ba-chashamash hamaa pushath roo | 84 |
translation: And, the whole past and future events manifest before his eyes. (84)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਰਾਜ਼ਿ ਅਾਲਮ ਬਰੋ ਅਾਸ਼ਕਾਰ
transliteration: hamaa raaz aalam baro aashakaara
translation: All the mysteries of the world are perceptible to him.

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਚੋਬਿ ਖੁਸ਼ਕ ਅਜ਼ ਦਮਸ਼ ਬਾਰਦਾਰ ||੮੫||
transliteration: hamaa chob khushak az dhamash baaradhaar | 85 |
translation: And, even the dry wood of a stem, with his strength, starts to bear fruits. (85)

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਅੰਜਮ ਚਿਹ ਅਫ਼ਲਾਕ ਮਹਿਕੂਮਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: chih anjam chih afalaak mehikoom oo
translation: Whether (we talk about) the stars or the skies, all are his subjects,

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਬਾਲਾ ਓ ਚਿਹ ਪਸਤ ਮਨਜ਼ੂਮਿ ੳੂ ||੮੬||
transliteration: chih baalaa ou chih pasath manazoom oo | 86 |
translation: Everyone, high and low, is under his management and control. (86)

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਖ਼ਾਕੋ ਚਿਹ ਅਾਤਿਸ਼ ਚਿਹ ਬਾਦੋ ਚਿਹ ਅਾਬ
transliteration: chih khaako chih aathish chih baadho chih aaba
translation: Whether it is the dust or the fire, whether it is the wind or the water,

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਖ਼ੁਰਸ਼ੀਦਿ ਰਖ਼ਸ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਓ ਮਾਹਤਾਬ ||੮੭||
transliteration: chih khurasheedh rakhashindhaa ou maahathaab | 87 |
translation: Whether it is the bright sun and whether it is the star-studded moon, (87)

gurmukhi: ਚਿਹ ਅਰਸ਼ੋ ਚਿਹ ਕੁਰਸੀ ਹਮਾ ਬੰਦਾ-ਅਸ਼
transliteration: chih arasho chih kurasee hamaa bandhaa-asha
translation: Whether (we talk about) the skies and cosmos, or the earthlings and the earth, all these are his slaves;

gurmukhi: ਬਖ਼ਿਦਮਤ-ਗੁਜ਼ਾਰੀ ਸਰ ਅਫ਼ਗਦਾ-ਅਸ਼ ||੮੮||
transliteration: bakhidhamatha-guzaaree sar afagadhaa-ash | 88 |
translation: All of them are standing with their heads bowed before him and willing to serve him. (88)

gurmukhi: ਸਿਹਗਾਨਾ ਮਵਾਲੀਦੋ ਅਸ਼ਰਾ ਹਵਾਸ
transliteration: sihagaanaa mavaaleedho asharaa havaasa
translation: The three species, born out of egg, placental, and out moisture and heat, and the ten organs of sense and reproduction,

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਤਾਅਤ-ਗੁਜ਼ਾਰੀਸ਼ ਦਾਰਦ ਪਾਸ ||੮੯||
transliteration: ba-thaaatha-guzaareesh dhaaradh paas | 89 |
translation: All give special consideration to his meditation and worship. (89)

gurmukhi: ਸਤੂਨਿ ਖ਼ਿਰਦ ਤਾਫ਼ਤ ਤਸ਼ਯੀਦ ਅਜ਼ੋ
transliteration: sathoon khiradh thaafath thashayeedh azo
translation: Pillar of wisdom received fortification from him,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨਾੲਿ ਸਖ਼ਾ ਰਾਸਤ ਤੌਕੀਦ ਅਜ਼ੋ ||੯੦||
transliteration: binaae sakhaa raasath thaauakeedh azo | 90 |
translation: And, because of him,  the foundation of bestowals became cemented and strong. (90)

gurmukhi: ਮੁਸ਼ੲੀਅ?ਦ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਰਾਸਤੀ ਰਾ ਅਸਾਸ
transliteration: musheeadh azo raasathee raa asaasa
translation: The foundations of truth became firmer only because of him,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਨੂਰਸ਼ ਜਹਾਂ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ੲਿਕਤਬਾਸ ||੯੧||
transliteration: z noorash jehaa(n) yaafathaa eikathabaas | 91 |
translation: And, the world got its illumination from his refulgence and brilliance. (91)

gurmukhi: ਜਮਾਲਿ ਹਕੀਕਤ ਬਰ ਅਾਰਾਸਤਾ
transliteration: jamaal hakeekath bar aaraasathaa
translation: The decorated beauty and elegance of realism and truth

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਜ਼ੁਲਮਤ ਜਹਾਂ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਪਰਦਾਖਤਾ ||੯੨||
transliteration: z zulamath jehaa(n) jumalaa paradhaakhathaa | 92 |
translation: Was able to dispel all the darkness and tyranny from this world and made it clean and chaste. (92)

gurmukhi: ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਅਦਲੋ ੲਿਨਸਾਫ਼ ਅਫ਼ਰੋਖ਼ਤਾ
transliteration: rukh adhalo einasaaf afarokhathaa
translation: The face of justice, equity and fair play glistened,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਜਬਰੋ ਬੇਦਾਦ ਰਾ ਸੋਖ਼ਤਾ ||੯੩||
transliteration: dhil jabaro baedhaadh raa sokhathaa | 93 |
translation: And, the hearts of cruelty and outrage were frustrated and  burnt into ashes. (93)

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨਾੲਿ ਸਿਤਮ ਰਾ ਬਰ-ਅੰਦਾਖ਼ਤਾ
transliteration: binaae sitham raa bara-andhaakhathaa
translation: The foundations of tyrannt were uprooted,

gurmukhi: ਸਰਿ ਮਾਅਦਲਤ ਰਾ ਬਰ-ਅਫ਼ਰਾਖ਼ਤਾ ||੯੪||
transliteration: sar maaadhalath raa bara-afaraakhathaa | 94 |
translation: And, the head of justice and fair play was elevated and raised high. (94)

gurmukhi: ਰਯਾਹੀਨਿ ਫ਼ਜਲੋ ਅਤਾ ਰਾ ਸਹਾਬ
transliteration: rayaaheen fajalo athaa raa sehaaba
translation: He is the raining cloud to nurture the vines of grace and blessings,

gurmukhi: ਸਮਾੲਿ ਕਰਾਮਾਤ ਰਾ ਅਾਫਤਾਬ ||੯੫||
transliteration: samaae karaamaath raa aafathaab | 95 |
translation: And, he is the sun of the skies of miracles and generosity. (95)

gurmukhi: ਬਸਾਤੀਨਿ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ੋ ਸਖ਼ਾ ਰਾ ਗ਼ਨਾਮ
transliteration: basaatheen faizo sakhaa raa ghanaama
translation: He is dense cloud for the gardens of blessings and generosity,

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਨਿ ਅਤੀਅਾਤ ਰਾ ੲਿੰਤਜ਼ਾਮ ||੯੬||
transliteration: jehaan atheeaath raa einthazaam | 96 |
translation: And, he is the management for the world of gifts and donations. (96)

gurmukhi: ਮਹੀਤਿ ਫ਼ਯੂਜ਼ਾਤੋ ਬਹਿਰਿ ਫ਼ਜ਼ਾਲ
transliteration: meheeth fayoozaatho behir fazaala
translation: He is the ocean of bestowals and a sea of compassion,

gurmukhi: ਸਹਾਬਿ ਅਨਾਯਾਤੋ ਅਬਰਿ ਨਵਾਲ ||੯੭||
transliteration: sehaab anaayaatho abar navaal | 97 |
translation: And, he is the cloud full of largess and showers of generosity. (97)

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਂ ਖ਼ੁ?ਰਮੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਾਬਾਦ ਅਜ਼ੋ
transliteration: jehaa(n) khuramo aalam aabaadh azo
translation: This world is pleasant and the universe inhabited because of him,

gurmukhi: ਰ?ਯਅਤ ਖ਼ੁਸ਼ੋ ਮਮਲਕਤ ਸ਼ਾਦ ਅਜ਼ੋ ||੯੮||
transliteration: rayaath khusho mamalakath shaadh azo | 98 |
translation: And, the subjects are satisfied and happy and the country is comfortable due to him. (98)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ਹਿਰੀ ਓ ਲਸ਼ਕਰੀ
transliteration: hamaa aalam az shehiree ou lashakaree
translation: From an ordinary citizen to the entire army, and in fact the whole world

gurmukhi: ਪਜ਼ੀਰਾੲਿ ਹੁਕਮਸ਼ ਬ-ਨੇਕ ਅਖ਼ਤਰੀ ||੯੯||
transliteration: pazeeraae hukamash ba-naek akhatharee | 99 |
translation: follow the command of this noble star. (99)

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਨਿ ਜ਼ਿ ਫ਼ੈਜ਼ਸ਼ ਹਮ ਅਾਗੋਸ਼ਿ ਕਾਮ
transliteration: jehaan z faizash ham aagosh kaama
translation: The wishes of this world are fulfilled because of his compassion and grace,

gurmukhi: ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਯਾਫ਼ਤ ਨਸਕੋ ਨਿਜ਼ਾਮ ||੧੦੦||
transliteration: dho aalam azo yaafath nasako nizaam | 100 |
translation: And, it is due to him that both the worlds are functioning under an orderly management and rules. (100)

gurmukhi: ਹ?ਕਸ਼ ਦਾਦ ਮਿਫ਼ਤਾਹਿ ਹਰ ਮੁਸ਼ਕਲੋ
transliteration: hakash dhaadh mifathaahi har mushakalo
translation: God has blessed him with a solution to every problem,

gurmukhi: ਨਸ਼ਾਂਦਸ਼ ਜ਼ਬਰਦਸਤ ਹਰ ਮੁਕਬਲੋ ||੧੦੧||
transliteration: nashaa(n)dhash zabaradhasath har mukabalo | 101 |
translation: And, he has defeated even the greatest tyrants in every encounter. (101)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਹਿਨਸ਼ਾਹਿ ਅਕਲੀਮਿ ਤਜਮੀਲ ਰਾ
transliteration: shehinashaahi akaleem thajameel raa
translation: He is the king of the rule of grandeur and grace,

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁਦਾਵੰਦਿ ਦੀਵਾਨਿ ਤਜਜ਼ੀਲ ਰਾ ||੧੦੨||
transliteration: khudhaavandh dheevaan thajazeel raa | 102 |
translation: And, he is the master of the anthology of poems of venerability and status. (102)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਹਰ ਤਾਜਿ ੲਿਹਜਾਜ਼ੋ ਤੌਕੀਰ ਰਾ
transliteration: guhar thaaj eihajaazo thaauakeer raa
translation: He is the gem of the grandeur and glory of miracles and status,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਅਾ-ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ ਅਸਫ਼ਾ ਓ ਤਨਵੀਰ ਰਾ ||੧੦੩||
transliteration: ziaa-bakhash asafaa ou thanaveer raa | 103 |
translation: He blesses the luster and chasteness with radiance. (103)

gurmukhi: ਜਿਲਾ ਲੂਲੂੲਿ ੲਿ?ਜ਼ੋ ਤਾਅਜ਼ੀਮ ਰਾ
transliteration: jilaa loolooe ezio thaaazeem raa
translation: He is the brilliance of the stones of respectability and honor,

gurmukhi: ਸਨੀ ਨੲੀਯਰਿ ਫ਼ਖ਼ਰੋ ਤਫ਼ਖ਼ੀਮ ਰਾ ||੧੦੪||
transliteration: sanee neeyar fakharo thafakheem raa | 104 |
translation: And, he is the light of the sun of elderliness and veneration. (104)

gurmukhi: ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ੲਿ?ਜ਼ਤੋ ਜਾਹ ਰਾ ੲਿੰਜਲਾ
transliteration: rukh ezitho jaah raa einjalaa
translation: He blesses the face of respectability and status with happy disposition,

gurmukhi: ਲਵਾੲਿ ਤਬਾਜੀਲ ਰਾ ੲਿਅਤਲਾ ||੧੦੫||
transliteration: lavaae thabaajeel raa eiathalaa | 105 |
translation: And, he raises the banner of veneration and maturity high in the sky.(105)

gurmukhi: ਮਹੀਤਿ ਸਖ਼ਾ ਓ ਕਰਮ ਰਾ ਗੁਹਰ
transliteration: meheeth sakhaa ou karam raa guhara
translation: He is the pearl of the ocean of blessings and generosity,

gurmukhi: ਸਪਹਿਰਿ ਸਖ਼ਾ ਓ ਅਤਾ ਰਾ ਕਮਰ ||੧੦੬||
transliteration: sapehir sakhaa ou athaa raa kamar | 106 |
translation: And, he is the moon in the sky of blessings, donations and offerings. (106)

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਂਬਾਨਿ ਮੁਲਕਿ ਫ਼ਜ਼ਾਲੋ ਕਰਾਮ
transliteration: jehaa(n)baan mulak fazaalo karaama
translation: He is the overseer and monitor of the realm of grace and compassion,

gurmukhi: ਮੁਹਿ?ਮਾਤਿ ਦਾਰੈਨ ਰਾ ੲਿੰਤਜ਼ਾਮ ||੧੦੭||
transliteration: muhmiaath dhaarain raa einthazaam | 107 |
translation: And, he is the general manager of the tasks and actions of both the worlds. (107)

gurmukhi: ਮਿਸੇ ਸ਼ਖ਼ਸਿ ਅਾਫ਼ਾਕ ਰਾ ਕੀਮੀਅਾ
transliteration: misae shakhas aafaak raa keemeeaa
translation: He is the chemical to convert the nature of the brass of the sky (into gold).

gurmukhi: ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਮਿਹਰੋ ੲਿਨਸਾਫ਼ ਰਾ ੲਿੰਜਲਾ ||੧੦੮||
transliteration: rukh miharo einasaaf raa einjalaa | 108 |
translation: He is the happy disposition of the face of justice and love. (108)

gurmukhi: ਕਬਾ ਕਾਮਤਿ ਦੌਲਤੋ ਕਦਰ ਰਾ
transliteration: kabaa kaamath dhaaualatho kadhar raa
translation: He is beneficial to the status of honor and wealth,

gurmukhi: ਬਸਰ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ ਅਜ਼ਮਤੋ ਸਦਰ ਰਾ ||੧੦੯||
transliteration: basar dheedhaae azamatho sadhar raa | 109 |
translation: And, he is the light of the eyes of command and greatness. (109)

gurmukhi: ਰਿਅਾਜ਼ਿ ਜਿਨਾਂ ਰਾ ਨਸੀਮਿ ਸਹਰ
transliteration: riaaz jinaa(n) raa naseem sehara
translation: He is the early morning frangrance for the heavenly gardens,

gurmukhi: ਦ੍ਰਖ਼ਤਿ ਕਰਨ ਰਾ ਨੌ ਅਾੲੀਨਿ ਸਮਰ ||੧੧੦||
transliteration: dhrakhath karan raa naau aaeen samar | 110 |
translation: And, he is the new sprouting fruit for the tree of generosity. (110)

gurmukhi: ਤਰਾਜ਼ਿ ਅਾਸਤੀਨੋ ਮਾਹੋ ਸਾਲ ਰਾ
transliteration: tharaaz aasatheeno maaho saal raa
translation: He is the trimming of the cuffs of months and years,

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਲਕ ਰਿਫ਼ਅਤਿ ੲਿ?ਜ਼ੋ ੲਿਕਬਾਲ ਰਾ ||੧੧੧||
transliteration: falak rifaath ezio eikabaal raa | 111 |
translation: And, he is the sky (limit) of the heights of honor and glory. (111)

gurmukhi: ਦਲੇੋਰੋ ਤਨੋਮੰਦੋ ਫ਼ੀਰੋਜ਼ ਜੰਗ
transliteration: dhalaeoro thanomandho feeroz janga
translation: He is courageous, powerful, and a victorious valiant in the war,

gurmukhi: ਗੁਲਿ ਅਦਲੋ ੲਿਨਸਾਫ਼ ਰਾ ਬੂ ਓ ਰੰਗ ||੧੧੨||
transliteration: gul adhalo einasaaf raa boo ou rang | 112 |
translation: And, he is the fragrance an colors of the flower of justice. (112)

gurmukhi: ਜਫ਼ਾਨਿ ਸਖ਼ਾ ਅਾਲਮਿ ਮਕਰਮਤ
transliteration: jafaan sakhaa aalam makaramatha
translation: He is the world of generosity and a universe of blessings,

gurmukhi: ਮਹੀਤਿ ਅਤਾ ਕੁਲਜ਼ਮਿ ਅਾਤਫ਼ਤ ||੧੧੩||
transliteration: meheeth athaa kulazam aathafath | 113 |
translation: And, he is the sea of bestowals and deep ocean of grace and kindness. (113)

gurmukhi: ਹਪਹਿਰਿ ਅਲਾ ਸਾਹਿਬ ਅਜਤਬਾ
transliteration: hapehir alaa saahib ajathabaa
translation: He is sky of high altitude and the chief of the selected ones,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਬਿ ਕਰਮ ਅਾਫਤਾਬਿ ਹੁਦਾ ||੧੧੪||
transliteration: saahab karam aafathaab hudhaa | 114 |
translation: He is the cloud bursting with blessings and the sun of learning. (114)

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਰੋਗ਼ਿ ਜਬੀਨਿ ਰਸੂਖੋ ਸਦਾਦ
transliteration: farogh jabeen rasookho  sadhaadha
translation: He is the light of the forehead of the truthful conversation,

gurmukhi: ਜਮਾਲਿ ਰੁਖ਼ਿ ਅਦਲੋ ੲਿਨਸਾਫ਼ ਦਾਦ ||੧੧੫||
transliteration: jamaal rukh adhalo einasaaf dhaadh | 115 |
translation: And, he is the brightness of the face of justice and fairness. (115)

gurmukhi: ਚਂਰਾਗ਼ਿ ਸ਼ਬਿਸ਼ਤਾਨੀ ਮਜਦੋ ਬਹਾ
transliteration: chaaraagh shabishathaanee majadho behaa
translation: He is the lighted oil lamp of the long and wedding night of confluence,

gurmukhi: ਬਹਾਰਿ ਗੁਲਿਸਤਾਨਿ ੲਿ?ਜ਼ੋ ਅਲਾ ||੧੧੬||
transliteration: behaar gulisathaan ezio alaa | 116 |
translation: And, he is the spring of the garden of greatness, nobility, honor and reputation.(116)

gurmukhi: ਨਗ਼ੀਂ ਖ਼ਾਤਮਿ ਨਿਸਫ਼ਤੋ ਅਦਲ ਰਾ
transliteration: naghee khaatham nisafatho adhal raa
translation: He is the gem of the ring of justice and fairness,

gurmukhi: ਸਮਰਿ ਸ਼ਜਰਾੲਿ ਰਹਿਮਤੋ ਫ਼ਜ਼ਲ ਰਾ ||੧੧੭||
transliteration: samar shajaraae rehimatho fazal raa | 117 |
translation: And, he is the fruit of the tree of kindness and grace. (117)

gurmukhi: ਗ਼ਹੁਰਿ ਮਾਅਦਨਿ ਫ਼ਜਲੋ ਅਕਰਾਮ ਰਾ
transliteration: ghahur maaadhan fajalo akaraam raa
translation: He is the diamond of the mine of compassion and largess,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿਅਾ ਬਖ਼ਸ਼ਿ ੲਿਹਸਾਨੋ ੲਿਨਅਾਮ ਰਾ ||੧੧੮||
transliteration: ziaa bakhash eihasaano einaaam raa | 118 |
translation: And, he is the light that grants boons and gratitude. (118)

gurmukhi: ਤਰਾਵਤ ਰਯਾਹੀਨਿ ਤੌਹੀਦ ਰਾ
transliteration: tharaavath rayaaheen thaaueheedh raa
translation: He is the moisture for the vines of the Unique Primal Lord,

gurmukhi: ਨਜ਼ਾਰਤ ਬੁਸਾਤੀਨਿ ਤਜਰੀਦ ਰਾ ||੧੧੯||
transliteration: nazaarath busaatheen thajareedh raa | 119 |
translation: And, he is the aroma of the garden of the One and the only One. (119)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਰਜ਼ਮ ਅੰਦਰੂੰ ਨ?ਰਾੲਿ ਸ਼ੇਰਿ ਦਮਾਂ
transliteration: ba-razam andharoon naraae shaer dhamaa(n)
translation: He is a roaring lion in the battlefields, and

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਬਜ਼ਮ ਅੰਦਰੂੰ ਅਬਰਿ ਗਹੁਰ ਫ਼ਿਸ਼ਾਂ ||੧੨੦||
transliteration: ba-bazam andharoon abar gahur fishaa(n) | 120 |
translation: He is the cloud that showers pearls and gems in a happy social cultural party(120)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਮੈਦਾਨਿ ਜੰਗ ਅਾਵਰੀ ਸ਼ਹਿਸਵਾਰ
transliteration: ba-maidhaan jang aavaree shehisavaara
translation: He is great a cavalaryman in the battlefields, and

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਜੌਲਾਨਿ ਖ਼ਸਮ ਅਫ਼ਗਨੀ ਨਾਮਦਾਰ ||੧੨੧||
transliteration: ba-jaaualaan khasam afaganee naamadhaar | 121 |
translation: He is famous for the race knocking down the enemies. (121)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਬਹਿਰਿ ਤਹਾਰਬ ਦਮਿੰਦਾ ਨਿਹੰਗ
transliteration: ba-behir thehaarab dhamindhaa nihanga
translation: He is a snorting alligator in the ocean of battles, and

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਿ ਖ਼ਸਮ ਦੋਜ਼ਾਂ ਬ ਤੀਰੋ ਖ਼ਦੰਗ ||੧੨੨||
transliteration: dhil khasam dhozaa(n) b theero khadhang | 122 |
translation: He is capable to pierce through the hearts of the enemy with his arrows and muskets (122).

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਿਰੋਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਮਿਹਰੇ ਬ ਅਾਵਾਨਿ ਬਜ਼ਮ
transliteration: firozindhaa miharae b aavaan bazama
translation: He is the shining sun of the palaces of gala parties,

gurmukhi: ਦਮਾਂ ਅਜ਼ਦਹਾੲਿ ਬ ਮੈਦਾਨਿ ਰਜ਼ਮ ||੧੨੩||
transliteration: dhamaa(n) azadhehaae b maidhaan razam | 123 |
translation: And, he is the hissing snake of the battlefronts. (123)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾਯੂੰ ਹੁਮਾਂ ਅੌਜਿ ਤਕਮੀਲ ਰਾ
transliteration: hamaayoon humaa(n) aauaj thakameel raa
translation: He is the mythical bird, Humaa, whose shadow brings in luck, of the heights of competence and skill,

gurmukhi: ਦਰਖ਼ਸ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਮਹਿ ਅੌਜਿ ਤਫ਼ਜ਼ੀਲ ਰਾ ||੧੨੪||
transliteration: dharakhashindhaa mehi aauaj thafazeel raa | 124 |
translation: And, he is the shining moon of the elevations of praises and idealism. (124)

gurmukhi: ਗੁਲ ਅਾਰਾੲਿ ਬਾਗ਼ਿ ਜਹਾਂ ਪਰਵਰੀ
transliteration: gul aaraae baagh jehaa paravaree
translation: He is the decorator of the flowers of the garden providing sustainence to

gurmukhi: ਫ਼ਰੋਗ਼ਿ ਦਿਲੋ ਦੀਦਾੲਿ ਸਰਵਰੀ ||੧੨੫||
transliteration: farogh dhilo dheedhaae saravaree | 125 |
translation: He is the light of the heart and eyes of chief-ship. (125)

gurmukhi: ਨੇ ਅਾੲਨਿ ਗੁਲਿ ਗੁਲਸ਼ਨਿ ਫ਼?ਰੋ ਜ਼ੇਬ
transliteration: nae aaean gul gulashan faro zaeba
translation: He is the fresh flower of the garden of glory and decoration, and

gurmukhi: ਬੁਲੰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਮਾਰਿ ਫ਼ਰਾਜ਼ੋ ਨਸ਼ੇਬ ||੧੨੬||
transliteration: bulandh az shumaar faraazo nashaeb | 126 |
translation: He is beyond the arithmetic of ups and downs. (126)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਹਾਂਬਾਨਿ ਮੁਲਕਿ ਦਵਾਮੋ ਅਬਦ
transliteration: zehaa(n)baan mulak dhavaamo abadha
translation: He is the caretaker of the eternal and immortal country or region, and

gurmukhi: ਬ-ੲਿਲਮੁਲ ਯਕੀਂ ਦਰ ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਹਦ ||੧੨੭||
transliteration: ba-eilamul yakee dhar dho aalam ahadh | 127 |
translation: He, based on knowledge and belief, is the same entity in both the worlds. (127)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਅੌਲੀਅਾ ਓ ਹਮਾ ਅੰਬੀਅਾ
transliteration: hamaa aaualeeaa ou hamaa anbeeaa
translation: All prophets and all saints have

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਅਸਫ਼ੀਅਾ ਓ ਹਮਾ ਅਤਕੀਅਾ ||੧੨੮||
transliteration: hamaa asafeeaa ou hamaa athakeeaa | 128 |
translation: All Sufis, Muslims mystics and religious persons practicing abstinence have bowed (128)

gurmukhi: ਬਖ਼ਾਕਿ ਦਰਸ਼ ਸਰ ਨਿਹਾਦਾ ਬ-ੲਿ?ਜਜ਼
transliteration: bakhaak dharash sar nihaadhaa ba-ejiza
translation: Bowed their heads with utmost humility at the dust of his door, and

gurmukhi: ਬਪਾ ਅੰਦਰਸ਼ ਓਫ਼ਤਾਦਾ ਬ-ੲਿਜਜ਼ ||੧੨੯||
transliteration: bapaa andharash oufathaadhaa ba-eijaz | 129 |
translation: They have fallen on his feet with utter respect and honor. (129)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਅੌਤਾਦ ਹਾ ਓ ਚਿ ਅਬਦਾਲ ਹਾ
transliteration: ch aauathaadh haa ou ch abadhaal haa
translation: Whether we talk about the elders or carefree Muslim ascetics,

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਅਕਤਾਬ ਫ਼ਰਖ਼ੰਦਾ ੲਿਕਬਾਲ ਹਾ || ੧੩੦[
transliteration: ch akathaab farakhandhaa eikabaal haa | 130 |a
translation: Whether we talk about the Kutab or the accepted ones with chaste intentions (130)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਸ਼ਿ?ਧੋ ਚਿ ਨਾਬੋ ਚਿ ਗ਼ੌਸੋ ਚਿ ਪੀਰ
transliteration: ch shdhio ch naabo ch ghaauaso ch peera
translation: Whether we talk about Sidhs or Naaths (those who prolong their lives by controlling their breath), or whether we talk about Gaus group of  Muslin saints of higher rank, or the prophets, and

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਸੁਰ-ਜਨ ਚਿ ਮੁਨਿ-ਜਨ ਚਿ ਸ਼ਾਹ ਚਿ ਫ਼ਕੀਰ ||੧੩੧||
transliteration: ch sura-jan ch muni-jan ch shaah ch fakeer | 131 |
translation: Whether we talk about the holy persons or hermits, or we talk about kings or beggars (131)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਬੰਦਾ ਓ ਫ਼ਿਦਵੀੲਿ ਨਾਮਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: hamaa bandhaa ou fidhaveee naam oo
translation: All of them are the servants and slaves of his Naam, and

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਖ਼ਾਸਤਗਾਰਿੰਦਾੲਿ ਕਾਮਿ ੳੂ ||੧੩੨||
transliteration: hamaa khaasathagaarindhaae kaam oo | 132 |
translation: All of them are extremely anxious to fulfill his desires and wishes. (132)

gurmukhi: ਕਜ਼ਾ ਓ ਕਦਰ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਦਰ ਤਾੲਿਤਸ਼
transliteration: kazaa ou kadhar har dho dhar thaaeithasha
translation: Both the destiny and Nature are subservient to him, and

gurmukhi: ਸ-ਪਹਿਰੋ ਜ਼ਮੀਂ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਦਰ ਖਿਦਮਤਸ਼ ||੧੩੩||
transliteration: sa-pehiro zamee har dho dhar khidhamathash | 133 |
translation: Both the sky and the earth are (always) ready to be at his service. (133)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ੁ?ਰੋ ਮਾਹ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਗਦਾੲਿ ਦਰਸ਼
transliteration: khuro maah har dho gadhaae dharasha
translation: Both the sun and the moon are beggars at his door, and

gurmukhi: ਬ?ਰੋ ਬਹਿਰ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਸਨਾ ਗੁਸਤਰਸ਼ ||੧੩੪||
transliteration: baro behir har dho sanaa gusatharash | 134 |
translation: Both the water and the land are spreading his praises, virtues and qualities. (134)

gurmukhi: ਤਵਾਲੀ ਤਫ਼?ਜ਼ੁਲ ਤਵਾਤਰ ਕਰਮ
transliteration: thavaalee thafazul thavaathar karama
translation: He is the pursuer and appreciator of kindness and blessing,

gurmukhi: ਤਵਾਫ਼ਰ ਤਰਾਹਮ ਤਕਾਸਰ ਨਅਮ ||੧੩੫||
transliteration: thavaafar tharaaham thakaasar naam | 135 |
translation: He is the bounty of benevolence and ultimate of granting boons. (135)

gurmukhi: ਮਕਾਲਿਸ਼ ਰਿਅਾਹੁਲ-ਅਜ਼ਮ ਵਲ-ਅਰਬ
transliteration: makaalish riaahula-azam vala-araba
translation: His words and messages are full of fragrance for the Arab and Iran regions, and

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਨੂਰਸ਼ ਫ਼ਰੋਜ਼ਾਂ ਸ਼ਰਕੁਲ ਗ਼ਰਬ ||੧੩੬||
transliteration: z noorash farozaa(n) sharakul gharab | 136 |
translation: Both the east and the west are illuminated with his radiance. (136)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਅਾਂ ਕਸ ਕਿ ਅਜ਼ ਰਹਿ ਸਿਦਕ ੲਿਅਤਕਾਦ
transliteration: har aaa(n) kas k az rehi sidhak eiathakaadha
translation: Every such person who with a chaste mind and firm faith

gurmukhi: ਥਪਾੲਿ ਹਮਾਯੂਨਿ ੳੂ ਸਰ ਨਿਹਾਦ ||੧੩੭||
transliteration: thapaae hamaayoon oo sar nihaadh | 137 |
translation: Put his head down on his sacred lotus feet, (137)

gurmukhi: ਸਰ ਅਫ਼ਰਾਖ਼ਤਸ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਜ਼ਿ ਹਰ ਸਰਬੁਲੰਦ
transliteration: sar afaraakhathash hak z har sarabulandha
translation: The Primal Lord blessed him with honors higher than even the great persons,

gurmukhi: ਅਾਗਰ ਸ਼ਰ-ਨਿਗੂੰ ਬਖ਼ਤੋ ਅਖ਼ਤਰ ਨਜ਼ੰਦ ||੧੩੮||
transliteration: aagar shara-nigoon bakhatho akhathar nazandh | 138 |
translation: Even though, he had a bad fortune and his star of destiny was bleak.(138)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਅਾਂ ਕਸ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਖ਼ਾਂਦ ਨਾਮਸ਼ ਬਸਿਦਕ
transliteration: har aaa(n) kas k oo khaa(n)dh naamash basidhaka
translation: Every such person who remembered his name with a true faith,

gurmukhi: ਰਵਾ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਹਰ ੳੁਮੀਦੋ ਕਾਮਸ਼ ਬਸਿਦਕ ||੧੩੯||
transliteration: ravaa shudh har oumeedho kaamash basidhak | 139 |
translation: Without any doubt, every wish and ambition of that person was fulfilled.  (139)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਅਾਂ ਕਸ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਨਾਮਿ ੳੂ ਰਾ ਸ਼ਨੀਦ
transliteration: har aaa(n) kas k oo naam oo raa shaneedha
translation: Every such person who heard or listened to his sacred name

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਪਾਦਾਸ਼ਿ ਹਰ ਮਾਅਸੀਅਤ ਵਾ ਰਹੀਦ ||੧੪੦||
transliteration: z paadhaash har maaaseeath vaa reheedh | 140 |
translation: Was forgiven and redeemed of the punishement of every sin that he had committed. (140)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਅਾਂ ਕਸ ਕਿ ਦੀਦਾਰਿ ਪਾਕਿਸ਼ ਬਦੀਦ
transliteration: har aaa(n) kas k dheedhaar paakish badheedha
translation: Every such person who happened to have had a sacred glimpse of him,

gurmukhi: ਬਚਸ਼ਮ ਅੰਦਰਸ਼ ਨੂਰਿ ਹ?ਕ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਪਦੀਦ ||੧੪੧||
transliteration: bachasham andharash noor hak shudh padheedh | 141 |
translation: The Divine Light manifested with resplendent glow in his eyes. (141)

gurmukhi: ਹਰ ਅਾਂ ਕਸ ਕਿ ੳੂ ਗਸ਼ਤ ਮਨਜ਼ੂਰਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: har aaa(n) kas k oo gashath manazoor oo
translation: Anyone who happens to be favored in his eyes,

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਵਸਲਿ ਖ਼ੁਦਸ਼ ਹ?ਕ ਫ਼ਜ਼ੂਦ ਅਾਬਰੂ ||੧੪੨||
transliteration: ba-vasal khudhash hak fazoodh aabaroo | 142 |
translation: Was blessed with the Divine meeting thus enhancing his esteem. (142)

gurmukhi: ਤੁਫ਼ੈਲਸ਼ ਹਮਾ ਮੁਜਰਮਾਂ ਰਾ ਨਜਾਤ
transliteration: thufailash hamaa mujaramaa(n) raa najaatha
translation: With his clemency, all sinner are forgiven and granted salvation,

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਪਾ-ਸ਼ੁੲਿ ੳੂ ਮੁਰਦਗਾਂ ਰਾ ਹਯਾਤ ||੧੪੩||
transliteration: z paa-shue oo muradhagaa(n) raa hayaath | 143 |
translation: By washing his lotus feet, even the dead become alive, are revived. (143)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਹੈਵਾਂ ਮੁਕਾਬਿਲ ਬ-ਪਾਸ਼ੂੲਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: ch haivaa(n) mukaabil ba-paashooe oo
translation: Compared to washing his lotus feet, even the nectar becomes far inferior,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਅਾਂ ਨੀਜ਼ ਸ਼ੁਦ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ਕੂੲਿ ੳੂ ||੧੪੪||
transliteration: k aaa(n) neez shudh bandhaae kooe oo | 144 |
translation: Because, it also becomes a slave of his street (realm). (144)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਹੈਵਾਂ ਅਰ ਮੁਰਦਾ ਗਿਲ ਹਾ ਜ਼ੀਅੰਦ
transliteration: z haivaa(n) ar muradhaa gil haa zeeandha
translation: If the dead dirt can be revived with this life-giving potion,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ੀਂ ਅਾਬ ਜਾਂ-ਹਾ ਓ ਦਿਲ ਹਾ ਜ਼ੀਅੰਦ ||੧੪੫||
transliteration: azee aab jaa(n)-haa ou dhil haa zeeandh | 145 |
translation: Then, with this nectar, soul and heart become alive again. (145)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਲਾਲਿ ਮਕਾਲਿਸ਼ ਚੁਨਾਂ ਅਾਮਦਾ
transliteration: zalaal makaalish chunaa(n) aamadhaa
translation: The tenor of his conversation is such, that

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਸਦ ਅਾਬਿ ਹੈਵਾਂ ਦਰਾਂ ਅਾਮਦਾ ||੧੪੬||
transliteration: k sadh aab haivaa(n) dharaa(n) aamadhaa | 146 |
translation: Hundreds of life-giving nectars become contained therein. (146)

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਂ ਦਰ ਜਹਾਂ ਮੁਰਦਾ ਰਾ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: jehaa(n) dhar jehaa(n) muradhaa raa zindhaa karadha
translation: He revived dead people of numerous worlds (world after world), and

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਦਿਲਿ ਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਰਾ ਬੰਦਾ ਕਰਦ ||੧੪੭||
transliteration: hazaaraa(n) dhil zindhaa raa bandhaa karadh | 147 |
translation: He made servitors out of thousands of enlivened hearts. (147)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਗੰਗਾ ਮੁਕਾਬਿਲ ਬ ਅੰਮਿ੍ਰਤਸਰਸ਼
transliteration: ch gangaa mukaabil b anmrithasarasha
translation: Sacred river Gangaa is absolutely no match to his pool of nectar, (Amrit Sarovar of Amritsar), because

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਹਰ ਹਸ਼ਤੋ ਸ਼ਸਤ ਅਾਮਦਾ ਚਾਕਰਸ਼ ||੧੪੮||
transliteration: k har  hashatho shasath aamadhaa chaakarash | 148 |
translation: Every one of the sixty pilgrim centers is at his beck and call and his servant. (148)

gurmukhi: ਵਜੂਦਸ਼ ਬਹ?ਕ ਪਾੲਿਦਾਰੋ ਮੁਦਾਮ
transliteration: vajoodhash behak paaeidhaaro mudhaama
translation: Because of truthfulness, his body and stature is eternal and immortal,

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਸ਼ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਅਜ਼ ਨੂਰਿ ਹ?ਕੁਲ-ਕਰਾਮ ||੧੪੯||
transliteration: dhilash raauashan az noor hakula-karaam | 149 |
translation: Due to the radiance of Akaalpurakh's blessings, his heart is always brilliance and illuminated. (149)

gurmukhi: ਬਹ?ਕ ਦਾਨੀ ਅਜ਼ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਵਾਲਾ ਨਜ਼ਰ
transliteration: behak dhaanee az jumalaa vaalaa nazar
translation: He has the highest divine insight to appreciate and recognize the 'truth',

gurmukhi: ਬਹ?ਕ ਬੀਨੀ ਅਜ਼ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਬਸਰ ||੧੫੦||
transliteration: behak beenee az jumalaa raauashan basar | 150 |
translation: He has the keenest luminous and brilliant vision to examine the truth and take the right decision. (150)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਅਾਗਾਹੀ ਅਜ਼ ਜੁਮਲਾ ਅਾਗਾਹ ਤਰ
transliteration: ba-aagaahee az jumalaa aagaah thar
translation: He is most familiar about the knowledge about truth than all, and

gurmukhi: ਦਰ ਅਕਲੀਮ ਦਾਨਿਸ਼ ਸ਼ਹਿਨਸ਼ਾਹ ਤਰ ||੧੫੧||
transliteration: dhar akaleem dhaanish shehinashaah thar | 151 |
translation: He is the king of wisdom and perception. (151)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਬੀਨਿ ਮਤੀਨਸ਼ ਫ਼ਰੋਜ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਨੂਰ
transliteration: zabeen matheenash farozindhaa noor
translation: His steel-like forehead radiates with heavenly glow, and

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਮੀਰਿ ਮੁਨੀਰਸ਼ ਦਰਖ਼ਸ਼ਿੰਦਾ ਹੂਰ ||੧੫੨||
transliteration: zameer muneerash dharakhashindhaa hoor | 152 |
translation: His divine and luminous soul is a shining sun. (152)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਫ਼ਜਲੋ ਤਰਾਹਮ ਸਰਾਸਰ ਫ਼ਜ਼ਾਲ
transliteration: ba-fajalo tharaaham saraasar fazaala
translation: He is absolutely forgiving in terms of compassiona and generosity, and

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਜ਼ੇਬੋ ਤਜ?ੲੀਅਨ ਸਰਾਪਾ ਜਮਾਲ ||੧੫੩||
transliteration: ba-zaebo thajaeean saraapaa jamaal | 153 |
translation: He is all beauty for grace and embellishment from head to toes. (153)

gurmukhi: ਬ-ਹਿੰਮਤ ਬੁਲੰਦੀ ਬੁਲੰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਹਮਾ
transliteration: ba-hinmath bulandhee bulandh az hamaa
translation: In terms of courage, he is the most courageous of all, and

gurmukhi: ਬ-ੲਿਕਬਾਲ ਫ਼ੀਰੋਜ਼ਮੰਦ ਅਜ਼ ਹਮਾ ||੧੫੪||
transliteration: ba-eikabaal feerozamandh az hamaa | 154 |
translation: As far as rank and status is concerned, he is most fortunate of all. (154)

gurmukhi: ਅਗਰਚਿ ਬ-ਤਸਖ਼ੀਰਿ ਹਰ ਦੋ ਜਹਾਂ
transliteration: agarach ba-thasakheer har dho jehaa(n)
translation: Even though, in order to conquer both the worlds

gurmukhi: ਨਿਅਾਜ਼ਸ਼ ਨਾ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਬ ਤੇਗ਼ੋ ਸਨਾਂ ||੧੫੫||
transliteration: niaazash naa baashadh b thaegho sanaa(n) | 155 |
translation: He does not need swords and spears, (155)

gurmukhi: ਵਲੇ ਜੌਹਰਿ ਤੇਗ਼ ਅਫ਼ਰੋਖ਼ਤਾ
transliteration: valae jaauehar thaegh afarokhathaa
translation: But when the skill, feat and the power of his sword springs up

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਬਰਕਸ਼ ਦਿਲਿ ਦੁਸ਼ਮਨਾਂ ਸੋਖ਼ਤਾ ||੧੫੬||
transliteration: z barakash dhil dhushamanaa(n) sokhathaa | 156 |
translation: Then, with its lightening, the hearts of the enemy get singed. (156)

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਜ਼ੋਪੀਨਿ ੳੂ ਪੀਲ ਰਾ ਖ਼ੂੰ ਜਿਗਰ
transliteration: z zopeen oo peel raa khoon jigara
translation: The heart of an elephant is bludgeoned with his lance, and

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਤੀਰਸ਼ ਜਿਗਰ ਸੋਖ਼ਤਾ ਸ਼ੇਰਿ ਨਰ ||੧੫੭||
transliteration: z theerash jigar sokhathaa shaer nar | 157 |
translation: Even the heart of a lion is scorched with his arrow. (157)

gurmukhi: ਕਮੰਦਸ਼ ਦਦੋ ਦਾਮ ਦਰ ਬੰਦ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: kamandhash dhadho dhaam dhar bandh karadha
translation: His scaling rope has captured animals and ferocious beasts in its snare,

gurmukhi: ਸਿਨਾਨਸ਼ ਜ਼ਿ ਦੇਵਾਂ ਬਰ ਅਾਵੁਰਦ ਗਰਦ ||੧੫੮||
transliteration: sinaanash z dhaevaa(n) bar aavuradh garadh | 158 |
translation: And, his heavy spear has spread the dirt under the demons and Satans, (by defeating them) (158)

gurmukhi: ਚੁਨਾਂ ਨਾਵਕਸ਼ ਹਲਕਾ ਦਰ ਕੋਹ ਕਰਦ
transliteration: chunaa(n) naavakash halakaa dhar koh karadha
translation: His sharp arrow pierced the mountain in such a manner

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਅਰਜੁਨ ਨ ਕਰਦਾ ਬਰੂਜ਼ਿ ਨਬੁਰ?ਦ ||੧੫੯||
transliteration: k arajun n karadhaa barooz naburadh | 159 |
translation: That even the brave Arjun could not do on the day of the battle. (159)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਅਰਜੁਨ ਚਿ ਭੀਮੋ ਚਿ ਰੁਸਤਮ ਚਿ ਸਾਮ
transliteration: ch arajun ch bheemo ch rusatham ch saama
translation: Whether we talk about Arjun, Bheem, Rustam or Saam, or

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਅਸਫ਼ੰਦਯਾਰੋ ਚਿ ਲਛਮਨ ਚਿ ਰਾਮ ||੧੬੦||
transliteration: ch asafandhayaaro ch lashaman ch raam | 160 |
translation: Whether we talk about Asafan? Dayar, Lachhman, or Ram; who and what were these brave men? (160)

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਮਹੇਸ਼ੋ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਗਨੇਸ਼
transliteration: hazaaraa(n) mehaesho hazaaraa(n) ganaesha
translation: Thousands of Mahayshs and Thousands of Ganayshs

gurmukhi: ਬਪਾੲਿਸ਼ ਨਿਹਾਦਾ ਸਰਿ ੲਿਜਜ਼ਿ ਖ਼ੇਸ਼ ||੧੬੧||
transliteration: bapaaeish nihaadhaa sar eijaz khaesh | 161 |
translation: Bow their heads with humility and reverence on his lotus feet. (161)

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਬੰਦਾੲਿ ੳੂ ਸ਼ਾਹਿ ਫ਼ੀਰੋਜ਼-ਜੰਗ
transliteration: hamaa bandhaae oo shaahi feeroza-janga
translation: All of them are servitors-slaves of this victorious king of the battle, and

gurmukhi: ਦੋ ਅਾਲਮ ਅਜ਼ੋ ਯਾਫ਼ਤਾ ਬੂ ਓ ਰੰਗ ||੧੬੨||
transliteration: dho aalam azo yaafathaa boo ou rang | 162 |
translation: Both the worlds were bestowed with fragrance, gaiety and brilliance by him. (162)

gurmukhi: ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਅਲੀ ਓ ਹਜ਼ਾਰਾਂ ਵਲੀ
transliteration: hazaaraa(n) alee ou hazaaraa(n) valee
translation: Thousands of Alis and thousands of prophets

gurmukhi: ਬਪਾੲਿਸ਼ ਨਿਹਾਦਾ ਸਰਿ ਸਰਵਰੀ ||੧੬੩||
transliteration: bapaaeish nihaadhaa sar saravaree | 163 |
translation: All bow their heads of their chieftainship with humilty and respect at his  feet. (163)

gurmukhi: ਚੂੰ ਤੀਰਸ਼ ਜਿਹਦ ਅਜ਼ ਕਮਾਂ ਤੇਜ਼ ਤਰ
transliteration: choon theerash jihadh az kamaa(n) thaez thara
translation: When his arrow is shot from his bow in the battle with tremendous speed,

gurmukhi: ਹਮਾ ਦੁਸ਼ਮਨਾਂ ਰਾ ਸ਼ਿਗਾਫ਼ਦ ਜਿਗਰ ||੧੬੪||
transliteration: hamaa dhushamanaa(n) raa shigaafadh jigar | 164 |
translation: It pierces through the hearts of the enemy. (164)

gurmukhi: ਖ਼ਦੰਗਸ਼ ਚੁਨਾਂ ਸੰਗਿ ਖ਼ਾਰਹ ਦਰਦ
transliteration: khadhangash chunaa(n) sang khaareh dharadha
translation: His arrow cuts through the hard stone in such a manner,

gurmukhi: ਕਿ ਸ਼ਮਸ਼ੀਰਿ ਹਿੰਦੀ ਗਿਅਾਹ ਰਾ ਬਰਦ ||੧੬੫||
transliteration: k shamasheer hindhee giaah raa baradh | 165 |
translation: Like an Indian sword that can mow through the grass. (165)

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਸੰਗੋ ਚਿ ਅਾਹਨ ਬਰਿ ਤੀਰਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: ch sango ch aahan bar theer oo
translation: Neither the stone nor the steel are no match against his arrow, and

gurmukhi: ਚਿ ਫ਼ਰਜ਼ਾਨਗਾਂ ਪੇਸ਼ਿ ਤਦਬੀਰਿ ੳੂ ||੧੬੬||
transliteration: ch farazaanagaa(n) paesh thadhabeer oo | 166 |
translation: The wisdom of the intellectuals does not cut much ice before his plans and procedures. (166)

gurmukhi: ਅਮੂਦਸ਼ ਚੂੰ ਬਰ ਫ਼ਰਕਿ ਪੀਲਾਂ ਰਸਦ
transliteration: amoodhash choon bar farak peelaa(n) rasadha
translation: When his heavy steel mace falls on the head of an elephant,

gurmukhi: ਅਗਰ ਕੋਹ ਬਾਸ਼ਦ ਬਖ਼ਾਕ ਅਫ਼ਗ਼ਨਦ ||੧੬੭||
transliteration: agar koh baashadh bakhaak afaghanadh | 167 |
translation: At that time, even if it were a mountain, it will become a part of the dust. (167)

gurmukhi: ਸ਼ਨਾੲਿਸ਼ ਜ਼ਿ ਨਕਦਿ ਹਸਾੲਿਰ ਬਿਰੂੰ
transliteration: shanaaeish z nakadh hasaaeir biroon
translation: His praise and glory cannot be contained within any periphery or boundry, and

gurmukhi: ੳੁਲੂਅਸ਼ ਜ਼ਿ ਫ਼ਹਿਮਿ ਮਲਾੲਿਕ ਫ਼ਜ਼ੂੰ ||੧੬੮||
transliteration: oulooash z fehim malaaeik fazoon | 168 |
translation: His loftiness is much beyond the intellectual capacity even of the angels.(168)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ਾਂ ਬਰਤਰੀਂ ਤਰ ਕਿ ਅਾੲਿਦ ਗੁਮਾਂ
transliteration: azaa(n) baratharee thar k aaeidh gumaa(n)
translation: He is much loftier than our intellect or perception, and

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ਾਂ ਬਰਤਰੀਂ ਤਰ ਕਿ ਗੋੲਿਦ ਜ਼ੁਬਾਂ ||੧੬੯||
transliteration: azaa(n) baratharee thar k goeidh zubaa(n) | 169 |
translation: Our tongue is incapable to describe his praises and glory. (169)

gurmukhi: ਵਜੂਦਸ਼ ਸਤੂੰ ਸਕਫ਼ਿ ਤਹਿਕੀਕ ਰਾ
transliteration: vajoodhash sathoon sakaf thehikeek raa
translation: His body is the pillar and post for the roof of the plan to search for Akaalpurakh, and

gurmukhi: ਰੁਖ਼ਸ਼ ਰੌਸ਼ਨ ਅਜ਼ ਰਹਿਮਤਿ ਕਿਬਰੀਅਾ ||੧੭੦||
transliteration: rukhash raauashan az rehimath kibareeaa | 170 |
translation: His face, with Waaheguru's magnanimity and munificence, is always radiant and shininmg. (170)

gurmukhi: ਦਿਲਸ਼ ਮਿਹਰਿ ਰਖ਼ਸ਼ਾਂ ਜ਼ਿ ਅਤਵਾਰਿ ਹ?ਕ
transliteration: dhilash mihar rakhashaa(n) z athavaar haka
translation: His heart is the bright sun shining with the divine radiance,

gurmukhi: ਬ ਸਿਦਕ ਅਜ਼ ਹਮਾ ਸਾਦਿਕਾਨਿਸ਼ ਸਬ?ਕ ||੧੭੧||
transliteration: b sidhak az hamaa saadhikaanish sabak | 171 |
translation: In faith, he is ahead and higher than all the true followers and sincere believers. (171)

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ਾਂ ਬਰਤਰ ਅਾਮਦ ਕਿ ਦਾਨਦ ਕਸੇ
transliteration: azaa(n) barathar aamadh k dhaanadh kasae
translation: He has a higher rank and status than anyone who is recognizable anywhere and anybody,

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ਾਂ ਬਰਗੁਜ਼ੀਦਾ ਕਿਹ ਖ਼ਾਨਦ ਕਸੇ ||੧੭੨||
transliteration: azaa(n) baraguzeedhaa kih khaanadh kasae | 172 |
translation: He is more reverential than anyone could describe. (172)

gurmukhi: ਜਹਾਂ ਦਰ ਜਹਾਂ ਮਕਰਮਤ ਜ਼ਾਤਿ ੳੂ
transliteration: jehaa(n) dhar jehaa(n) makaramath zaath oo
translation: All the worlds are saturated with the graciousness of his personality, and

gurmukhi: ਜ਼ਿ ਹ?ਦ ਬਰਤਰ ਅਾਮਦ ਕਮਲਾਤਿ ੳੂ ||੧੭੩||
transliteration: z hadh barathar aamadh kamalaath oo | 173 |
translation: His feats cannot be confined within any limits. (173)

gurmukhi: ਚੂ ਤੌਸੀਫ਼ਸ਼ ਅਾਮਦ ਫ਼ਜ਼ੂੰ ਅਜ਼ ਹਿਸਾਬ
transliteration: choo thaauaseefash aamadh fazoon az hisaaba
translation: When his praises and glory are beyond any accountability,

gurmukhi: ਕੁਜਾ ਗੁੰਜਦ ਅੰਦਰ ਹਜਾਬਿ ਕਿਤਾਬ ||੧੭੪||
transliteration: kujaa gunjadh andhar hajaab kithaab | 174 |
translation: How could, then, they be confined to the screens (pages) of any book. (174)

gurmukhi: ਸਰਿ ਲਾਲ ਬਾਦਾ ਬਪਾੲਿਸ਼ ਫ਼ਿਦਾ
transliteration: sar laal baadhaa bapaaeish fidhaa
translation: With Waaheguru's grace, I pray that the head of Nand Lal be sacrificed for his naam, and that

gurmukhi: ਅਜ਼ੋ ਬਾਦ ਜਾਨੋ ਦਿਲਸ਼ ਰਾ ਨਵਾ ||੧੭੫||
transliteration: azo baadh jaano dhilash raa navaa | 175 |
translation: With Akaalpurakh's kindness, the soul and heart of Nand Lal be offered before Him. (175)
